speaker: Ike
text: That must be...

speaker: Titania
text: ...the Tower of Guidance. It's so bright I can hardly bear to look at it! What's happening in there?

speaker: Soren
text: Let's hurry, Ike. I can't imagine that the glowing is a good omen. We're running out of time.

speaker: Ike
text: The city gate is shut. I guess we'll have to force it to get to the tower--
Ahh! You guys made it!

speaker: Ike
text: Skrimir! I didn't realize your group had already arrived.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes, we've been here for quite some time. I've been itching to go inside and see what the bad guys have waiting for us.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Skrimir listened to reason, however, and agreed to wait here with us. We know nothing about the numbers or strength of the enemy.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It seemed safest to wait here for the rest of you to show up. We pitched tents outside the gate.

speaker: Ike
text: Hello, Micaiah. Any word from Yune?

speaker: Micaiah
text: She came back to me a number of times during our trip. But nothing for the past few days...

speaker: Ike
text: I see... Do we know where Tibarn and Elincia's group is?

speaker: Skrimir
text: No word yet, no. Ike, it's a waste for us to just sit around waiting. Why don't you and I have a look inside?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Wait! What's happening?

speaker: Naesala
text: Get ready for an attack, people!

speaker: Ike
text: Caineghis? What are you doing here?

speaker: Caineghis
text: In an occurrence I'm told is increasingly common, we heard a voice in our dreams and followed it here.

speaker: Ike
text: And Lord Tibarn! I should have guessed your group would beat everyone here.

speaker: Tibarn
text: We joined up with King Caineghis and mopped up the Disciples of Order around the capital.

speaker: Elincia
text: The only people left within the city are the ones who have been petrified.

speaker: Yune
text: Good! I like air-breathers with initiative!

speaker: Ike
text: Yune! Here to give us our next instructions?

speaker: Yune
text: Yes, good guess! Everyone, gather around. You'll all need to hear this.

speaker: Yune
text: Good job, everyone! All three teams got here, and a little faster than I thought you would. While you were traveling, I went around recruiting more help, including King Caineghis here. Unfortunately, it looks like Ashera had the same idea. By the time I made my way to Goldoa, there was no one there.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Wh-what do you mean? Where were they?

speaker: Tibarn
text: If you're saying what I think you're saying, then we could have a very big problem. Lots of very big problems.

speaker: Yune
text: I don't know for sure, Tibarn. There aren't a whole lot of dragons altogether, but... It looks like every one of them joined Ashera.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: How...how could this be?

speaker: Yune
text: I haven't seen them anywhere else on Tellius, so they must already be inside the tower. Let's camp for the night before walking into Ashera's own home.

speaker: Stefan
text: ...What can I do for you, Goddess Yune?

speaker: Yune
text: You're very strange. What are you?

speaker: Stefan
text: That's a strange question, especially coming from you. Didn't you create all of us?

speaker: Yune
text: I didn't create anything. Not laguz nor beorc. But I know what they are, because I've watched them change and grow over time. You... You're not something I've seen before.

speaker: Stefan
text: I'm the same as the girl you dwell inside.

speaker: Yune
text: Ohhh... I thought Micaiah was the only one. She could hear my voice and sing the galdr of release. But I learned that others existed. There's that boy who's always with Ike. Or the little girl who stays by the queen of Crimea.

speaker: Stefan
text: There are several in my village, as well. They are my comrades. We all live under the safe fate...and carry the same curse in our blood.

speaker: Yune
text: When you say these words, what do they mean? Why are you cursed?

speaker: Stefan
text: It means that we carry the blood of both beorc and laguz. Beorc call us Branded, and laguz call us Parentless.

speaker: Yune
text: Does that mean your parents are beorc and laguz?

speaker: Stefan
text: Not always. It means that laguz and beorc mixed blood somewhere along the line. Beorc and laguz rarely associate in that way. For them to conceive a child together is an even rarer event. What's strange is that the child bears no laguz characteristics. It's just a normal beorc infant. However, the laguz blood lies asleep, waiting, in the child's veins.

speaker: Yune
text: Oh...

speaker: Stefan
text: One day, the laguz blood shows itself, marking the child's body with a brand. How old is that girl, hmm? I don't think she's as young as she looks. The other curse is that we age differently from beorc. It depends on what laguz blood the child has, but it always slows how fast we age.

speaker: Yune
text: Micaiah says that's true. She's listening to every word you say. Please, continue.

speaker: Stefan
text: The laguz blood gives the Branded unnatural powers. Beorc fear and distrust us because they can't understand those abilities. The laguz are even worse. They treat us like we're phantoms, refusing to acknowledge us, as if we don't exist.

speaker: Yune
text: I see...

speaker: Stefan
text: It's easy to hide among beorcs. You just cover the brand, avoid getting close to anyone, and never settle down. Pretending you're normal. The laguz are different. They can sense what we are... They have an instinct for it. Not all laguz know for sure, but the sharp ones figure it out instantly. Others just feel uneasy around us. Some never figure it out, but they're surrounded by ones who do. Either way, the laguz would never talk to us voluntarily. Why would you pay attention to someone who doesn't even exist?

speaker: Yune
text: Why? That doesn't make any sense. How did things get like that?

speaker: Stefan
text: I would like to know that as well. It's said that a union between laguz and beorc is a crime against the goddess. That's what we've always been told.

speaker: Yune
text: That's silly. I've never heard anything of the sort.

speaker: Stefan
text: ...Heh... Heheh... Hahahahaha...!

speaker: Yune
text: Why are you laughing?

speaker: Stefan
text: It's all been a lie! For hundreds of years, we've faced persecution, abuse, and isolation. And for what? A lie! What's not to laugh about, huh? Hahaha...

speaker: Yune
text: What's happened? This is all wrong... How did history get so distorted? Was it at a particular place and time? I don't understand. I've been asleep for too long...

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Almedha! You're safe!

speaker: Almedha
text: Kurthnaga...

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Al, what's wrong? You're so pale, and you've grown so thin...

speaker: Almedha
text: Oh, Pelleas... My little Pelleas... Why? Tell me why?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Almedha! Almedha, you have to pull yourself together!
Prince Kurth? Are you there?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I'm busy, Ena! Stay where you are.

speaker: Ena
text: Oh!

speaker: Almedha
text: ...Ena. It's been a long time. I felt your presence nearby, but you never came to see me...

speaker: Ena
text: Lady Almedha...

speaker: Almedha
text: I understand that you don't want to see me. I'm sure you hate me for what I've done. My brother Rajaion... Your betrothed... He died because of me.

speaker: Ena
text: Don't. It's not important. That's all in the past...

speaker: Almedha
text: ...What? How can you pretend like nothing happened!? You can't! I know you hate me! You have to hate me! Go ahead, blame me for what happened! Insult me! Do anything, but you have to hate me!

speaker: Ena
text: ...I don't hate you, Almedha. Rajaion made his decision. He gave his life to save you and his little nephew. Did you know that? He decided to sacrifice himself to protect you. I can't blame you for what Rajaion decided to do. That would mean insulting my beloved for his sacrifice... For his nobility.

speaker: Almedha
text: Sniff... Sniff... Sniff...

speaker: Ena
text: Prince Kurth, my grandfather is here to see you. The king knows nothing of this visit.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Nasir is here?

speaker: Nasir
text: Prince Kurthnaga. I am glad to see that you are safe. And Lady Almedha, as well. It has been a long time. We haven't seen each other in over ninety years, I believe.

speaker: Almedha
text: Nasir.... You returned to Goldoa?

speaker: Nasir
text: Yes.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Nasir, I need to know something. Why has Goldoa sided with Goddess Ashera!? What is Father thinking? The laguz and beorc have joined together to save the petrified. Why hasn't Goldoa joined the effort?

speaker: Nasir
text: As you wish. Lady Almedha... Are you aware of the fact that everything that's happening is due to your decision to leave Goldoa?

speaker: Almedha
text: ...What?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Explain, Nasir.

speaker: Nasir
text: King Dheginsea forbade the dragon tribe to use our transformation for the purpose of war. Almedha, you left because you did not agree with this policy, did you not?

speaker: Almedha
text: That's right.

speaker: Nasir
text: Shortly after you left Goldoa, you met Ashnard in Daein and were united with him. However, your union begat a chain of tragedies. Did you know that the red dragon platoon which went in search of you was captured and turned into Feral Ones by King Ashnard?

speaker: Almedha
text: I-I had no idea.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ashnard needed Goldoa to get involved in his war. That's why he did everything in his power to provoke King Dheginsea. Most of you have never fought in a war, but even more than other laguz, the dragon tribe loses control once they taste battle.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Oh...

speaker: Nasir
text: Near the end of the war, we found out that Prince Rajaion could not be saved. I thought the king would surely go on a rampage. At the time, we had no idea that Lady Almedha was still alive. The king thought he'd lost not only dragon soldiers but also his children.

speaker: Nasir
text: If the war had ended any later... Had Ike not killed Ashnard... Goldoa would have joined the war. And we would have started killing. We would have destroyed the Daein army, it's coconspirators, everyone. We would not have stopped until the continent was ashes. Then the spirit of chaos would have spread across Tellius, awakening the goddess and destroying the dragon tribe. That was the danger we faced in the Mad King's War.

speaker: Ena
text: But Ashnard was defeated. And Rajaion regained his sanity thanks to the songs of the heron clan.

speaker: Almedha
text: ...Sniff. Bwuah... Sniff...

speaker: Nasir
text: We escaped annihilation once. We took Prince Rajaion's body back to Goldoa. And the king did not shed a tear, nor fly into a rage. He endured his loss by himself. He endured for the sake of his last child, and for the sake of his people. Goldoa remained neutral.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father...

speaker: Nasir
text: But now... All that effort has been wasted. The war between the Laguz Alliance and Begnion has spread through Daein and Crimea. And to top it all off, Goldoa can no longer stay neutral because of what Prince Kurthnaga has done!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: You're saying this is my fault...!? That I've started a war that my father tried to avoid?

speaker: Almedha
text: No, Kurthnaga! This was my fault. You fought because of me.

speaker: Ena
text: This was not Prince Kurth's fault! Besides, the goddess Yune was not awakened by chaos sweeping across Tellius. She was awakened by the galdr of release!

speaker: Nasir
text: By a galdr!? Are you certain?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes. That was what Sir Ike said.

speaker: Nasir
text: That's...very strange. Nevertheless, the end result remains the same. Goddess Ashera has rendered her judgment. The laguz and beorc must follow her decision.

speaker: Ena
text: What...!? Nasir!

speaker: Nasir
text: I've come here as a favor to the king. Prince Kurthnaga, you have to return to us. At once.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: If we just accept Ashera's judgment, we'll all be turned to stone! That's the end of history as we know it! Do you expect me to just lie down and accept that? How can I? What you're asking is insanity! I won't do it.

speaker: Nasir
text: And you, Ena?

speaker: Ena
text: I feel the same as Prince Kurth.

speaker: Nasir
text: Then I have nothing more to say to you. However, I hope to avoid fighting my own people if at all possible.

speaker: Ena
text: Nasir...

speaker: Almedha
text: ...What will you do on the battlefield, Kurth? Will you face your father as an enemy?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...I will do whatever I have to.

speaker: Yune
text: Oh, no!

speaker: Ike
text: Yune, what is it? What's happening?

speaker: Caineghis
text: This isn't good...

speaker: Yune
text: These soldiers... We've killed them already. They've been reborn in flesh but not spirit.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Brought back from the dead...

speaker: Elincia
text: A miracle of the goddess...

speaker: Caineghis
text: A blasphemy, you mean! How could the goddess of order violate the most fundamental natural law?

speaker: Ike
text: Philosophy later, everyone! They're about to attack!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you all right? Those dead soldiers really got to you, didn't they?

speaker: Yune
text: ...We can't win. All we do is kill the flesh, but she brings the flesh back... We need more time... No, there is no more time! Everyone else will be turned to stone...and I will be lonely forever. There's nothing more that I can do! I've failed... I've failed.

speaker: Ike
text: Yune! Get a hold of yourself!

speaker: Yune
text: Ouch! My ears!

speaker: Yune
text: Wh-what was that for? You big bully! Who do you think I am?!

speaker: Ike
text: Yune, the goddess of chaos... The warmhearted being whose courage and love gives us the will to go on.

speaker: Yune
text: Ike... Thank you.

speaker: Ike
text: As things stand, we can't bring everyone into the tower. We'll need support here to hold this position. But at the very least, how many are we going to need inside?

speaker: Yune
text: They'll have much stronger forces inside the tower...not to mention Ashera herself. We'll send in our best 11. Oh, and we'll want the two dragons! ...And one from the heron tribe... And...uh...the empress. Plus, it wouldn't hurt to have Sothe.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. If that's everyone, I'll gather them together.

speaker: Yune
text: ...And once we get inside, you can leave most of the fighting to Micaiah.

speaker: Yune
text: Something like this should work.

speaker: Ike
text: We're ready.

speaker: Yune
text: All right, everyone's almost ready. Who would you like to bring from the heron tribe?

speaker: Ike
text: Rafiel... Would you join us?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Of course. I am honored.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson... Would you join us?

speaker: Reyson
text: Gladly. I'll give you everything I've got.

speaker: Ike
text: Leanne... Would you join us?

speaker: Leanne
text: I...I do...best fighting!

speaker: Yune
text: All right, Tower of Guidance, here we come!

speaker: Ike
text: It's...so quiet. Is the goddess here?

speaker: Yune
text: Uh-huh. She's at the top. Be careful, everyone. This tower is Ashera's home territory. She's certain to have her most powerful troops waiting for us up ahead. We must proceed with the utmost caution.

speaker: Yune
text: Hm?

speaker: Female Voice
text: So, you were companion to the very first empress, Altina. I am honored that you have chosen to speak with me.

speaker: Male Voice
text: You would trust in the word of a stranger?

speaker: Female Voice
text: Yes. I can see inside you. I know you cannot speak lies.

speaker: Male Voice
text: Is it possible? Do you share some aspect of my power?

speaker: Female Voice
text: I do, as did my mother... Generation after generation, each apostle has been blessed to hear the voice of the goddess. We know of impending disasters, how crops will fare.... All revelations originally intended for you.

speaker: Male Voice
text: The children of my union with Altina... I had no idea...

speaker: Female Voice
text: Please look at this.

speaker: Male Voice
text: That mark...

speaker: Female Voice
text: All of the apostles have born this brand. It is our greatest secret. The senators must never know. Because of this brand, I thought that I had been born of some great sin. It plagued me always. Guilt tore at me every day as I hid my mark from my people, deceiving them constantly about my true nature.

speaker: Male Voice
text: Oh, child...how can I apologize to you?

speaker: Female Voice
text: And yet, now that I've met you, I understand. There is no shame in my heritage. None at all. I will not live in hiding. I will reveal to the world that I am one of the Branded. They must see there is no shame in who I am.

speaker: Male Voice
text: No! You mustn't! You don't understand the danger you will be placing yourself in!

speaker: Female Voice
text: Oh, but I do. The senators will do their utmost to rally the people against me, as they did when I freed the laguz from slavery. But I will not be deterred. If I am to lead this nation, I cannot allow it to be corrupted by prejudice and hatred. I can put the life the goddess has given me to no greater good than this.

speaker: Male Voice
text: ...Such determination. Your eyes... They very much resemble Altina's.

speaker: Female Voice
text: I will stand before my people and proudly proclaim the truth. And then I will guide them to a just and honest future. This is my promise to you.

speaker: Male Voice
text: Thank you. Your strength of will, the truth that guides your life... You have shown me the way back to myself. I shall return to Goldoa and tell my friends of you and your actions. I will tell them that laguz and beorc may once again live together in peace. I will tell them that there is hope.

speaker: Female Voice
text: Thank you, father of my mothers. I strive to be worthy of the gift of live you have granted me.

speaker: Yune
text: ...What was that? Someone's... Was it someone's memory?

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Yune
text: Sorry? Oh, I... Don't worry. It was nothing. All right, then... Our path leads through that door there.

speaker: Lekain
text: Well, well... "Apostle" Sanaki. What a surprise seeing you here. Frankly, I'm amazed that you, of all people, would dare to set foot inside the most holy Tower of Guidance.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Lekain... We've been looking for you for a long time. You bound Daein to your awful pact, hounded noble King Pelleas, and stole countless lives in your appalling war. You are...beyond redemption!

speaker: Lekain
text: Beyond redemption? My, that does sound awful. Whatever will you do with me? Oh, and let me remind you, the blood pact is still in effect. You would do well to remember that. I think you know what will happen to the people of Daein if you should dare oppose me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Enough. We fear your threats no longer. No more will we bow to your every whim. Now that we've found you, we will exact justice upon you, then destroy the blood pact itself, ending its power over us!

speaker: Lekain
text: So you figured it out, did you? Heh, heh... It matters not. This changes nothing, do you hear me? Here is the scroll for which you've been searching so diligently. Right here in my hands.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ah!

speaker: Lekain
text: And yet, none of you will ever lay one grimy little finger upon it. I have been blessed by the goddess herself. Her protection will not allow you fleas to even approach me!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Lekain! Cease this travesty of virtue at once!

speaker: Lekain
text: What have we here? Oh yes, the apostle. Excuse me, child, but I had completely forgotten you were here. Since you've deigned to grace us with your exalted presence, dear apostle, let me share a bedtime story with you.

speaker: Lekain
text: The year was 640, Begnion era... The empire had been without an apostle for 15 long years. The senators were being constantly harassed with complaints from the people. There had been nothing like it in history. The voices calling for young Sanaki to be crowned grew louder every day... You had just turned five years old when the senate welcomed you to the throne as the new apostle. Ah, but my young mistress Sanaki, what a difficult child you were. You threw tantrums, you screamed and cried constantly. Your conduct was hardly befitting an empress of Begnion! Everyone was at a loss... You wouldn't even stop mewling and crying during official proceedings. But then along came our youngest senator ever, Sephiran, Duke of Persis. When he took you in his arms, you immediately stopped crying. You even smiled. We had to take advantage of this obvious miracle. In an unprecedented move by the senators, we elevated Sephiran to prime minister, keeping him serving as close to you as possible. This plan, radical as it was, proved far more effective than we dared dream. A young, handsome prime minister and an adorable moppet of an apostle brought the people's support to incredible new heights. Apparently the common citizenry is gullible enough to blindly follow any leader who is sufficiently attractive. Enamored as they were, no one ever seemed to care whether or not you could hear the voice of the goddess. With the new apostle and prime minister, the political landscape became unrecognizable. Even in the face of overtly unreasonable legislation, the two of you would stand on the balcony... A smile and a wave later, the people would cheer and go on with their happy lives.

speaker: Lekain
text: It was too good to be true, however. Both of you were only meant to be puppets! Each year you interfered with our government more and more, imposing your soft-hearted ideals over our sovereign rights. Were such trivialities as laguz slavery and the Daein occupation worth making issues of? The pair of you were becoming an increasingly bothersome thorn in our side. And then this war against the laguz forces... You went so far as to expose our previous indiscretions and demand reparations for the sub-humans. This was unforgivable. Clearly you both had to be removed. Sephiran would be falsely accused and jailed, necessitating his removal from office. The apostle would suffer a sudden illness, and be excused from official proceedings. Or so we intended...

speaker: Lekain
text: And somehow, despite the extraordinary plans of great me, here you are standing before my very eyes.

speaker: Sanaki
text: If Sephiran and I hadn't been freed... You were just waiting for your chance to kill us? Just as you killed my grandmother.

speaker: Lekain
text: Out of respect for the imminently deceased, I'll be completely honest. Yes, you assume correctly. Your assassination, and the plot to once again frame the Serenes herons for it, was entirely my idea.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes... I thought as much.

speaker: Lekain
text: Impressive, Sanaki. When you were first crowned, you would have cried your little eyes out. You've grown, slightly.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Lekain, Duke of Gaddos! Before the 37th empress of Begnion... Prepare to be judged!

speaker: Lekain
text: An amusing game, child, truly. But you must know that there is nothing you can do against me! I am the greatest servant of the all-knowing, almighty Ashera. I am her chosen champion! And you, Sanaki, are a pathetic wretch, mewling behind her pack of Daein curs. Ashera's judgment is upon you! You will not live to be turned to stone... You will die here as flesh and blood!

speaker: Lekain
text: Ta ha haaa! Bathe in my radiance!

speaker: Hetzel
text: There can be no forgiveness for my hand in these evil deeds. Salvation is denied me and my stained soul. My torment will be eternal.

speaker: Hetzel
text: I don't understand any of you. how can you oppose the goddess? It's only natural that people live to please the gods...the weak follow the strong.

speaker: Jill
text: Strong, weak... It doesn't matter. I fight on the side of my conscience, and have yet to regret my battles.

speaker: Hetzel
text: Wait... I remember you... You were one of the dracoknights that fled to Daein, defying the senators... You opposed the almighty Begnion and the word of the goddess... Why? Why would you defy such power?

speaker: Haar
text: You could live another lifetime, and you'd still never understand.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hetzel... I had thought that you alone might be above Lekain's foul conspiracy! It saddens me to see you at his side.

speaker: Hetzel
text: N-no, Apostle Sanaki! I--

speaker: Sanaki
text: I didn't ask for excuses! ?You fight alongside Lekain. That's more proof than I'll ever need.

speaker: Hetzel
text: ...You are right, I fight with him. I had no choice. But...please, understand that I've always done my best to honor and respect Your Majesty.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Then how do you explain my confinement in Mainal Cathedral?

speaker: Hetzel
text: I-I didn't do anything! It was all Lekain! I didn't know anything about it, and only heard later...

speaker: Sanaki
text: And when you did hear of it, why didn't you stop it?

speaker: Hetzel
text: I...couldn't. Actually, I could have, but I...didn't say anything. It was the same with Misaha, and the Serenes Massacre... I...

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...didn't say anything. In other words, you stood by as my grandmother and the Serenes people were killed!

speaker: Hetzel
text: P-please forgive me...

speaker: Hetzel
text: Rafiel... Rafiel, I’m sorry.

speaker: Hetzel
text: I did a horrible thing. I have lived in the shadow of my regret for many years now. Please tell me that you can find it in yourself to forgive me! Please...

speaker: Hetzel
text: Rafiel... I was kind to you, was I not? I didn’t treat you like a slave! I always watched over you so kindly. Be kind in return and forgive me, Rafiel.

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...I’m sorry, I... I don’t have anything to say to you.

speaker: Hetzel
text: No! Rafiel...

speaker: Nailah
text: So you’re Hetzel, huh? Rafiel told me about you.

speaker: Hetzel
text: That’s right... Yes... I’m... I’m the one who saved his life. He’s still alive because of me!

speaker: Nailah
text: Ancient history doesn’t change the fact that you’re fighting against him now. And if fight him, you fight me.

speaker: Hetzel
text: It is not too late, child, to surrender and accept Ashera's grace. You can win favor in her eyes by abandoning her enemies.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Surrender? I wouldn't' dare "accept the grace" of a goddess that turns her worshippers to stone!

speaker: Hetzel
text: Some things simply can't be helped. You and I are alive, and we should be thankful for that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I have a feeling that we're not going to be able to come to terms on this.

speaker: Hetzel
text: L...Lord Lekain! Help! Help me!

speaker: Tibarn
text: As payment for taking care of Rafiel when I couldn’t, I’ll make this quick.

speaker: Hetzel
text: You look so much like Rafiel... Is there anything in the world so beautiful as a Serenes heron?

speaker: Reyson
text: I was born this way, and mere birth is not praiseworthy. Praise me instead for my strength. What I look like is irrelevant, so long as I have the power to protect my friends.

speaker: Hetzel
text: Oh! Oh my! A fair heron maiden. I thought they were all gone...

speaker: Hetzel
text: W-wait! Don’t run away. Don’t just run away!

speaker: Hetzel
text: D-Duke Tanas! You’ve betrayed us? But why?

speaker: Oliver
text: You could never understand the depth of my commitment to beauty! Sometimes it simply overwhelms me. I can’t stop the love welling up inside! I’d do anything to keep the hideous likes of you from my precious birds!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Senator Hetzel! Do I understand correctly that you oppose Apostle Sanaki alongside Vice-Minster Lekain?

speaker: Hetzel
text: Th-that’s absurd! Vice-Minster Lekain oppose the apostle! I’m just... I’m just following orders!

speaker: Tanith
text: Senator Hetzel, Duke of Asmin! You are guilty of treason against our empress!

speaker: Hetzel
text: No! That’s a lie! I never did anything wrong...

speaker: Hetzel
text: Mortals cannot measure up to gods. Any child knows as much. Why do you not kneel before her?

speaker: Astrid
text: That would be throwing away my own beliefs to live a life of blind obedience. I stopped doing that three years ago, and I’ve never looked back.

speaker: Hetzel
text: Wait, please... I never wanted to fight... I'm here only because I was ordered.

speaker: Ike
text: Then surrender your weapon.

speaker: Hetzel
text: I-I cannot do that. I would fall into disgrace with Vice-Minister Lekain.

speaker: Hetzel
text: Save me! My goddess... Help...

speaker: Lekain
text: Knight of Daein, I am Lekain of Gaddos. Your ruler, King Pelleas, will--

speaker: Jill
text: You can stop it right there! Daein will never bow down to you again!

speaker: Haar
text: Why is it that authority figures are always so unwilling to let go of their power? The world could flip upside down and you'd be trying to boss around gravity.

speaker: Lekain
text: You clearly know nothing of me, lout! To oppose me is to oppose the goddess Ashera herself!

speaker: Haar
text: That's strange... I always thought that role was filled by the apostle. But who can keep up these days? So you're defending the goddess...but will she do the same for you?

speaker: Lekain
text: You're quite tenacious for a heron. I thought your entire fragile race had been exterminated...

speaker: Reyson
text: Evil... You are pure evil. I hear it in your heart. How do you even survive?

speaker: Lekain
text: How pathetic. Hated by a heron, the only sub-human so weak as to actually be incapable of violence. This must feel just like the massacre to you: completely helpless before your inevitable doom!

speaker: Tibarn
text: I'm glad I got to you first. See, I heard that the Serenes Massacre was all your doing... That puts you at the very top of the list of the enemies of the bird tribes.

speaker: Lekain
text: That may very well be, but I am under the divine protection of the goddess herself! A shabby sub-human pirate like yourself will find me quite invincible!

speaker: Tibarn
text: As much as I'd love to draw this little chat out, I don't think I can keep my talons out of your neck another instant.

speaker: Lekain
text: Why... Why are you laughing? Are you...enjoying yourself?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Some of us here are just overflowing with the chaos you're causing with this fight. That might be part of it... But, to be honest, there's a part of me that can hardly believe how much fun tearing your head off will be.

speaker: Rafiel
text: No!

speaker: Lekain
text: Tah ha ha... How delightfully pathetic. Poor heron prince, teeming with rage, but incapable of hurting me! Tah ha ha ha! How absolutely marvellous!

speaker: Rafiel
text: Your soul... is deeply scarred...

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah, interesting! You’re one of those sub-humans from the east that I’ve been hearing about.

speaker: Nailah
text: And you’re one of the fat, corrupted pieces of filth that we’re fighting.

speaker: Lekain
text: How dare you! I am Duke of Gaddos!

speaker: Nailah
text: Gaddos? Where’s that? That name means nothing to me. How do beorc always get the idea that the place they’re from is the center of everything?

speaker: Lekain
text: Silence, you loathsome cur! I’ll ensure that your country is left in ruins!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Eep, it’s you! Where’s Tibarn when you need him...)

speaker: Lekain
text: The lovely heron maiden... If not for the battle raging around us, I’d keep you as a... trophy.

speaker: Lekain
text: Duke of Tanas... What’s gotten into you? Why are you fighting with these mercenary scum?

speaker: Oliver
text: I am Oliver, champion of beauty! You would harm my precious feathered angels! That makes you my enemy! Unsightly man... Prepare yourself!

speaker: Lekain
text: Have you finally gone stark mad? Who, exactly, do you think you’re blathering at?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Lekain, Duke of Gaddos... Don’t bother with any of your practiced lies. Speak with your weapon.

speaker: Lekain
text: Dame Sigrun... I suppose I’m not surprised. I should have known you would still be on Sanaki’s leash! Have you asked yourself why? She is a mere pretender to the throne. You’re just a dog to a false apostle!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Correct me if I’m wrong, Lord Lekain, but Sanaki was formally recognized by the senators as the empress. Where in Begnion law is an empress required to also be an apostle? This sounds like yet another case of you senators trying to twist the law for your own benefit.

speaker: Lekain
text: Bah! Your legalistic manipulations don’t make you right!

speaker: Sigrun
text: For too long, we have tolerated you bending laws for your own benefit, with no foundation whatsoever in justice. Now it’s time for you to pay for your sins!

speaker: Lekain
text: Impudence! You can’t beat me... I am the chosen one!

speaker: Lekain
text: Hmph... Hello, Tanith. How odd to find you alongside these imbeciles, not to mention their imposter of a leader.

speaker: Tanith
text: Silence your filthy mouth! I will not brook such insults.

speaker: Lekain
text: F... Fi... Filthy?! How dare you slander the duke of Gaddos! I will rule the world in place of our goddess Ashera! Sanaki is not a true apostle or an empress. She’s a mere slip of a girl!

speaker: Tanith
text: There is no Begnion law that requires an empress to also be an apostle.

speaker: Lekain
text: Whaaat?

speaker: Tanith
text: Each apostle has thus far been seated as emperor only because that has been what served the senators best. Sanaki has ruled successfully without the benefit of divine inspiration for more than half her life. She is well loved by her subjects. Saying that she is not a true apostle will do nothing to alter that fact.

speaker: Lekain
text: Dogmatic rhetoric will achieve nothing!

speaker: Tanith
text: Very true. Empress Sanaki is my liege, and as her knight, it is my duty to destroy her enemies.

speaker: Lekain
text: Blasphemy! Striking me is no different than raising your sword to our goddess!

speaker: Tanith
text: Speaking of dogmatic rhetoric... Duke of Gaddos, farewell.

speaker: Astrid
text: Lord Lekain...

speaker: Lekain
text: Hm? You... You are from House Damiell...

speaker: Astrid
text: Yes, I am. It’s been a while, but I didn’t think you’d forget me quite so easily. I wasn’t sure at the time, but marrying you would have been the biggest mistake of my life.

speaker: Lekain
text: Ha! Bold talk from a penniless mercenary! You were never worthy of Lekain of Gaddos, head of the senators and chosen by the goddess herself!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Vi-Vice-Minister Lekain...

speaker: Lekain
text: Hm? Ahhh, still alive, are we? I suppose that I can still find a use for you... I know! Go and attack the enemy general.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Um...

speaker: Lekain
text: Why are you not obeying, fool? That look on your face... You think you're going to save your people! That is precious! You can't possibly believe that one so flawed as yourself has a prayer against me?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I do, actually.

speaker: Lekain
text: Whaaat?! Did I hear you correctly?!

speaker: Pelleas
text: I said I believe. I believe in myself, and I believe in my companions. Even if I falter and fail... My friends will defeat you. This belief sustains me. I can fight you because I am no longer alone.

speaker: Lekain
text: Let us test your theory, then! Die, upstart!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Burn, traitor!

speaker: Lekain
text: Watch your tongue, girl!

speaker: Lekain
text: Hm? Who are you? How did a shabby little burglar get in here?

speaker: Sothe
text: If that's how you want to see me, then so be it. But know that that's also how I see you. I don't think we even need to exchange names. I'll just kill you and leave it at that.

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah, the so-called Silver-Haired Maiden. Both dark goddess and Daein general... Your very existence is vile beyond belief.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Lekain, Duke of Gaddos... You crushed the people of Daein beneath your unjust rule and dragged us into a futile war. How do you live with the guilt of your sins?

speaker: Lekain
text: Sins? Do not presume to speak to me of sin, child of Daein. If only you had understood that I am on the side of the angels, you might be standing with me here today.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your delusions can't change what I see in your twisted soul, demon! Now give me that scroll!

speaker: Lekain
text: Impudent brat!

speaker: Lekain
text: Tah ha ha... So nice to see you, King Naesala. When you can’t oppose me, that is. Your blood pact means that you’ll have to betray your companions... yet again.

speaker: Naesala
text: Not today, actually.

speaker: Lekain
text: What did you say?

speaker: Naesala
text: Sorry to break it to you, Lekain, but I have recently... been promoted, shall we say. I now take orders from over your head, Vice-Minister. From Empress Sanaki, to be exact.

speaker: Lekain
text: Wh-what...Whaaaat... ?!

speaker: Naesala
text: The curse of the blood pact applies if the master’s orders aren’t obeyed, but by the law of Begnion, you’re overruled. So, Lekain, right here, right now... I’m going to tear you apart, as I’ve been wanting to do for years.

speaker: Lekain
text: Urk!

speaker: Lekain
text: Tah ha ha! Laughable mercenaries! Sanaki could certainly have chosen better allies. If only she had sided with me, she wouldn't be damned now. Oh well...

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, whoever chose you as an ally has had better days, too. So who is it? Who's pulling your strings?

speaker: Lekain
text: Pulling my strings? What are you saying? I alone have been chosen to protect her! I masterminded the plan to resurrect the goddess and become Ashera's chosen one! It is my right! Mine alone!

speaker: Ike
text: Really? I didn't see you around when the galdr of release was sung to the medallion...

speaker: Lekain
text: What medallion? What nonsense are you talking about?

speaker: Ike
text: Wow... You don't have any idea what's really going on, do you, "mastermind"? I'm just wasting my time.

speaker: Lekain
text: You... You! Urghh! I am Lekain, Duke of Gaddos! The one and only!

speaker: Lekain
text: This... This can't be... I was... I was...chosen...

speaker: Micaiah
text: King Pelleas! This is it. Lekain was carrying it. It's... It's...the blood pact!

speaker: Pelleas
text: At long last... We finally found it. All that misery Daein has suffered over this wretched parchment... But this is the last thing we need. Now we can free Daein of the senate's tyranny. Micaiah, savior of Daein... Would you do the honors and destroy that damned thing?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course...

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Whew...

speaker: Micaiah
text: That's it.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes, and now no one has to die.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank goodness...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah...Sothe... You have my deepest gratitude.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey! Look, there's another pact here. Lekain was carrying two of them. What's going on?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh... I'll hang on to this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Empress Sanaki?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I promised to return this to its proper owner, Raven King Naesala. Because of this, he was forced to serve under Lekain, and he had to turn against his allies...

speaker: Pelleas
text: So, Kilvas, too?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes. Lekain's treachery ran deep. At least it's finally over. I'm happy for everyone.

speaker: Micaiah
text: As am I.

speaker: Pelleas
text: And yet, Daein and Kilvas's newfound freedom is wasted on the statues that call them home. We still must confront the goddess.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Well spoken. We can't stop until everyone is truly free. Come! The goddess awaits.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Lekain... To think that the warped dreams of one treacherous madman could corrupt an entire nation...

speaker: Ike
text: Apostle? Are you well?

speaker: Sanaki
text: So you still insist on calling me "apostle"? I think we're past that, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: So what should I call you? Miss Sanaki?

speaker: Sanaki
text: How rude! You have no right to address me with such familiarity! Please call me "Empress."

speaker: Ike
text: Got it, Empress.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You don't have to say it like that. Loosen up a bit.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, give me a break...

speaker: Yune
text: You creatures are made of some tough meat. I don't think that girl even needs to hear the divine word, do you?

speaker: Ike
text: Yune, you're a bit of a mystery, yourself. It almost sounds like you're happy to se that people don't necessarily need you.

speaker: Yune
text: The one constant truth of people, Ike, is that nobody can stop them from changing. People sometimes do things that even the highest divinities couldn't imagine. That makes me sad. But that also makes me very happy. That's why I love people so much.

speaker: Ike
text: There are some changes that goddesses can't even predict or control. Maybe Ashera resented that.

speaker: Yune
text: I don't know... But I do know that Ashera loved people. I'm sure of it...

speaker: Elincia
text: We’re almost there. Tomorrow, we head to the tower.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Do not worry, Your Majesty. We will be right beside you.

speaker: Bastian
text: Though long tested by the trials of the goddess Ashera, we shall overcome, and our mission will be laid to rest.

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes. What we do now, we do not only for the people of Crimea, but for all the people of Tellius.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes... We shall succeed.
You are a courageous queen, indeed.

speaker: Elincia
text: Who said that?

speaker: Elincia
text: U-Uncle Renning! Are you all right now!?

speaker: Renning
text: Don’t I look it? I stand before you in full health... Thanks to your efforts, of course.

speaker: Elincia
text: Wonderful! I’m so relieved, Uncle!

speaker: Lucia
text: Duke Renning.

speaker: Renning
text: Lucia, you have my gratitude for looking after Elincia so diligently. Bastian, Geoffrey... Everyone, you have my sincere thanks.

speaker: Lucia
text: Please, Duke Renning. It is our joy to serve Her Majesty. Our loyalty extends beyond the queen. Please do not forget that.

speaker: Renning
text: ...Thank you. I appreciate your concern. Especially yours, Bastian.

speaker: Bastian
text: I stand by you, my lord.

speaker: Renning
text: You have ever been my most loyal and clever confidant. Was it possible for you to acquire the things I desired?

speaker: Bastian
text: Indeed, my lord. For you, to whom I owe my mastery of disciplines esoteric and arcane, no task is too difficult. Your sword, your armor, and your faithful steed stand ready, that the battlefield shall know your valor once more.

speaker: Renning
text: You haven’t changed a bit, Bastian. Always the clever one.

speaker: Bastian
text: Your praise is too much, my lord.

speaker: Elincia
text: Uncle! You intend to join the fight!? Please, you mustn’t push yourself too hard!

speaker: Renning
text: My, how things have changed! Am I to take orders from my niece on what battles I am allowed to fight in? I’m not a princess to be coddled and kept safe behind the vanguard, Elincia. I am a knight of Crimea, and I will be one until I die. As long as I live, as long as I am able to walk, and as long as I draw breath, I shall fight. It is my duty.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...I understand. Swear to me, then. Swear that you won’t die. That you won’t ever leave me alone.

speaker: Renning
text: I swear to you that I will never leave you behind. I swear it upon my pride as a knight and upon my love for my country. Now, Your Majesty, please grant me the honor of protecting you in battle.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, Uncle... You may have to compete for that role, I think.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Duke Renning... I will not give up my place as the commander of the Royal Knights, even to you.

speaker: Renning
text: Let’s take it outside, then. Perhaps I’ll remind you why you have never won a match against me.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: As you wish, Duke Renning. I will also show you that I have spent three years preparing solely to defend the queen from harm. I have made it my life.

speaker: Elincia
text: U-Uncle?! And Geoffrey, you too?! Bastian, do something!

speaker: Bastian
text: Truly, I shall have to! After all, a match between such stalwart warriors needs be judged. I believe I shall volunteer my services. Excuse me.

speaker: Elincia
text: Bastian!

speaker: Lucia
text: Oh, Your Majesty. Let them be.

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia? Are you siding with them, too?

speaker: Lucia
text: Doesn’t all of this remind you of a scene in Melior from years ago? Tomorrow is full of uncertainty. We may live and we may die. Yet here we are, enjoying a little scene of high drama from glory-filled past. I’m glad of it.

speaker: Elincia
text: That’s true... It’s like a weight has been lifted off my chest. Why don’t we follow them? We should enjoy our final night together.

speaker: Lucia
text: Of course, Your Majesty.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Ike. I have something to give you.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, this is...

speaker: Caineghis
text: It’s called Urvan, if I remember correctly. I borrowed it from your father’s grave.

speaker: Ike
text: Why?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Honestly? I have no idea. But I felt a sudden urge to visit Greil’s grave on the morning of our journey. When I told Giffca my idea for a little side trip, he said he thought the same thing.

speaker: Giffca
text: I believe we were guided to your father’s grave by a divine message from the goddess.

speaker: Caineghis
text: When I saw your father’s axe, I was convinced that I had to take it to you. I felt that’s what your father would have wanted.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Maybe he and my mother are looking over us from somewhere else. All right. It’s my father’s, so it’s only right that I take it.

speaker: Ike
text: Volke...?

speaker: Volke
text: Over here.

speaker: Ike
text: Looking for you is still like trying to find spilled ink at night.

speaker: Volke
text: It’s part of the job. Anyways... You’ve grown quite a bit since the last time I saw you.

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone loves telling me that.

speaker: Volke
text: You’re starting to look like Greil.

speaker: Ike
text: That might be true, too. He IS my dad. I didn’t expect to see you here. Did someone from this camp hire you?

speaker: Volke
text: Sure did.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. It’s good to have you on our side under any circumstances. Why did you call me over?

speaker: Volke
text: I have to return something to you.

speaker: Ike
text: What the...!? What’s all this money for?

speaker: Volke
text: It’s the 50,000 gold you paid me the last time around. Well, minus my pay, expenses, and that sort of thing, of course.

speaker: Ike
text: Even so, there’s a lot here.

speaker: Volke
text: Well, the contract ended sooner than expected, I guess.

speaker: Ike
text: You did a lot for us back then. I didn’t even get a chance to thank you.

speaker: Volke
text: It was a job. There’s no need to thank me.

speaker: Ike
text: I know. But if you hadn’t told me the story of my father, I would never have known about his past. So thanks, Volke.

speaker: Volke
text: Uh, yeah, so, anyhow... You have your money back. See you later.

speaker: Ike
text: Did he really just get embarrassed because I thanked him? What a weird guy.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ahem! As general staff officer of Daein's Liberation Army, allow me to outline my latest strategy.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Excuse me, but shouldn't Prince Pelleas be here?

speaker: Izuka
text: There's no need to distract the prince with the war's petty details. He won't be coming to any more meetings. From now on, consider my words the prince's own.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm not sure that's--

speaker: Izuka
text: Enough idle chatter. Come have a glance, my pretties.

speaker: Izuka
text: Our next target shall be Umono. Among all the work camps, it is one of the largest.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Conditions within the prison camp are harsh. If we are to save the prisoners, every moment matters.

speaker: Sothe
text: One of the largest work camps... Can our forces handle that?

speaker: Izuka
text: ...Suck a trivial concern, and one my profound genius has already addressed! Behold this lake next to the camp that provides fresh water to all there. Into this lake, we shall dump a deadly toxin of my own devising! Then we'll sit back...as the enemy slowly dies.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What are you saying?! Poison is inexcusably vile! I will agree to no such plan.

speaker: Izuka
text: Wha-wha-what was that?! You! You! How dare you question my plan, conceived in a state of exalted meditation!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No matter how misguided the enemy may be, we must fight with compassion and consideration for the innocent.

speaker: Sothe
text: She's right. Poison doesn't discriminate. Prisoners would die too. And any nearby villages would be affected. And then what would happen? People would doubt us, question our cause, maybe even side against us. And it would cast a stain on Prince Pelleas's name, don't you think?

speaker: Izuka
text: Errrrrgh... Fine then! Do as you like! And when you find yourselves utterly defeated, you can come crawling back to me!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: My apologies to both of you. When Lord Izuka gets excited, he can lose all sight of reason.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I apologize too, General Tauroneo. He stormed out because I--

speaker: Tauroneo
text: You needn't apologize. ?You are in the right. I would never condone the use of poison. However, this does mean we must devise another plan if we are to have any hope of victory.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, you're right. In that case, what do you think of this strategy?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sorry to call you here like this. Forgive me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's quite all right.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Can I pour you some tea? Or is there something else you would prefer?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm fine, thank you. What did you want to speak with me about?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I know you are angry with me. Please, forgive me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Can you tell me why you stopped showing up at our meetings?

speaker: Pelleas
text: It was at Izuka's request.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You are the leader of this army! You cannot simply leave all the decisions to someone else!

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...I'm sorry. I'll ask Izuka before the next meeting. I need his permission to attend.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Why? You're the prince. Why should you need any man's permission, much less your own advisor's?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes, I am the prince, but...I owe much to Izuka. He taught me everything I needed to know to become a proper member of the royal family. He contacted Tauroneo and the other senators from Daein for help. Without his power and influence, I would never have mustered an army--or met my own mother.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I see. You were alone...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Pardon?

speaker: Micaiah
text: And then Izuka reunited you with your mother, gave you a place to stay, and provided you with a reason to live. And you feel you owe him a debt of gratitude for ending your loneliness. That is why you try to do as you are told--as Izuka wishes.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, you're--

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm sorry! I didn't mean to-- That was inappropriate.

speaker: Pelleas
text: You're amazing!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Amazing?

speaker: Pelleas
text: You really can read minds! I'm simply amazed! You saw right through me!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sorry, I got too excited. Look at me, I'm sweating.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Prince Pelleas!

speaker: Pelleas
text: What is it? Why are you looking at me like that?

speaker: Micaiah
text: That mark...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Oh...that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it?

speaker: Pelleas
text: It's called the Spirit's Protection. The source of all magic in this world is tied to the power of the spirits. When you make a pact with such a spirit, its power manifests on your body like this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...see.

speaker: Pelleas
text: What am I saying? You already know all of this, of course. You have the Spirit's Protection, too.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I saw you washing your hands the other day. When I walked up to you to say hello, Is aw the mark on your right hand.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You saw...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I thought of confiding in you right away, but my mother called for me. I didn't get a chance to tell you until now.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Do you think this mark is really the Spirit's Protection?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Oh! You didn't enter into the pact yourself?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I see. So, it must have been the spirit who wished to make a pact with you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Pardon?

speaker: Pelleas
text: It's a very rare phenomenon among newborns. Usually it happens to infants who have an exceptional talent for magic. You truly are amazing, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't know about that...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Let's keep this among ourselves... We don't want people to confuse us with the Branded.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What are the "Branded"?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm pretty sure it refers to beorc who have laguz blood in their veins. I know, it's hard to imagine someone with the blood of a sub-human running through their veins. Anyway, I've been terribly mistreated by people who thought I was one of the Branded.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh...sorry. I think I understand more about you now, and about the marks we share...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm glad I was able to tell you. I'm surprised you didn't know. Come talk to me again sometime.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Certainly.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Oh, I almost forgot. Here. I wanted to give you this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it?

speaker: Pelleas
text: It's this splendid sword I recently acquired. It gives its wielder the upper hand in battle. Keep it or give it to whomever you like.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Shouldn't you give it to the soldier you deem most worthy?

speaker: Pelleas
text: No, I wouldn't want the soldiers thinking I'm giving anyone special treatment. It would be inappropriate. That's what Izuka says, anyway. So I think you should do it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I understand. You must have so much on your mind.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Indeed. I long for the hold days when I was poor, but had few worries.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Prince Pelleas...

speaker: Pelleas
text: But I'll keep fighting. I won't stop until Daein is free once more.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hear, hear!

speaker: Meg
text: H-hello...

speaker: Zihark
text: Oh, hello there.

speaker: Meg
text: H-h-hello.

speaker: Zihark
text: Yes...hello. Now that we have that established, what can I do for you?

speaker: Meg
text: Um... Uh... I... I'm...Meg.

speaker: Zihark
text: Yes, I know. It's nice to meet you, Meg. That's a very nice name.

speaker: Meg
text: And, uh... I'm from Crimea.

speaker: Zihark
text: Yep, I'm one step ahead of you! Heard that too. You're far away from home now, aren't you? Quite an independent girl, eh?

speaker: Meg
text: Um, and, my village... It's called Ohma.

speaker: Zihark
text: Oh! You're from Ohma? Now that's something I didn't know.

speaker: Meg
text: Yes.

speaker: Zihark
text: Then you must know Brom... Hold on a second... You look exactly like him. Are you two related?

speaker: Meg
text: We sure are! I'm his daughter. His...youngest daughter.

speaker: Zihark
text: Oh, I've heard stories! He loves to tell stories about his kids. He said that you could lift a full-grown cow! It's nice to meet the person I've heard so much about! How is Brom? Doing well?

speaker: Meg
text: Yes! Yes, he is! He works ALL the time. I do wish he would slow down...

speaker: Zihark
text: Ah, yes. Well, it's good to hear he's staying busy. Brom, huh? Wow, brings back memories... Well, if you're his daughter, I'll do whatever I can do help you. You said you were looking for somebody? Who is this person?

speaker: Meg
text: Well... He's my... He's my fiance.

speaker: Zihark
text: How could any guy leave a girl like you? What's this lucky guy's name? What's he like?

speaker: Meg
text: Well...he's standing right in front of me.

speaker: Zihark
text: I'm sorry, I'm sure I misheard you. Can you repeat that? ...Slowly?

speaker: Meg
text: My daddy told us years ago that he was going to marry one of us to a really nice friend of his, a mercenary named Zihark.

speaker: Zihark
text: Whoa, hey now...I don't, uh...

speaker: Meg
text: But my older sister got married last year, and so I came instead! Oh, it's so nice to finally meet my husband!

speaker: Zihark
text: Meg, look, this is kind of crazy...

speaker: Meg
text: Zihark... I'm sure I still have a lot to learn... But after meeting you, I just know we'll live happily ever after!

speaker: Zihark
text: Meg, I need you to listen very closely...

speaker: Meg
text: Oh, don't worry! I'll work hard every waking moment to become a good wife! Even during a fight! See you later, pookums!

speaker: Zihark
text: Meg, wait! Wow, she's downright pushy. She must get that from her old man. ...And did she just call me "pookums"?

speaker: Djur
text: What?! An enemy attack?

speaker: Begnion
text: Yes, sir! The Liberation Army has mounted an assault on the gate! We require reinforcements!

speaker: Djur
text: Hmph. They seek to free their men? My elite guard shall stay here with me. Take the rest to squash these "rebels"!

speaker: Begnion
text: But, sir, if your guard remains here, we'll have barely enough men to--

speaker: Djur
text: Who do you think you're talking to, soldier? With my guard and me at the ready, this camp need fear no attack. Understood? Now go! You have your orders!

speaker: Sothe
text: Looks like Tauroneo has them distracted. They've left only a small force here to defend the camp itself.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Perfect. That should make it easier for us to eliminate their defenses, seize the camp, and free the prisoners.

speaker: Tormod
text: What do you think, Muarim? Is that the building Sothe's in?

speaker: Muarim
text: Most likely, little one.

speaker: Vika
text: So, are we gonna help them, or should we just stand here all day and twiddle our thumbs?

speaker: Tormod
text: What do you think? We're helping, of course! Keep up, Muarim! Come on, Vika!

speaker: Vika
text: Hey, boss! Wait a second! I'll be... He's already out of sight. How does he do that on those skinny beorc legs?

speaker: Muarim
text: Who do you think taught him how to run? We'd better go after him.
Sooooo--ooothe!

speaker: Sothe
text: Huh?! What...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Eh?

speaker: Tormod
text: Have no fear...Tormod is here! I'm coming to your rescue!

speaker: Sothe
text: Tormod?! You crazy fool...

speaker: Zihark
text: Time for the trusty hero to save the day, I see. Still quite the showman, eh, Tormod?

speaker: Jill
text: It's more like a reunion every moment. Now if Haar were just here...

speaker: Tormod
text: All right! Let's go wild!

speaker: Begnion
text: Ah...eyahhhhhhh! Sub-human! It's a sub-human!

speaker: Begnion
text: Calm down! Just use fire magic for the beasts and wind for the birds! That'll do the trick. That child hasn't transformed yet! Nab him before he does!

speaker: Tormod
text: Fool! Transforming ain't what I do. But I can do this...

speaker: Begnion
text: He-he's a mage! Fall back! Don't get too close to him!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who in the world are they?

speaker: Sothe
text: People I used to know. I'll introduce you later, but for now, let's concentrate on the fight.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey, Tormod!

speaker: Tormod
text: You! What in blazes did you do?! You scurvy traitor!

speaker: Sothe
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Tormod
text: You grew! Too tall!

speaker: Sothe
text: And to think, I expected you to make sense. I have more important things to tend to.

speaker: Tormod
text: Hey, it's important to me!

speaker: Sothe
text: What I'd really like to hear about is that issue I asked you to look into... How did it go?

speaker: Tormod
text: I have news to report. But! There's no time to chat in the thick of a fight. I'll tell you later!

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey! Drat!

speaker: Sothe
text: Ah, hello. It's been a while.

speaker: Muarim
text: Little Sothe... You've grown up.

speaker: Sothe
text: Why does everybody keep saying that?

speaker: Muarim
text: Hmm?

speaker: Sothe
text: You know, "little"?

speaker: Muarim
text: Oh, sorry. I guess I have to respect your manly pride now.

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes, please. Or something like that.

speaker: Muarim
text: Sir Sothe. Will that do?

speaker: Sothe
text: Sothe will do. Just Sothe.

speaker: Muarim
text: I'm afraid I could never speak so familiarly with my little one's good friend. So, with your permission... Sir Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: No! That doesn't... Ohhh, never mind!

speaker: Jill
text: Muarim, do you remember me?

speaker: Muarim
text: Indeed I do, Jill.

speaker: Jill
text: I'm glad. So why are you in Daein?

speaker: Muarim
text: You'll have to ask the little one. I merely trail around after him.

speaker: Jill
text: I see. I will ask him. Thank you for helping us today.

speaker: Muarim
text: It is an honor.

speaker: Jill
text: Tormod!

speaker: Tormod
text: If it isn't Jill!

speaker: Jill
text: Thanks for fighting beside us. It's a big help.

speaker: Tormod
text: Ah, it's nothing!

speaker: Jill
text: How did you happen to...

speaker: Tormod
text: An enemy! Excellent! Leave him to me!

speaker: Jill
text: There he goes... At least some things never change.

speaker: Zihark
text: Hey there, Tormod. You're looking well.

speaker: Tormod
text: So you're here too, eh, Zihark?

speaker: Zihark
text: Polished your mage skills over the last few years, I see.

speaker: Tormod
text: But of course! I'll toast anyone who dares oppose me!

speaker: Zihark
text: Really? Well then, why don't you take on the rest of the guards while I sit back and take a break?

speaker: Tormod
text: You know what I mean! Get back here and fight like you mean it! Zihark!

speaker: Zihark
text: Muarim!

speaker: Muarim
text: Zihark, has it been three years?

speaker: Zihark
text: First Crimea, now Daein. Never a dull day! Still, it's good to fight with you again.

speaker: Muarim
text: You can say that again.

speaker: Zihark
text: OK. It's good to fight with you again.

speaker: Muarim
text: Beorc humor is so...odd. But you know I feel the same.

speaker: Ex-Daein
text: Y-you really came to save us? Thank you. Oh, thank you. You have no idea how scared I've been. I'm so glad I didn't give up. We knew the Maiden of Miracles would free us.

speaker: Ex-Daein
text: Thank you! I'm saved! I couldn't have held on any longer... I'm going to make a run for it. I refuse to die in this pit of despair. I choose to live and return to my family!

speaker: Ex-Daein
text: This isn't a dream? I can really leave this miserable cage? Oh, thank you. Thank you! You've saved my life!

speaker: Ex-Daein
text: You're the Liberation Army. I've heard about you... I'll never forget my debt to you. If I survive and make it home, I vow to devote the rest of my life to your cause. I'll fight for Daein honor, like you do.

speaker: Djur
text: Errrrrgh...! Blundering through like a bull in a china shop... Come closer, so I can shatter your ambition like glass! I will beat into your very bones just who rules this land!

speaker: Djur
text: They were...worthless, trivial... Only...scum of Daein... How? How... could that filth have...

speaker: Micaiah
text: We are the Daein Liberation Army! We demand you free the hostages... or face the consequences!

speaker: Djur
text: Of all the ridiculous... All of you pigs from Daein will be our slaves 'til you die! It's your destiny. What need have swine for freedom? Swine are happier being kept...and consumed.

speaker: Micaiah
text: If that's how you really feel, then....

speaker: Izuka
text: S-see here! Sothe! Who were those three, and where did they come from? Will they join my Liberation Army?

speaker: Sothe
text: They are my personal acquaintances from Begnion. And yeah, they can handle themselves in a fight. But if any more laguz join us, there will be problems. We've managed to hide Volug and his true nature, but...with more laguz, it will surely get out.

speaker: Izuka
text: Any such backlash can be extinguished with proper punishment. But laguz... They're powerful!  Just what we need. By all means, invite them to join!

speaker: Sothe
text: They're good friends. I'm sure they'll agree to help if I ask . But... Isn't it the prince--and not you--who should make those decisions?

speaker: Izuka
text: Question me not, young Sothe. My words are the prince's words. You need to understand that. Isn't that right, my prince?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Ah, ah, yes, that's right. You should do as Izuka wishes.

speaker: Sothe
text: I...see.

speaker: Izuka
text: I'm glad you see. Now, quickly, quickly...go talk to your friends. And see to it you don't foul up.

speaker: Sothe
text: How did you get here so soon? More importantly, how did the investigation go?

speaker: Tormod
text: It went great! In fact, we finished up so quickly that we flew here to back you up in case you needed help.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Um...

speaker: Tormod
text: Oh, sorry I haven't introduced myself yet. You're Micaiah, I take it? I'm Tormod! Three years back, Sothe and I were in the Crimean Army...sorta. We fought side by side as mercenaries under Ike.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course...General Ike...again.

speaker: Tormod
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Nothing. Don't mind me. So, anyway, what is this investigation Sothe requested of you?

speaker: Sothe
text: I began to doubt that the apostle--Begnion's empress--actually knew what was happening in Daein. At only thirteen, the apostle may be young, but she's proud and upstanding. She'd never let these kinds of things happen to Daein. So, I asked Tormod to fill her in on what was really happening here.

speaker: Tormod
text: This is what we learned... The apostle had noticed something shady about Daein. She was investigating on her own. She traced the ones pulling the strings to a certain faction of senators. Now, she's snapping mad, but without proof, she can't publicly move against them.

speaker: Sothe
text: The apostle is the highest power in Daein... Even so, she and the senate are rarely on good terms with each other.

speaker: Tormod
text: Sothe, she promised she'd help us however she can. She said to do whatever is necessary... And that inspired me to find you sooner than later.

speaker: Sothe
text: I see. So... I can depend on having you three around, for at least a little while?

speaker: Tormod
text: Yeah! Your old pal here is gonna take care of everything. Just try getting rid of me!

speaker: Sothe
text: I can only try!

speaker: Tormod
text: What do you mean by that?! Ah, you're as blockheaded as ever.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That Sothe... He looks happy, for some reason.

speaker: Muarim
text: Because he's reunited with my little one?

speaker: Micaiah
text: That must be it... Oh, Sothe, ever since he was small, he's tried to act more grown up than the grown-ups... I've taken care of him so long, and still I've never seen him smile so easily before.

speaker: Muarim
text: Hm... Watch what you say. Comments like that... They reveal that your appearance belies your true age.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What are you--

speaker: Muarim
text: Among the laguz, there are those who detest and revile half-breeds such as yourself. They call you "parentless," and deny you any laguz heritage, honor, or dignity. Take due care.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh... Oh no...

speaker: Sothe
text: What's going on, Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm not sure. I sense...something. There's a presence here that calls out to me.

speaker: Sothe
text: All right, Micaiah, you and I should look into this. Everyone else, check the surroundings.

speaker: Nolan
text: Got it. Everybody, be on your guard.

speaker: Sothe
text: Amazing... I can't believe these ruins are still standing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: They do seem to be very old, indeed. I wonder who built them...

speaker: Sothe
text: Judging by the size, it must have been the laguz.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What makes you say that?

speaker: Sothe
text: What do you think it would be like, to change into a bird or a dragon, as the laguz can? Being part beast is one thing, but being able to transform into that beast, with more strength than we could ever imagine... I mean, they could build a place like this before breakfast.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I suppose that's true... But what surprises me most is not that these could be laguz ruins, but you, Sothe. You've changed, haven't you?

speaker: Sothe
text: Me? How so?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I remember a time when you used to refer to them laguz as "sub-humans." Such an ugly word. Now look at you.

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, come on. Beorc are called the "Children of Wisdom"--and the laguz the "Children of Strength"--for a reason. But I know now that just because our two races differ, that doesn't mean one is better than the other. The age-old beorc bias against laguz is based on sheer ignorance. When I met Ike during the war three years ago...and fought beneath him...he made me realize this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Honestly. Here I thought you were saying something enlightened, and you're just talking about him again?

speaker: Sothe
text: What do you mean, "again"?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, sometimes, every other thing you say is like an ode to Ike. I know you fought beside him. I know you owe him your life. And I know you want to be just like him... But to the people of Daein, he's the man who crushed us three years ago. Some would even call him our archenemy. If we hadn't lost the war to that man, Daein wouldn't be in the mess it's in now. You know that.

speaker: Sothe
text: Pish! I know that. Everyone knows that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, have you noticed…

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes. Ever since we arrived here.

speaker: Sothe
text: What should we do?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hmm, I can’t sense any malice. Whoever it is doesn’t seem to mean us any harm, but… Yes, let’s do it.

speaker: Sothe
text: All right. On three, then. One…two…three!
Ahh!

speaker: Meg
text: Hey!

speaker: Micaiah
text: There, now we can see your face.

speaker: Sothe
text: You’re…a girl?

speaker: Meg
text: I-I’m sorry!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! Wait! Please don’t run!

speaker: Micaiah
text: My name is Micaiah. Don’t be afraid.

speaker: Sothe
text: Have you gone mad? Don’t tell her your name! We’re on the run, remember?

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s all right. She’s not after us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thie is my…brother, Sothe. We’re from Nevassa.

speaker: Meg
text: Oh…uhh…hi there.

speaker: Micaiah
text: And you are?

speaker: Meg
text: I’m Meg.

speaker: Sothe
text: What are you doing out here on the edge of the desert?

speaker: Meg
text: I’m looking for someone. Someone very important. Someone close to my heart…

speaker: Micaiah
text: All by yourself?

speaker: Meg
text: Yes.

speaker: Sothe
text: You’re meeting someone way out here?

speaker: Meg
text: I’m not sure, exactly. All I know is that this is where he came before he disappeared. I thought maybe he went into the desert…

speaker: Micaiah
text: What a coincidence. We’re also looking for someone in the desert. Would you like to come along?

speaker: Meg
text: Really? Are you sure?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course.

speaker: Meg
text: Oh, thank you! I’ve been so lonely since I left Crimea all on my own.

speaker: Sothe
text: You came all the way from Crimea? I’m surprised you made it this far.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That’s it then. Welcome aboard, Meg. You’re one of us now.

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, there you are. Can we have a word with you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Aimee, Muston. How may I help you?

speaker: Aimee
text: Relax, honey. I’m here to tell you about our business. You like to shop, don’t you?

speaker: Sothe
text: Let me guess, you want to sell us weapons and other items. Am I right?

speaker: Muston
text: That’s right. Our inventory changes depending on where we are and what time it is. But one thing is always the same. We guarantee fair prices! So stop by whenever you can.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Do you carry tomes?

speaker: Muston
text: Yup. Fire, Thunder, Wind, Light… we’ve got your basics covered.

speaker: Aimee
text: My shop also has lots of staves and medicine. Oh, and I have recently made some…key connections. Now I carry some very rare items. They’re one of a kind, and very valuable. You should come have a look! Rare weapons too. Honestly, you should buy them, before someone else does! At these prices, they’re bound to sell quickly.

speaker: Muston
text: Well, that’s our spiel. Thanks for listening.

speaker: Aimee
text: Do come by! We’ll be waiting.

speaker: Jorge
text: Well, hello! Don’t mind us. We won’t take but a moment of your time…

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello, Jorge. Hello, Daniel.

speaker: Daniel
text: We just wanted to tell you a little about what we can do for YOU.

speaker: Sothe
text: I’ve already told her. Jorge will buy from us any items or weapons that we no longer need. And Daniel--

speaker: Jorge
text: Hey! Excuse me, we’re here to talk to Micaiah! Not to some stuffy, know-it-all pun--

speaker: Daniel
text: Jorge, don’t be rude! I’m sorry about that, Sothe. Anyway, we just wanted to tell you about some changes we made to out business.

speaker: Sothe
text: All right, then. I’ll keep my mouth shut as long as Daniel does the talking.

speaker: Daniel
text: Thank you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: So, what do you have, Daniel?

speaker: Jorge
text: Hey, thanks for asking! I’ve got a guy who’s a master blacksmith. He makes weapons you wouldn’t believe…and they’re not available anywhere else!

speaker: Daniel
text: Hey, thanks a lot, Jorge! I make weapons too…pretty good ones, if I do say so myself! It’s just, you know, customs have been extremely tight lately…raw materials are so hard to come by… Which reminds me, if you ever have weapons you don’t need, would you sell them to us?

speaker: Jorge
text: Yes, please. Actually, even better…sell me your weapons, and I’ll give them to Daniel. Then he can smelt them down and use the steel for newer, shinier, pieces!

speaker: Daniel
text: It costs some money to upgrade weapons, but… But hey, let’s face it, it’s worth the money. Owning a custom-made weapon sets you apart from the common soldier!

speaker: Jorge
text: Oh, and here’s a one-time-only deal! I won’t even charge you for the materials on your first upgrade! Pretty nice, huh? Now you have no excuse not to come by. Got that, Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Umm…yes. Thank you.

speaker: Daniel
text: One last thing. If you ever bring me a coin, I’ll give you a little bonus on whatever I’m making for you. They’re very rare, so be sure to hang on to them. Don’t sell them to some stranger!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What are you doing out here, Kurth?

speaker: Kurth
text: Hello, Micaiah. Pay me no mind. I’m just watching the desert. How the wind changes the sandscape…The ebb and flow of the dunes, like giant swells in the ocean. I find it mesmerizing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Is this your first time in the desert?

speaker: Kurth
text: Yes. My homeland is ringed with mountains. Everything about Daein looks new and curious to my eyes.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I see.

speaker: Kurth
text: …You have not asked.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m sorry?

speaker: Kurth
text: You have not asked me who I am or where I am from. Not just you, Micaiah, but the others as well. No one seeks to know who I am.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You seem to not want to talk about yourself. Am I right?

speaker: Kurth
text: Yes… Quite right.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That’s why no one asks. People can tell when someone wants privacy. Many of us desire privacy too. Kurth, you are not our enemy. I know that much. You’re kind and gentle. That is all I need to know.

speaker: Kurth
text: Thank you…

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune? What is it? Where are you going?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Incredible! Sothe:  Mounds of treasure! Maybe it was the gold calling you, Micaiah?
Grrruah! What is this?! Looks like a tasty snack turned up while we were out!

speaker: Pain
text: Mwah-ha-ha! Our first prey in a long time. Leave them to me, my fang-brothers!

speaker: Sothe
text: Not good. Laguz bandits! Micaiah, give the signal.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Consider it done!

speaker: Pain
text: Mwah-ha-ha! Come here so I can taste you!

speaker: Pain
text: Mwah...ha...ha-- Gnk! How did this happen?

speaker: Agony
text: Grrruah! Puny little humans, come and fight!

speaker: Agony
text: Grrrua...gack! What happened to me...

speaker: Pain
text: Mwah-ha-ha! Beorc are good eats!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Listen up! We did not intentionally intrude on your territory.

speaker: Pain
text: Mwah-ha-ha! I'll listen...while I'm gnawing on your bones!

speaker: Agony
text: Oooohhhh...a beorc mage. Shiny, sparkly magic makes me soooo scared.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We do not want your treasures, and we mean no ill will. Step back, and we will not harm you.

speaker: Agony
text: If the fire don't roar like a furnace, it don't scare me! Mwah-ha-ha! I'm gonna rip your throat out!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune? Yune, where are you? You can come out now!

speaker: Sothe
text: You and that bird. It's...a little strange.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You're just jealous. Wait, I hear something.

speaker: Sothe
text: I can't hear anything.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Someone's singing. It's coming from over there.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, wait!

speaker: Micaiah
text: You! Hello! Who are you?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I am Rafiel. A voice guided me here. Was it yours?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No. But I heard a voice that guided me here as well. Someone or something may want us both here.

speaker: Sothe
text: You're laguz, aren't you? One of the heron clan, and two of the beast tribe. Right?

speaker: Rafiel
text: That is correct, beorc youth.

speaker: Sothe
text: Your white wings reveal you're of the heron royal family. Are you related to Prince Reyson by any chance?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Reyson? My younger brother? You know of him?

speaker: Sothe
text: You could say that. We served in the same company for a while.

speaker: Rafiel
text: What? You are suggesting that my brother is still alive?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes. He is still alive. And as far as I know, your father the king and the princess Leanne are as well. Unless something's happened, all three of them live in the royal palace of Gallia, country of the beast tribe.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Unbelievable! My father and sweet Leanne... They're still with me! Oh, goddess! I'm...not alone. Not anymore... ...Ah...

speaker: Nailah
text: Rafiel...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello. And you are?

speaker: Nailah
text: I am Nailah, Queen of Hatari, and this is Volug, my loyal servant. Our kingdom lies far east of here.

speaker: Sothe
text: There's a country on the other side of the desert?

speaker: Nailah
