text: Yes. Everybody knows that this whole war is a mess and that none of us should be fighting right now. But Lady Micaiah is fighting for her people, and I’m gonna stick with her until the very end.

speaker: Zihark
text: Meg, I understand how you feel.

speaker: Meg
text: But I don’t consider you my enemy! Not at all. Not ever! Please, try to understand.

speaker: Zihark
text: I’m so sorry, Meg. I should be standing alongside you, but my country has lost its mind. I didn’t want to hurt you, too.

speaker: Meg
text: Let’s hope for the fight to end soon... Then, we can be together again and get back to making wedding plans!

speaker: Zihark
text: Right...

speaker: Jill
text: Meg! I’m glad I found you! Lower your sword and listen to me!

speaker: Meg
text: No, I can’t! I’m not supposed to talk to my enemies.

speaker: Jill
text: Enemies? Am I an enemy to you, Meg?

speaker: Meg
text: Um... Not really. But this being a battlefield and all, I just thought it’d be easier for both of us if--

speaker: Jill
text: Meg, I could never attack you, no matter the circumstance.

speaker: Meg
text: I couldn’t hurt you either, Jill. It’s probably a bad thing for a soldier, but I don’t care. You’re my friend.

speaker: Jill
text: I don’t understand what’s going on... This war is so meaningless. Can’t you tell me why Daein is still fighting?

speaker: Meg
text: I’m sorry, Jill. I can’t. It’s not that I don’t want to. It’s because I want to protect you. All I can say is that I feel as helpless as a plow without an ox. I wish we could all be together like a family again.

speaker: Jill
text: Meg...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ugh... All this chaos... I can barely see straight...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Still no word from the battle. What’s going on out there? I should go to my people. They may need me.
Hey, just where do you think you’re going? Do you think the high-and-mighty apostle should be traipsing around a battlefield, hmm?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Wha-- Oh, it’s just you. Hmph. How dare you sneak up on me that way!
That beauty from the Holy Guards told me to keep an eye on you. So, do me a favor and sit still, will you?

speaker: Sanaki
text: But I can’t see anything from here! I have to know how my people are faring down there! I...I can’t bear doing nothing! Hmm... I have an idea. You! Carry me to a place where I can observe the battle! Don’t give me that look! You’re the one who agreed to guard me, so do your duty and obey your orders! Come on, let’s get moving!
Wait a minute... Is that what passes for beorc logic these days? No wonder you’ve lost your throne. OW! Stop that!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Are you going to obey me, or shall I have you chased back home in a cloud of feathers?

speaker: Naesala
text: By the goddess, what have I gotten myself into? As you wish, Empress. My back is yours.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: My body feels like it’s on fire... I can hardly breathe! So, this is what war feels like... No, please, don’t come near me... I don’t want to hurt anyone!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Whe...What did you say? Did somebody call for me? Who just called out my name?

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah? Micaiah, what’s wrong?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait. I’m coming! I’ll be right there!

speaker: Boyd
text: Ike, get over here, quick! Mist collapsed!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist?! Mist! What’s wrong?!

speaker: Mist
text: Ike... My head... It hurts so much... It’s the medallion...

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Mist
text: The medallion is calling out to me... Please, Ike... Take me to the medallion...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! Talk to me! Wake up, please!

speaker: Boyd
text: I’ll clear you a path! Take Mist with you! Get her out of here, quick!

speaker: Mist
text: Boyd...

speaker: Boyd
text: Don’t worry. I won’t die here. You take care of yourself, all right? Hang in there, for me.

speaker: Mist
text: Boyd... I will. I promise.

speaker: Boyd
text: Look after her, all right, Ike? Make sure nothing happens to her.

speaker: Ike
text: I will. Thanks for this, Boyd.

speaker: Ike
text: What's this light? Is it the medallion?

speaker: Nailah
text: She collapsed, too?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I get it now. Anyone who has the spirit of order within them is affected by this light.

speaker: Ike
text: Tibarn! Queen Nailah! What are you two doing here?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson collapsed suddenly. I figured I'd take him to a safe place.

speaker: Nailah
text: Rafiel fell unconscious as well. I thought I'd let him rest with Leanne. But then I found that she had collapsed too.

speaker: Ike
text: And you think the medallion did this to them? Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: The seal...on the medallion...is about to break... It can't be controlled anymore... My song won't work anymore... We're running...out of time...

speaker: Ike
text: What are you talking about?!

speaker: Mist
text: Call the apostle... She must sing the galdr of release... Hurry, before it's too late... Please, Ike... I can hear...a voice... It's inside my head... The voice is telling me...that we must not awaken the dark god through war...

speaker: Ike
text: A voice in your head? Mist, what is going--

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Mist! Wake up!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ulki! Do you hear me? Bring the apostle here at once!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure about that? Mist is saying that she should sing the galdr of release. She's saying that we should wake up the dark god!

speaker: Tibarn
text: The seal will break anyway. If that's the case, then we should take a chance on your sister and do what she says.

speaker: Nailah
text: I agree with the hawk king. It's too late to calm the dark god back to sleep. It would take too long.

speaker: Ike
text: Do you think we'll be safe if the apostle wakes up the dark god? Didn't we fight a major war to prevent that from happening a few years ago?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I don't know. Are we safe now? But I did always wonder why Heron Queen Lillia passed down the galdr of release. She must have left it behind for a good reason. I'm willing to bet my life on it.

speaker: Nailah
text: It's the only choice for our survival. Besides, we won't know if it'll work until we try.

speaker: Ike
text: All right... Let's do it.

speaker: Ulki
text: I brought the apostle with me.

speaker: Janaff
text: ...And a little extra baggage.

speaker: Naesala
text: Reyson! Leanne!

speaker: Naesala
text: Now, now, Tibarn. I know you're angry, but we'll work it out when this is over.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Not a chance, Naesala. I hope you've said all your prayers and farewells. After I break every bone in your body, I'm going to rip your wings off and feed them to you before you get to die.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hawk King Tibarn, I must ask you for your patience. This man serves under my command.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You think I care, child? This is a laguz matter. You should see yourself out of it very quickly.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I will explain later. Put aside your past quarrels for now. Not to repeat the king of Kilvas, but we have more pressing issues we must attend to. Oh, and Hawk King? Don't ever call me "child" again.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hmph...fine. You get to live now, Naesala. Once this is done, though, you're a corpse.

speaker: Sanaki
text: So, what would you have me do? I will use all the power at my disposal to help in this.

speaker: Ike
text: Sing the galdr of release for us. The song that was passed down from the heron queen to my mother, then from my mother to Mist.

speaker: Sanaki
text: But if I sing that galdr before the medallion, it would awaken the dark god...

speaker: Ike
text: This is what my sister said: We must not awaken the dark god with the spirit of chaos. We must use the galdr of release instead. The seal will break if we just leave the medallion alone. Please, sing the song.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Better than releasing the dark god through war, is that it? Very well. I shall try.

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on? Nothing's happening.

speaker: Sanaki
text: It's not working! But why?

speaker: Sanaki
text: A bird?
A melody alone won't work.

speaker: Sothe
text: Wait! This is right in the middle of enemy territory!

speaker: Ike
text: Sothe! Why are you here?

speaker: Sothe
text: Commander Ike! And the laguz kings... Even the apostle is here? I thought you'd all be on the battlefield, commanding the army! This just got really, really bad...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist and the herons collapsed because of that thing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I can hear the voice. Finally, we get to meet. I have been guided by this voice for so long... I have finally found my purpose.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Galdrar consist of melody and lyrics. Without both in harmony, the songs have a mere fraction of the power.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Maiden of Daein, the only part I was taught was the melody. I do not know the lyrics.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The words. They are passed down through the ages like a bloodline. Though time may pass, their meaning is never lost. When I heard you sign the melody, the words came to me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah? I don't understand what you're going on about. There's no way you could--

speaker: Ike
text: Sothe, shut up and watch.

speaker: Micaiah
text: When I heard the melody, the lyrics felt as if they poured out from deep within me. I know this song. I've known it since before I was born. I am...
Good morning to you, my goddess.
What has happened? A thousand years have not passed. Why am I awoken early?

Indeed, my goddess. You have been asleep for 780 years. During that time, the world kept its promise to you for a mere two hundred years, at best. It was as you said. Neither the laguz nor beorc could resist the urge to fight. They are too weak. Though there are 220 years left until the thousandth year, there is no longer any need to wait.
Is that so? That is your analysis? Then I shall pass down my judgment. I will save them from themselves.

speaker: Mist
text: Ugh...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! How do you feel?

speaker: Mist
text: Ike, you look so worried... What happened? Where am I, anyway? The last I remember, I was on the battlefield...

speaker: Ike
text: You don't remember?

speaker: Mist
text: I had a horrible headache, and my stomach really hurt... Then suddenly, it all went away.

speaker: Reyson
text: Unnh...!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson?

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn... What is this place?

speaker: Naesala
text: Are you all right, Reyson?

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala? Why are you here? You betrayed us again, you dastard!

speaker: Naesala
text: I had my reasons. I know you'll never forgive me, but I at least want you to hear me out. But it can wait. Tibarn and I will work out our problems first. You go ahead and sleep now, all right?

speaker: Reyson
text: Very well... I'm glad to hear that...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Start talking, before I tear your arms off.

speaker: Naesala
text: Whatever my reasons, you won't forgive me. I know that. But I'm asking you to put your feelings aside for now. We're both worried about the herons, right?

speaker: Tibarn
text: You spineless piece of trash! You used that line on me before, remember?! And look what my forgiveness did to my people! You live now because I choose for you to live, Naesala. Once this mess gets sorted, though, I'll be wearing your beak as a trophy. Get out of my sight.

speaker: Nailah
text: Rafiel and Leanne are still out cold. Will they be all right?
There's no need to worry. They're just not used to the spirit of chaos being so near. They'll wake up soon.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah! What happened to the dark god? Is she awake?
I'm not Micaiah. She's sleeping right now.

speaker: Sothe
text: What?! What are you saying?! If you're not Micaiah, then where is she?!
I wonder where Ashera is? We must hurry and make our judgment. Wait...what are you doing?! No! You must consult with me first! No, don't do this!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist. Are you all right?

speaker: Mist
text: Yes, I'm fine. What happened, though? What was that light?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know... But it's very quiet outside. Too quiet. I hope everyone's OK...

speaker: Tibarn
text: So, can you tell what's going on out there?

speaker: Ulki
text: ...Impossible! I can't hear anything... Either that light took my hearing, or...there's nothing out there...

speaker: Tibarn
text: What do you mean?! There were thousands of troops...

speaker: Janaff
text: I'll go take a look!
It's time. Everyone, let's go outside.

speaker: Sothe
text: H-hey! Micaiah! Wait!

speaker: Ike
text: What in... What happened? They're statues...

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Anyone! Can anyone hear me? Somebody, please!

speaker: Ike
text: Answer me! Is anyone here!?

speaker: Mist
text: What’s this? A bag of spirit powder?

speaker: Boyd
text: Yeah. You said you wanted one, right?

speaker: Mist
text: And you found one for me? Thanks, Boyd. You’re the greatest.

speaker: Boyd
text: Yeah, well. You always take such good care of us.

speaker: Boyd
text: What’s wrong, Mist? Are you feeling sick? You look a little pale.

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah. I’ve been feeling a bit under the weather lately.

speaker: Boyd
text: Hey, you can’t go out and fight if you’re feeling sick! You should rest!

speaker: Mist
text: No! No way!

speaker: Boyd
text: Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: I’m staying with everyone! I have to! I’m not going to be left behind. Something might happen!

speaker: Boyd
text: But you’re in no condition to...

speaker: Mist
text: Dad never came back! He died somewhere, and I wasn’t there to say goodbye!

speaker: Boyd
text: Aww, but that’s--

speaker: Mist
text: That’s why I’m not staying behind! I want to stay with my family until our last moment together. Please, Boyd. Don’t stop me.

speaker: Boyd
text: All right, I won’t say anything. I won’t tell you to stay behind, either. I guess I’ll just have to be careful to protect you when we’re out in the field. Does that sound good?

speaker: Mist
text: Yes, Boyd. Thank you.

speaker: Rolf
text: Ah, I see...

speaker: Shinon
text: Then you secure it right there, and... There, it’s finished!

speaker: Rolf
text: Yeah! Shinon, you’re the greatest! I’m so proud that you’re my teacher!

speaker: Shinon
text: Oh, come on, Rolf. Don’t make puppy eyes at me.

speaker: Rolf
text: What? But it’s true! You’re really amazing!

speaker: Shinon
text: Cut it out, kid. You exaggerate too much.

speaker: Rolf
text: Are you going to sell this one to Aimee again? Can I come along? Please?

speaker: Shinon
text: I’m not selling this one.

speaker: Rolf
text: What? But... Oh, I got it. You’re going to use it yourself. Then can I fight alongside you? I want you to teach me that trick where you shoot them in the neck and then--

speaker: Shinon
text: We can talk about that later. Here, this is for you. Go on, take it.

speaker: Rolf
text: But this is--

speaker: Shinon
text: You’ve been running around camp with that silly grin plastered on your face, but I can tell all the fighting’s wearing you down. I can’t help you get a good night’s sleep, or make you eat your vegetables, but I can see that you’re using a decent bow.

speaker: Rolf
text: Shinon...

speaker: Shinon
text: I don’t know why we’re fighting this stinkin’ war, but I ain’t about to die like a dog. And I know you’re too young to be pushing up daisies.

speaker: Rolf
text: But I...

speaker: Shinon
text: What’s your problem, kid?

speaker: Rolf
text: I can’t possibly pay you back for it! A great bow like this... what can I do? You taught me how to shoot a bow. How to make a bow. And that’s not all! You’ve given me so much, and yet there’s nothing I can do to pay you back for it.

speaker: Shinon
text: Of all the stupid...

speaker: Rolf
text: Ouch!

speaker: Shinon
text: Quit whining at me!

speaker: Rolf
text: Oww! You didn’t have to hit me with that bow!

speaker: Shinon
text: Did I ever ask you to pay me back? Did I ever tell you my help had any strings attached? No! Kids should be kids and just learn from their elders!

speaker: Rolf
text: But--

speaker: Shinon
text: If you want to pay me back, then be better than me! Doesn’t matter if it’s at using a bow or making one. Just do it better. Then I can point at you and tell people "That’s the best student I ever had."

speaker: Rolf
text: Shinon...

speaker: Shinon
text: I look after you because you have talent. I like watching you, kid. I like watching you shoot better every single day, you know? But if someone sticks an arrow in your eye, I ain’t gonna have any way to pass the time. So stay sharp! You hear?

speaker: Rolf
text: ...Fine. Thanks, master. I’ll do my best to surpass you. I swear!

speaker: Shinon
text: Master? I think I like the sound of that. Keep listening to me and you’ll be all right.

speaker: Begnion
text: Assembling is forbidden! All violators will be punished immediately!

speaker: Man
text: Assembling? We were just talking around the well...

speaker: Begnion
text: Silence! No excuses!

speaker: Man
text: Gyaaahhh!

speaker: Fiona
text: Can I really have just seen that?

speaker: Jarod
text: Lady Fiona. The self-proclaimed "Liberation Army" is on the march. Marado's army has been ordered to deploy with us.

speaker: Fiona
text: Understood, General. We will prepare immediately. But I need to address your soldiers' conduct--

speaker: Jarod
text: A new war is afoot. You never answered Ashnard's call to arms in the last one. You have a reputation for ruling wisely. Don't endanger your people by hurling ugly accusations at my soldiers. I trust I needn't worry that you'll fail to answer the empire's call.

speaker: Fiona
text: I will not lie to you. My people are proud citizens of Daein, and some agree with these so-called liberators. However, I will not lead my people into danger over ridiculous rumors of some unknown orphan prince.

speaker: Jarod
text: I'm glad to hear it.

speaker: Jarod
text: I need a volunteer. Follow that woman's every move. I trust her no farther than I can throw her.

speaker: Izuka
text: Well, well! The rumors that my...operatives started have spread like wildfire through all of Daein! "Late King Ashnard's orphan surfaces!" "Silver-Haired Maiden at Prince Pelleas's side!" Now that we have the people's attention...we snag their hearts! We'll just extol the savior, fan the rebellion, go to battle...and conquer the enemy in a blaze of glory!

speaker: Sothe
text: Do we have sufficient forces to arouse said rebellion and achieve victory?

speaker: Izuka
text: You let me worry about that. This highly sophisticated strategizing is beyond your young minds! Worry not, my prince. After painstaking investigation, I have determined the exact locations to target! Gather 'round, all of you! Hear my plan for our next strike.

speaker: Izuka
text: If the Liberation Army attacks any of these places, we are assured of an absolute victory.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Masterful as always, Izuka. It's good to know I can count on you.

speaker: Izuka
text: First, we'll target Talrega. It borders the frontier, Begnion's hold is shaky...and resentment runs high.

speaker: Micaiah
text: No. Talrega is no good.

speaker: Izuka
text: Wha-what was that!? On what grounds are my decisions being questioned by this...this child?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: The timing is wrong. Because of the rains, we won't be able to advance well, let alone fight.

speaker: Jill
text: It's true. I'm from Talrega, and I remember well the landslides and floods that come every spring. The mountain road leading to that particular work camp is notoriously dangerous.

speaker: Izuka
text: Wha-what?! Impossible! My...my strategy is flawless, perfect even. Hmph, I never...

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, where do you think we should attack?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ... Terin... We'll have better luck in Terin.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Terin, too, lies in the mountains, but in the arid northern region, where the weather is predictable.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, you're amazing! I count my blessings to have you as vice-general. You give me hope.

speaker: Jill
text: Lady Micaiah, few outsiders know of the landslides in Talrega. Have you been there before?

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah is a powerful seer. We in the Dawn Brigade owe our lives and our freedom to her abilities.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhggghhhk!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Goodness, Izuka, what is it?

speaker: Izuka
text: She can foresee battle outcomes!? Magnificent! Why didn't anybody tell me of this? This only makes the maiden that much more appealing. And let us just be honest here, my foresight in decreeing her vice-general was wondrous--nay, genius!

speaker: Izuka
text: Excellent. Well then, yes. All bow to the maiden's vision. Let's leave the camp and make for Terin!
Yes, that's what I heard! What with that light...and that silver...

speaker: Lass
text: Could she... Could she be the Silver-Haired Maiden?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hm?

speaker: Lass
text: Oh, it is! It is you!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Oh... Oh, my...

speaker: Lass
text: You're fighting with King Ashnard's son to free Daein, aren't you? Oh, we've heard so much about you!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Oh...what a blessing! What a blessing!

speaker: Lass
text: We're all waiting! We're waiting for the day you free us from those filthy Begnion pigs!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Please...take...this.

speaker: Lass
text: It's not much, but people from all over the village pitched in.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, no, I couldn't possibly...

speaker: Sothe
text: Thank you. We appreciate your kindness.

speaker: Lass
text: We're all counting on you! Please, free us!

speaker: Sothe
text: Looks like Izuka's propaganda is working fast.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Mm.

speaker: Sothe
text: You didn't want me to take the money, did you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's not that. It's just... Oh, never mind.

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, come on. What did I do this time? You're not going to say? Great. In that case, let's get out of here and go find the others.

speaker: Kurth
text: So, you're staying, then?

speaker: Almedha
text: I appreciate your concern. However, I--

speaker: Kurth
text: You can't leave Prince Pelleas's side. Is that not so?

speaker: Almedha
text: That's right.

speaker: Kurth
text: Then take this, at least. Almedha: A sending stone?

speaker: Kurth
text: Do you remember how to use one?

speaker: Almedha
text: Of course I remember how to use one. But it's such a precious gift... Are you sure about this? Thank you, Kurth.
Kurth! Where are you?

speaker: Almedha
text: I must go now.

speaker: Kurth
text: Please, remain safe.

speaker: Almedha
text: You as well.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth?

speaker: Kurth
text: Micaiah. How nice to see you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth, I'm leaving for Terin. I know this is sudden. To tell the truth, I'm surprised too.

speaker: Kurth
text: I see. You are off to perform your first duties as a general of this "Liberation Army".

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes.

speaker: Kurth
text: I abhor violence. I do not think you should fight.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth, I'm not fighting because I enj--

speaker: Kurth
text: I know. I know you wish there were another way. And I understand that you feel this is what you must do to save your country.

speaker: Kurth
text: Here, take this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it?

speaker: Kurth
text: May it serve to protect you. Micaiah, I must leave you now. I am going home to my own country.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? So suddenly?

speaker: Kurth
text: I'm sorry, Micaiah. Being so close to battle frightens me, to tell the truth. Thank you for rescuing me. And thank you for the short time we spent together. I enjoyed it immensely.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Will I ever see you again?

speaker: Kurth
text: Who knows? Why don't we... Yes. Let us leave it up to the goddess.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I suppose we must.

speaker: Begnion
text: A small troop approaches from the east! It appears to be the Daein Liberation Army!

speaker: Laverton
text: ...Blissfully ignorant of the trap that awaits them. I pity them, really. Have the first platoon assume their battle positions!

speaker: Fiona
text: Shall we deploy too?

speaker: Laverton
text: Kind of you to offer, Lady Fiona. But the first platoon will suffice here. This is really none of Marado's business.

speaker: Fiona
text: I see. In that case, we'll use this opportunity to observe the empire's army at work.

speaker: Laverton
text: Hornet hairs! At this rate they'll breach our lines before we can stop them. I have no choice. You! Bring out the prisoners!

speaker: Boy
text: I'm sc-scared! Please don't hurt me.

speaker: Fiona
text: Lord Laverton, exactly what are you planning to do?!

speaker: Laverton
text: This so-called "Liberation Army" is forcing me to sacrifice this boy!

speaker: Boy
text: Help!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah!

speaker: Laverton
text: Fight, and these people will be executed right now! Surrender, and they will be spared.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Everyone, throw down your weapons.

speaker: Sothe
text: You have a feeling, don't you? Got it. We'll follow your instinct.

speaker: Laverton
text: Ha ha ha ha ha... A wise choice, girl! Well, no more need for these prisoners, is there? Kill them all!

speaker: Fiona
text: No!

speaker: Laverton
text: What do you think you're doing?

speaker: Fiona
text: I'll have nothing to do with you and your monstrous tactics!

speaker: Laverton
text: So, you betray us after all. Marado has never been known for holding its faith. You'll die like the rest!

speaker: Sothe
text: A troop of Daein cavalry just mutinied. Is this what you sensed?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. Now we must reinforce them and help save the hostages!

speaker: Laverton
text: Y-you pretentious little fools. I'll show you how insignificant you are!

speaker: Laverton
text: Gu...uarrgh... You...disgust...me...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Making hostages of the helpless. Is that how knights of the great Begnion Empire operate?

speaker: Laverton
text: Shut up, shut up, shut up!

speaker: Laverton
text: Wh-what kind of monster are you?! A su-sub-human? B-but, there are no wolf sub-humans!

speaker: Laverton
text: Don’t just stand there! Say something, you vile beast!

speaker: Laverton
text: General Jarod will never, ever overlook this betrayal! Marado will be put to the torch, and your people will be put to the sword. You will rue this day!

speaker: Fiona
text: Empty threats! My fate lies in defending my country and my people. You don’t stand a chance against that kind of loyalty!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Dear boy, I'm sorry you had to suffer on our account.

speaker: Boy
text: I wasn't scared! I knew the Dawn Brigade would save us. Thank you!

speaker: Fiona
text: Thank you for rescuing my people.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Your people? So you must be--

speaker: Fiona
text: Yes. I am Lanvega's daughter, Fiona. After my father died, I assumed the governance of Marado.

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Lanvega? From the song? "Bryce, Tauroneo, Gawain, and Lanvega... Four Riders of Daein, one country, one king, While they bear our banner, A free Daein shall sing." You're THAT General Lanvega's daughter?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Indeed... Lanvega, of the Four Riders. He was a good friend, and a mighty swordsman as well. And stubborn as a mule. Your father was a powerful warrior of unquestionable integrity. A great man.

speaker: Fiona
text: Yes. And that's why he renounced his rank and title as Rider and withdrew from court life, rather than serve King Ashnard. You've heard the rumors, no doubt, that Ashnard murdered his own father? My father could not serve such a man... And so, to protect Marado from a madman, we did not send men to fight for Daein in the war. I doubt you could ever forgive us...

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, quite the opposite. You are these people's steward, and you chose the course that would protect them. But now, Begnion is willing to sacrifice innocent children to maintain their grip over our country. We cannot allow that. That is why we are asking you to lend your strength to the Liberation Army. Together, we can reclaim our country.

speaker: Fiona
text: And now, you ask us to bear part of the burden of restoring our motherland? If you would have my lance, then... I, Fiona, Steward of Marado, do gladly swear allegiance to your Liberation Army. I and my men bind ourselves to your fate. Use my army as best you see fit.

speaker: Jarod
text: And now, Marado betrays us as well? You are aware that riots broke out in three other regions yesterday, are you not? ...All quelled immediately, of course, but the unrest grows.

speaker: Numida
text: Who cares what the commoners do or think? Does the shepherd fuss when his sheep butt their heads against the fence post?

speaker: Jarod
text: Nevertheless, as the insurgence grows, news of it will inevitably reach Begnion.

speaker: Numida
text: Yes... I see what you mean. That would be...less than desirable.

speaker: Jarod
text: The Imperial Prime Minister Sephiran casts a grim eye on dishonesty. If he finds out what has been going on in Daein under our rule...

speaker: Numida
text: That would not be good. Sephiran's persistent as a mosquito and quick to judge. Though you and I know I have been nothing but fair and just in my rule here...it's best to avoid an inquiry.

speaker: Jarod
text: Which leaves us but one recourse... Crush the rebel faction before it grows larger. Exterminate them. Then the commoners, bereft of all hope, will turn their sheep eyes back to us and beg to rejoin the flock.

speaker: Numida
text: I see. Well, I leave the matter in your hands. What funding you need is yours.

speaker: Jarod
text: I'm glad we agree on this. Well then, pardon me, sir, while I tend to our little lambs on the loose.
Yes, that’s what I heard! What with that light… and that silver…

speaker: Lass
text: Could she… Could she be the Silver-Haired Maiden?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hm?

speaker: Lass
text: Oh, it is! It is you!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Oh… Oh, my…

speaker: Lass
text: You’re fighting with King Ashnard’s son to free Daein, aren’t you? Oh, we’ve heard so much about you!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Oh…what a blessing! What a blessing!

speaker: Lass
text: We’re all waiting! We’re waiting for the day you free us from those filthy Begnion pigs!

speaker: Grandmother
text: Please…take…this.

speaker: Lass
text: It’s not much, but people from all over the village pitched in.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, no, I couldn’t possibly…

speaker: Sothe
text: Thank you. We appreciate your kindness.

speaker: Lass
text: We’re all counting on you! Please, free us!

speaker: Sothe
text: Looks like Izuka’s propaganda is working fast.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Mm.

speaker: Sothe
text: You didn’t want me to take the money, did you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s not that. It’s just… Oh, never mind.

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, come on. What did I do this time? You’re not going to say? Great. In that case, let’s get out of here and go find the others.

speaker: Kurth
text: So, you’re staying, then?

speaker: Almedha
text: I appreciate your concern. However, I--

speaker: Kurth
text: You can’t leave Prince Pelleas’s side. Is that not so?

speaker: Almedha
text: That’s right.

speaker: Kurth
text: Then take this, at least.

speaker: Almedha
text: A sending stone?

speaker: Kurth
text: Do you remember how to use one?

speaker: Almedha
text: Of course I remember how to use one. But it’s such a precious gift… Are you sure about this? Thank you, Kurth.
Kurth! Where are you?

speaker: Almedha
text: I must go now.

speaker: Kurth
text: Please, remain safe.

speaker: Almedha
text: You as well.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth?

speaker: Kurth
text: Micaiah. How nice to see you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth, I’m leaving for Terin. I know this is sudden. To tell the truth, I’m surprised too.

speaker: Kurth
text: I see. You are off to perform your first duties as a general of this "Liberation Army."

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes.

speaker: Kurth
text: I abhor violence. I do not think you should fight.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth, I’m not fighting because I enj--

speaker: Kurth
text: I know. I know you wish there were another way. And I understand that you feel this is what you must do to save your country.

speaker: Kurth
text: Here, take this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it?

speaker: Kurth
text: May it serve to protect you. Micaiah, I must leave you now. I am going home to my own country.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? So suddenly?

speaker: Kurth
text: I’m sorry, Micaiah. Being so close to battle frightens me, to tell the truth. Thank you for rescuing me. And thank you for the short time we spent together. I enjoyed it immensely.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Will I ever see you again?

speaker: Kurth
text: Who knows? Why don’t we… Yes. Let us leave it up to the goddess.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I suppose we must.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How should we explain yesterday to Sothe and Nolan?

speaker: Leonardo
text: It's like you said. We didn't have a choice. We had to save Nico and the townsfolk. But I admit, getting spotted by those Begnion soldiers was unfortunate. Still, I'd do it all over again. The worst part is they know we're near. They could find this hideout as easily as they found our last one.

speaker: Edward
text: I just don't get it. This is our country... Why do we have to live in hiding, like prisoners in our own land?

speaker: Leonardo
text: Come on, you know why. We lost the war...and Crimea won. It's not "our" country anymore. End of story.

speaker: Edward
text: Except that Crimea walked away after winning, leaving those heartless Begnion dogs to rule our country for the last three years! The occupying soldiers march around like they own the place, doing whatever they want, and no one dares to stop them!
To be fair, Crimea didn't have the resources to rule another country.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe! And Nolan, too! Welcome back. I'm glad you made it in one piece.

speaker: Leonardo
text: At last, the Dawn Brigade is all present. But you are unusually late. Were you delayed?

speaker: Sothe
text: I think our fame's catching up with us. Begnion patrols are everywhere. It took us a while to avoid them.

speaker: Nolan
text: I've never seen so much Begnion activity in this area before. Is there...something we should know?

speaker: Leonardo
text: Um, well, actually, the truth is...

speaker: Nolan
text: Ah, that's what did it. You had a run-in with bandits?

speaker: Micaiah
text: And Begnion soldiers spotted us as we made our escape. I'm sorry. We only wanted to help. We were careless.

speaker: Sothe
text: We'll worry about that later. More importantly, Micaiah, were you seen healing anyone with Sacrifice?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm afraid so.

speaker: Sothe
text: You can't allow anyone to know what you can do. Healing without any tomes or staves is a rare gift—-almost unheard of. If anyone saw you doing it, you'd be given away immediately, and I don't know if I could keep you safe.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know, Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: I know you know, but you keep doing it! This place isn't safe anymore. We should leave at once.

speaker: Nolan
text: Correct. Ah, but it would have been nice to eat just one meal in peace...

speaker: Edward
text: This way's no good either. Begnion soldiers have every alleyway blocked. A kitten couldn't sneak past them.

speaker: Nolan
text: It looks like this really is the least guarded path, then. Even so, it's swarming with soldiers.

speaker: Micaiah
text: There are more coming up behind us! We'll be trapped if we don't move quickly!

speaker: Nolan
text: We can't wait for Sothe.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The stairs by the church lead to the marketplace. We can break through there.

speaker: Nolan
text: I'll go first and secure the way. Micaiah and Leonardo, cover my back! Remember to keep your distance from the enemy. Team up and bring them down one by one!

speaker: Micaiah
text: We'll be careful.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Leave it to us.

speaker: Nolan
text: Edward, you bring up the rear. Your skills have improved, but you're still new to fighting. Don't rush the enemy. Just focus on surviving their attacks. Got it?

speaker: Edward
text: Yeah, yeah, I got it.

speaker: Mercenary
text: Captain Isaiya! Just as you said. A group that appears to be the Dawn Brigade is storming the alley!

speaker: Isaiya
text: How generous of them. I'll wipe them out and advertise my exploits to our commanders back home.

speaker: Grandmother
text: You there! You must be... Ah, you needn't say a word. I see the goodwill in your eyes. Take this and go, quickly. You've done so much for Daein's poor. It's time we did something in return.

speaker: Man
text: Those beasts! They do whatever they want in our country. They're even sending our clergy to their awful camps! But I'm helpless. I don't have your strength or courage. This axe... You should have it.

speaker: Isaiya
text: What fast little mice you are! How long do you plan on scurrying around in back alleys?

speaker: Isaiya
text: What?! This can't be! I'm in my prime... Not...so easily...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Step aside!

speaker: Isaiya
text: The girl we've been looking for! The lucky little escapee. Too bad for you, sweetie. Your luck ends today!

speaker: Sothe
text: Everybody...this way!

speaker: Begnion
text: They're running to the center of town! After them!

speaker: Nolan
text: Good work! I see the market. If we can blend into the crowd, they'll lose us, and we'll be free and clear.

speaker: Nico
text: Hey, lady!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Nico!

speaker: Lady
text: They're after you again, aren't they?

speaker: Nico
text: Are you and your friends all right?

speaker: Begnion
text: Moldy onions! Where'd they go?!

speaker: Grandfather
text: Leave the soldiers to us. Go on, now. Get yourselves to safety.

speaker: Lady
text: Quickly—-don't dawdle. You must escape. You're our only hope.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you so much!

speaker: Begnion
text: Wait! There they go! Catch them!

speaker: Begnion
text: What are you stopping for?

speaker: Begnion
text: W-well, they...

speaker: Lady
text: You won't get past us! We stand by the Dawn Brigade.

speaker: Nico
text: That's right! Goddess protect the Dawn Brigade!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait! Something terrible is about to happen!

speaker: Sothe
text: What is it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...No! We have to go back.

speaker: Begnion
text: What?! You're letting this rabble stop you? Ready your bows! Nobody defies the will of Begnion.

speaker: Grandmother
text: No! How could you shoot a child? You vicious savages!

speaker: Lady
text: Someone! Someone, help him, quickly! Please...this child is dying!

speaker: Begnion
text: Pay heed! This is what happens when you meddle in Begnion affairs of state. Remember it well!

speaker: Man
text: I didn't realize that the Begnion Empire's affairs of state included murdering children in the street!

speaker: Begnion
text: Don't point your fingers at us. We're just doing our job. If you're upset, blame the Dawn Brigade! They made this happen!

speaker: Begnion
text: It's the girl we're looking for! Call for reinforcements! Surround and arrest every last one of them...

speaker: Begnion
text: What's happening?! What does she think she's doing?! Hey, you, step away from that child!

speaker: Grandfather
text: It...it's a miracle. We've seen a miracle today!

speaker: Man
text: That was Sacrifice...

speaker: Lady
text: That girl! She must be the Silver-Haired Maiden. Only she possesses Sacrifice!

speaker: Begnion
text: Stop right there! After them! We can't let them get away!

speaker: Man
text: We still stand by the Dawn Brigade.

speaker: Begnion
text: What is wrong with you people?! Did you hear me?! Clear a path, or you'll end up like that kid!

speaker: Jarod
text: You sniveling idiots! Why are you just standing there?! Give chase. Now!

speaker: Begnion
text: Yes, sir! We would like to, sir, but...the townspeople are blocking our way.

speaker: Jarod
text: Oh...I see. The townspeople are blocking your way. You dullards!

speaker: Jarod
text: Clean out those dirty ears and listen to me! You are soldiers, and I am your commander! You will follow my orders promptly and without hesitation. Understand, you useless vermin? Now, move!

speaker: Jarod
text: Unbelievable! If it's not one thing, it's another. Why am I always stuck leading the buffoons?

speaker: Sothe
text: Are you awake now? Thank goodness. Do you see? This is why I told you not to use Sacrifice...

speaker: Edward
text: We sure showed them in Nevassa, huh? I guess we can't go back there... not for a while anyway.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm so fond of Nevassa. It's where we all met. It feels like my only real home. We will return...someday.

speaker: Sothe
text: We will, Micaiah. I know you, and you have a way of getting what you want.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Because you're always there to help me get it, Sothe.

speaker: Brom
text: Mornin', Jacob!

speaker: Jacob
text: Look atcha, always sowin' yer seeds! It's lookin' like it'll be a fine crop this year--a real dandy!

speaker: Brom
text: Heck, I just work the fields. It's the rich soil beneath m' boots and the fine sun over m' head what does the hard stuff.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Brom!

speaker: Brom
text: Well, if it isn't Nephenee. What's the story with the armor? Haven't ya heard the war's over?

speaker: Nephenee
text: You'll be needin' armor too. A revolution's brewin'. Better suit up--and make it snappy!

speaker: Brom
text: Revolution?!

speaker: Jacob
text: ...Oh yeah. Nobody tells us ol' geezers much, but I hear talk about some young hotheads over yonder. They're jawin' about bein' fed up with the queen, and how they want change...

speaker: Brom
text: I don't get it! Her Majesty is a fine, fine lady... ...even if she is a tad young to be passin' laws instead of havin' fun. I guess I'll go have a look for m'self.

speaker: Yeardley
text: ...We are the victors. It was Crimean blood and sweat that defeated Ashnard! And what do we have to show for it? We do not rule Crimea. Our towns have been destroyed. We need coin to ease our suffering. Who's to blame?

speaker: Youth
text: The queen!

speaker: Yeardley
text: We've been violated! Daein robbed us of families, friends, and homes! We cannot reconcile with monsters! And now, our hated enemy is rebuilding to threaten us again. Will we stand by and accept this?

speaker: Youth
text: No! We will not!

speaker: Yeardley
text: To arms, I say! We are not afraid! We shall fight for the prosperity of our fatherland, as did Ike the patriot!

speaker: Nephenee
text: Hmm...

speaker: Brom
text: Oomph, hoaa... Lemmee tell ya... It's been a while. This armor feels like a ton of bricks.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Brom... Didn't you say somethin' about usin' axes these days...not spears?

speaker: Brom
text: Uh, yeah... I suppose I did. What, ya went and brought armor AND weapons?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Here, you take this axe... And hold on to it good, ya hear? All right... Let's go!

speaker: Brom
text: Hey now... What's going on?

speaker: Youth
text: Hey, look, it's Nephenee. She even brought her own weapon. So you're gonna join the revolution?

speaker: Youth
text: Together, we can make a difference. Together, we have the power to dethrone the queen!

speaker: Nephenee
text: ...What're y'all thinking?! You don't know the first thing about Queen Elincia!

speaker: Brom
text: Maybe this is all some big mistake? Our queen is a splendid gal. Ain't nobody out there with a kinder heart. We should know as well as anyone... Heck, we fought beside her.

speaker: Yeardley
text: ...You fought with the queen, eh? Hmph... I see. Brothers! Do not be deceived! These two are the queen's agents, and are undoubtedly spying on us!

speaker: Brom
text: Listen, fella, you're talkin' nonsense. Queen Elincia wouldn't dream of usin' spies like that!

speaker: Yeardley
text: Do not be deceived, my people! If they go to the Royal Knights... ...they will return bearing torches, burning homes, and taking prisoners! We must silence these spies!

speaker: Brom
text: Listen up, you blockheads... I guess you forgot 'bout the war. After fighting for years, we finally have peace...and now you want to fight again?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Ain't no good, Brom. These folk got their blood a-pumpin'. Ain't got a lik'a sense left in 'em.

speaker: Brom
text: Horsefeathers. Reckon you're right. Listen up, Nephenee, let's try not to kill too many of these dang fools.

speaker: Man
text: There was a stranger in here earlier. He left this axe--probably meant to use it on the queen. You know, I came to this village for some peace and quiet! Isn't there something you can do? Heck with it! Just take this thing. I'm fed up with war!

speaker: Lass
text: What? People are fighting outside? That doesn't make any sense... If anyone were to get hurt... We've got to do something. Ohhhh, I hope Sis is all right...

speaker: Boy
text: You ever heard of Miss Calill? She teaches magic. You know what? I told her she was pretty, and she gave me one of these! People who can't use magic can use this, and then...well...they'll be able to use magic...or something like that. Here, you take this one!

speaker: Boy
text: What? People are fighting outside? That doesn't make any sense... If anyone were to get hurt... Wait, you should take this. It's a kind of medicine we make. Ohhhh, I hope Sis is all right...

speaker: Lady
text: There was a bizarre man who just came through here. He was talking about a revolution and stuff. Left this. I'm tellin' ya, I've had a bellyful of this war business. I don't want this anywhere near me. Toss it... Sell it... I don't care what you do with it. Just get it out of my house. It's all yours.

speaker: Heather
text: Sounds like the whole village is in an uproar. More men fussing over nothing, I'm sure. Bigger fools were never made. Lucky me! Time to find one ripe for the picking, get his goods, and be on my way. Be home soon, Mom!

speaker: Nephenee
text: ...Uh, hello?

speaker: Heather
text: Argh, whaaat?! Do you need something?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Hey, y'all best... Er... You should be careful hanging around here like that. I reckon you should clear out of here while you're still in one piece.

speaker: Heather
text: Aww, that's so sweet of you! What's your name?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Nephenee...

speaker: Heather
text: Nephenee... What a cute name. I'm Heather. Pleased to meet you.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Pleasure's all mine. So it's Heather, huh? You gonna get outta here, then?

speaker: Heather
text: Well... It looks to me like you have an uphill battle to fight. I bet I can help you out.

speaker: Nephenee
text: But you...

speaker: Heather
text: Don't worry about it. I'm the type that likes to help nice country girls like you.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Um...like me?

speaker: Heather
text: That's right. Don't worry about it. Tee hee... This is turning out to be a great day.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Uhhh... Yeah...

speaker: Brom
text: Hey...

speaker: Brom
text: Hey, pay attention.

speaker: Brom
text: Aw, heck, I hope I ain't shoutin' at a deaf girl... CAN YOU HEAR ME?!

speaker: Heather
text: ...Knock it off, already. What do you want, you old hick?

speaker: Brom
text: ...Oh, sorry 'bout that. They call me Brom, by the way... How 'bout you?

speaker: Heather
text: ...Excuse me? Are you trying to get lucky or something? Give it up, you smelly pig farmer. There's no way I'm having anything to do with you.

speaker: Brom
text: No, no! It's nothin' like that at all! I got myself a darlin' wife and a whole passel of kids, and I love 'em ta death.

speaker: Heather
text: So... What do you want?!

speaker: Brom
text: See, I believe ya just went and stole something from one of these here youngsters in the village. You did quite a job at it, I might add.

speaker: Heather
text: Were... Were you watching?!

speaker: Brom
text: Now hold on a spell... I ain't preachin' at ya, and I'm not gonna turn ya in or nuthin'. I was just thinkin' that maybe ya could lend me a hand.

speaker: Heather
text: A hand? With what?

speaker: Brom
text: Well, me and uh...you see that girl over there with the long hair? We're havin' a bit of a tussle with some'a the young folk in the village... They picked a fight, but we don't want anyone gettin' hurt. I just thought maybe you could borrow some'a their weapons, so we won't have to fight at all?

speaker: Heather
text: Huh... So that girl is a friend of yours? Hmmm...

speaker: Brom
text: Friend ain't exactly the right word... Nephenee... We met when we fought together during the war. We're kinda neighbors, so we hit it off. Durin' the war, neither of us knew much about fightin', so we helped each other out.

speaker: Heather
text: All right, I'll help.

speaker: Brom
text: Whew, that's great! That's just swell of ya!

speaker: Heather
text: Hey, I couldn't care less about you, but I can't just sit back when a girl's in trouble. OK, let's go. We can't leave Nephenee waiting!

speaker: Brom
text: Hey, hold up! Just wait a tick. What's your name?

speaker: Heather
text: Heather! but as for you, hayseed...don't forget the "Miss." Got it?

speaker: Brom
text: Miss Heather, then. All righty. By the way... Could ya maybe slow down a touch? Huff huff huff...

speaker: Yeardley
text: Be gone with you, thief! We won't have filth like you stand in the way of our supremacy!

speaker: Heather
text: So! You're the ones sent by Ludveck of Felirae?! You've been stirring up these little revolts all over the place.

speaker: Yeardley
text: What?! How did you know?!

speaker: Heather
text: I see things here and there. But half of it was just a guess! ...Judging by your reaction, though, it seems I was right.

speaker: Yeardley
text: You...little...

speaker: Heather
text: Tsk... Don't get so steamed up, Mr. Fancypants! You just look silly. Nothing personal... I just don't like men like you!

speaker: Brom
text: Hey, you! Who put ya up to this? Politics ain't my strong suit, so ya can spare me the details, but I know you're up ta no good, and someone's behind it.

speaker: Yeardley
text: Hah! Clamor all you like, but it won't change a thing. Revolution is taking root across Crimea. Our plan is flawless. We're getting rid of that...girl! We shall have a new ruler in Melior... Soon... Lord Ludveck, duke of Felirae, will wear the crown.

speaker: Brom
text: Ludveck? From Felirae?

speaker: Yeardley
text: That is correct. And you shall perish with that name fresh on your lips, you blundering cow!

speaker: Yeardley
text: Ah, survivors of the war. You would be better off dead and forgotten. You can't stop the duke!

speaker: Nephenee
text: Duke?

speaker: Yeardley
text: Yes. Our master, Lord Ludveck, duke of Felirae, will rule over Crimea. When our plan is complete, the queen will be erased from history. Now then! I believe it's time for you to die...

speaker: Nephenee
text: Right...

speaker: Yeardley
text: No! My duty is incomplete... Lord Ludveck... Please forgive me!

speaker: Youth
text: You bumpkins! Just stay out of it!

speaker: Youth
text: It hurts! It hurts so bad! Look, my leg! It... My leg!

speaker: Youth
text: M-murderer! You're a murderer!

speaker: Nephenee
text: But I...

speaker: Brom
text: Yeah. That's right. Nephenee and me... We been to war. When y'all were hidin' in cellars and attics, we were toe-to-toe with Daein. And look at us now...

speaker: Youth
text: St-stop it... Please! I...was wrong! I'm sorry! I'm so sorry!

speaker: Brom
text: You got your head on straight now? You youngsters get so riled up... "Let me at 'em!" and "Bring 'em on!" Hmph! You know spit about war! Nephenee... Let's gear up and head out to the royal palace. Her Majesty's gotta know Ludveck's stirrin' up all kinds of nonsense. And my girl, Meg... She's off on her own... Knowing Meg, though, she'll be fine. All righty then. Let's get movin'.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Sounds like a plan.

speaker: Jacob
text: You two're really leaving, then?

speaker: Brom
text: We put the people of this village in danger. We can't stay here now, knowin' that. We'll hafta set things straight. I hate to leave, but...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Why did it have to come to this? I always thought our Queen Elincia was about as good as they come, lowering taxes and looking after orphans.

speaker: Nephenee
text: The young folk don't care 'bout that stuff. They only care about what's getting' their dander up. Then they ignore everything else. I reckon that's why we gotta do what we gotta do. If we don't step up, the whole country'll be goin 'on the compost heap.

speaker: Brom
text: That's why we've got to get to Queen Elincia right away. It's all gonna be just fine. If I know Her Majesty, she'll take care of this uprising in no time. Then we can return to our farms and grow some mighty good eats. All of ya just hold tight, now.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Thank you for coming today, everyone. I am in your debt...all of you. The king of Gallia, Caineghis. The king of Phoenicis, Tibarn. The Serenes Royal Family, Rafiel and Reyson. And the queen of Crimea, Elincia, who worked tirelessly to arrange this meeting and generously extended her hospitality. She gave me hope when I was driven out of my country, and offered aid when all seemed lost. You have my sincere gratitude.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Before we begin, allow me to make a few things clear about the recent war between Begnion and the Laguz Alliance. When we received your letter stating that the senate had made scapegoats of the herons for the previous apostle's assassination, Prime Minister Sephiran and I decided to investigate the senate and prosecute them if needed. Then the senators made their move.

speaker: Caineghis
text: What did they do?

speaker: Sanaki
text: They imprisoned me in a room in the Mainal Cathedral. They then forged an arrest warrant for Sephiran and jailed him. ...I admit there had been major rifts between myself and the senators in the past. However, I had no idea that they would stoop to such deplorable acts. I should have known. This is all my fault.

speaker: Tibarn
text: We didn't think you were behind all this war-mongering. What you just told us confirms what we had guessed.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I have been forced to flee my country, but that doesn't change the fact that I am the empress of Begnion. I will not allow the senate to declare me false, nor will I stand by as they seize and ravage Begnion. I must return to my country, save my people, and take back my birthright. To accomplish all this, I would like to form an alliance with the laguz tribes. Help me save Begnion.

speaker: Caineghis
text: I will accept, if you agree to a few conditions. First, the immediate and total emancipation of any laguz remaining in slavery. Second, that new diplomatic relations between our peoples start with a clean slate; no bias against beorc or laguz shall be tolerated. Lastly, a full alliance between our countries, to further solidify this agreement. If you agree to these terms, I give my support. I hope that a long last the dream that both King Ramon and I held can come to fruition.

speaker: Elincia
text: I agree with King Caineghis completely. If these conditions are agreed to, Crimea would like to join this alliance as well.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Do you intend to return the Serenes Forest to the herons when you take back the throne?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Of course. The goddess loved the forest because the herons made their homes there. I will see to it that you can return home.

speaker: Reyson
text: My brother! We can finally go home! Our family can be together again, in our own homeland, for the first time in decades...

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right. I'm all for this. I didn't need much convincing, though. I just want to rip those idiots senators in half.

speaker: Elincia
text: Gallia, Phoenicis, Serenes, and Crimea shall hereby make a pledge. Apostle Sanaki, we will wholeheartedly support your effort tot return to the throne, so long as we stand united in our ideals. Please bring peace back to our lands.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Each of you has my deepest gratitude. I will accomplish that goal.

speaker: Ike
text: So, it sounds like everyone is on the same side now. That's the best news I've heard in a long time.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I feel the same, but it's too early to celebrate. I will not be happy until I take back my country. How we fare in the battles to come will be of the utmost importance.

speaker: Ike
text: The Greil Mercenaries would be glad to help. I know that we're a small unit, but we'll do our best to see the job done right.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I certainly hope you will. Especially since I've decided to make you the commander of our combined forces.

speaker: Ike
text: Wait, hold on there! What did you say?! Listen, Apostle Sanaki, I'm really flattered, but General Zelgius is much more qual--

speaker: Sanaki
text: Zelgius returned to the empire by himself to rescue Prime Minister Sephiran. Our army consists of the troops he left behind, as well as the armies of Crimea, Gallia, and Phoenicis. Ike, you're probably the only person on the face of Tellius who commands respect from all four countries represented here.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike, I know you're not happy about this, but you're the only person who can bridge the rift between the laguz and beorc.

speaker: Ike
text: No, I'm not happy about it. I thought my days of being a general ended three years ago. But I won't refuse. If you think I'm the only person who can pull this off, then I'll do my best not to let you down.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Thank you, Ike. Let us go meet with the armies and the soldiers you will be leading. They will want to meet their new commander.

speaker: Ike
text: Not again...

speaker: Sanaki
text: It is time to get moving. Do we have a target?

speaker: Ike
text: First, we'll head for Flaguerre, the fortress town between Crimea and Begnion. Since the Laguz Alliance has fought in Flaguerre already, we're familiar with the lay of the land.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sounds like a good plan. Do you still resent your choice to command this army?

speaker: Ike
text: No offense, Apostle, but you didn't give me much of a choice in the first place. Besides, if I'm not fully committed, how can I expect these troops to be? Just remember: when this is all over, you'll be getting one heck of a bill.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, I'm sure, and I know you'll be worth it. Speaking of which, I have something for you. Consider it a down payment.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I'm sure you remember this blade. It is the holy sword Ragnell. Please take it.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure about this? I returned it after the Mad King's War because you said it was one of Begnion's national treasures.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Indeed. This sword was used by Empress Altina, the first apostle of Begnion, back in the early days of the empire. It was one of the two swords the empress used to fight the dark god. I can think of no better person to give it to.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. I'd be happy to use it again. Thanks.

speaker: Crimea
text: Excuse me! I bring urgent news to Queen Elincia and General Ike of the apostle's army!

speaker: Elincia
text: What happened?!

speaker: Crimea
text: We've received a report that the Daein army has appeared near the border between Daein and Crimea! The Daein army demands custody of the apostle on behalf of Begnion! They will use force if necessary.

speaker: Ike
text: Daein wants to get in our hair again? Perfect.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...I am puzzled by this. Why does Daein support the senate? Well, I suppose it doesn't matter. Ike, we must change our target.

speaker: Ike
text: Agreed. We have to get Daein out of our way before we do anything else.

speaker: Sanaki
text: So, Daein still refuses to negotiate?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Either they believe the senate's lies, or...the senate is pulling some strings behind the scenes.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, whatever the reason, we can't attack Begnion without taking care of this first.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I will not give up. I won't stop sending messengers until they respond. Ike, I leave you in charge here.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's keep our numbers small. We shouldn't provoke them any further.

speaker: Skrimir
text: I understand. Gallia will stay behind.

speaker: Ike
text: You'll have your turn soon, Skrimir. I promise. All right, let's go!

speaker: Goran
text: I cannot believe this! It's an army of sub-humans and beorc. It must be true that this apostle is a fake. The true apostle would never join forces with those filthy creatures!

speaker: Daein
text: The enemy has sent a messenger once again. Commander, this is the third time they've asked to negotiate.

speaker: Goran
text: Ignore the messengers! We must protect this bridge. That is the order from the Maiden of Dawn!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hey, sorry to keep you waiting. I had a little thing back at camp that I had to deal with.

speaker: Ike
text: No problem, Tibarn. What kind of thing? Oh, and hey, where's Reyson?

speaker: Tibarn
text: He was exhausted, but he insisted on coming with me. I had to tie him down to a bed to keep him there.

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Nah, I'm just kidding. He passed out earlier. So I have a different anchor slowing me down this time.

speaker: Leanne
text: Tibarn! You're horrible! I am not an anchor!

speaker: Ike
text: Leanne?

speaker: Leanne
text: I...um, I will...fight. Yes?

speaker: Tibarn
text: She's Reyson's sister, for sure. The girl is as stubborn as he his! Listen up, young lady. You herons are supposed to be more like Rafiel. Quiet and graceful and all that.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't mind Tibarn, Leanne. We're honored to have you here.

speaker: Goran
text: Followers of the false apostle! Bow down to the miracles of our savior! As long as the Maiden of Dawn watches over us, we cannot be defeated!

speaker: Goran
text: My death means nothing... The Maiden of Dawn...will bring victory...to Daein.

speaker: Goran
text: Your troops fought bravely. I commend your effort.

speaker: Ike
text: But your force has been obliterated. I order you to retreat. Continue this fight and you will die.

speaker: Goran
text: Fool, the battle is not over yet! The Maiden of Dawn has helped us overcome every adversity...

speaker: Ike
text: The Daein army is much stronger than it was three years ago.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Yes, by far. Even after the situation turned against them, every soldier fought with valor. Quite impressive.

speaker: Tanith
text: They kept muttering about the power of their general, this "Maiden of Dawn." The soldiers seem obsessed with her.

speaker: Ike
text: This might sound strange, but think of it like this: they believe in her as much as you Holy Knights believe in the apostle.

speaker: Tanith
text: Hmph, I understand. They are formidable and deluded, then. I shall use caution.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, it's over. The front line is broken. The apostle's army is crossing the bridge.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All right, then.. Order a retreat.

speaker: Inspector
text: Wh-what?! No! Are you a simpleton? Just destroy the bridge!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Inspector... With all due respect, Daein soldiers will also die if we destroy the bridge now.

speaker: Inspector
text: Those are called acceptable losses, my dear, and any losses suffered by your men are acceptable if it means stopping that army! As a representative of the senate, I will not allow you to retreat! Fight to the last man!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Inspector. While I respect your opinion... The final decision is up to me, as commander in chief of this army. Sothe, order the retreat. Get those men out of there before they're routed.

speaker: Inspector
text: Insolent little brat! How dare you disobey my orders!

speaker: Sothe
text: We could always leave you here while the rest of us retreat, Inspector. How's that sound?

speaker: Inspector
text: Y-you... I will report this incident to both your king and the senate! Start thinking of an excuse now, perhaps!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Pompous fool...

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, I'll go order the retreat.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...I'm sorry, I...

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't move. I'll be right back!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What's happening? I was doing so well...for a while... I feel like...fog is clouding my mind... Am I...losing my powers?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Funny... I always wished that I didn't have this farsight... It often feels like such a burden... But this clouded vision seems so strange. Now, I miss the clarity... Ironic, isn't it, Yune?

speaker: Nailah
text: What's wrong, Rafiel?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I sensed something...strange. It just came out of the blue. It was some sort of voice...

speaker: Reyson
text: My brother, did you call me?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I did not. You heard it too, Reyson?

speaker: Nailah
text: What's going on here? What was that voice?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I don't know, but it's calling for us. The voice was coming from the northeast... From the direction of Daein.

speaker: Reyson
text: I have a bad feeling about this. Let us head for Daein. Please prepare to leave immediately. I will speak with King Caineghis and get permission to leave.

speaker: Nailah
text: I hope nothing has happened to your sister.

speaker: Rafiel
text: As do I... All I know is that I must go there. That much is certain.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm here. What do you want?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hmph. Don't look so sour.

speaker: Ike
text: I always look like this, Apostle Sanaki.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ah, yes. That's true. Well, I didn't summon you to talk about your grumpy expressions. I wanted to give you something before we set off for battle.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Do you know what this is?

speaker: Ike
text: Not a clue.

speaker: Sanaki
text: When I fled the cathedral, I took some valuables with me. This is called a master crown. It's said to release a beorc's hidden power.

speaker: Ike
text: I've never heard of it.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Not everyone can use it, so think before you pass it on to someone.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, I'll take it. Thank you.

speaker: Sigrun
text: General Ike. Thank you for helping the apostle. I appreciate it from the bottom of my heart.

speaker: Ike
text: I would have refused, if I'd known that I'd be commanding the entire army.

speaker: Sigrun
text: That's why we didn't tell you beforehand.

speaker: Ike
text: That's a pretty devious move, Sigrun.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Here are some funds, so you can properly prepare for the upcoming battle. Show us how you've grown since the days of the Mad King's War, General.

speaker: Kieran
text: Rahh! Hyahh! Hahh!

speaker: Kieran
text: Hiyah! Umph! Hahh!

speaker: Oscar
text: You really push yourself in training, don't you, Kieran?

speaker: Kieran
text: Huh!? Ah, Oscar! You snuck up on me! Only a true rival of mine could accomplish such a feat!

speaker: Oscar
text: I've been watching for half an hour.

speaker: Kieran
text: What!? Then why didn't you say hello? And I would have expected better manners!

speaker: Oscar
text: I did. You didn't notice.

speaker: Kieran
text: Ah, yes! My concentration while training is unbreakable! No one can distract me!

speaker: Oscar
text: Hmm. I wonder if he realizes that he contradicts everything he says.

speaker: Kieran
text: What was that!? If you have something to say, let it out! Speak like a man! Stand tall!

speaker: Oscar
text: Yes, yes. Whatever you say. Here, I got this for you.

speaker: Kieran
text: What is this?

speaker: Oscar
text: This is an Imbue scroll. Imbue is a skill you should learn, especially since you always train until you're soaked in your own blood.

speaker: Kieran
text: I've never heard of such a skill. Is it special?

speaker: Oscar
text: Oh, yes. It's very special.

speaker: Kieran
text: Why would you give such a precious thing to me?!

speaker: Oscar
text: Well, um... I just told you.

speaker: Kieran
text: I cannot accept it! I accept no charity from rivals!

speaker: Oscar
text: Why do you have to be like this?

speaker: Kieran
text: We are equals. I need no favors from you! Run along, now.

speaker: Oscar
text: Sigh.

speaker: Kieran
text: I don't have the time to talk to you. I'm too busy training! Go on, leave!

speaker: Oscar
text: Ahem... It was meant as a symbol of friendship for my lifelong rival.

speaker: Kieran
text: What?!

speaker: Oscar
text: But I guess if you won't accept it, I'll find someone else who will.

speaker: Kieran
text: Wait! I'll take it.

speaker: Oscar
text: You'd swallow your own words?

speaker: Kieran
text: Ugh! Never! However... I note that your lifelong rival is me, and no one else! If your gift will mark me as your lifelong rival, I must have it!

speaker: Oscar
text: That's what I like about you, Sir Simpleton.

speaker: Kieran
text: You insult me!?

speaker: Oscar
text: No, that was a compliment. You're a very...simple...knight. Living only for battle and whatnot.

speaker: Kieran
text: Great! Thanks!

speaker: Oscar
text: Life is boring without you, Kieran.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Find anything?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Not yet, sir, no.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Someone's gotta be here. Keep looking.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Sir!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: We're wasting our time. There's no one here.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: I know I heard something...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hush, Yune! Please, don't cry. If they hear you, you'll give us away.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Who's there?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Is it the Dawn Brigade?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: No. It was just a bird.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Ha ha ha! Thought we didn't see you?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Look... Silver hair...

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: If it's the fortune-teller, we'll be heroes! Without her, the Dawn Brigade is nothing.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Oh, the general's going to love this. Bind her.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Sir.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Listen up, lass. If you don't want to get hurt, don't struggle.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: She's not alone!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe...

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Got you now!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ekarif Magae Teiodasto Ieraka!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: My eyes!

speaker: Sothe
text: Good job, Micaiah. Let's go.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Right. Yune!

speaker: Edward
text: Something must have happened to him.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Don't worry. He'll be here.

speaker: Edward
text: Hey, I have an idea... Micaiah, why don't you use your farsight to see when Leonardo will arrive?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Edward, you know that's not how it works. I foresee some things, but I don't get to choose what I see.

speaker: Edward
text: I was just teasing! Still, Leonardo's never late. Something must have—-
H-help! Someone, please help us!

speaker: Lady
text: Bandits! Bandits are attacking the town! Run away! Who knows what the brutes will do if they catch you!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Where is the Imperial Occupation Army this time? How can they keep the peace when they're nowhere to be found?

speaker: Lady
text: Who, the Begnion soldiers?! Hah! They don't care a lick about us! We lost the war, and they won. We're nothing to them.

speaker: Lady
text: They're only interested in chasing down the Dawn Brigade. They let the real scoundrels run wild and brutalize us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: They're worse than useless! We'll be glad to help you. Just find someplace to hide, and leave those bandits to us.

speaker: Edward
text: And don't worry about us. We happen to be members of that same Dawn Brigade that the Begnion troops are so interested in!

speaker: Boy
text: What! Really?! You guys are in the Dawn Brigade?! Wow, my friends and I talk about you all the time!

speaker: Lady
text: You? But you're just children! Oh, how Daein has fallen... Children, forced to fight and steal for the good of the poor.

speaker: Lady
text: But we can't fight the rogues, so we'll take you up on your offer. Please be careful. They're slice clean through you if they can.

speaker: Pugo
text: Listen up, you louts! This town is nothin' but idiot kids and drooling graybeards. Steal everything you can!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune, it's dangerous here. Go find someplace safe for now.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Heh heh heh! A pretty little girl like you'll fetch a pretty penny for me! Now be a good girl and come to papa.

speaker: Ruffian
text: What did you say? That better not have been an insult, you... Huh!?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No matter the manner of man, the goddess judges with an even hand.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Leonardo! How did you find us?

speaker: Leonardo
text: A little bird told me. Yours, in fact.

speaker: Leonardo
text: What were you two thinking, taking on these bandits alone? That's beyond reckless.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm sorry, Leonardo. We couldn't just leave the helpless villagers to these monsters. Please, help us fight them.

speaker: Pugo
text: Who do you brats think you are, the Dawn Brigade?

speaker: Pugo
text: Aghhh! What just happened?!

speaker: Pugo
text: You give proper thieves a bad name. Hah! You like charity? Come closer! I'll show you some charity!

speaker: Micaiah
text: These people work hard to feed their families mere scraps. Then you come along and steal what little they've earned.

speaker: Pugo
text: Shut up, kid! I work hard, too! You want honest? Once I've sold you, I'll have earned an honest penny!

speaker: Edward
text: Fantastic! We won! It's just like you said, Micaiah. They were no match for us!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune, come here.
You did it!

speaker: Lady
text: Thank you so much! We owe you our lives.
You there! What are you doing? Stop immediately!

speaker: Edward
text: Well, well, well. Look who decided to show up... Begnion soldiers. They certainly took their time, didn't they?

speaker: Leonardo
text: We mustn't be caught. Micaiah! Edward! Make a break for it. Run!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm sorry. We have to leave.

speaker: Lady
text: I know. Thank you again for all you've done. Now, go! Run!

speaker: Boy
text: Hey, lady! My name's Nico! When I grow up, I want to be just like you guys! Come back sometime!

speaker: Begnion
text: Hold it! Stop right there!
Who are you bellowing at, soldier?

speaker: Begnion
text: General Jarod?! Wh-when did you arrive?

speaker: Jarod
text: Answer my question, maggot. I want to know who you were yelling at and why you did nothing but yell at them.

speaker: Begnion
text: S-sorry, sir. We suspect they were from the Dawn Brigade, a band of thieves that targets goods levied from the town. People say they give what they've stolen back to the villagers and strut around acting like heroes.

speaker: Begnion
text: They're said to have a witch among them, a girl called the Silver- Haired Maiden. They say she can heal wounds instantly by laying her hands on any injury. Townspeople treat her like a savior.

speaker: Jarod
text: And? What have you been doing about this band of fools?

speaker: Begnion
text: Sir. A few days ago we stormed their hideout. We found a girl much like the Silver-Haired Maiden... We ran the dogs from their den, but they were cunning and cautious, and...we lost them.

speaker: Jarod
text: I see. I'm beginning to understand.

speaker: Begnion
text: How do you mean, sir?

speaker: Jarod
text: I'm beginning to understand exactly how incompetent you all are!

speaker: Begnion
text: Urk!

speaker: Jarod
text: Make the villagers talk. I want to know who these bandits are and where they're hiding.

speaker: Begnion
text: Y-yes, sir! Understood, sir!

speaker: Alder
text: I don't care who they are. The more kick they have in them, the more fun for us, don't you think, sir?

speaker: Jarod
text: Precisely. Overseeing this dusty old town is wearing thin. A little fresh game is just what I need.

speaker: Tormod
text: Listen and be amazed! BIG news afoot! The apostle is sending an inspection team to investigate the occupation army's abuses!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Really?

speaker: Tormod
text: She sent me a message that preparations are finally complete. But wait...it gets better. She also issued an imperial edict to the occupation forces telling them to cease all military action immediately!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Does that mean the fighting is over? That we've won?

speaker: Sothe
text: Indeed. It's hard to believe it's over. It almost seems too easy.

speaker: Tormod
text: And best of all, Duke Persis is leading the inspection team! We'll be home free the moment they arrive. Our worries are over.

speaker: Sothe
text: Duke Persis...Lord Sephiran? So Apostle Sanaki's dispatching one of the empire's greatest men to handle this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What kind of man is he?

speaker: Tormod
text: He is amazing...the best person ever! He's incredibly influential and high up, but he never stood on ceremony with us. Well, go on, you guys! Don't just stand there. You have to spread the news!

speaker: Sothe
text: We have to spread the news? Aren't you going with us?

speaker: Tormod
text: Umm...nah. It's mostly your doing. We'll hold back...let you take the glory.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's Izuka, isn't it? You don't want to come because he'll be with the prince.

speaker: Tormod
text: Well, yeah, basically.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All right...but wait here! We'll come right back once we've announced the good news.

speaker: Begnion
text: ...In light of which, Her Imperial Highness, Empress Sanaki, has conveyed to you this edict. Occupation forces are to hereby lay down all arms, convene in Daein Keep, and await the inspection team.

speaker: Jarod
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Begnion
text: Duke Numida maintains that your forces performed alleged abuses independently...in flagrant violation of his orders. The apostle, in her mercy, will hear your testimony. Do not abuse her magnanimous spirit...and lose your small advantage.

speaker: Jarod
text: Hah! What a magnificently ruthless maneuver. I didn't know Numida had it in him. Disowning the entire occupation army...and framing me for their actions. Brilliant.

speaker: Alder
text: So then...the game is over. Might we at least drag Duke Numida down with us?

speaker: Jarod
text: Not a chance. We are proof that Duke Numida--and therefore the entire senate--is corrupt. No doubt they'll work together to silence us. Besides, there's more tantalizing prey than those tottering relics. If I'm to fall, so too should the one who upended our plans and drove us to this dead end... That girl.

speaker: Alder
text: Oh... I like that. Our final mission.

speaker: Jarod
text: You create a diversion with the troops tonight, after dark. And I will seek our target...the girl's silver-maned head.

speaker: Izuka
text: A-hhrrmm! Silence! Prince Pelleas would now like to favor you with a word. You may begin, my prince.

speaker: Daein
text: Am I dreaming? Everything looks so delicious! What should I eat first...?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Everyone, you've done a fine job. Once the inspection team arrives, Daein will be free once again! In anticipation of our emancipation, I invite you to eat and drink to your hearts' content.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Whew... Yune! What is it? You didn't need to slip away from the banquet, too.

speaker: Micaiah
