text: Silly you! You're kind of a mysterious bird, you know that? How is it you can fly around even at night?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, Yune...for some reason...I feel so tired lately. ...But it won't be long... I'll go back home to Nevassa...and then...save Daein...

speaker: Jarod
text: So, you escaped the idiot's ball to be alone? How trusting of you, Silver-Haired Maiden... No--I'm sorry--"Priestess of Dawn." If you really can work miracles, you'd best work one up for yourself now.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hm? What? Oh! Begnion soldiers!

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Jarod?! Why are you here?

speaker: Jarod
text: I'm doomed, thanks to you. But if I have to go down, I'm taking someone with me... The vice-general to the Daein Liberation Army, the revered "Priestess of Dawn."

speaker: Micaiah
text: Even if you kill me, the kingdom of Daein will be reborn. As long as the prince survives, the people will fight.

speaker: Jarod
text: Hah! The prince! He's a sham, a travesty, a clod of mud no amount of polishing could shine. The real jewel--whose radiance attracts the people like moths to flame--is you, Priestess. And so I shall steal you and extinguish Daein's light of hope! Know despair, Priestess of Dawn!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ah!

speaker: Jarod
text: Guhahh!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who are you?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Be at ease, Maiden. I shall not let him harm you. I was once one of the Four Riders, serving the army of old Daein. If you recall the name of the Black Knight, you will withdraw from this place at once.

speaker: Jarod
text: Riiiight! That's precious. You're the legendary Black Knight? Maybe you haven't heard...he died in the war. But let's put your claim to the test, if only to indulge my own amusement.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Then have at me...and learn your folly.

speaker: Jarod
text: In due time. But before I bother, why don't you have a go-round with my restless minions? Douse the torches!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Maiden. I shall be your shield. Remain by my side.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I will. I know I can trust you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight, how did you know I was in danger?

speaker: Black Knight
text: That is not important right now. Are you injured?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I'm all right.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Maiden, stay by me. I will not let them harm you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know you won't. Thank you.

speaker: Jarod
text: I see you're pretty impressed with yourself!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Did you think the likes of you could be a worthy opponent for me? Know your place.

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Jarod! Your occupation army has caused untold suffering to the people of Daein... The time has come! You must atone for your deeds!

speaker: Jarod
text: As if I should care one whit about the wretched worms I trample!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Make your peace. This blow will be your end.

speaker: Jarod
text: Heh... How kind of you...

speaker: Alder
text: Gugrh...

speaker: Jarod
text: Alder?! You... Why are you here?

speaker: Alder
text: I'd rather fight beside my general than create a distraction with the other soldiers.

speaker: Jarod
text: You idiot! Who asked you to join me?

speaker: Alder
text: General Jarod... You are a terror to work under. Even so...I've always sensed a kindred spirit in you. I will follow you and fight for you...to the very gates of the abyss...

speaker: Jarod
text: He was a good soldier... What now? Why don't you kill me?

speaker: Black Knight
text: My sword is not made for killing those who will not raise their weapons.

speaker: Jarod
text: You've got to be kidding me!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Stop! Stop it, both of you! A man has died protecting you. Don't waste his sacrifice!

speaker: Jarod
text: This is not the end!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No. It's not.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You would simply let him go?

speaker: Micaiah
text: He is not ours to judge. He belongs to the apostle now. I suppose he must bury his fallen friend and pray before facing her.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You have my thanks for saving me.

speaker: Black Knight
text: There is no need for thanks.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, are you safe?!

speaker: Sothe
text: You! Micaiah, run!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe! It's OK. This knight just saved my life!

speaker: Sothe
text: What?! Micaiah, do you know who this is?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Everybody knows who he is, Sothe! He is the Black Knight. One of the Four Riders under King Ashnard, and the strongest swordsman--

speaker: Sothe
text: Exactly! The scum that General Ike defeated in Nados Castle in Crimea, three years ago. So how can he be here now...alive?

speaker: Black Knight
text: You are correct, Sothe. Ike did defeat me in that battle, in a fashion. But as you can see, I managed to escape.

speaker: Sothe
text: What do you want?

speaker: Black Knight
text: For Daein to raise its banner as a kingdom once again. I came here to protect those who are necessary for that dream.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, General Jarod was here a moment ago. If the Black Knight hadn't stepped in, Jarod would have killed me.

speaker: Sothe
text: What?! But...I don't see his corpse here. And that means...he's still alive, isn't he?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. There was another soldier who sacrificed his life protecting Jarod. I presume Jarod's burying him now. Oh! Oh, no...

speaker: Sothe
text: What is it?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I see a dark cloud... It's dimming the light of hope... By letting Jarod go, I may have allowed something terrible to happen...

speaker: Sothe
text: You aren't sure?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, I hadn't told you, but I haven't been feeling well lately. My mind feels...foggy. Things I could always see clearly are now dim and vague. I may have committed us to an irreversible fate.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I shall aid you. No matter what Jarod may plot, I will prevent it.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah and I don't want your help!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, stop that! In King Ashnard's War, you severed below General Ike, and you and the Black Knight were enemies. But now, you are comrades with the same goal--Daein's restoration. Listen to me. The Black Knight was Daein's strongest general. We need him.

speaker: Black Knight
text: And I am willing to serve.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight... That you should come to us now, is surely the will of the goddess. I thank you for your aid just now, and ask you to lend us your strength a while longer.

speaker: Black Knight
text: May my sword serve you well, Maiden of Dawn.

speaker: Sothe
text: I don't like this...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sothe. How unusual to see you alone.

speaker: Sothe
text: Prince Pelleas. You here to see Micaiah?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes. At least, I intended to. But she is quite popular, isn’t she? She’s always so busy talking to everyone that I can never get near her.

speaker: Sothe
text: They’re your soldiers. Tell them to get out of the way.

speaker: Pelleas
text: No, I can’t do that. My job is to be the symbol of Daein’s liberation. But the Priestess of Dawn is no mere symbol. For her, the soldiers will gladly give their lives.

speaker: Sothe
text: Prince Pelleas?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Oh, don’t worry, Sothe. I’m not jealous, if that’s what you’re thinking. It isn’t like that. Although I have to admit, I do envy her from time to time.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hm.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I almost forgot. Here. These war funds are for you.

speaker: Sothe
text: But the war’s over. And, besides, this is a small fortune.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes, well, share it with the troops if you like. I may not be much a leader, but I truly appreciate the sacrifices everyone has made. They deserve something in return. Divide it up as you see fit. I trust your judgment.

speaker: Sothe
text: Prince Pelleas, you should be the one to give the troops their reward.

speaker: Jill
text: Lady Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello, Jill. What are you doing here?

speaker: Jill
text: I saw you walking over here as I was heading back to my tent. Is something wrong? You shouldn’t be leaving camp by yourself.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m just exhausted from talking to so many people. But there’s no need for concern. I just need some time to myself.

speaker: Jill
text: Now that you mention it, you do look a little pale. Why not rest in your tent? It’d be much more comfortable.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don’t want Sothe and the others to know how tired I am. They worry too much.

speaker: Jill
text: Ah, I can see that. Sothe seems so detached from everything, unless it involves you... He gets so... worked up. He strikes me as a bit overprotective.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We’ve always lived by ourselves, just the two of us. I don’t think he can help it.

speaker: Jill
text: Then I shall bring you some medicine, and I’ll make sure no one sees me. I’ll meet you at your tent.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, no, that won’t be necessary! Do you see that tree? I’ll be resting over there. I should recover in no time.

speaker: Jill
text: But...

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’ll be safe. We’re still in camp. Besides, don’t you have an errand of your own to take care of? It must be really important to leave the feast so early in the evening.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, no, not really. I just thought I’d write a letter to a friend. That’s all.

speaker: Micaiah
text: To the man you told me about? The one you run a wyvern delivery service with?

speaker: Jill
text: Well... um, yes. You know everything, don’t you, Lady Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: You’re going to tell him that the fighting is over, right?

speaker: Jill
text: Yes. More than anything, he despises trouble. He made a delivery to Begnion, and never returned. I’m sure it’s the war that has kept him away.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Really?

speaker: Jill
text: Well, indirectly, at least. To be honest, it’s probably more about his napping. Give him a few minutes of free time, and he’s sure to close his eyes and drift away. The war would certainly disrupt his sleep schedule.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What an... interesting fellow. Well, you should write him and let him know it’s safe to return.

speaker: Jill
text: Are you sure you’re all right? You’re not pushing yourself too hard?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m fine. Please, don’t worry about me.

speaker: Jill
text: All right. I’ll let you relax alone, then. Oh, but here... Please take this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it?

speaker: Jill
text: It’s a Pass scroll. It might come in handy. Please keep it, if you’d like.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you, Jill. I will.

speaker: Jill
text: Good night, Lady Micaiah.

speaker: Ranulf
text: This might be the end of our war. The Northern and Central Armies have merged. A force of that size is too powerful for us. If Tibarn and Naesala can't help us, it might be a good idea to go back to Gallia and regroup. Convincing Skrimir won't be easy, but I can't let our people get killed in a hopeless battle.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. Ranulf, this is your war, so I'll follow your orders. I have to say, though, retreating won't be easy. According to Soren, the Central Army has mobilized and begun marching on our position during the last few days.

speaker: Ranulf
text: They finally brought in a competent commander, huh? Hmmm... Our path is blocked both ways.  Hey!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hello, boys. It's good to know you two still hang out together.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Tibarn! Glad to see you're safe! But, what happened?! Didn't the bird tribes hit the supply unit? The Begnion Central Army is here, and they're marching on us!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Talk later, eat now. Sorry, but I gotta put something in my stomach and get some rest...

speaker: Ike
text: How's Tibarn?

speaker: Ranulf
text: He's resting inside that tent over there. Ike, did you see them? Did you see his wings?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah. They were covered in blood. He's not hurt, so it must be someone else's...

speaker: Ranulf
text: I have this awful feeling... A feeling that something terrible has happened. I really hope I'm wrong...

speaker: Reyson
text: Ike! Ranulf!

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson! You're here, too?

speaker: Janaff
text: Your Highness! Please wait!

speaker: Reyson
text: I have to check on him. I'm worried about Tibarn.

speaker: Ulki
text: We're worried too, but Reyson can't just let him be for a while.

speaker: Ike
text: Janaff, Ulki, what's going on? What happened to you out there?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Naesala and the ravens of Kilvas betrayed us? Again?

speaker: Janaff
text: I'm so mad I can barely see straight! The ravens were informants. They told Begnion our battle strategy.

speaker: Ulki
text: It was a trap. The supply unit we raided turned out to be the Central Army itself. The troops were under the command of Begnion's most famous general, Zelgius.

speaker: Ike
text: General Zelgius? This just got a lot worse...

speaker: Ranulf
text: You've heard of him?

speaker: Ike
text: I met him during the Mad King's War. He's powerful, experienced, and clever. One of the best generals of our time.

speaker: Janaff
text: Yeah. For a beorc, he was quite powerful all right. Tibarn, while shifted, mind you, attacked this Zelgius guy. Zelgius didn't even budge an inch. But all of a sudden he stopped fighting and said, "We've delayed you long enough. If you cherish the lives of your people, return home at once."

speaker: Ike
text: He said that?

speaker: Ulki
text: So the king made a decision. We flew night and day and reached Phoenicis, but...it was too late. Save for the elderly, women, and children, they were all...

speaker: Reyson
text: I also heard what happened, and... I just couldn't believe it. Naesala has betrayed us once again. I cannot believe he'd play a role in wiping out Phoenicis...
Hey, we're not wiped out yet.

speaker: Reyson
text: Huh?

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn!

speaker: Tibarn
text: I'm alive and well. My people are few, but they still live. Phoenicis is still a country. Janaff. Ulki. You know what we must do.

speaker: Janaff
text: Of course!

speaker: Ulki
text: Yes. Begnion and Kilvas will burn for this.

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...So, that's the whole story. Sorry we were late, but now we're here to stay and see this war out. Don't tell me you kittens are going to run off with your tails between your legs. I won't accept that.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Of course not, King Tibarn! I'll get Skrimir right now. A slight delay, but now that we've merged with the hawk tribe, we have the strength to fight.

speaker: Soren
text: Our goal is to cross the Ribahn. The core of our forces will ford the river and attack the Central Army head-on. Ranulf, you'll need to form a small unit of your best warriors and lead them behind enemy lines, undetected. Can you do it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: No sweat. We'll do some officer hunting and keep their leaders' attention on us.

speaker: Soren
text: Good. But a distraction alone will not get us across the river. They've got the terrain and Zelgius in their favor.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Bah! Use fewer words, tiny beorc! Tell us what we must do! Some of us have a battle to fight!

speaker: Soren
text: Don't interrupt me again, Skrimir. All these words may be the only thing that can possibly win this battle. As I was saying, while Ranulf and his men sow confusion in the rear ranks, a group of hawk laguz will carry the Greil Mercenaries south, around the battlefield. We'll cross the river and make our way to the supply train, which also serves as the senators' camp.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ahhh, I see what you're doing. You're going to involve the senators and have them start messing things up.

speaker: Soren
text: Precisely. Zelgius is the military commander, but the senators have authority over him. If attacked, they will panic and request aid. He will be forced to return and rescue them. Zelgius is a soldier through and through. He will not disobey an order, no matter how foolish it might be. Once he leaves, their front line will crumble. That's when you advance. Tibarn and Skrimir will lead the charge. That's all. Is everyone clear on what they have to do?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hmph. I still dislike beorc tactics. I'd rather face my enemy and give him my name before I snap his neck in my jaws. But in order to defeat cowards, we must use the weapons of cowards. Let's go.

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius! The men are in position.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Good work. Hm... It's becoming foggy.

speaker: Levail
text: It looks like the hawk tribe has joined with the main force, but I'm sure this fog will hinder them.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I wouldn't be too sure about that. The fog might actually be a boon to them. We'll wait and see what move they make.

speaker: Begnion
text: General! We hear splashing. The Laguz Alliance is on the move!

speaker: Ranulf
text: The van's marching. Halfway across the river already. There's no point in waiting.  Oh, well. Enemy'll spot them soon.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Then it's time to fight. You should go.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Don't remind me. I hate flying. Anyway, give the word, will you?

speaker: Skrimir
text: No need. Our friends heard every word.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah. Finally it's time. I've had enough of sitting around. To wing, brothers! Keep up with me if you can!

speaker: Begnion
text: My lord?

speaker: Zelgius
text: It's nothing. I'm needed elsewhere. Keep them engaged until I return.

speaker: Begnion
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, well... Sorry to drop in unannounced. We thought it best to hunt the strongest prey first.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Of course. Interesting maneuver.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Will you draw your blade?

speaker: Zelgius
text: I trust you know who you face. Zelgius, commander of this army. If you are not worthy of fighting me, then you are only wasting my time.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I'm Ranulf, right-hand to Gallia's future king.  Will that do?

speaker: Zelgius
text: We shall see. I shall accept your challenge.

speaker: Zelgius
text: At your ready.

speaker: Senator
text: What is all that noise? And at this hour!

speaker: Veyona
text: A battle has begun on the other side of the woods, near the river.

speaker: Senator
text: Then tell Zelgius to wipe out the sub-humans quickly and quiet down! I cannot sleep with all this racket. Don't you peasants know I need my beauty sleep?! I should have you all flogged, you inconsiderate fools!

speaker: Veyona
text: Wretched snob...

speaker: Ike
text: We're in. Soren, let's go over the plan one more time.

speaker: Soren
text: Our objective is to destroy the enemy supplies. The senators store their food and personal effects in crates. If we burn those crates, the senators will likely pull their troops back to protect their own hides.

speaker: Ike
text: So, while the laguz distract the enemy, we force the gate open, storm inside, and burn all the supplies.

speaker: Soren
text: Exactly.

speaker: Titania
text: We can also set their horses loose. That should add to the confusion.

speaker: Soren
text: Agreed. Also, please try not to hurt the senators themselves. Harming them might cause us trouble later on, especially once the fighting is over.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. We've got to finish before the fog burns off. Let's get this done. Attack!

speaker: Begnion
text: Enemies in the camp! We're under attack!

speaker: Veyona
text: How interesting! I never expected them to attack this particular camp. While the senators may deserve to get kicked around a little bit, I cannot let my general down. I shall protect this camp with all my power.  Soldiers of Begnion! Wipe out the bandits! Kill every last one of them!

speaker: Begnion
text: You're with the Laguz Alliance? W-wait! Please! I don't want to die for those useless, decrepit old senators! I'm getting out of here. You can take whatever you want from this stash. Thanks!

speaker: Lass
text: What? Um...yes, I was ordered to keep the lord's valuables neat and tidy. But the lord, he ran away, and, well... What, this? He told me it was very precious. Here, you take it.

speaker: Senator
text: Aaaaahhh!  P-please! I beg of you! Spare me! Mercy!

speaker: Veyona
text: Protect the supplies, men! If anything is ruined, the senators will have our hides! We cannot let this camp fall into chaos! For the honor of General Zelgius, protect the stores!

speaker: Veyona
text: The laguz assault was a decoy, and your real objective was this camp? You're more clever than I expected. This isn't the strategy of laguz. It must have been planned by beorc.

speaker: Ike
text: Our objective is only to burn these supplies. Step aside, and I'll spare your life.

speaker: Veyona
text: You know I can't do that. Our masters may be fools, but we are their soldiers nonetheless. Our duty is to carry out orders from our masters.

speaker: Ike
text: I thought you'd say that. But I have a duty as well.

speaker: Veyona
text: Protect the supplies... Stay...calm...

speaker: Ike
text: The fog is about to clear. Our work is done. Let's pull back!

speaker: Zelgius
text: I'm impressed that you've held out this long, but it's over now. Good-bye, Ranulf.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Pray to the goddess. You're finished.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ahh... I tried...

speaker: Zelgius
text: Farewell.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What?!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hey, there. Y'know, you look kinda familiar.

speaker: Zelgius
text: The king of Phoenicis! Why did you transform? Do you not wish to fight me?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Oh, I wish to fight you, all right. Unfortunately, I don't really have the time. So, I'll let you go this time.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Begnion
text: General Zelgius! You must return at once! Our supply camp is in flames! We need you to take control of the situation!

speaker: Zelgius
text: What?!

speaker: Zelgius
text: I see. Now I understand.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You were kind enough to tell me of the attack on my country. I'm only returning the favor.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Understood. I accept the favor, then.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I'll let you go this time. Next time we meet, keep your sword drawn and make sure you've said your prayers.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ugh...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hey, how are you doing? Thanks to Ike, the army is crossing the river as we speak. We should go join Skrimir. Can you move?

speaker: Ranulf
text: No...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Damn. Fine, I'll carry you. Don't get thrown off, kid. You better hang on tight!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Your strategist is something else. Does he have some kind of magic hat that he pulls all his crazy ideas out of?

speaker: Ike
text: Well, I do pay him plenty for them.

speaker: Titania
text: Soren said this mission would fail without help from the Phoenicis Army. We’re asking you to take a very big risk, King Tibarn.

speaker: Tibarn
text: We can handle it. We can do anything if it involves teaching those vermin in Begnion a thing or two.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Soren has even answered some of Skrimir’s more insane requests. He doesn’t listen to a word I say, but when Soren talks strategy, he’s all ears.

speaker: Ike
text: Is that why he hasn’t been complaining during the briefings?

speaker: Ranulf
text: He says he looks forward to what the little strategist will say next. It looks to me like Soren’s charmed his way into the most powerful position in this army.

speaker: Titania
text: I’m glad to hear it. He’s changed, hasn’t he?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah, I think so. He still doesn’t say much, but he’s a lot more at ease these days. He used to be completely closed off, rejecting anyone who tried to get close. Like he’d lock himself away, all alone in his own little world.

speaker: Ike
text: We all lost and gained something during the Mad King’s War. Maybe it wasn’t a complete waste, after all.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Do you think we’ll feel the same way about this war when it’s over?

speaker: Ike
text: Who knows? We’ll have to survive it first.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Fair enough.

speaker: Mist
text: Wow, how long has it been since we were here? It sure feels great to be home.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, we've been away for too long... Dealing with Crimean nobles always seems to take longer than it should. At least now we can finally get some rest.

speaker: Titania
text: Still, it was nice to be needed, don't you think? Especially for a band of mercenaries as poor as we are.

speaker: Mist
text: You know, Ike, if you hadn't renounced your lordship, we wouldn't have to run around like this to support ourselves.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, I...

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, I know. I'm just teasing you, silly. Besides, I'd rather spend my time helping people. Who wants to live like some overstuffed noble, anyway? Definitely not me! We have Father's legacy to look after, as well: the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, a visitor to see you.

speaker: Ike
text: A visitor? Who is it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Long time no see, Ike. I've been looking all over Crimea for you. You're never home!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf! How are you, my old friend? How's everyone in Gallia? Is Caineghis well?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Everyone's doing great. We laguz don't take ill too easily, so it's hard not to be "well."

speaker: Ike
text: Seeing you again brings back memories. We couldn't have won the war if not for Gallia's aid...and yours especially.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, same goes for you. Who knows where Gallia would be if not for Ike and the Greil Mercenaries!

speaker: Ike
text: Speaking of old friends... I saw Princess Leanne in the Crimean royal court. Apparently, she'd been looking for me, too. She said, "Please save my brothers." Do you know what she's talking about?

speaker: Ranulf
text: So, she's heard. Let me get straight to the point, Ike. I have some bad news. War has come to us once again.

speaker: Ike
text: What?!

speaker: Ranulf
text: The Laguz Alliance, which is made up of Gallia, Phoenicis, and Kilvas, is setting out against Begnion. The situation has escalated very quickly.

speaker: Ike
text: Escalated seems a bit soft. I know there are problems between the laguz and Begnion, but I thought things were getting better.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Rafiel, the eldest son of the herons, brought back some disturbing news from Daein. He'd learned that Begnion senators ordered the herons' extermination. This spurred the laguz to strike against Begnion. That's why I came looking for you, Ike. We need your help.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Flaguerre is close now. It's a fortress city near the Begnion border. We'll storm the city at night and hit them fast enough that the troops inside the fortress won't have time to take their positions.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes! Finally, a chance to rend my foes! But I would rather have a head-on fight. Why do we wait until nightfall, like a pack of cowards?

speaker: Ike
text: What's our role in this?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I want the Greil Mercenaries to act as a guerrilla force. Take out their fire mages and ballistae. They're really bad news for us laguz.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Bah, enough talking! To the battlefield, to taste my enemies' fear! No more waiting!

speaker: Ranulf
text: No, Skrimir. This isn't the kind of fight where a general takes the field. You should stay behi--

speaker: Skrimir
text: Are you insane?! Oh, I'll fight! A general of Gallia does not hide behind his men! Leave this "tactics" garbage to the beorc. We need only our claws and teeth! I call an end to this meeting! Time to kill!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Wait! Skrimir! Blast.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah. That thickheaded fool... This'll be his first major battle. Hopefully, he won't get his teeth kicked out. How about you, Ike? Are you sure about this?

speaker: Ike
text: Sure about what?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, you know.. You're beorc. I'm laguz. You sure you want to take our side?

speaker: Ike
text: The Laguz Alliance is in the right, Ranulf. The senate is actively ignoring you, and worse, they're murdering your messengers. Why shouldn't we help you get the senate's attention? I'm sure my people understand. Besides, I would never abandon a friend in need.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Thanks, Ike.

speaker: Septimus
text: Oh, this is lunacy! Look how meager our force is, especially considering our proximity to Gallia!

speaker: Silvano
text: General Septimus, sir, we're only making the rounds this evening. We don't need a bigger force.

speaker: Septimus
text: No, you're wrong! Even now, those bloodthirsty beasts are stalking us. I just know it! Believe me!

speaker: Silvano
text: General, p-please calm yourself. You say this every evening, and yet we've never had any--

speaker: Begnion
text: E-enemy fire! We're under attack! It's those Gallian beasts! The sub-humans are attacking us!

speaker: Silvano
text: What?!

speaker: Septimus
text: See? See?! Now do you see, fool?! I was right! Hah, I told you...um... N-now what do we do?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Run down all who get in your way! Make your path of blood and bone! Advance! Advance! Advance!

speaker: Ike
text: Yeesh, glad he's on our side! I see the family resemblance. Keep up, everyone! Let's get to work!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Weaklings! Where is your general? Come out and fight, coward! I am Skrimir, general of Gallia!

speaker: Septimus
text: Oh no! They're drawing near! We're finished! We're doomed!

speaker: Silvano
text: P-please be quiet, General! You'll hurt the troops' morale! Wait, where are you going?!

speaker: Septimus
text: To safety! I must escape to Mugill. The beasts... The beasts wish to... CONSUME ME!

speaker: Silvano
text: General Septimus! Gutless coward! Are you scared of these worthless sub-humans?!

speaker: Silvano
text: Wait, there are beorc among them? Why would beorc fight alongside sub-humans?

speaker: Silvano
text: Sub-humans... You dare to fight Begnion? There's no hope for you now. This will be your end. Mark...my words...

speaker: Ike
text: Are we done?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah. The guards are dead, and the rest of the troops fled to the east. We're in good shape.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Bah! Is that it? I still crave blood! Find me more humans to kill!

speaker: Ike
text: The civilians have no quarrel with us, and the soldiers who surrendered have handed over their weapons.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Grrrrr. If this is all the fight Begnion can give, this war will be over too soon!

speaker: Ranulf
text: I wouldn't be so sure. We won this fight, yes, but the empire has a massive army. Don't forget that there was a time when Begnion ruled over us.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hmph. You forget...that was before my time.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Did you listen to a word I just said?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Soldiers of Gallia! The battle is over! We have won! No human can stand against the laguz! We are not done yet! We'll continue to fight, kill, and crush our enemies!

speaker: Soren
text: My... What a stupid speech.

speaker: Titania
text: Don't say things like that. I hear that King Caineghis of Gallia was not so different when he was young. So try not to judge so quickly.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know. That's really hard to imagine.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I'm sure that Skrimir will settle down, given time. Well, I hope so, anyway...

speaker: Skrimir
text: Victory awaits us in Mugill! We shall attack, conquer, and celebrate our victory!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, I've been thinking. Is this war...something that we should really be fighting? After all, we know about Lehran's Medallion...

speaker: Soren
text: As long as the dark god sleeps within the medallion, the world shall not war. Is that what you mean?

speaker: Titania
text: That's right. Our ancestors made a vow, and it's our responsibility to prevent the horror they strove against.

speaker: Titania
text: Chaos is born of strife. "If the land is covered in war, the dark god will break free of the medallion and destroy the world." This war could easily spread across Tellius, and the dark god could be awakened. We were very fortunate during the Mad King's War, but it was a close call. Can we count on being lucky again? Already, we're talking about a war between Begnion, the largest nation on Tellius, and three laguz countries. That's half the known world, and it's not over yet. Have they all forgotten about the possibility of the dark god's rebirth?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hello, all. Sorry to interrupt. Lady Titania, Soren, you're both very perceptive. I'd expect nothing less from the deputy commander and the strategist of the Greil Mercenaries. You don't have to worry, though. The whole situation is under control.

speaker: Ranulf
text: The medallion is under the protection of the Serenes royal family. Even if the god escaped, the herons can control it with their galdrar.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson, Leanne, and...Prince Rafiel, was it?

speaker: Soren
text: Ah. Ages ago, the heron leader Lehran sealed the dark god within the medallion. His descendants have therefore been taught how to subdue it with their seid magic.

speaker: Ranulf
text: So that's the story. We'll be relying heavily on the power of the Greil Mercenaries. I'm counting on you all.

speaker: Titania
text: Understood. We'll do our best to see this conflict finished as quickly as possible. Right, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. Of course.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Sigh…

speaker: Ike
text: Are you all right? You look distracted.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hmm? Oh, it’s nothing. Don’t worry about me.

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf, you know you can talk to me.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Sigh. It’s just… I feel bad about this whole thing, you know?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m not sure I understand what you mean.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I’ve pulled you beorc into laguz affairs. It’s not exactly your problem, you know?

speaker: Ike
text: Listen. You offered me a job, and I decided to take the contract. It’s as simple as that. I told the others they could leave if they didn’t want to work with laguz, but everybody decided they’d rather stay. Don’t worry about it, Ranulf.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What about the Black Knight? Are you going to abandon your search?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, at least for now. I figure that if he’s still alive, our paths will cross again. There’s no rush.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hmm… Yeah, I guess you’re right. No point in dwelling on things I can’t change, right? Thanks, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, no problem. Anything to keep you from moping around like a sullen kid!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Fair enough. Besides, I’ve had this nagging headache ever since I left Gallia with that hotheaded lion…

speaker: Ike
text: Do you mean General Skrimir?

speaker: Ranulf
text: That’s the one. Skrimir is King Caineghis’s nephew, and is on track to become the next king of Gallia.

speaker: Ike
text: He’s the successor to Caineghis? He must be an absolute terror in battle.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Absolutely. He’s so powerful, I think he’s gonna get himself in trouble. And… He’s the reason for my headache.

speaker: Ike
text: You need a sympathetic ear about that, too?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Thanks, Ike. But I’ll tell you about it some other time. Let’s eat and catch some shut-eye before we set off for battle tonight.

speaker: Ike
text: All right.

speaker: Ranulf
text: See you at dinner.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, Ranulf!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah?

speaker: Ike
text: You can come talk to me anytime you want. Don’t think you’re alone in all this.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Heh… What are you, an inquisitor?

speaker: Ike
text: A guy’s got to do something between battles. Talk to you later.

speaker: Ike
text: To be honest, I didn’t want you to come along on this mission.

speaker: Mist
text: Really? Well, it’s not like you could have stopped me, even if you wanted to. Ranulf is my friend too, you know!

speaker: Ike
text: Come on, Mist. I--

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! I’m not going to repeat the same mistake I made with Dad! I don’t want you to die while I… while I’m somewhere else. It was horrible… It ate me up from the inside. I’m never going through something like that ever again.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist…

speaker: Mist
text: Everyone in the Greil Mercenaries is part of a family. We all follow the commander, no matter what. We’ll live together, fight together, and die together. Right, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: …All right. But promise me this. When we’re out on the battlefield, stay where I can see you. It’ll put my mind at ease.

speaker: Mist
text: I promise, Ike.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ah! Ike, beorc hero! How are you?

speaker: Ike
text: Pretty good.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Giffca and Ranulf told me about you. You are a skilled warrior, right?

speaker: Ike
text: Well… I don’t think I’m a pushover. I’ll say that much.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Don’t be humble! My uncle… Er, my king also told me about you. "Observe Ike and learn his skills. Then you shall become even stronger."

speaker: Ike
text: King Caineghis said that?

speaker: Skrimir
text: He did. I am eager to watch you in battle. You can learn from me, as well.

speaker: Ike
text: I intend to.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Lions are the strongest of the beast tribe, and I have been trained to fight by the king himself. I was going to fight in the Mad King’s War, but my uncle forbade it. He said I still had much to learn. But now my time has come, and you will see the true might of the beasts!

speaker: Titania
text: …So, what do you think?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ahh! These are all the favorite foods of the beast tribe. They will be happy.

speaker: Lethe
text: Oscar, you’re a chef?

speaker: Oscar
text: That’s right.

speaker: Lethe
text: Hah! Great! I can’t wait to see the looks on all their faces when they learn that a beorc made all this delicious food!

speaker: Oscar
text: Aww, stop it. You’re embarrassing me!

speaker: Titania
text: But it’s true! Where did you learn all this, Oscar? You should start teaching classes.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Yes, your food very good! So good, it will be eaten very quickly.

speaker: Oscar
text: Really? Hmm. Do you think I should make more?

speaker: Lethe
text: Us beasts have a healthy appetite, of course. On top of that, we have General Skrimir and Ike. …Yeah. I’d be surprised if what’s here lasted past those two, much less a whole pack of laguz.

speaker: Titania
text: Tsk, you’re exaggerating! Ike is a beorc. He couldn’t possibly eat as much as someone from the beast tribe. Well, maybe he would. Actually… He most definitely would.

speaker: Oscar
text: Yeah. Especially the ribs and steaks.

speaker: Lethe
text: Mordecai. How about we go hunt for more game?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Right!

speaker: Oscar
text: There probably aren’t enough herbs to flavor everything. I’ll go get more.

speaker: Titania
text: My. We might need to harvest an entire mountain.

speaker: Sothe
text: Are you sure about this, Micaiah? This makes absolutely no sense.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The Daein Royal Army will answer Begnion's request and attack the Laguz Alliance at the Ribahn River. Those are our orders from King Pelleas. As his subjects, we will obey him.

speaker: Sothe
text: Without even asking why? Daein is finally on its own. Why are we even speaking to Begnion, let alone fighting for them?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't know. I do know that King Pelleas wants what's best for Daein...just like us. He must know something we don't. I trust him. He's changed since the coronation, though. He doesn't smile or laugh anymore. Maybe it's because Izuka and the Black Knight vanished.

speaker: Sothe
text: Who cares about Pelleas smiling or laughing? We have no quarrels with the Laguz Alliance! Why are we targeting them?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Well, with a few exceptions, the soldiers are excited about hunting down the laguz... They've been promised a large bounty for each one they kill. It's certainly raised morale.

speaker: Sothe
text: Listen to yourself! Laguz hunting?! That's just great. We've gone from being freedom fighters to bigots in the blink of an eye. I can't believe you'd go along with such a murderous plan. How do you feel about this, Micaiah? Tell me the truth.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I don't want to fight.

speaker: Sothe
text: Then why ar--

speaker: Micaiah
text: What choice do I have?! I'm the general of this army. It doesn't matter how I feel. Besides, I can't let the king or the soldiers down. My duty ultimately lies with them... I'm sorry.

speaker: Sothe
text: Following Pelleas's orders is the same as approving of them.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, you don't have to do this. I heard that your friend Ike is fighting on the side of the Laguz Alliance. Go, fight with them. Or don't fight at all. But don't let me force you into anything.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm not leaving your side. I swore I'd protect you, no matter what. I keep my promises. If I can't talk you out of this insanity, I'll fight Commander Ike and his men.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe...

speaker: Sothe
text: But we'd better prepare ourselves. This fight will be harder than any we've had before.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you. I know this isn't easy. But if one side must fall, I will do all I can to make sure it is not Daein. I have no other choice.

speaker: Ranulf
text: We've just begun crossing the river. This fog worries me. I can't see the other side at all.

speaker: Skrimir
text: When we first crossed this river, it was in triumph, thanks to that tiny strategist... Ranulf: C'mon, Skrimir... You're hurting morale.

speaker: Skrimir
text: I was defeated. By a beorc. How can I return to Gallia with this shame? If only I had died, I wouldn't have to suffer this humiliation!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir, stop. If you had died, Gallia would have lost a brave soldier.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Brave? I am a failure... Please. Leave me alone.

speaker: Lyre
text: Hey, Kyza... Do you smell that?

speaker: Kyza
text: I can't smell anything. What is it?

speaker: Lyre
text: Hm. Maybe it's just my imagination.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Think hard. What kind of smell?

speaker: Lyre
text: Hello, Captain Ranulf! Um, well... Let's see. What IS that smell? Oh, I know! It smells like one of those torches that the beorc use!

speaker: Ranulf
text: What?!

speaker: Kyza
text: Are we being pursued? I don't smell any beorc.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That's because the wind is blowing from the other side. Oh no... I have a bad feeling about this. Call a halt on the river crossing! Kyza, Lyre! Go tell everyone else. I'll make a run for the lead force and let them know! I just hope it's not too late!

speaker: Lyre
text: No... No! The enemy is here? No way!

speaker: Kyza
text: Lyre, run to the left wing and inform them of the situation.  Lyre!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Not yet. Wait for them to get closer. Everyone, stay quiet...

speaker: Sothe
text: There's the lead force!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Everyone! Take your positions! Attack!

speaker: Lethe
text: Blast! We're being ambushed! Grr... Turn back! Brothers, turn back!

speaker: Gallia
text: Never!

speaker: Lethe
text: What did you just say?!

speaker: Gallia
text: We're the beast tribe! I'd rather die than be a coward!

speaker: Lethe
text: ...Fine. No pulling back. We stay here and fight to the last. All forces, attack!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Lethe, you idiot! Why won't you fall back?!

speaker: Lethe
text: The soldiers think that if we retreat any longer, we'd be throwing away our pride.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You're following the lead of some blood-crazed soldiers? You're supposed to be in charge!

speaker: Lethe
text: I know that retreat is the sane course of action, Ranulf. But if we run now, we'd lose the values we hold dearest in our hearts!

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Fine, Lethe. As long as it's your decision, not someone else's. I'll join the others in the back and watch over Skrimir. We're counting on you!

speaker: Lyre
text: Lethe! Are you out here? Where are you?

speaker: Lethe
text: Lyre! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Lyre
text: Lethe! Oh, Lethe! You're safe! I'm so glad you're all right!

speaker: Lethe
text: Why are you sneaking around?! Get back into position!

speaker: Lyre
text: What?! How dare you! I was just... Oh, forget it! I don't care what happens to you anyway!

speaker: Lethe
text: I'm sorry, Lyre. It's much too dangerous here. Get back in position. Now.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight! You're safe! But where have you been?

speaker: Black Knight
text: My maiden. I shall not ask why you choose to engage in this battle.

speaker: Micaiah
text: For that, you have my thanks.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I am here to protect you. There need be no other reason. Do not leave my side.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I understand. Then I shall not ask you why you have been absent. I want you to know, I'm happy to see you again. I am very glad you're safe.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ah! Zee... Eehark! Hm... Sorry, Mordecai not say your name right. Not yet.

speaker: Zihark
text: What am I doing here? This isn't right. Tell me this is all a bad dream...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Oh, it's good to see... Zee-haark? Why are you sad?

speaker: Zihark
text: Mordecai... I'm so sorry...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ahh! Jill! It's been a long time! What? What's wrong? Why are you sad?

speaker: Jill
text: I'm sorry, Mordecai. I won't take your life, but I must take you out of this battle. Forgive me.

speaker: Mordecai
text: What? Why? Mordecai does not understand this...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ahh! You! I remember you! Sothe! You're so big now!

speaker: Sothe
text: Mordecai... I have to fight you. Please fight back.

speaker: Mordecai
text: What?! Mordecai does not wish to...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Sorry, Lethe... I am hurt... I must go back and rest.

speaker: Zihark
text: Lethe?

speaker: Lethe
text: Zihark! So, you also side with the enemy?

speaker: Zihark
text: Lethe, please surrender. Our commander doesn't want any more killing.

speaker: Lethe
text: Surrender? Even you could not convince me to surrender. You know that, Zihark.

speaker: Zihark
text: Lethe, please!

speaker: Lethe
text: Enough! We are enemies. The only thing left for us is this fight!

speaker: Zihark
text: How did it come to this...

speaker: Lethe
text: How unfortunate. I remember when we first met, as enemies.

speaker: Jill
text: Yes. And then we became allies. And after that, friends. But now...

speaker: Lethe
text: Let us keep emotion out of this. This is war. We will fight.

speaker: Jill
text: My goddess... You can be so cruel...

speaker: Lethe
text: You!

speaker: Sothe
text: Wait... Lethe, is that you?

speaker: Lethe
text: Sothe, right? You've grown to become a strong soldier.

speaker: Sothe
text: Please surrender, Lethe. You know the situation is hopeless. Continuing this will only mean that more of your soldiers will die.

speaker: Lethe
text: We will not surrender. This alliance stands for something more important than our lives!

speaker: Sothe
text: What are you talking about? Death is final, Lethe. Nothing matters if you're dead.

speaker: Lethe
text: Silence! We'll never be the slaves of beorc ever again!

speaker: Lethe
text: Grr... Their defenses are strong. We can't push through them. But we can't pull back! Retreat is not an option! I'll give my life to uphold the honor of the beast tribe!

speaker: Micaiah
text: This is pointless. The Gallian soldiers just keep coming, no matter how many we take down. If we keep this up, both sides will take horrible casualties.

speaker: Lethe
text: Grr, I can't find an opening! If only I could find one weak point, we could break through!

speaker: Ranulf
text: These guys are really clever. They must have a veteran commander to use a strategy like this.

speaker: Lethe
text: Ranulf! But, what about General Skrimir?! Isn't he supposed to be at the back of the army?

speaker: Ranulf
text: You know how he is. I've got six strong men trying to keep Skrimir from coming out here.

speaker: Lethe
text: All right, then. We'll show these beorc a real fight. We should regroup, and...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Wait. Look, over there.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All troops, lower your weapons! I'm going to propose a cease-fire to the Laguz Alliance.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I've seen that black armor before. You're with the Daein army! Why is Daein attacking us?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Are you the general of this army? I am Micaiah, a general of the Daein Royal Army.

speaker: Lethe
text: Wait, you're the one in command?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: My king, Pelleas, has decided to answer Begnion's request for help in fighting the Laguz Alliance. You have no chance for victory. Further bloodshed is meaningless. Please surrender while you can.

speaker: Lethe
text: Do not insult us, tiny beorc! We'd rather die than surrender!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Behind you lies the Begnion army. In front of you is the Daein army. You've nowhere to run.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, I guess we'll just have to chase you down like cattle and press on. Sound good to you, Skrimir?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What in the goddess's name was that?!

speaker: Sothe
text: Get back, Micaiah! That roar... That must be a lion! Lion laguz are stronger than the cat or tiger laguz we've been fighting.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey... Is that you, Sothe? You look so much older now. Beorc grow up so fast... Just like Ike. Remember him, Sothe?

speaker: Sothe
text: What? So Commander Ike really IS fighting with you?!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Let's just say you shouldn't assume that you can see all of our troops. Sothe, if you care for this girl at all, get her and her men out of here. That's my only warning to you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait!

speaker: Sothe
text: Stop, Micaiah. If we chase them, they'll kill us for sure.

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Tauroneo! What brings you out here? Has something happened to the king?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: No, I am here to deliver supplies. ...And to see how the battle fares.

speaker: Sothe
text: You made up a clever excuse and convinced the king to let you come here? I'm impressed. Thanks for coming, General Tauroneo.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Don't worry about it. I trust that the fight is going well against the Laguz Alliance?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, but the enemy seems to have additional forces deployed in the area. I expect another battle to begin very soon, and I doubt it will be as easy as the last.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: So, we still remain on the brink of battle. I see.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I shall do my best to defeat the Laguz Alliance quickly. When this battle is over, please persuade the king to negotiate a peace treaty as soon as possible. Would you do this for me? Would you please talk to the king and help to stop this pointless war?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I shall try...

speaker: Micaiah
text: I wonder what this is?

speaker: Sothe
text: Let me see. Ah, that’s a master crown. King Pelleas got one especially for you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How do you use it?

speaker: Sothe
text: He said that a beorc who honed their combat skills could use it to gain further power.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Someone who has refined their skills. I see. So, not everyone can use it.

speaker: Sothe
text: Sounds like it. It’s a very precious item, so choose the recipient with care.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All right.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Here you go, Jill. This weapon is for you.

speaker: Jill
text: ...Thank you. Um... Lady Micaiah, I have to ask. What is the purpose of this war?

speaker: Micaiah
text: King Pelleas has decided to come to the aid of Begnion.

speaker: Jill
text: Has he deigned to share his reasoning with you? Micaiah, this war is madness! Why would he ask us to aid Begnion!?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I don’t know.

speaker: Jill
text: Wonderful.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I believe in our king. That’s all I can say.

speaker: Jill
text: At least someone does.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Edward, I have something for you...

speaker: Edward
text: Really? What is it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s a gift from King Pelleas. One of Daein’s national treasures, the blade Caladbolg.

speaker: Edward
text: What? Whoa, this thing is amazing! I’ve never seen a blade so sharp! Is it really for me? That means the king’s counting on me, right? Well, Caladbolg and I won’t let him down!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Um... Listen, Edward, this war... Daein really shouldn’t be...

speaker: Edward
text: Huh? Shouldn’t be what?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, never mind. It’s nothing. Forget I said anything.

speaker: Edward
text: OK, sure. Um, Micaiah? Look, I don’t know anything about kings, or nobles, or anything else like that. But you’re fighting because you believe it’s what’s best for Daein, right? And, well, that’s good enough for me. I’m with you, no matter what.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, Edward...

speaker: Edward
text: Now, I want to use this sword! They’re going to write song about me after this, I just know it!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Leonardo, King Pelleas asked me to present you with this bow. This is Lughnasadh. It’s been stored away in the vaults of Daein, waiting for someone worthy enough. It’s more powerful than the purest silver bow.

speaker: Leonardo
text: It’s beautiful... Honestly, this bow is beyond my skill. It was crafted for better hands than mine. I guess... I guess we really have to win now, don’t we?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I suppose we do.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Don’t look so sad, Micaiah. You’re not responsible for this war. We’re doing the best we can hope to do. But I’m fighting for Daein. The circumstances may change, but my feelings never will.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello, Nolan. A gift from King Pelleas has arrived for you.

speaker: Nolan
text: You’re kidding me... it can’t be! That’s Tarvos, isn’t it? That’s one wicked-looking axe. I’d heard stories about the fabled axe of Daein, but to actually feel the heft... King Pelleas wants me to have it? I always did like that man. I’ll take good care of it, don’t you worry.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know you will, Nolan. King Pelleas does too. That’s why he’s chosen to give it to you.

speaker: Nolan
text: Micaiah, look... I know how hard it is to be a commander, especially with all of this confusion and doubt flying around. Fighting a war you don’t believe in is a bitter pill to swallow.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Nolan, I--

speaker: Nolan
text: Just remember something, will you? We’re still the Dawn Brigade. Lots of us aren’t your "comrades," we’re your family. If you need anything, we’re with you, no matter what. Nothing’s going to change that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, Nolan... Thank you so much.

speaker: Nolan
text: Just a quick half-mark, and we'll be in Kisca. I'd like to stock up there, but...

speaker: Sothe
text: Begnion will be on the lookout for us. Let's steer clear of towns for now, unless we want more trouble.

speaker: Edward
text: Don't tell me... This means another night sleeping on the cold ground with nothing but bugs to keep us warm!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, Edward, it's not that bad!  The forest is so beautiful and serene. I'd almost rather be out here. Right, Yune?
Um...excuse me. Are you people heading to town by any chance? Our abbot is ill. He needs medicine, but Begnion soldiers are hoarding our provisions in the manor house.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The Dawn Brigade, at your service! I'm sure we can help you and your abbot.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, do you know the layout of the manor?

speaker: Sothe
text: I was here years ago. As I remember, there's a large armory tucked deep inside the building. And if I understand correctly, Begnion soldiers guard valuables they've stolen-—from rare objects to necessary supplies—-in that armory.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Then the medicine will be there, too.

speaker: Laura
text: Are you sure you don't mind?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course not! Danger is part of our work. Leave everything to us!

speaker: Sothe
text: Your abbot will have his medicine.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, thank you so much! Good luck!

speaker: Zaitan
text: Intruders, you say?! What with a full battalion stationed here? The gall! And the intrigue! Now, listen up, my men, catch 'em midstream and filet 'em like fish!

speaker: Sothe
text: That takes care of the locks. Now, I just have to figure out how to get everybody safely up here.

speaker: Begnion
text: Hey, you! How did you get in here?!

speaker: Sothe
text: We are the Dawn Brigade. We go where we please. We're here to reclaim what you've stolen from the people of Daein.

speaker: Begnion
text: Sir! There are burglars on the loose! Several young men and women have broken into the manor house!

speaker: Jarod
text: Did you say women? What... What color is their hair?

speaker: Begnion
text: There are two girls. One has bizarre silver-colored hair, and the other—-

speaker: Jarod
text: The Silver-Haired Maiden! Hm, very well. I want all soldiers on hand. Capture the girl...alive. Do what you will with the others, but bring me that girl! Understand!?

speaker: Begnion
text: Sir, yes sir!

speaker: Zaitan
text: Don't move a finger, thief, or I'll skewer you with my lance and serve you for lunch!

speaker: Zaitan
text: With this many, we...can't...hold them back... Call...for...rein...force...ments...

speaker: Zaitan
text: The Silver-Haired Maiden! I've got you! Lucky for you, Jarod wants you alive—-but there's no escaping now!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm afraid I have to disappoint you.

speaker: Zaitan
text: Oh, how pompous! Try to "disappoint" me, and I'll break both your arms!

speaker: Laura
text: At last... Glory be! The abbot will have his medicine. Wait for me here. I'll return soon.

speaker: Sothe
text: Well done, everybody! Are we all present and accounted for?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait! Laura's missing! She was just with me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Let's split up and search for her. Micaiah, you come with me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Hm, the forest is huge. We can cover more ground if we search individually.

speaker: Sothe
text: But...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Let's rendezvous at Kunu Swamp in three marks' time.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Somebody's near by...
You sensed me, did you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Where is Laura?

speaker: Jarod
text: And you saw through my ruse. You're as clever as they say, my dear. You even came alone. How brave of you. Was that to give your friends a chance to escape? What a thoughtful little thing you are.

speaker: Laura
text: Mi-Micaiah! Don't come any closer!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Laura! Let her go! She isn't one of us...

speaker: Jarod
text: Now, you know I can't do that. She's a valuable hostage, just like you!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! Yune, fly away!

speaker: Jarod
text: Argh, dratted bird! Yes, get that mangy flying bag of bones out of here before I squash it like a fly! Tch. How annoying. Enough of this! Back to the castle. As long as we have these two, the others don't matter.

speaker: Alder
text: Sir. All hands, withdraw!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I've got a bad feeling about this...

speaker: Mist
text: This is great! I can't remember the last time we got to sleep indoors! We can be thankful for the rain, I guess.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, the decorations are a little...overdone, but the beds will be warm and dry. I'm glad I remembered this mansion was here.

speaker: Soren
text: Presumably we're the first people to set foot in here since Oliver was posthumously found guilty of trading in heron slaves. I understand the senate confiscated his lands and property immediately after the Mad King's War ended.

speaker: Titania
text: Well, someone must be living here; the place is spotless. By law, there shouldn't be anyone here. I wonder if someone is squatting.

speaker: Nailah
text: Is something wrong, Rafiel?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I feel that we are being watched. I sense no malice...but there is definitely some sort of presence. Perhaps the master of the house?

speaker: Nailah
text: Hmm. I'll be we find out soon.

speaker: Nailah
text: The Disciples of Order are here! They just appeared in the outer building.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let's get everyone mobilized.

speaker: Rafiel
text: General! Come quickly! Our friends are in trouble!

speaker: Ike
text: Friends?

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Isn't that--

speaker: Mist
text: It's Tormod! We haven't seen him since the Mad King's War!

speaker: Order
text: Extinguish them!

speaker: Tormod
text: Funny you should phrase it that way, you soon-to-be cinder!

speaker: Tormod
text: What the—That should have worked better. Who are these guys?

speaker: Ike
text: Tormod, your backup's here! Just hold your position!

speaker: Tormod
text: Much appreciated! Don't worry. We're not going anywhere! Wait a second...Ike? What happened to you, musclehead?

speaker: Muarim
text: It's definitely Sir Ike. But beorc growth always amazes me. It's like looking at a different person.

speaker: Tormod
text: Between him and Sothe, I'm starting to feel a little inadequate! Well, that settles it! I've still got a lot of growing to do, so I've got to survive! I can't die like this!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let's help these guys out. Get ready for battle!

speaker: Hetzel
text: Oliver, Duke of Tanas, have a care. The last time you faced these enemies, you were defeated, humiliated, and your heron slave trade was exposed. By the good graces of your fellow senators, you were saved from death and hidden away here. Behind the backs of the apostle and the prime minister, we have kept you safe. Do not fail us.

speaker: Oliver
text: I understand, Senator Hetzel. Rest assured, the savages who dare set foot in my home a second time will be eradicated for the glory of the goddess! Ugly creatures deserve nothing but an ugly death. You will not regret the lovely mercy you've shown me!

speaker: Ike
text: Tormod, it's been a while.

speaker: Tormod
text: Holy moly! You are absolutely huge! I feel puny next to you...

speaker: Ike
text: That's because you are puny. Magic clearly doesn't give you much muscle tone.

speaker: Tormod
text: Oh...I suppose that's true. Still, it works pretty well for winning battles.

speaker: Ike
text: Actually, Tormod...

speaker: Tormod
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: Did you actually get smaller?

speaker: Tormod
text: Nah, you just can't see me properly because all of your blood gets pumped to your muscles, away from your brain!  Ike: A little touchy, Tormod? ...Whatever. We have work to do.

speaker: Ike
text: Muarim, we've got your back here. Are you ready for these guys?

speaker: Muarim
text: Absolutely, Sir Ike. I'm glad to have the chance to fight with you again.

speaker: Ike
text: The pleasure's mine, Muarim. You're a good man.

speaker: Muarim
text: Thank you.

speaker: Oliver
text: I have seen death's vistas and returned an even wiser, more exquisite man! Take it in! Bask in the beauty!

speaker: Oliver
text: Ohhh...you are truly a banquet for the eyes as well as the...spirit. I am quite overcome!

speaker: Rafiel
text: Unhand me!

speaker: Oliver
text: But how is it that anyone could risk a precious treasure like you in battle? What if something marred you?

speaker: Rafiel
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Oliver
text: Don't worry, pretty bird; I'll save you. You need someone who can give you loving protection. Someone...like me.

speaker: Oliver
text: I'll take you away from these savages! I would never let them lay a single finger on you, my precious! No, no... The jealous cretins mustn't ruffle a single feather... I'll have to kill them. Come now, come to daddy!

speaker: Ike
text: Hold on a second... Aren't these your men? Why are you fighting them?

speaker: Oliver
text: It's quite simple, really. A true guardian of beauty stands with those who are beautiful. If your exquisite heron prince will not stay here in my home, I must follow him. I have seen death; it holds no mystery for me. Only my pursuit matters. Rest at ease, friends.

speaker: Ike
text: Look... Would you mind rejoining the enemy?

speaker: Oliver
text: Aagh... Still so many beautiful things...that...I...don't own.

speaker: Oliver
text: Ho ho, what have we here? A fine little raven indeed! Please... Let me see the length of those wings. I'll need to know, if I'm to take proper...care of them.

speaker: Vika
text: You Begnion nobles... Can't you ever just say what you're thinking?

speaker: Oliver
text: Sub...sub...sub-human! Tiger! Tiger! Eyes burning bright! In my foyer late at night! Oh, my poetic soul! I'm much too delicate for this!

speaker: Muarim
text: Oh boy...

speaker: Tormod
text: Hey, chunky! Apparently we didn't kill you enough last time! Time to try again!

speaker: Oliver
text: Yawp! Dear me! What a frightening young child.

speaker: Tormod
text: I am NOT a child!

speaker: Volug
text: Grrrrr!

speaker: Oliver
text: Ack! A sub-human! What a horrible monster, smacking his lips before dining on my delicate body! Someone, please help me! A man like me doesn't deserve this!

speaker: Oliver
text: S-sub-human! A hideous sub-human is attacking me! Help! Someone help me! I'm much too lovely for this!

speaker: Nailah
text: What a strangely shaped creature... Is this some rare subspecies of beorc?

speaker: Ike
text: You! You're still alive?!

speaker: Oliver
text: The world simply could not bear to be without me. Your crude weapons have no force against true magnificence! Blessed with such beauty, I have no foes...only inferiors!

speaker: Ike
text: Glad to see you're still barely clinging to that last shred of sanity. Just give it up, already.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, another storm weathered. It's late. Everyone try to get some sleep and be ready for tomorrow.

speaker: Hetzel
text: Wiped out... Not a man left standing. It must be the will of the goddess.

speaker: Rafiel
text: You! You are...

speaker: Hetzel
text: Rafiel? How-- You're still alive! I'm so glad you're safe...

speaker: Rafiel
text: I have nothing to say to you.

speaker: Hetzel
text: So, you know, then. What we did was unforgivable... I was against it from the beginning... I argued with the others time and again! ...Ah, what's the use... It doesn't matter what I say now. Rafiel... Despite everything, I'm very happy to see that you're alive. But I beg of you... Stay away from the capital. You must not anger the goddess!

speaker: Ike
text: I've seen that man before. He's a pretty influential senator, isn't he?

speaker: Rafiel
text: His name is Hetzel, duke of Asmin... I owe my life to him.

speaker: Nailah
text: Ike, I'm sorry, but can we talk later? Rafiel needs to rest.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Ike
text: So... Why are you guys here, anyway?

speaker: Tormod
text: You won't believe me, but it came to me in a dream, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: A dream?

speaker: Tormod
text: Yeah. Shortly after that light turned everyone to stone, I had a really strange dream. I don't remember it very well, but it was like there was a voice in my head, whispering encouragement. When I woke up, I knew what I had to do. I knew that everyone who hadn't been petrified was heading to the Tower of Guidance, and from there we'd all be saved.

speaker: Muarim
text: I had the same dream. I thought this must be a divine revelation, so we left the desert to make for the tower.

speaker: Ike
text: Sounds like more of Yune's handiwork.

speaker: Nailah
text: Agreed. This is her way of gathering able bodies. I suppose a goddess of chaos will do things her own way...

speaker: Tormod
text: Yune? Isn't that the dark goddess I keep hearing about? Should I even be listening to her?

speaker: Ike
text: I can't really put it into words, but I can feel it inside. Listening to her is the right thing to do. I guess it's a lot like the dream you described.

speaker: Nailah
text: We laguz are pretty intuitive. I feel it in my blood that Yune is the goddess of our ancestors.

speaker: Tormod
text: All right. That makes it a little easier to come to grips with.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you feeling any better?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Yes, much. Sorry if I worried you. That was quite a shock.

speaker: Ike
text: No problem... Can we talk about it? I'd like to know about you and that man...

speaker: Rafiel
text: Yes, Hetzel... It was some time ago now, a little while before the Serenes Massacre...

speaker: Rafiel
text: I was alone outside of the forest. There, I was found and captured by beorc slave traders. The slavers sold me at auction, and the winner was Lord Hetzel. I didn't know until later, but the bidding for me among the senators was extremely competitive. Lord Hetzel actually spent much of his fortune on my purchase.

speaker: Rafiel
text: After he took me home, I fell deathly ill, mostly just from desperation. Lord Hetzel was deeply moved by my plight... He brought me to a temple and spent many days nursing me back to health. I have no doubt that he saved my life, but my wings never fully recovered. I haven't been able to fly since. Lord Hetzel felt terrible... Do you know what he told me? He said, "Once you fully recover, you can return to the forest." Members of the heron clan, we can look inside people's hearts. I knew the truth of what Lord Hetzel said... He was being absolutely honest. I knew I could trust him from that moment on.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Then... The Serenes Massacre. I didn't need to be told. I would have felt the suffering of that many of my brethren from anywhere in the world. Lord Hetzel never said anything, but I knew that the senators had murdered the apostle and blamed my clan. Because of the monstrous ambition of a handful of evil men, my entire race was burned to ash.

speaker: Ike
text: Rafiel...

speaker: Rafiel
text: Late that night, I returned to the temple. Something happened to me there... Some sort of force took hold of me... The next thing I knew... I was lying in the sand. If Queen Nailah hadn't come, I would have died right there. I didn't even realize how far I was from my dear home.

speaker: Ike
text: So Duke Hetzel is both your savior and your enemy.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Hetzel was not directly involved, nor did he give orders to those who were. Something about him still troubles me, though... Whenever I think of him, I feel chaos boiling up from his heart. ...I sense it in myself, as well. I have the same feelings welling up in me. I suppose that's why I can accept it in him.

speaker: Ike
text: Your people, the remaining heron tribe... They've also changed. King Tibarn has said many times that Reyson and Leanne are far from typical herons.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Yes, I was surprised when we met again. They're both so strong...and vitality seems to shine forth from within them.

speaker: Ike
text: It makes you wonder if chaos is really all bad, doesn't it?

speaker: Rafiel
text: I am starting to think that what the world needs is a balance between order and chaos. What do you think?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know. I think there are some things we're not meant to understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Er. Hello. What can I do for you?

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, that’s an elixir.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, I like them too.

speaker: Nailah
text: (Volug, speak out loud. Ike is confused by your silence.)

speaker: Volug
text: (But, Your Majesty... He doesn’t understand our language.)

speaker: Nailah
text: (It’s better than staying silent.) Sorry. I don’t mean to leave you out of the conversation.

speaker: Ike
text: No, that’s fine. I would have been confused either way. I didn’t know you could speak the ancient language.

speaker: Nailah
text: It’s Hatari’s common language. I would never have known about the Tellius language if I hadn’t met Rafiel.

speaker: Ike
text: The Tellius language?

speaker: Nailah
text: You don’t know? The language we are using right now is called the Tellius language. You call it modern speech, I suppose.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, I see.

speaker: Nailah
text: Long ago, beorc created the Old Tongue. The ancient speech is what we laguz call it. The language was too difficult for the laguz to master. So the language of Tellius was created in its place.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh. I’ve never heard that before. The only people I’m aware of who know the ancient speech are the heron laguz. I think Nasir of Goldoa said he could read it. Among beorc, only mages know how to use it, and that’s only for spells.

speaker: Nailah
text: Well, the laguz who live a long time, such as dragons and herons, have all the time in the world to learn it. Beorc probably left the ancient speech behind in favor of a newer and improved language, with the exception of spells.

speaker: Ike
text: That makes sense, I suppose. Mordecai once told me that speech lets you avoid fighting when it’s not a good idea. He said that’s why it’s a good idea to know many languages.

speaker: Nailah
text: Did he, now? Volug, did you hear that? You can learn the language of Tellius with Mordecai.

speaker: Volug
text: ...I will... I...will try.

speaker: Nailah
text: He understands what you’re saying, for the most part. It’s the speaking that’s the hard part for him.

speaker: Ike
text: You don’t need to feel obligated. I mean, it isn’t like I can understand ancient speech.

speaker: Volug
text: (Here, I want you to have this.) Um, here... Take.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, I understand. Thanks.

speaker: Volug
text: (It’s about time!)

speaker: Ike
text: I think I understood that. You were happy that I understood what you just said.

speaker: Volug
text: (I guess you could say that.)

speaker: Nailah
text: Good. As long as you have the desire to learn, words will soon follow.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. I’ll try to learn a little ancient speech from now on, too. Volug, you be my teacher and I’ll be your teacher.

speaker: Volug
text: (All right. It’s a deal.)

speaker: Ike
text: How are we doing for time, Janaff?

speaker: Janaff
text: They're gaining on us. Their lead force is about...let's say...one day off.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You've got to be kidding! How did they cover so much ground since yesterday?!

speaker: Ike
text: They're definitely moving faster than we expected. At this rate, they'll catch us soon. Any ideas?

speaker: Soren
text: ...With the enemy closing in so quickly, it would be unwise to use this secret passage. If Begnion found it, it would give them an open invitation to surge across Gallia. Your kind would not be pleased.

speaker: Ranulf
text: We can't expose our country to that danger. We have to think of something else.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, we can't start a fight in the Serenes Forest. Besides the terrain disadvantage, the forest isn't fully healed, and we can't risk burning it down again. Soren, any ideas?

speaker: Soren
text: Our options are profoundly limited, Ike. It appears our only other choice is those caves up ahead.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Caves? Oh...yeah, those are the Kauku Caves. We don't want to go there. It's a complex maze, full of lava and ash. Not exactly a place you'd want to rest. The legends say that, through the caves, there's one exit that leads to Gallia, and another exit that leads to Goldoa. Whatever the legends say, though, the fact is that it's suicide to go in there. We don't even have a map!

speaker: Ulki
text: However, the more you hens carry on, the closer the enemy advances on us. They're now less than a day away.

speaker: Soren
text: If the enemy catches up to us in this forest, we will certainly die. The caves are known to be dangerous, so Begnion may not pursue. Even the most formidable natural hazard isn't as deadly as an intelligent, living enemy. We must go to the caves. Now.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, Soren. I trust you. Let's move out for the caves.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Are you sure? We have visual confirmation of the Laguz Alliance heading into the Kauku Caves?

speaker: Levail
text: Yes, sir. The enemy must be desperate. Why else would they enter that forsaken death trap?

speaker: Zelgius
text: We cannot go there without preparation. It would be suicide. Let's not follow them to their deaths. ...That ends our pursuit, then. Tell the men that this mission is over.
I cannot allow you to do that, my dear General.

speaker: Levail
text: You're--!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Senator Valtome.

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee hee. You're not even a tiny bit surprised, Lord Zelgius of Cador? What a frightful bore you are. I came here in secret just to surprise you.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Oh, I am surprised indeed. What would bring a senator of your station to a place like this? Do you bring new orders?

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee hee. Oh, yes. I am here to deliver a decision handed down by the senate. In its wisdom, the senate has appointed me commander in chief of the Imperial Army. From this moment on, this army is mine.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...I see. Then I am at your command. Your orders, Commander?

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee hee. Oh, you are ever so serious! You haven't changed one bit, Zelgius. One of these days, I will catch you off guard. Well, I suppose that impassive face of yours is just part of your charm.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...Senator Valtome. Your orders.

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, yes, orders. Hmm, well, this battle is taking far too long for my taste. We will pull back and conquer Gallia by taking a different path.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I see. Then I shall inform my men.

speaker: Valtome
text: The northern force will stay here. Tell them to go inside the caves and search for bodies of dead sub-humans or something.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What?! Sending them into those caves is the same as sending them to the gallows. I implore you to reconsider, Commander.

speaker: Valtome
text: I gave my order, did I not? Get those men in those caves right this minute! And, Zelgius? Never question my orders again, or I'll have you killed. Is that clear? Besides, you should be happy. You're coming with me to finally wipe out those beasts. Come along now.

speaker: Septimus
text: Why... Why do I always get stuck with these awful missions? I should have curried favor with General Zelgius! Then perhaps I wouldn't have had to step into these ghastly caves...

speaker: Janaff
text: Hey, Ike! We have company.

speaker: Ike
text: Seems that way. What kind of numbers are we looking at? I can't see through all this smoke and heat.

speaker: Ranulf
text: It's just like Soren said: a token force.

speaker: Janaff
text: As far as I can tell, Zelgius isn't leading them. That helps things.

speaker: Ike
text: We have to keep the enemy away from Skrimir? And the others while they look for an exit. Let's proceed as planned. We have enough people here to deal with these clowns. Everyone ready?

speaker: Ranulf
text: We're set. Let's finish this and get out of here!

speaker: Septimus
text: They told me that the enemy would be burnt by the time I reached them. The only thing I'd have to do was carry their dead bodies back as proof... It's just my luck that the enemy is alive and well! Why does this always happen to me?

speaker: Septimus
text: AHHH! Th-they're here! Th-th-the sub-humans! The mongrels are here! They want to consume me!

speaker: Septimus
text: I-I knew it... I knew I would end up like this...

speaker: Septimus
text: Wh-who are you?!

speaker: Ike
text: Ike of the Greil Mercenaries. You don't look too good. Maybe you should just leave...

speaker: Septimus
text: Wait a moment... HAH! Look, everyone! Look at this one! He's not a beast! Oh, thank the goddess! Victory is nigh!

speaker: Ike
text: So... Chasing us into these caves wasn't the plum assignment that all the best generals wanted, huh?
