speaker: Septimus
text: How DARE you! Take my spear, knave!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ike, Ranulf! This way! I found a way out.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Excellent! Let's get out of here!

speaker: Ike
text: You don't have to tell me twice.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes! We did it! We made it through the caves!

speaker: Ike
text: Looks like we finally lost the Begnion army, as well. We can finally rest a bit.

speaker: Skrimir
text: I thought we were finished... I thought my rashness had killed us. But we've lived to see our land again!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hey, Skrimir. Has all the heat gone to that shaggy head of yours? Look around. Is this Gallia?

speaker: Skrimir
text: ...What?! No! We can't be in--

speaker: Goldoa
text: You! By whose authority have you entered this land?!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Goldoa, the land of the dragons... By the goddess, did we mess up.

speaker: Skrimir
text: The dragons... It is said they are the most powerful of all the laguz tribes. I've always wanted to fight a dragon, but I never expected it would happen like this... When our king finds out about this, I will have much explaining to do.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You've got to get home first, Skrimir. I guess we have to pay that stubborn old lizard a visit, don't we?

speaker: Reyson
text: Let's go.

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...And there you have it. We never intended to violate Goldoa's borders. It was an accident.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: I see... I understand your predicament. However, your reasons neither justify nor change the fact that you trespassed on our territory. I order you to leave immediately. Go back the way you came, through the caves.

speaker: Skrimir
text: You would have us go through Kauku Caves again?! Never!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Stop talking, Skrimir!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Many of my men are wounded! You're sending them to their deaths! I will not allow this!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: It is regrettable, yes. However, I cannot make exceptions. Your men will leave. Now.

speaker: Skrimir
text: How could a laguz be so cold to his brothers? We are your people as well!

speaker: Tibarn
text: This isn't news, Skrimir. Goldoa and its lizards have ignored the suffering of their laguz brothers for centuries. They even looked the other way while we birds and beasts were enslaved by beorc! Isn't that so, Dragon King?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...Our country is neutral. It has been since time out of mind and will continue to be so.

speaker: Ike
text: Then you might as well just kill us now. It'd be the same as sending us back to the Kauku Caves, and it saves us the walk.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You are a beorc. I would not expect your short-lived kind to understand.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't need to understand to see that it's a poor king who has so little regard for his fellow living creatures!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Hmm...

speaker: Ena
text: ...Your Majesty! Please hear our plea!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: What are you two doing here?

speaker: Ena
text: Please allow my grandfather and me to guide the Laguz Alliance to the borders of Gallia. I beg of you.

speaker: Nasir
text: Prince Reyson of the heron tribe stands among these men. The dragon tribe owes him safe passage. Please, Your Majesty! He saved the soul of your son! Would you condemn them to die, despite the good they've done?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...Hmph. Do as you like. This is the only exception I will ever make.

speaker: Ena
text: Thank you, Your Majesty.

speaker: Nasir
text: Well, here you are. I think you know the way from here.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Thanks, Nasir. You really saved us back there.

speaker: Nasir
text: It's the least we could do. I will pray for your safety.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, wait up, you two!  We haven't seen you in a long time. Don't you have some time to stay and talk with us for a little while?

speaker: Ena
text: A long time? What do you mean? We just saw you three years ago!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, that's right... Three years isn't all that long for you dragons, is it?

speaker: Ena
text: Oh, I'm sorry. I suppose three years would feel slightly longer for beorc.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike. I would love to stay and talk, but now is not the proper time. In truth, we are not even allowed to speak with you at all. Now, please go.

speaker: Ike
text: Why? Why do you isolate yourselves from everyone?

speaker: Nasir
text: ...I don't expect you to understand. But I want you to know that we obey our king's decision of our own free will. That's all I can say.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir...

speaker: Nasir
text: You should go. Many of your wounded need immediate attention. Head back to Gallia at once, and tell the lion king what happened.

speaker: Ike
text: All right... I don't get it, but I'll go now. We'll see each other again?

speaker: Nasir
text: I certainly hope so. You are one of our dearest friends.

speaker: Ena
text: Take care, and be safe.

speaker: Skrimir
text: How are the injured holding up?

speaker: Ranulf
text: They’re exhausted. Some are so bad off they can’t even get up the energy to transform. The unwounded soldiers have been taking turns carrying the injured.

speaker: Skrimir
text: That’s a good idea. Maybe I’ll carry one or two on my back once we enter the caves.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey, you’re hurt, too. Be careful you don’t strain yourself and cause permanent injury, all right?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hurt? Do I look like I’ve been wounded?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir, you’re standing in a pool of your own blood. Tell me the truth. It hurts to even stand, right?

speaker: Skrimir
text: ...A little. Do the others know?

speaker: Ranulf
text: No. None of our soldiers do. But I’m sure King Tibarn and Ike both know.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Good. Our soldiers shouldn’t know. I have to be their role model! They’ll see that I’ve been wounded yet continue to fight. Maybe that will help them carry on.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir...

speaker: Lethe
text: Lyre, come on. You have to stop sulking.

speaker: Lyre
text: Don’t talk to me! I hate you, Lethe!

speaker: Lethe
text: That’s too bad, because I like you.

speaker: Lyre
text: Liar.

speaker: Lethe
text: I’m only hard on you because I worry about you, and I want you to stay safe. Why did you even become a soldier? You used to hate fighting.

speaker: Lyre
text: Hmph.

speaker: Lethe
text: Was it because of Ranulf?

speaker: Lyre
text: That was one reason, I guess.

speaker: Lethe
text: There were other reasons?

speaker: Lyre
text: Yeah. I wanted to stay with you.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...Does that mean you’ll start talking to me again?

speaker: Lyre
text: Yeah. Even though you drive me crazy, you’re still my sister!

speaker: Lethe
text: I’m glad.

speaker: Lyre
text: Here. Take this as a token of apology.

speaker: Lethe
text: What is it?

speaker: Lyre
text: It’s a Daunt scroll. I thought it’d be perfect for someone as scary as you!

speaker: Lethe
text: What!? Say that again, I dare you!

speaker: Lyre
text: Aaahh! Lethe’s mad at me again! Stop being mean to me!

speaker: Lethe
text: I’m the mean one!?

speaker: Ike
text: Amazing. We've been traveling for miles now, and there hasn't been a single moving person.

speaker: Nailah
text: And yet the other plants and animals seem completely unaffected. The only creatures turned to stone were laguz and beorc... A miracle of the goddess, indeed.

speaker: Rafiel
text: My sister just sent a warning about some "Disciples of Order." Ashera has freed them from stone to fight for her. She's also blessed their weapons and armor. They'll only get stronger as we approach the tower. They nearly beat Leanne's team.

speaker: Soren
text: Worse, they can attack at any moment and we'd have no idea who or where they are. I'll start working on contingency plans.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, we'll break here. Everyone, be sure to keep your weapons and supplies in reach tonight.

speaker: Ike
text: Ena, how is Prince Kurthnaga feeling?

speaker: Ena
text: Not good. He keeps staring into space, he won't say anything, and he hasn't touched a bite of his food.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm sorry to hear that. I wanted to ask him some questions, but it can wait.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, we're under attack! They've already surrounded us!

speaker: Ike
text: What?! That's impossible!

speaker: Ena
text: How could they get this close without us seeing them?

speaker: Nailah
text: I don't know. There was no sign or scent of their approach... I wonder if they simply materialized?

speaker: Ike
text: Ena, stay here! Protect Kurthnaga's tent at all costs!

speaker: Ena
text: Understood.

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone, watch the perimeter! There are a lot of them, but just focus on one enemy at a time!

speaker: Ike
text: Ena, they're getting close! Be ready to fight!

speaker: Ena
text: It's OK, Ike. I'm ready.

speaker: Ena
text: I am ready... Aren't I?

speaker: Catalena
text: Unclean souls, your executioner awaits! Repent, before your vile sins pour out of your black hearts and consume you!

speaker: Catalena
text: Death? But my work is not yet...complete...

speaker: Catalena
text: Pawns of your excretable goddess, die! You are a festering wound in the flesh of the world! Die, and let it heal!

speaker: Ike
text: I suppose talking it over is out of the question?

speaker: Ike
text: That looks like all of them. Fanatics that appear out of nowhere and attack from darkness... This'll be tough.

speaker: Ike
text: Ena, are you all right? Why didn't you transform?

speaker: Ena
text: I didn't want Prince Kurthnaga to be frightened, so I tried to hold them off in this shape. He hates blood...

speaker: Ike
text: This can't go on. I'm going to talk to him.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, Prince Kurthnaga!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...Eyuhhh...ugh... Stay away!

speaker: Ike
text: What's wrong? Don't you remember me?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...Aughhh...that smell... The blood...on your sword...

speaker: Ike
text: What, this? No problem. I'll go drop it over there.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, look... No sword. Are you OK now?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Y-yes.

speaker: Ike
text: Good. I wanted to talk to you a little. Do you remember who I am?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...Yes. We met once... Three years ago in Goldoa.

speaker: Ike
text: That's right. You do remember. You helped us when our ship ran aground... And you gave us food and water.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Yes... You were the first beorc I had ever met.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm glad our paths have crossed again. We didn't have much time to talk back then... I didn't even get to introduce myself. I'm Ike, of the Greil Mercenaries. Thanks to you, we completed our voyage safely. I've been wanting to thank you for three years. So... Thank you. Kurthnaga: No, it was nothing at all. Actually, it was quite an experience... I had only read of beorc in books, so meeting one was a rare privilege. I wasn't really myself, so I hope I didn't say or do anything rude. It's embarrassing when I think about it now. I'm sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: No, if anything, I was the rude one. I was just an ignorant hothead with no manners or gratitude at all. But you just laughed and forgave me. I'm really grateful for that.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I'm glad that I could be of some help. It seems like it's been a while since I've had that chance.

speaker: Ike
text: Prince Kurthnaga... There's something I have to ask you. Before Yune's awakening, why did you side with the Daein army to fight against us and the apostle's army? The dragon tribes are neutral, and known for their hatred of blood and war. As their prince, I can't see why you would do it.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I suppose I owe you an explanation for that. First of all, the dragon tribes had nothing to do with any of this. I... I disobeyed my father, and the laws of Goldoa. I joined the battle against all my training, of my own free will. Ena just saw me leaving, or I wouldn't have brought her into this. I just wanted... I just wanted to help my sister.

speaker: Ike
text: Sister? You have a sister in Daein?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Yes... A sister and a brother, actually.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: My sister's name is Almedha. She was the wife of the late King Ashnard.

speaker: Ike
text: Mad King Ashnard was married to a princess of Goldoa?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Yes. And my brother... My brother's name was Rajaion.

speaker: Ike
text: Rajaion? Wasn't he the dragon that was warped and used by the Mad King? Wasn't Ena supposed to marry him?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Yes. That savage Ashnard held his own baby hostage...the baby born of my sister, Almedha. Then he took my brother, Rajaion...and warped him in order to use him as a mount like a common wyvern.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm sorry. I didn't know...

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...Ike, you were there at my brother's last hour. I'm sorry to ask you, but when my brother died... Did he die peacefully?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Yes, he did.

speaker: Ike
text: Before he died, Reyson was able to undo what Ashnard had done to his body. Rajaion passed on in Ena's arms, with a contented smile, as if he were sleeping peacefully.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Thank you... It's a tremendous relief to know that.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: My sister was tangled in Ashnard's schemes, our brother was killed, and her son taken away... She was unable to return to Goldoa and unable to consult our father... My sister has suffered so much. I wanted to help her.

speaker: Ike
text: So that's why you came to Daein... I'm sure that was difficult for you to tell me. Thank you.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Actually, it makes me feel a little better just talking about it.

speaker: Ike
text: I won't repeat a word of anything you just told me. I swear on my father's grave.

speaker: Ike
text: ...The dragon tribes, and the Black Knight... They both lead back to Daein. Something about that country always draws me back to it...

speaker: Rafiel
text: Mmph.

speaker: Ike
text: What’s wrong, Prince Rafiel? Are you feeling sick?

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...No. I am all right. Thank you, though.

speaker: Ike
text: ...You’re a real puzzle, you know that?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Ike
text: You look a lot like your brother Reyson, but you’re nothing like him. Reyson looks delicate, but on the inside he’s all iron. You, on the other hand... I don’t know. I worry that I might kill you if I shout too loud or something.

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...I’m sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: See? That’s exactly what I mean! You should get mad at me for saying that, not say "I’m sorry." I mean, come on!

speaker: Rafiel
text: I-I apologize.

speaker: Ike
text: There you go again! What I mean is that--

speaker: Nailah
text: That’s enough, Ike. Rafiel is everything that herons are expected to be: quiet, elegant, and delicate. Those are words people use to describe herons, and he fits all three.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, well... None of those words fit Reyson.

speaker: Nailah
text: True. Maybe Princess Leanne is only so innocent and sweet because she was asleep for twenty years. Prince Reyson certainly doesn’t seem to have any of the characteristics herons are known for.

speaker: Ike
text: King Tibarn did mention that "real" herons are more like Prince Rafiel.

speaker: Nailah
text: Prince Reyson spent a long time in the care of the hawk tribe. No doubt he’s picked up all sorts of quirks. Thank goodness Reyson hasn’t picked up Tibarn’s speech or mannerisms, though. It would be completely ridiculous. Can you imagine a man with Reyson’s looks, talking and acting like Tibarn? I don’t think I could help but laugh at him.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, he told me he wanted to be just like King Tibarn. He admires Tibarn a great deal.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Reyson said that?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah. What about you?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Well... Sure, it’d be nice to be a bit more like Tibarn, I suppose.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, it looks like you guys really are brothers after all.

speaker: Nailah
text: Ike, be quiet. You’re a bad influence! I won’t allow Rafiel to be tainted like that.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: Take a look at this!

speaker: Ike
text: How odd. Looks like a master crown.

speaker: Mist
text: I had the strangest vision just now. There were these places on the ground which were shining. One was close, so I went to take a look, and here it was!

speaker: Ike
text: Stop it. You sound like Yune when you talk like that. The enemy could attack at any time, so don’t go wandering around alone.

speaker: Mist
text: All right. You’re the boss!

speaker: Aimee
text: Ooo, it’s my hero, Ike! I’ll take the spot next to you.

speaker: Ike
text: Hello, Aimee.

speaker: Aimee
text: Would you do me a favor? Take this and give it to little Soren. It’s an extremely rare item. We don’t know what we’ll run into out there. He’ll be ready for anything with a powerful tome like this.

speaker: Ike
text: What, you can’t give it to him yourself?

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, no way! I’m trying to get YOUR attention. So I’d much rather give it to you.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s very direct of you.

speaker: Aimee
text: Because you can be so thick sometimes! I swear, you wouldn’t know how I felt if I didn’t tell you outright.

speaker: Ike
text: Even if I did, I wouldn’t do anything about it.

speaker: Aimee
text: That’s fine. I understand. You still have things you want to do, places you want to explore. That’s why you don’t want to be tied down by a relationship. I know how you are.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh...

speaker: Aimee
text: But someday, you’ll be ready to settle down. When you are, maybe you’ll think of me. That’s why I’m starting work on you now! Don’t worry about it...for now.

speaker: Ike
text: But it DOES worry me!

speaker: Aimee
text: See? You’re already under my spell! Well, good night! Sleep well, my hero.

speaker: Ike
text: That woman has issues with reality.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: A rebellion in the empire?! Is that true?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes. The empire has been thrown into chaos since General Zelgius freed Prime Minister Sephiran. They've incited the peasants by asking, "Who should you believe in? The senate, or the apostle?"

speaker: Tauroneo
text: And the people have chosen the apostle, correct?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes. They're rioting in the capital day and night, demanding answers. The senate is busy trying to quell the masses.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: This is great news! If we were to forge and alliance between Daein and the apostle's supporters in Begnion--
That is not a wise choice.

speaker: Pelleas
text: The curse on the blood pact will begin killing our people as soon as we do anything the senate doesn't care for. Defeating the senate doesn't guarantee the curse will be broken either. In fact, it may ensure it can never be broken. In which case, Daein's destruction will come more slowly, but it will come nonetheless.

speaker: Sothe
text: So, we can't attack the senate, and we can't ask for help. The only thing we can do is search for a way to get rid of the curse. This is driving me crazy...

speaker: Tauroneo
text: If we could only contact the apostle... But if the senate heard a word of it, they'd destroy us. Our hands are tied.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Luckily for us, that's not true. I have some good news, for a change. I found a way to break the blood pact. Where is Micaiah? Please bring her here.

speaker: Sothe
text: You discovered how to break the blood pact?! I'll get her right away.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You can't be serious, Your Majesty!

speaker: Pelleas
text: But, I am. Don't you see?! This is the way to save Daein! The information was in a book hidden away in a secret room. I think it is reliable.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I must ask you to reconsider, my king. There has to be another way. There must be!

speaker: Pelleas
text: We can't afford to wait for another solution to present itself. We have to try.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I cannot go through with it.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, the life of every single person in Daein depends on this! If it works, we can stop fighting this absurd war. It will be all right. I know this will work! Please do this for me, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I can't! I thought I made up my mind... I thought I'd do anything for Daein! But then I saw Sothe taken from me, and I saw him fall... I was powerless to do anything! I'd taken so many lives as a general, and yet, when I thought of Sothe dead...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Even if it hadn't been Sothe in front of you, you would have reacted the same way. That's the kind of person you are.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Individual lives taken before your eyes weigh more heavily than the many lives taken during the chaos of war. If that life is someone dear, the burden is even worse. It's only human. Isn't that true?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah. It's your caring soul that I admire. That's why I want it to be you.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I want you to kill me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I can't! I can't do it! Don't make me do this, please!

speaker: Pelleas
text: The blood pact breaks when the pact-maker is killed by a third party. That is exactly how it's written. This is the only way to save Daein.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Please! Please don't ask me to do such a horrible thing.

speaker: Pelleas
text: This is my duty as king, Micaiah! If you won't do it, I must ask someone else!

speaker: Micaiah
text: All right... I'll do it... I'll do it for you, and for Daein.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Thank you, Micaiah.

speaker: Pelleas
text: General Tauroneo. Please look after the people of Daein.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Yes...Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sothe. I'm sorry for all that I put you and Micaiah through, including this. Please forgive me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't worry about that now, Pelleas.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah. Please give this ring to my mother. Tell her that I loved her dearly.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I will, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Good-bye, my friends.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your Majesty. Sniff...what have I done?

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas! Is he here?!

speaker: Almedha
text: NOOOOO!  Pelleas! My dear Pelleas!

speaker: Almedha
text: Who did this?! Who killed my son?! Was it you?! I know who it was... YOU! You killed my Pelleas!

speaker: Sothe
text: It was the king's wish. He sacrified himself to make Daein free. He asked Micaiah to end his life.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: It was an honorable end for a king. Thanks to his noble sacrifice, Daein has been saved.

speaker: Almedha
text: Fools! Is that what you think?! Daein has not been saved!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Wh-what do you mean, my queen?!

speaker: Almedha
text: Take a good look.

speaker: Almedha
text: The mark is still on his wrist. My son's death was in vain!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! It can't be! Sothe, tell me that it isn't true...

speaker: Almedha
text: Murderer! Give me back my son! You took my only son! Give him back!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...I'm sorry. I can't do this...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I see... That is all right, Micaiah. I know it's a terrible thing to ask.

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...General Tauroneo. It is your duty.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Your Majesty... Is this necessary?

speaker: Pelleas
text: This is your king's order, General. You must obey.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Such will, at so young an age! ...As you wish, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: General Tauroneo. Please look after the people of Daein.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Yes...Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sothe. I'm sorry for all that I put you and Micaiah through, including this. Please forgive me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't worry about that now, Pelleas.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah. Please give this ring to my mother. Tell her that I loved her dearly.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I will, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Good-bye, my friends.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your Majesty... Sniff... What have we done?

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas! Is he here?!

speaker: Almedha
text: NOOOOO!  Pelleas! My dear Pelleas!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Queen Almedha...

speaker: Almedha
text: Who did this?! Who killed my son?! Was it you?! I know who it was... YOU! You killed my Pelleas!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: No, Queen Almedha. It was I. I killed the king.

speaker: Almedha
text: Traitor!

speaker: Sothe
text: It was the king's wish. He sacrificed himself to make Daein free. He asked Micaiah to end his life.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: It was an honorable end for a king. Thanks to his noble sacrifice, Daein has been saved.

speaker: Almedha
text: Fools! Is that what you think?! Daein has not been saved!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Wh-what are you saying, my queen?!

speaker: Almedha
text: Take a good look.

speaker: Almedha
text: The mark is still on his wrist. My son's death was in vain!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! It can't be! Sothe, tell me that it isn't true...

speaker: Almedha
text: Murderer! Give me back my son! You took my only son! Give him back! Bring him back to me!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...I'm sorry. I can't do this...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I see... That is all right, Micaiah. I know it's a terrible thing to ask. ...General Tauroneo. It is your duty.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Your Majesty... Is this necessary?

speaker: Pelleas
text: This is your king's order, General. You must obey.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Such will, at so young an age! ...As you wish, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: General Tauroneo. Please look after the people of Daein.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Yes...Your Majesty...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sothe. I'm sorry for all that I put you and Micaiah through, including this. Please forgive me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't worry about that now, Pelleas.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah. Please give this ring to my mother. Tell her that I loved her dearly.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I will, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Good-bye, my friends.

speaker: Micaiah
text: NO! This is wrong! We can't give up, Your Majesty!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Eh?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah?!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Lady Micaiah...

speaker: Pelleas
text: What did you do?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...I'm all right. I...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Fetch a healer! Now!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I'm fine, really. I'm just confused... Is the goddess telling me that I'm not worthy to become a martyr for Daein?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Or maybe she is saying that you're just too important to lose... But this is my fault! It was all because I signed that blood pact! I can only amend my mistake by giving my life!

speaker: Micaiah
text: You must stop running, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Wha--!

speaker: Micaiah
text: But what if your information is incorrect, Your Majesty? I couldn't live with myself if I'd let you give up your life in vain. There MUST be another way! We'll look for it together. There is... I... I can see...

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah! Hey, Micaiah! Wake up!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I will call a healer right away!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah... Thank you...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Welcome back. What's going on with Daein?

speaker: Janaff
text: They're hold up in this big castle to the east. I'd say ten thousand soldiers, give or take. They're looking pretty desperate.

speaker: Tibarn
text: To the east, eh? It's just like Soren said. Nox is the next battlefield.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ten thousand? They aren't really going to try to fight us with only ten thousand men, are they? It'd be suicide!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Daein should know about the rebellion in the empire by now. We should speak with them. They have nothing to gain by siding with the senate. Why continue the fighting?

speaker: Ike
text: We can't afford to lose any more troops or time here, either. We should be at the senate's doorstep by now.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Agreed. Sephiran has earned some time for us. We can't afford to lose that advantage. We must press on. Let us win this battle quickly and continue on our way!

speaker: Rafiel
text: General Ike. Please allow us to join you on the battlefield.

speaker: Ike
text: Shouldn't you be watching over the medallion with your brother and sister? Is it really a good idea for you to be away?

speaker: Rafiel
text: They can manage without me for a while. I am here because I must see Micaiah. I want to save her. I can reason with her. I know it.

speaker: Nailah
text: If we can talk to her face-to-face, maybe she will understand. It's also for our own peace of mind.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. Come with us. I'll tell my men to avoid firing at Micaiah. Sound good?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Thank you, Ike.

speaker: Daein
text: The outer gate has been breached! The apostle's army is storming the castle!

speaker: Sothe
text: Here they come.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...It all ends here.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's finish this fight quickly! All units, attack!

speaker: Micaiah
text: We will not lose! We cannot lose! If we lose today, everything Pelleas has done will have been in vain! In the name of King Pelleas, fight for Daein!

speaker: Daein
text: Maiden, please take this. You are the commander general of the Daein army. It is imperative that you lead our troops from this spot. However, with this tome, you can aid your allies from afar.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike, are you safe? Wait, that was a dumb question, wasn't it? I don't think any of us are safe at the moment.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you guys finished with the preparations?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah. The rest of the force is on the way. They should arrive any minute.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. Once we merge, we'll launch the attack.

speaker: Nailah
text: Rafiel, are you ready? Let's go look for Micaiah. Do not leave my side; these beorc look edgy.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Yes, Queen Nailah. I'll be closer than your own shadow.

speaker: Sothe
text: Queen Nailah! Are you going to try to hurt Micaiah?

speaker: Nailah
text: No, silly boy. I'm here to talk to her. Since you know me, why don't you take me to her? I would prefer not to kill all your soldiers if I can help it.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm sorry, but I can't do that. I can't let a laguz near Micaiah. Lots of people from Daein have issues with the laguz.

speaker: Nailah
text: We are not your enemy.

speaker: Sothe
text: I know that, but our troops wouldn't understand. I'm sorry, Queen Nailah.

speaker: Nailah
text: ...Very well, then.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm...I'm ashamed it has to be like this.

speaker: Nailah
text: Try not to worry. Just...survive, all right? Watch after Micaiah, as well.

speaker: Sothe
text: I will. We're fighting for our survival as it is. I don't plan to let anyone go.

speaker: Volug
text: (Your Majesty...)

speaker: Nailah
text: Let me hear it from you. Why is Daein involved in this war?

speaker: Volug
text: (The Daein king was tricked into cooperating with Begnion.)

speaker: Nailah
text: What about Micaiah? And Sothe?

speaker: Volug
text: (They haven’t changed at all. They fight for the continued survival of their country.)

speaker: Nailah
text: I see. They are our friends. We cannot let them fall.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Ugh... What a terrible place... to die...

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, retreat!

speaker: Soren
text: But, Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Aren’t you supposed to be my strategist? Use your head! I need your help.

speaker: Soren
text: ...I see. As you command...

speaker: Soren
text: Our last battle, in the valley. Was that your strategy?

speaker: Soren
text: That was impressive. You killed thousands of beorc soldiers with your little ambush. Well done.

speaker: Soren
text: The Maiden of Dawn... What are you? One of the Branded, that’s for sure. But there is something else about you... Power. Yes, I can feel it in you. You possess great power.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, and you would know. There’s something very different about you, too. Your energy feels so...ancient. You and I seem to have so much in common.

speaker: Soren
text: That doesn’t matter in the slightest. The only thing that does matter is that you are a dangerous adversary. You are also in Ike’s path, so it falls to me to remove you. It’s almost a shame. Farewell, Maiden of Dawn.

speaker: Micaiah
text: So, you fight for someone, as well. So very much alike... But I will defeat you. I will protect the ones I love!

speaker: Mist
text: Oww! Hey, that hurts! Sorry, Ike. I’m going to pull back.

speaker: Mist
text: Jill! Why? Why are you doing this?!

speaker: Jill
text: I’m sorry, Mist. There’s no way we can turn back now.

speaker: Mist
text: But, Jill...

speaker: Jill
text: Mist...run. I won’t be expected to kill you if you just turn and run!

speaker: Titania
text: Ugh... They got me...

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Retreat and don’t exert yourself. We wouldn’t be complete if you weren’t here. We need you.

speaker: Titania
text: Ah, I understand, Ike. ... You’ve... grown to become a legend... Greil... are you watching? Be proud of your son.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Arg! Like being hit... with a mountain...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ranulf! Enough! Get back! I can’t let you die! What would I tell King Caineghis and Skrimir?

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...I’m sorry, King Tibarn...

speaker: Boyd
text: Ugh! They hit me good. I hate to say it, but I have to pull back!

speaker: Oscar
text: The enemy uses good tactics. Sorry, Ike. I’m pulling back for now.

speaker: Shinon
text: Why do these softheads keep fighting?! There’s no chance they’ll ever win this battle! I’m pulling back for now. I’m not wasting my arrows on these fools!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Ugh! Hey, you’re pretty good! Better than I expected, honestly. Ike, I’m pulling back.

speaker: Rolf
text: I... I guess it’s over...

speaker: Rhys
text: Ugh! That’s it for me... I’m pulling back now, everyone.

speaker: Mia
text: They’re strong! I can’t defeat them! But I’ll be stronger tomorrow, and then we’ll see who wins!

speaker: Daein
text: Maiden of Dawn! The enemy is approaching. Please, you must withdraw inside the castle!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Our defenses have been broken... We did everything we could. It's only a matter of time now.  Daein soldiers, pull back immediately! Take up positions inside the castle! We won't let them take us without a fight!

speaker: Daein
text: The inner gate has been breached! It's only a matter of time before they break through the inner walls.

speaker: Sothe
text: That was fast. We didn't even get a chance to rest.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Isn't there anything else we can do? King Pelleas has worked so hard to find the answer... Was it for nothing? There must be something... A rumor, old folklore... Anything...

speaker: Sothe
text: Hold on. Didn't Lady Almedha seem to know something about the blood pact? Come to think of it, she recognized the mark of the pact on Pelleas's arm right away, like she'd seen one before.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You're right!  Why didn't I realize it sooner? Where is she? Where is Lady Almedha?!

speaker: Daein
text: General! It's no use! We can't hold them off any longer! Enemy troops have broken through and are headed this way! Escape while you can!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! I must find Lady Almedha! Everything depends on it!

speaker: Ike
text: Break down that gate! If they won't come out, we'll just let ourselves in. All forces, advance!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike! We have a problem! A big problem. All this battlefield chaos is starting to really affect the laguz. They're on the verge of losing control. I can't stop them, Ike! If they find Micaiah, they're going to tear her apart. I guarantee it.

speaker: Ike
text: Blast! We need to get them under control. Where's Skrimir?

speaker: Janaff
text: Sheesh! What a relief to finally have the end of this thing in sight. I can't believe what a fight the Daein army put up, especially considering their numbers. Wait a minute... Hey, Ulki. What the heck is that on the horizon?

speaker: Ulki
text: It's flying toward us... The flapping sounds heavier than a wyvern... It sounds huge.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Oh, you've got to be kidding me... All units, get down! NOW!

speaker: Ena
text: All of you are ordered to throw down your weapons and cease fighting! Do this for your own welfare.

speaker: Ike
text: Ena! Elincia! What's going on here?

speaker: Ranulf
text: It's a black dragon of Goldoa...

speaker: Ike
text: Tibarn, what's going on?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Why are you asking me? All I know is that I'm not ready to step up to a black dragon. Did you see that blast?

speaker: Ike
text: Point taken. All units, retreat! Platoon commanders, gather your men!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What just happened? Why did the apostle's army leave? And what was that horrible sound?
Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth! Where have you been? I haven't seen you since you left for home. How did you get here? Why would you even come to a horrible place like this?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I wanted to save you...and my sister, as well.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your sister? She's here?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Never mind that now. I'm just glad you're safe. Are you hurt?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I don't think so. I'm just very confused right now.

speaker: Daein
text: The sub-humans are here! Protect the maiden with your lives!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Stop! Stand down, all of you!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Queen Nailah... Rafiel... I... Th-thank you. Thank you...so...much...

speaker: Rafiel
text: It's all right, Micaiah. It'll be all right...

speaker: Ike
text: That black dragon is Prince Kurthnaga? Sheesh, I thought the lions got big...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, it's the son, is it? I thought maybe the dragon king had shrunk a bit in his old age.

speaker: Skrimir
text: You all know the dragon prince of Goldoa?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah. Goldoa hosted a meeting of laguz royalty three years ago. That's when Tibarn and I met him.

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia and I met him around the same time. I'd say he was a nice kid, except that he's older than all of us put together.

speaker: Ena
text: The prince hopes to avoid the complete destruction of Daein and its people. He wishes to stop the fighting. We would like to ask you to implement a cease-fire and hold a peace talk.

speaker: Sanaki
text: We have attempted to hold peace talks with Daein on multiple occasions! They refuse to listen to reason, and instead choose to fight. We have no more time to waste on people who choose war over peace at every turn!

speaker: Ena
text: Your people are waiting for you in Begnion. Is that what presses you?

speaker: Ike
text: It's not just that. All this strife and chaos has affected the medallion. It's shining brighter each day.

speaker: Elincia
text: No! that can't be!

speaker: Ena
text: The blue flame burns once more...

speaker: Ena
text: The light that radiates from the medallion looks like blue fire. It's this flaming aura that earned the medallion its other name: the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Sanaki
text: The Fire Emblem...

speaker: Ena
text: The flames on the Fire Emblem indicate the awakening of the dark god. If the war is allowed to continue, nothing can stop the dark god's awakening. We must halt this fighting.

speaker: Sanaki
text: If there is a way to stop the fighting, we shall do everything in our power to aid in that effort. We have pursued peace since this began.

speaker: Ena
text: Then let us wait until Prince Kurthnaga returns. He is speaking with the leaders of Daein now.

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia, what are you doing here? Did Ena and Kurth ask you to bring them to this battle?

speaker: Elincia
text: No, that wasn't the case. Prince Kurthnaga and I ran into each other on our way here.

speaker: Lucia
text: We are actually in Daein to look for Count Bastian of Fayre.

speaker: Ike
text: Lucia! You're here, too?

speaker: Lucia
text: Of course. I cannot let Her Majesty out of my sight. You know that.

speaker: Elincia
text: Bastian... He'd been so good about sending me reports until recently.

speaker: Ike
text: He was searching for the Black Knight, right?

speaker: Elincia
text: After the Mad King's War, Begnion sent an envoy to investigate war crimes committed during Ashnard's reign. The Black Knight had already left Daein before the empire's observer arrived. Where he went remains a mystery. That was the last piece of information we received from Bastian. Then he sent word saying that something more important had come up with regards to Crimea. He's been missing ever since. I haven't heard a single word from him.

speaker: Ike
text: Bastian likes to keep his secrets. He's probably just laying low somewhere.

speaker: Lucia
text: I'm not so sure. He must've found something important, some new piece of information that he had to pursue.

speaker: Elincia
text: I ordered Geoffrey to watch over Crimea, and came here to begin a search for Bastian.

speaker: Ike
text: It's too dangerous for you and Lucia to travel by yourselves. Why don't you com with us? Everyone would love having you two around.

speaker: Elincia
text: Than you, Ike. We'll gladly accept the offer.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Say, Edward. We’ve been fighting really hard for quite a while now, haven’t we?

speaker: Edward
text: Yeah, I guess so. The war of emancipation, the war against the Laguz Alliance, and now against the apostle’s army. One after another, just like that.

speaker: Leonardo
text: The world can’t always be like this. These wars seem so pointless. All I want is to be able to live in Daein, peacefully and in freedom.

speaker: Edward
text: Yeah. The military is a pretty strange place. Hey, I have an idea! Once this battle is over, I’ll quit the army and go home.

speaker: Leonardo
text: What about Micaiah and the others? Are you going to abandon them?

speaker: Edward
text: What? No way! I’ll just have to talk them into leaving with me! And if that catches on, all the soldiers will leave, and then there can’t be a war. And then Daein will have peace again!

speaker: Leonardo
text: You know, I don’t think it’s that simple. But your plan sounds good to me, Edward.

speaker: Edward
text: See? You know it’s smart! First, you and I will leave. Together, we can tackle any obstacle!

speaker: Leonardo
text: We’ll have to survive the next battle, first. This should help. Here. Look what I got you.

speaker: Edward
text: Oh! This sword is amazing! Where did you get this!?

speaker: Leonardo
text: I’ve been saving up. Micaiah chipped in, too.

speaker: Edward
text: You got this for me?

speaker: Leonardo
text: Yeah. Since you’re always fighting so recklessly, I thought this sword would be a good match for you.

speaker: Edward
text: Thanks, Leonardo! You’re the best friend I could have!

speaker: Leonardo
text: I know. We’re each other’s best friend and family.

speaker: Aran
text: Hey, Laura! You dropped a staff over there.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh! Ah. Thank you, Aran.

speaker: Aran
text: You’ve been carrying a lot of things lately.

speaker: Laura
text: Yes, I suppose so. Many people are injured. I wanted to help heal as many of them as I can.

speaker: Aran
text: That’s admirable. Is there anything I can do to help?

speaker: Laura
text: Yes, of course!

speaker: Aran
text: First, hand me all of your things. I’ll carry them for you.

speaker: Laura
text: That would be great. Here you go. Say...

speaker: Aran
text: Hmm?

speaker: Laura
text: That staff you picked up earlier... It doesn’t belong to me.

speaker: Aran
text: Really? It was right at your feet, so I’d assumed that it was yours.

speaker: Laura
text: I’ve never seen a staff like this. I wonder what effect it has?

speaker: Aran
text: Hey, be careful. It might be dangerous or something. Let’s throw it away.

speaker: Laura
text: Well, maybe if I shake it like this... And then... Whoa!

speaker: Aran
text: Wuh!

speaker: Laura
text: What did you say, Aran?

speaker: Aran
text: Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, Aran. You’re such a clown. How do you fall asleep on your feet? I guess you must be really tired. Why don’t I just leave you be? Let me just take my things back.

speaker: Aran
text: Zzz... Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Sigh.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: There you are, Your Majesty.

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...General Tauroneo.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Take a look at this.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: The mark of the blood pact... It has faded quite a bit, hasn't it?

speaker: Pelleas
text: What do you think this means?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Hmm... I do not know. I must think on it.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes, we'll both have to. The lives of Daein's people depend on it.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Do you believe that people can be saved from the state they are in?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Of course I do. To be honest, I'm a little bit thankful for the situation right now. Daein was headed for destruction because of what I'd done. But what the goddess did has changed the course of things. I can't fail this time. I have to save everyone.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Ah, I see. I shall do everything I can to assist.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Thank you.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Your Majesty, this is for you.

speaker: Pelleas
text: It's a dark tome! Thank you, General Tauroneo. Dark tomes are harder to come by than tomes of other elements. How did you find it?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I did not find it. Your gratitude belongs to someone else.

speaker: Pelleas
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Lady Almedha looked for it at every village and town we stopped in. She gave it to me out of concern that you might not take it from her.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I see.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Your Majesty. If you'll excuse me.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Mother...

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...So, we have a bit of a predicament. I know it's none of your affair, but we would greatly benefit from laguz assistance in our hunt for last night's escapee.

speaker: Tibarn
text: No problem. I could use a little exercise before breakfast.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Thank you, King Tibarn! Please, follow me.

speaker: Lucia
text: Why are the others up so early? What's going on?

speaker: Elincia
text: Is it the Disciples of Order? Are we under attack?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: No, Your Majesty... It's not the Disciples of Order. If you'll excuse me, I must go!

speaker: Lucia
text: Wait, Geoffrey! ...Who does he think he is?

speaker: Elincia
text: Let's follow them.

speaker: Elincia
text: Bastian! What in the world is going on? I insist on a straight answer!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty! Sister! Why are you here?

speaker: Lucia
text: That's not important! Explain why there are Feral Ones here!

speaker: Bastian
text: See that odious man among them? He's controlling them. He is using fell magic to summon the poor laguz souls who were turned into Feral Ones! He is the man who escaped our custody last night. Volke found him just now.

speaker: Bastian
text: His name is Izuka. He designed the process that created the Feral Ones!

speaker: Tibarn
text: What?! He's the butcher who twisted the lives of my kinsmen? He won't die quickly. I'll make sure his screams are heard in Phoenicis, Gallia...even Goldoa.

speaker: Izuka
text: ...Dare not speak to me that way again... My work is humanity's greatest triumph... Depraved? Ha! ...Show them the meaning of genius! Come, my children, defend me! Come, my Feral Ones!

speaker: Elincia
text: We can't let a creature that twisted roam free. We must fight!

speaker: Elincia
text: Excuse me... Volke?

speaker: Elincia
text: Um... Sir Fireman?

speaker: Volke
text: ...What is it?

speaker: Elincia
text: You seem to have some time on your hands... Would you mind helping us?

speaker: Volke
text: Three thousand.

speaker: Elincia
text: Three thousand?

speaker: Volke
text: ...That's what the job will cost you in gold.

speaker: Elincia
text: Fine. I shall pay you that amount after the battle.

speaker: Volke
text: Agreed. I await your order.

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you. And, if I may ask...

speaker: Volke
text: What?

speaker: Elincia
text: Why do you need so much money?

speaker: Volke
text: One hundred thousand.

speaker: Elincia
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Volke
text: That's what it will cost you for me to answer that question. Are you prepared to pay it?

speaker: Volke
text: Then let's get to work. What shall I do first?

speaker: Bastian
text: Ah, my partner in crime. How shall I convince you to move those leaden feet of yours into action? How much "convincing" will it cost?

speaker: Volke
text: Three thousand.

speaker: Bastian
text: I thought I was the jester. Considering your usual schedule of services, three thousand is negligible!

speaker: Volke
text: I don't like that guy. Call it a personal discount. Do you want it or not?

speaker: Bastian
text: Of course I shall take your discount! Do as you wish when you see him. Now get to work.

speaker: Volke
text: Understood.

speaker: Bastian
text: I almost pity old Izuka...

speaker: Izuka
text: Don't you see? If I am harmed, my knowledge will be lost! Can the human race survive such a tragedy? If you fools cannot see the larger picture, you will have to be destroyed!

speaker: Zihark
text: Izuka the Cruel... You are the author of this atrocity against nature? What gives you the right to perform your vile works on the laguz!

speaker: Izuka
text: The sub-humans are perfect subjects! What could be wrong with using them?

speaker: Zihark
text: ...She always told me not to let anger and hatred get the best of me, not to let them guide my blade... This will be my only exception.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I saw the results of your experiments at Gritnea Tower. The mutilated bodies...the rotting flesh... It was the most horrifying experience of my life. I wonder if my nightmares will pass when I kill you?

speaker: Izuka
text: How could you not see the importance of my beloved research? That was my life's work!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Then it is appropriate that you will pay for those terrible crimes with your life. My long-suffering kinsmen, watch as I destroy your tormentor!

speaker: Izuka
text: You! You're...

speaker: Volke
text: ...under a new contract. Good-bye, Izuka.

speaker: Izuka
text: Feral Ones! Kill him! Do it now!

speaker: Izuka
text: Have a care, Crimean count! If my knowledge dies, so does your only hope of saving that man!

speaker: Bastian
text: Hmm...it's true that your knowledge is a valuable asset.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ah, my noble count! You are most merciful!

speaker: Bastian
text: I have some knowledge of anatomy. Once you are dead, perhaps I will dissect your brain and see if I can identify the root of your intelligence.

speaker: Izuka
text: Y-you monster! What you suggest is unconscionable!

speaker: Bastian
text: Exactly, yet you had no hesitation before doing worse to the laguz. I will speed you now to the afterlife, where you may contemplate your life's egregious mistakes.

speaker: Izuka
text: Don't you see? If I am harmed, my knowledge will be lost! Can the human race survive such a tragedy? If you fools cannot see the larger picture, you will have to be destroyed!

speaker: Lucia
text: I don't know what atrocities caused Bastian to hold you prisoner, but I know what you did to the laguz, and that's reason enough for me to kill you!

speaker: Izuka
text: Don't be too rash! If you kill me, Crimea will surely suffer!

speaker: Lucia
text: I will silence your lying tongue, degenerate!

speaker: Izuka
text: They've broken through my Feral Ones! I must create more!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: After the war against the Mad King, I always regretted not capturing you. Prepare yourself for justice!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Izuka!

speaker: Izuka
text: Ah, my dear prince Pelleas! Excuse me, King Pelleas! I'd assumed that you had been turned to stone. How nice to see you again! But I am saddened to see that you would betray me and fight alongside these shortsighted fools! I found you and set you on the path to royalty! I served you well, did I not?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I know that you've been working for the senate, Izuka.

speaker: Izuka
text: So you found out. Very well. At least I don't need to pretend anymore. It isn't like you will spare my life, anyway.

speaker: Pelleas
text: With most of Daein turned to stone, the blood pact can no longer harm anyone. But that doesn't change the fact that you tricked me into risking the life of every citizen of my kingdom. Why would you betray me, Izuka? Were you ever loyal to Daein?

speaker: Izuka
text: Betrayal? What of your betrayal to me? I remember well how you valued one worthless laguz life over mine! It was your betrayal that forced me to abandon my work! You were supposed to be my puppet, a weakling boy-king that I could control, giving me free reign!

speaker: Pelleas
text: What? How could that be...

speaker: Izuka
text: Oh, princeling boy, how completely I've fooled you... You are not King Ashnard's son. All I did was look for a boy that could pass for the king's son.

speaker: Pelleas
text: But... Mother said... She said she was certain that I was her child!

speaker: Izuka
text: Ah yes, Lady Almedha, paragon of sanity! She is certainly fit to identify a boy she hasn't seen in fifteen years. She was so desperate to have her son again that she would have believed anything I told her.

speaker: Pelleas
text: No... No! Stop it! Stop talking!

speaker: Izuka
text: Elincia, the Crimean queen! Are you here to seek revenge?

speaker: Elincia
text: Revenge? On whose account? What are you talking about? I am arresting a dangerous fugitive.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ah... You must be the hawk king! Understand that my work was never intended to harm the laguz, specifically!

speaker: Tibarn
text: No power on Tellius will protect you from me. With your death, I can finally lay my brothers' souls to rest.

speaker: Izuka
text: Aaaargh! But my work...is still...incomplete...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Disgusting filth. I can't kill him enough times for what he's done!

speaker: Elincia
text: At least he is finally gone. No one else will suffer by his hands.

speaker: Reyson
text: I suppose that is all there is, then.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Laguz brothers and sisters, I hope your souls can find peace now.
Hey! Count Bastian!

speaker: Jorge
text: That man in the black cape you left with us is in bad shape! We can't even hold him down anymore!

speaker: Bastian
text: Oh no... Your Majesty, we must return immediately. I will explain everything.

speaker: Daniel
text: Oh, thank goodness you're here! I couldn't hold him down anymore. Please, follow me!

speaker: Man
text: Aaaaargh! Ahhh! Grrr... Graaaagh!

speaker: Bastian
text: Shhh! Calm down, sir. It's all right. You are a strong man. You will pull through! Please, you must calm yourself! Duke Renning!

speaker: Elincia
text: It cannot be!  Uncle! Uncle Renning! You are alive! Oh, you are alive!

speaker: Renning
text: Ugh... Ahhhhhh! Grrr...rr...

speaker: Elincia
text: What's wrong, Uncle? Please speak to me! It's me, Elincia!

speaker: Bastian
text: It's no use, Your Majesty. Your noble uncle's mind has been broken...by the drug that creates Feral Ones.

speaker: Elincia
text: No! How did this happen? Uncle! Uncle! You must hold on! Uncle Renning...

speaker: Elincia
text: Forgive me. Please give me a moment to collect myself.

speaker: Tibarn
text: What happened back there? Who is that man?

speaker: Bastian
text: That is Duke Renning, the younger brother of Crimea's last king, and Queen Elincia's uncle. He was next in line to become the king of Crimea, but-- He was believed killed in the last attack by Daein, three years ago.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I see. And what's wrong with him now?

speaker: Lucia
text: Bastian. No more secrets. It's time for you to tell us everything you know.

speaker: Bastian
text: Duke Renning was apparently killed three years ago... but as you can see, he is still alive.

speaker: Bastian
text: Duke Renning was one of the strongest warriors in Crimea, and while Daein tried to kill him, he survived. When the Mad King heard of his skill, he had Renning kidnapped and gave him the drug that creates Feral Ones. This drug made Duke Renning even stronger, but shattered his mind. He became Bertram, one of Ashnard's infamous Four Riders. After Her Majesty and company defeated him, I had him taken back to my castle. I hoped to find a cure, but I didn't want to raise false hope, Your Majesty, so I kept the secret. However, his mind continued to deteriorate, and there were no signs of improvement. As a last resort, I hired Volke to investigate a way to cure him.

speaker: Bastian
text: Volke quickly discovered that Duke Renning's transformation was engineered by a man called Izuka. This man had made himself an aide to the new king of Daein and was not difficult to locate. Feeling that Renning was running out of time, we kidnapped Izuka to learn more of the condition.

speaker: Bastian
text: Returning to Fayre Castle, we interrogated Izuka at length and discovered more about his experiments. Perhaps unsurprisingly, beorc are affected differently by the drug than laguz. Izuka then offered to create an antidote in exchange for his freedom.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Did you agree to it?!

speaker: Bastian
text: We refused without a second thought. Such a monster cannot be allowed to roam free. Besides, we know a more certain way to cure Lord Renning.

speaker: Lucia
text: The galdr of rebirth!

speaker: Elincia
text: Prince Reyson, I beg of you. Please save my uncle!

speaker: Reyson
text: I can't guarantee anything, Elincia. But I will try.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, thank you, Prince Reyson! Thank you!

speaker: Reyson
text: Please give me a moment to myself. I must prepare.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Are you sure about this? I thought the galdr of rebirth was too powerful and complex for a single heron to perform.

speaker: Reyson
text: Usually, that's true. Right now, however, Ashera's awakening has infused the world with order; I've never felt stronger. What's more, Lord Renning's condition seems less severe than a true Feral One. I think I can do this.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well, you're the expert. Just don't go taking unnecessary risks.

speaker: Reyson
text: I won't, Tibarn. You needn't worry so much. I've grown a lot.

speaker: Renning
text: ...Grr...grrr... Aaarrrrgh! Grragh...

speaker: Elincia
text: Uncle! Hold on!

speaker: Renning
text: ...Unnnhh...

speaker: Reyson
text: ...It worked. He's sleeping peacefully. When he wakes, he should be his old self.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh! Thank you, Reyson. Thank you!

speaker: Ranulf
text: So, how's Prince Reyson?

speaker: Tibarn
text: He's asleep with a big, contented smile on his face. He'll be fine.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I suppose we should give thanks to Goddess Ashera. Her power gave strength to Prince Reyson and saved Duke Renning's life.

speaker: Tibarn
text: It's hard to think of her as the bad guy after seeing a thing like that. Goddess Ashera, huh? I can't die until I see what she looks like.

speaker: Amy
text: Oh! Queen Elincia!

speaker: Elincia
text: Amy! You’re safe! Oh, I’m so glad! It’s so good to see you!

speaker: Amy
text: I came here with General Geoffrey.

speaker: Elincia
text: With Geoffrey?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I was outside on the day when the bright light engulfed everything. At first, I thought that time had stopped. Then I realized that time was normal, but everyone around me had been turned to stone. I rode around the city to investigate, and I found this little girl crying in Calill’s bar.

speaker: Elincia
text: Did you find anyone else? What about Largo?

speaker: Elincia
text: No... How tragic. How am I going to tell Calill?

speaker: Amy
text: Mommy is here!? I want to see my mommy!

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. She is here, Amy. Lucia?

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes, Your Majesty. Amy, do you want to see your mommy? Here, take my hand. We’ll go together.

speaker: Amy
text: Yay! I can’t wait to see her!

speaker: Reyson
text: How unusual. I can’t believe a small child like that has been saved from petrification. Isn’t she the first?

speaker: Elincia
text: King Tibarn, Prince Reyson.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I’d assumed that only the people with a certain amount of power were safe from petrification, but I guessed wrong.

speaker: Reyson
text: I’m wondering if there are even rules at all.

speaker: Elincia
text: Hmm.

speaker: Amy
text: Mommy!

speaker: Calill
text: Amy! You’re safe! Thank goodness. I’m so glad!

speaker: Amy
text: M-Mommy! Daddy couldn’t move! H-he wouldn’t say anything! He... Sniff... Wahhhhhhh!

speaker: Calill
text: There, there. It’ll be all right. Mommy will take care of Daddy. Mommy and Queen Elincia are going to save all the people who can’t move. Everything will be all right. Daddy will be back soon. I promise.

speaker: Amy
text: All right... Sniff... Sniff...

speaker: Janaff
text: Sheesh, all I’m saying is that you should take it, Ulki!

speaker: Ulki
text: No... You are older than me. One must respect one’s elders. It’s yours, Janaff.

speaker: Janaff
text: That’s not fair! You only say things like that when it’s convenient for you. We’re only five years apart!

speaker: Ulki
text: Five years is five years. You deserve the perks due someone of your age. You take it.

speaker: Janaff
text: Did you just call me an old codger!?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Come on, I don’t care who keeps it. Just make a decision already.

speaker: Janaff
text: Shut up, Tibarn! This is between me and Ulki!

speaker: Ulki
text: Should you really be addressing your king with words like those?

speaker: Janaff
text: Who cares? It’s not like anyone else can hear.

speaker: Ulki
text: Selfish little magpie.

speaker: Janaff
text: Hey! Lookit me! I’m Ulki, the solitary peacock!

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right, Janaff, that’s enough.

speaker: Janaff
text: What?! How am I the one getting scolded!?

speaker: Tibarn
text: You too, Ulki. You know how to press his buttons. Don’t egg him on like that.

speaker: Ulki
text: ...Fine.

speaker: Reyson
text: What are you fighting over?

speaker: Tibarn
text: They’re arguing over who would take my gift. Neither of them seem willing to take it.

speaker: Reyson
text: Really? How uncharacteristically selfless of you to put up a fight, Ulki.

speaker: Janaff
text: What do you mean, White Prince? Ulki is just being an ungrateful wretch for not appreciating my thoughtfulness! He’ll never understand!

speaker: Ulki
text: Since the item is so nice, I thought that you should have it. I’m not the stubborn one here.

speaker: Reyson
text: Well, since neither of you want it, I’ll take it.

speaker: Janaff
text: What!?

speaker: Ulki
text: ...Prince Reyson?

speaker: Reyson
text: It will come in handy during a battle, right? Then I’ll wear it and fight next to Tibarn. Sure, it’s good to be thoughtful and giving, but if neither of you appreciates it, there’s no point.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson’s right! All right, this is for you. Reyson can be my one and only aide from now on. I shoulda thought of this sooner.

speaker: Janaff
text: W-wait! No, I’ll take it!

speaker: Ulki
text: No, I shall take it.

speaker: Janaff
text: Ulki?

speaker: Ulki
text: Once we have it, Janaff and I will discuss who should wear the item.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Do you agree to this, Janaff?

speaker: Janaff
text: Um... Yes, I do. I have no problem with that.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson?

speaker: Reyson
text: That’s fine with me. As long as you agree to keep me nearby, I’m all right with whatever you decide.

speaker: Tibarn
text: It’s a done deal, then. Now, don’t you two feel a little stupid after getting lectured like that? And by Reyson, as well!

speaker: Janaff
text: ...Sorry, Ulki.

speaker: Ulki
text: I... I apologize, too.

speaker: Janaff
text: I’ve been with you and Tibarn since our feathers hadn’t even grown in yet. I guess we know each other a little too well. Well, the White Prince certainly reminded me of who I am. I’m an aide to the king of Phoenicis!

speaker: Ulki
text: Me, too. Here, Janaff. This is for you.

speaker: Janaff
text: ...Hey, wait a minute! You think you pulled a fast one on me, don’t you?! Get back here, Ulki!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I hope the others escaped...

speaker: Laura
text: I'm sure they are safe and secure, just as I'm sure the abbot got his medicine. I believe in them.

speaker: Aimee
text: Pardon... Excuse me. Not to pry, but did you know you're bleeding? You've got some blood on your sleeve there.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hm? Oh, you're right! I've been so distracted, I didn't even notice...

speaker: Aimee
text: Unfortunately, there are no vulneraries to heal you in this rat hole... Here, try wrapping this cloth around your wound.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you very much. I don't believe we've met. I'm Micaiah.

speaker: Aimee
text: I'm Aimee. I've been a lucky guest in this dungeon for quite some time. On behalf of myself and my snoozing friend over there, Ilyana, it's very nice to meet you, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Why are you two in here?

speaker: Aimee
text: I wish I knew! I belong to a merchant caravan that was passing through en route to the next market day. When we arrived here, we were brought to this charming prison against our will. Now, we await "the general's pleasure."

speaker: Laura
text: I see. Well, that doesn't sound good. How unfortunate.
Um...

speaker: Aimee
text: So you can talk. You've been so quiet over there, I assumed you didn't speak our language.
...if you wish, you may use this salve on your wound. It's an infusion of olivi grass.

speaker: Aimee
text: Olivi grass? Hm, I've never heard of it. Are you sure it's safe?
It's unquestionably safe...and effective.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you most kindly. I'll try it.

speaker: Aimee
text: Well, aren't you the trusting one? Are you honestly comfortable applying a strange medicine to your wound?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I am. I know it will work. Thank you for sharing your medicine.
You're welcome!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I hear something!

speaker: Sothe
text: Here you are.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune! I'm so glad you're both all right!

speaker: Sothe
text: Sorry it took so long to get here. Hello.

speaker: Aimee
text: Well, hello! I remember you. You've certainly grown up to be easy on the eyes! I believe I'm a little smitten.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You two know each other?

speaker: Sothe
text: Somewhat. We crossed paths during the war. Let's get out of here before the guards come. I'll open the door, then we'll find a way out.
I would like to get out of here, too. Like Aimee, I have no idea why I've been imprisoned. May I join you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: By all means!
I thank you much. My name is Kurth.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Well then, Kurth, after you.

speaker: Nolan
text: Sothe, this way!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Nolan! Edward! Leonardo! It's so good to see you all.

speaker: Sothe
text: How did you manage to sneak in this far without my help?

speaker: Nolan
text: Oddly, one of the soldiers let us in the back way.

speaker: Micaiah
text: A Begnion soldier?

speaker: Edward
text: Yes, he said, "If you're here to save Laura, follow me."

speaker: Laura
text: How strange. Why would a Begnion soldier mention me?

speaker: Mercenary
text: The prisoners are escaping!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Surprise, surprise! They found us!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, this is for you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: My tome! How did you get it?

speaker: Sothe
text: I didn't know if it was yours, but I figured you could use it. So at the armory, I "borrowed" it too.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Well done, Sothe. Now I can pull my weight and fight.

speaker: Sothe
text: And a staff for you, Sister.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Um... I... I can fight too. Could you...lend me that tome?

speaker: Sothe
text: What, you mean this one? Ilyana, I didn't know you used light magic, too.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, that's a tome of lightning magic.

speaker: Sothe
text: It is?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I give up. You just grabbed at random, didn't you?

speaker: Sothe
text: You know I can't read the old language. The letters all look the same to me! Here. If this one will work, take it. Just like old times, right, Ilyana?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Thank you... And yes, Sothe... I don't want to fight...but I'm glad I'll get to fight alongside you again...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ilyana? If you're not up to it, don't feel pressured to fight. We can handle the soldiers. You look a little woozy. Are you sure you're going to be all right?

speaker: Aimee
text: She's fine, Micaiah. She's always like that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But...

speaker: Ilyana
text: I can fight... I'm...very angry... The food here... It was terrible, and...they gave us hardly any... I...will have vengeance.

speaker: Micaiah
text: This girl takes her food pretty seriously. Interesting.

speaker: Sothe
text: I see Ilyana is as hungry as ever.

speaker: Aimee
text: Don't worry about us. We'll carefully tiptoe around you all. The boy and I can't fight, so we'll stay out of harm's way. Good luck, everyone!

speaker: Kurth
text: I am sorry to impose upon you. Please be careful.

speaker: Laura
text: Aran? I can't believe it! It IS you!

speaker: Aran
text: Laura!

speaker: Laura
text: I knew it! But, Aran, why? Why would any true Daein join sides with Begnion?

speaker: Aran
text: A true Daein? I'm not sure I still am one... Not since a family of merchants from Begnion took me in... But I could never do anything to hurt you. You've always been like a little sister to me. Get out of here, Laura ...while you still have a chance! I'll turn a blind eye.

speaker: Laura
text: But what about Micaiah and Sothe? They've risked their lives fighting for the abbot--and for me. I couldn't possibly abandon them now, not even if it meant saving myself.

speaker: Aran
text: Oh, bother...

speaker: Laura
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Aran
text: I can't keep lying to myself any longer. I know what Begnion is doing in Daein is despicable, and I can't support it.

speaker: Laura
text: Then...

speaker: Aran
text: Then...from now on, I'm fighting for what's right...just like the abbot taught us. Come on. Let's get you--and everyone else--out of here!

speaker: Laura
text: Wonderful! Thank you, Aran. I knew it. You haven't changed a bit. You're as considerate as ever. Your family would have been so proud!

speaker: Burton
text: Ehhhh! You won't get away! I'll slice through you like a hot knife through cold butter!

speaker: Burton
text: Even if you run... There is no place...for you scum...to go...

speaker: Burton
text: You! Crawl quietly back to your cell, and I'll spare you. More than that, however, I cannot promise.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Don't be so sure. This isn't our first fight, and it won't be our last.

speaker: Burton
text: A brave, yet foolish, sentiment. Before the might of the empire, you lowlifes are just cracked dirt beneath my boots!!

speaker: Aimee
text: Thank you so much...all of you! Because of your bravery, I can finally rejoin my merchant caravan. Still, coming back to Nevassa, I'm stunned at the terrible state of things. Who would have thought that Begnion would rule with such an iron fist? They run your nation with boundless cruelty, looting the towns and sending your able-bodied men to camps. It breaks my heart.

speaker: Jorge
text: They make me miss Ashnard, Daein's late "Mad King." And I never thought I'd say that! At least he never tried to destroy Crimea as a country!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What do you mean by that?

speaker: Daniel
text: People make a country. One person--even a noble king--does not a country make. And a strong country only exists when its people are strong. As Begnion crushes the citizenry, it slowly destroys Daein.

speaker: Jorge
text: The dastards are treating Daein like a nation of slaves! If this persists, Daein's strength will be sapped, and the nation itself will cease to be.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Then, what should we do? What can we do to save our country?

speaker: Jorge
text: There is a rumor. If it's true, there might be hope...

speaker: Muston
text: Look here, Jorge! Don't go spouting off rumors.

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I want to know! If there is a shred of hope for us, tell me.

speaker: Jorge
text: Well, the rumor is that King Ashnard left an orphan behind.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Really? Is that true?!

speaker: Sothe
text: King Ashnard had a child? Why have I never heard of this?

speaker: Daniel
text: It's just a rumor--nothing more. But if it's true, it would be a strike of great fortune for Daein.

speaker: Jorge
text: In the last war, Crimea used a scion of the royal family to unify its people and rally a liberation army. So could Daein.

speaker: Aimee
text: And drive out the loathsome Begnion!

speaker: Micaiah
text: So where is this orphan?

speaker: Jorge
text: According to rumor, he's in the east, near the Desert of Death, trying to raise an army to lay claim to the throne. Shall we go there?

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, what do you think?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...In the desert...an important encounter awaits us. It shall be one that changes the shape of our future.

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, that's it then. We must go to the desert to meet our destiny.

speaker: Ike
text: The Daein army is working with Begnion? That's unexpected, to say the least...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Why would Daein join the war? I thought all their resources would be tied up in reconstruction.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah, that bothers me too. There's something weird about all of this. Didn't Daein resent Begnion's occupation? Why would they be so quick to help out their former enemy?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Why does not matter. We are running out of time. We must deal with this quickly, if we are to get home.

speaker: Ike
text: General Skrimir! Have you recovered from your wounds already?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes. Do not underestimate the healing power of the beast tribe.

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right, everyone's here. Let's begin the meeting.

speaker: Ranulf
text: The immediate threat is the Daein army. They're dug in around the area that we'll have to use to cross the Ribahn. Maybe we can find another spot to cross?

speaker: Soren
text: No, we can't afford it. If we waste any more time, the Central Army will catch up to us. If that happens, we're dead.

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf, tell me your impression of the Daein army. Anything special?

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Well, there weren't very many of them, but their morale was really up there. Their commander seemed very clever, as well.

speaker: Soren
text: It must be the Maiden of Dawn.

speaker: Ike
text: Who?

speaker: Soren
text: She was the hero of the recent Daein uprising. Micaiah is her name, if I recall correctly. Supposedly she has performed miracles and turned many losing battles into victories. An interesting figure.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Miracles? I'm finding that a bit hard to swallow. Are you sure about that?

speaker: Soren
text: Who knows? Personally, I doubt it. All I know is that the Daein army believes in her miracles, which makes her dangerous.

speaker: Soren
text: This Maiden of Dawn is supposed to be the savior of Daein, whose miraculous powers freed their people from tyranny. In other words, her followers are fanatics who see her as a goddess. She will make a formidable enemy.

speaker: Ranulf
text: If we attack them head-on, the fighting won't stop until one side is decimated. There's got to be a way to avoid that, right?

speaker: Titania
text: What about a decoy force, like we've used in the past?

speaker: Tibarn
text: The decoy only worked because the enemy didn't expect it. I wouldn't count on the same strategy working twice.

speaker: Soren
text: Not necessarily. The empire assumes superiority over all other countries. Begnion is only using the Daein army as a pawn to stop us, and likely won't care if it is destroyed in the process. As such, the Daein army is most likely uninformed about our past tactics.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You might have a point there. I went scouting after the fog cleared, and their forces looked really unprepared to fight us. They had no ballistae, and they hadn't fielded many fire mages. It felt like they didn't know a thing about fighting laguz.

speaker: Soren
text: Then we should definitely have a decoy force hit them head-on, while the bulk of the army crosses the river in the meantime.

speaker: Ike
text: I'll head up the decoy force, then. The armies of Gallia and Phoenicis can cross the river while we fight.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I'll go with you, Ike. Daein would get suspicious if they didn't see any laguz in the enemy force.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sounds like a plan to me. Take some of my men as well, if you want. I don't want their talons getting dull.

speaker: Ranulf
text: The Laguz Alliance may have lost the war of might. But we haven't lost the war to save the lives of our brothers! This fight will be ours!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes! With the fangs and wings of the laguz and the knowledge of the beorc, we will return home!

speaker: Reyson
text: Daein cannot stop us now, just as they could not stop us during the Mad King's War. We can do this!

speaker: Sothe
text: The laguz failed to cross the river. This is their last chance to try. This time, they'll attack with beorc as well.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, you know what that means. If we end up fighting beorc...

speaker: Sothe
text: I know. We'll probably be fighting the Greil Mercenaries. I'm aware. It's not going to be pretty.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe. Tell me more about Commander Ike.

speaker: Sothe
text: Why? You used to hate it when I said anything about him.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I want to know more about the man I'll be fighting against. What kind of a person is he?

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, let's see... He's generous. He doesn't care about petty things. He holds no prejudice against laguz, nor does he care about the opinions of the nobles. He's a master swordsman. He accomplishes everything he sets out to do. He's a true hero.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I see. He sounds...quite different from King Pelleas.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, they don't even compare. King Pelleas lacks any leadership or decision-making skills.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...That may be, but I believe in King Pelleas. His heart is in the right place. I believe in his virtuous nature and his commitment to being a good king...

speaker: Sothe
text: Even though he would set you out on a war that doesn't involve Daein at all? A war of bigotry and hate, fighting on the same side as our real enemies? You're smarter than this, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, we've been through this. I know we're about to fight Ike and the Greil Mercenaries, but I...

speaker: Ike
text: It's time. Shall we?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Sigh... Those two are still here. So much for friendly advice, I guess. Now it's friends against friends... Things are getting crazy around here.

speaker: Daein
text: The enemy is on the move. They're crossing the river! There are humans among the beasts!

speaker: Sothe
text: Here he comes.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Without the advantage of an ambush, this fight is sure to be tougher than our last one.

speaker: Reyson
text: Janaff? What are you doing here?

speaker: Janaff
