text: H-hello! Nice to see you, Prince! What a coincidence, huh?! I'm just, um, taking a flight. At night. In a battlefield.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Oh? I assumed Tibarn might have sent you to protect me.

speaker: Janaff
text: Oh, no, no! Nothing like that!

speaker: Reyson
text: Janaff. Do you really think you can hide anything from me.

speaker: Janaff
text: It... It was Ike! Ike asked me to help out the Greil Mercenaries! Really!

speaker: Reyson
text: Mm-hm.

speaker: Janaff
text: You see, Your Highness, the enemy might get suspicious if there were no birds among the force!

speaker: Reyson
text: Ah, that's a good point. Now I understand. My apologies for jumping to conclusions.

speaker: Janaff
text: No worries, Your Highness... Ha ha...ha...

speaker: Reyson
text: Then let us go together to Ike and seek his next command!

speaker: Janaff
text: What?! Whoa, hold up there!

speaker: Reyson
text: What's the problem? I thought you were here to help.

speaker: Janaff
text: Oh, hey, no problem at all, Your Highness. No problem whatsoever!

speaker: Reyson
text: Excellent. Let's go.

speaker: Janaff
text: Perfect... Tibarn's gonna have my beak for this...

speaker: Ike
text: Ulki! What are you doing here?

speaker: Ulki
text: Orders of the king. I am here to assist you.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, I get it. You're here to guard Reyson.

speaker: Ulki
text: Shh! Ike, please! I cannot let the prince hear about this! Please pretend that I'm only here to assist you, I beg of you.

speaker: Ike
text: Sure, that's fine with me. Whatever your reasons, I appreciate the help. Thanks!

speaker: Ulki
text: Don't mention it.

speaker: Ike
text: Janaff? What are you doing here?

speaker: Janaff
text: Oh, hey, Ike. Don't mind me. I'm just, um, getting some air.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm. Right. And here I was, assuming you were here to guard Reyson.

speaker: Janaff
text: Shhh! Not so loud! You can't let the White Prince know why I'm here!

speaker: Ike
text: I know, I know. I'm just giving you a hard time.

speaker: Janaff
text: Then help me! Hey, how about this? I'll join the Greil Mercenaries!

speaker: Ike
text: Sounds great to me. Free labor is always welcome.

speaker: Reyson
text: Ulki. Why are you here?

speaker: Ulki
text: King's orders. I'm here to assist.

speaker: Reyson
text: Oh, I see. It's that thing about having some birds in the decoy force, correct?

speaker: Ulki
text: Of course, Your Highness. Just so.

speaker: Reyson
text: Good. I'm sure Ike is glad to have your help. We'll be counting on you, Ulki.

speaker: Ulki
text: I shall do my best.

speaker: Lethe
text: Zihark!

speaker: Zihark
text: Lethe...

speaker: Lethe
text: You defeated me last time, but this time it’ll be different. Prepare yourself!

speaker: Zihark
text: You won’t surrender?

speaker: Lethe
text: I am a soldier. I will fight to my death.

speaker: Zihark
text: ... I knew you’d say that. Then I’m coming with you. I’m at your service, Lethe. Just like old times, yeah?

speaker: Lethe
text: What?! Why?

speaker: Zihark
text: The Daein soldiers call this war “the sub-human hunt.” You know I hate that word. I believed that Daein would change. Or at least I used to. But now... I just can’t stand by. This war is the last straw. I can’t fight for Daein anymore.

speaker: Lethe
text: ... You may not have claws, but I think your soul is more laguz than beorc. Welcome to our tribe, Zihark.

speaker: Mordecai
text: You, I know...

speaker: Zihark
text: Mordecai... I never expected us to meet like this, on opposite sides...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ah! Zee... eehark! Hm... No, that not it. Sorry, Mordecai says your name not right. Not right yet.

speaker: Zihark
text: But...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Zeehork? Zeeehar-ack? Zi...hark? Ahh! That is good! Zi-hark!

speaker: Zihark
text: Mordecai... Don’t you understand? We’re now–

speaker: Mordecai
text: I know. Mordecai is your friend. Allies we are. It does not matter who we fight for.

speaker: Zihark
text: But–

speaker: Mordecai
text: You have no fang or tail, but you are a beast brother, Zee-hark! Hmm... No. Mordecai forgets again. Sorry.

speaker: Zihark
text: Hey, don’t worry about it. I’ve got it! I’ll go with you. That way, you’ll get my name right in no time.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ah! Good idea! Mordecai likes this idea.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Sir Zihark. It’s not too late. Let’s not fight.

speaker: Zihark
text: I can’t do that... Daein has just freed itself. I can’t betray it now.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Even if you have been ordered by Daein to hunt down laguz?

speaker: Zihark
text: I-I just...

speaker: Ilyana
text: But this isn’t you! When I met you, you were so nice, and you never doubted yourself or your friends. You even risked your own life to fight on behalf of the laguz. And now you’re throwing it all away...

speaker: Zihark
text: ... Ilyana.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Yes?

speaker: Zihark
text: Thank you. You’ve opened my eyes.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Pardon?

speaker: Zihark
text: I will leave the Daein army. My friends in Daein are dear to me, but I refuse to take part in any “hunt,” or lie to myself any longer.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Oh, Zihark, I’m so glad...

speaker: Brom
text: Huh? Well, hey there, Zihark! Long time no see!

speaker: Zihark
text: Brom...

speaker: Brom
text: Ah, it sure is great to see ya! You’re looking mighty fine. Seem a bit sad, though.

speaker: Zihark
text: Oh, I’m all right, Brom. How’s the family?

speaker: Brom
text: Oh, they’re doin’ great. We had ourselves some troubles, but Queen Elincia took care of it. Ah, speakin’ of my family! About your engagement to one of my daughters... Have you given it any extra thought? All my daughters are eager to marry. Just say the word, now!

speaker: Zihark
text: What? All of your daughters? You told all of your daughters about me?

speaker: Brom
text: Ah, they’re all such dears! I can’t favor one over the others, can I? So, what do you say? My second daughter is startin’ to look a lot like me! Nice, soft cheeks.

speaker: Zihark
text: Um, well, I thought I was pretty clear on this the last time we went over it...

speaker: Brom
text: She left for Daein to see you. Have you run into her yet? Her name’s Meg. Nice girl. She looks a lot like me.

speaker: Zihark
text: You haven’t changed at all, Brom. You’re still the same good man that I remember from three years ago. I’m really glad I ran into you, Brom. Now I remember what I was fighting for back then. And now I know what I have to do.

speaker: Brom
text: Hm? What’re you goin’ on about, son?

speaker: Zihark
text: I’m leaving the Daein army. My friends in Daein are dear to me, but I refuse to turn my sword against the laguz any longer.

speaker: Zihark
text: I'm sorry. I didn't want us to meet again like this. Forgive me.

speaker: Zihark
text: I use my sword for Daein... But am I really fighting for Daein here? What am I doing...

speaker: Zihark
text: Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: It's been a while, Zihark. So, you're with Daein?

speaker: Zihark
text: Yep. This is weird, Ike. I never thought we'd meet again as enemies...

speaker: Ike
text: It's the nature of being a mercenary. No hard feelings, Zihark. Any chance you could convince the Daein army to retreat?

speaker: Zihark
text: I wish. It's too complicated right now. Too many politicians playing around.

speaker: Ike
text: I see... I'm not much for politics. All I do is live by my principles, my sword, and my friends. What can I say? I won't change who I am, even if it means fighting you.

speaker: Zihark
text: That's fine by me. You're still the man I knew from the Mad King's War. It's about time I also threw away my doubts...

speaker: Zihark
text: The Greil Mercenaries... They really are here. There's no way we can win this. Sorry, guys. I'm turning back for now. I really suggest you all retreat as well.

speaker: Jill
text: My friends... It grieves me to meet again under these circumstances.

speaker: Jill
text: Sir Haar! Why are you fighting for these people?!

speaker: Haar
text: Hey, you stole my question! Why are you fighting in the Daein army?

speaker: Jill
text: There was a war to liberate Daein while you were gone. So I joined the army again.

speaker: Haar
text: Well, it looks like you did a good job. Daein has been liberated. So why are you still with the army?

speaker: Jill
text: I can't just leave! These people are my friends!

speaker: Haar
text: Oh, stop with the sentimental nonsense, Jill. In case you haven't noticed, you're fighting your friends, too.

speaker: Jill
text: What about you, then? How did you end up in this fight?

speaker: Haar
text: Well... Somehow, I got mixed up in putting down uprisings in Crimea. And then I ended up with the Laguz Alliance because...you know, being old friends with Ike and all that.

speaker: Jill
text: What?! That is hardly a cause worth fighting for!! You're unbelievable!

speaker: Haar
text: All right, enough debating. What do you want to do now? Do you want to fight me?

speaker: Jill
text: Of course not! I could never...

speaker: Haar
text: Then join me.

speaker: Jill
text: Easy for you to say!

speaker: Haar
text: You're full of doubt. How do you live like that all the time? Is that how your father wanted you to live? Afraid to trust your own instincts?

speaker: Jill
text: But...

speaker: Haar
text: Daein has no business in this war. You know that, right?

speaker: Jill
text: But...what about my comrades? What about my friends?

speaker: Haar
text: Is dying how you show loyalty? If you're really their friend, then fight alongside us! Maybe that will get them to think about what they're doing.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, Captain...

speaker: Haar
text: Come with me, Jill. We both know that we should follow our hearts, even if it makes us traitors. We know that better than anyone. For the sake of your father, live your life without shame.

speaker: Jill
text: Y-you're right, Captain Haar! I've been so foolish. Just as before. I would be proud to serve with you. And...Captain Haar? Thank you. Thank you so much...

speaker: Mist
text: Jill! I can’t believe it! It is you!

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, Mist...

speaker: Mist
text: I’m so glad to see you!

speaker: Jill
text: Wh-what?

speaker: Mist
text: Well, I was wondering about what to do if I saw you here with the Daein army. I had it all worked out, you see? And, well, here you are! It’s great!

speaker: Jill
text: Mist. We’re enemies now.

speaker: Mist
text: No, you have to listen, Jill. Let’s not fight. There’s a really easy solution to this whole mess!

speaker: Jill
text: But... what?

speaker: Mist
text: Just listen! It’s so simple! Since Daein shouldn’t be in this war, they shouldn’t be here right now, right? And you and I are friends, right? So we can each pretend that the other one of us isn’t here! Isn’t that great?

speaker: Jill
text: Mist, that makes absolutely no sense. Besides, that’s no the issue here! You’re a mercenary. You know how th–

speaker: Mist
text: We’re not fighting. That’s final.

speaker: Jill
text: Mist?!

speaker: Mist
text: Jill, you’d never turn your weapon against me. I just know it. I trust you, because you’re my friend.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, Mist... All right, that’s it. I’ve had enough of this.

speaker: Mist
text: Jill?

speaker: Jill
text: You made my last doubts fade away. I’ve made my decision. I’m not fighting in the Daein army anymore. I’m joining back up with you.

speaker: Mist
text: Jill! I knew you’d come around!

speaker: Jill
text: I feel bad for my comrades in Daein, but I’m going to stand by what I believe. I will not be ashamed anymore.

speaker: Mist
text: That’s the Jill I know and love!

speaker: Jill
text: Thank you, Mist!

speaker: Ike
text: Jill? You're back with the Daein army?

speaker: Jill
text: I know I owe you all so much... And Mist would grieve if you fell. But I cannot retreat. I must stand my ground!

speaker: Ike
text: Fine. Do what you have to do. Since neither side can retreat, we will fight. And, Jill...I'm sorry it came to this.

speaker: Jill
text: ...I am too, Commander Ike. Are you ready?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Hello, Sir Zihark.

speaker: Zihark
text: Ilyana... You’re on their side, too?

speaker: Ilyana
text: And you stand with the enemy...

speaker: Zihark
text: I don’t know why, but it feels like you’ve been in my life longer than the others. I couldn’t handle it if you got hurt. Ilyana, please pull back before something awful happens. I beg of you.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Oh, Zihark...

speaker: Jill
text: Ilyana? You’re with the Laguz Alliance? No, I mean the Greil Mercenaries?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Yes. Muston and the others are with me, too.

speaker: Jill
text: I see... We fought together in Ashnard’s War, and in the war to liberate Daein. We didn’t spend much time together, but you were a trustworthy comrade.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Thank you... I wonder why we’re here. Why is Daein attacking us?

speaker: Jill
text: I don’t know. The occupation soldiers left Daein. But Daein still cannot refuse a request from Begnion. Liberation was only a dream.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Yet you continue to stay with the Daein army? Why do you do that to yourself?

speaker: Jill
text: Because I can’t abandon my comrades.

speaker: Lethe
text: Jill! We’re crossing the river this time!

speaker: Jill
text: I’m sorry, Lethe. I have to fight. I will do anything for my country...

speaker: Jill
text: They're so strong... Even stronger than three years ago. Lady Micaiah, I apologize. I must head back for now.

speaker: Fiona
text: Most impressive! I cannot fight with a wound like this. I'll be back shortly...

speaker: Meg
text: Oww! Sorry, y'all. I'm turnin' back for now.

speaker: Aran
text: Be careful! They're much stronger than any of the foes we've encountered! They defeated me, as well... I'm falling back temporarily.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh no, is this...blood? I'm sorry, Lady Micaiah. I must heal my wounds.

speaker: Edward
text: Ugh...! My ribs... Sorry, Micaiah. I've gotta fall back!

speaker: Leonardo
text: We're totally outclassed in this battle. This is insane. Micaiah, I'm sorry. I have to turn back for now...

speaker: Nolan
text: Blast! They're better than I expected! I'm sorry, Micaiah. I need to turn back for a while.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Stand aside. You are no match for me.

speaker: Reyson
text: Micaiah, the Maiden of Dawn ... Is that what they call you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who are you? Your wings look just like Rafiel’s.

speaker: Reyson
text: I am Reyson. My brother told me about you. This is why I’m here. Please pull back your troops. Our enemy is not Daein. This is not your fight. Am I not correct?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know how you feel... Though I owe a debt to Rafiel, I cannot do what you ask. It’s not that I don’t want to! I think this whole war is madness! But I must keep fighting.

speaker: Reyson
text: Why is that?

speaker: Micaiah
text: This fight is my king’s will. I cannot stop fighting just because I don’t agree with him. If we don’t pull together under our new king, Daein will fall apart again, just as it did before its liberation. I believe in King Pelleas. I believe that our king will lead the people of Daein to happiness

speaker: Reyson
text: ...I see. I understand your position. Please accept my apology for asking the impossible

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? What do you mean?

speaker: Reyson
text: You are fighting to protect your beliefs. I understand that now. But remember that we also cannot, and will not, pull back. We both carry a heavy burden. that’s why we’re here.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes...

speaker: Brom
text: Meg? Is it you, sweetie?

speaker: Meg
text: Daddy... Daddy!

speaker: Brom
text: There, there. Don’t cry, darlin’. I’m just glad you’re safe! What a mess we’re in, huh? But, that’s war, I reckon. In any case... There’s no way I could ever fight my own daughter. You run along now.

speaker: Zihark
text: Meg.

speaker: Meg
text: Sir Zihark? Wh-what’s wrong? What’s going on?

speaker: Zihark
text: I’m sorry, but I’m joining up with the alliance. I don’t want to betray you, but I can’t fight for Daein any longer.

speaker: Meg
text: No! Wh-what are you saying?

speaker: Zihark
text: I know this is a horrible thing for me to say, but listen. Please leave the battlefield. I don’t want to see you get hurt.

speaker: Meg
text: Sir Zihark! But... you can’t leave me here alone!

speaker: Zihark
text: I wanted to tell you that. I have to go. I’m so sorry, Meg...

speaker: Meg
text: Sir... Zihark...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh, I thought I smelled you earlier. We just have to stop meeting like this.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Back in Gallia, in Crimea... We just ran into each other recently, too. I don't know about the others, but I can tell who you are. You have one heck of a stench.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Enough talk. Prepare yourself.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Still won't own up, huh? Fine. If that's the case, I'll just tear your mask off and show everyone myself!

speaker: Ike
text: So, you are alive. Somehow, I knew it wasn't over yet.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Of course it wasn't over. You were a boy trying to live up to the memory of the greatest swordsman in history.

speaker: Ike
text: And yet, I was the one who walked out of the castle that day.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You have your father to thank for that. When you told me that he had crippled himself, I realized that I had never fought him at all, merely his shadow.

speaker: Ike
text: What are you getting at?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I saw immediately that you were not your father's equal, but that one day you might be. So I did the only thing I could to keep you alive... I let you win.

speaker: Ike
text: ...You did, didn't you? I've relived that fight so many times... How could I not have seen it before?

speaker: Black Knight
text: You were not yet capable of seeing it. But I had to let you live, so that you could continue to train and perhaps one day be worthy of Gawain's legacy. My armor's blessing is gone; let us see if that day is today.

speaker: Ike
text: I promise you that it will be. Begin.

speaker: Sothe
text: You should run. I'm not the weak child you remember.

speaker: Sothe
text: Commander Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Look at you, Sothe. You've grown a lot. I almost forgot... You're originally from Daein.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm glad you remembered. I hope it helps explain why I'm here.

speaker: Ike
text: Did you find the person you were looking for?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes. She commands this army.

speaker: Ike
text: The Maiden of Dawn?

speaker: Sothe
text: Please don't call her by that ridiculous name. Her name is Micaiah.

speaker: Ike
text: I see.

speaker: Sothe
text: Commander, I... I didn't want to see you like this.

speaker: Ike
text: But you don't intend to retreat, do you?

speaker: Sothe
text: That's right.

speaker: Ike
text: Sothe, before you challenge me, you better be ready never to see that girl again. Can you handle that?

speaker: Sothe
text: Wh-what?!

speaker: Ike
text: If you can't, stay away from me. You'll get no mercy, despite our past. I'm sorry, Sothe, but the choices we've both made have brought us to this. There's no turning back now.

speaker: Sothe
text: I understand, Commander. And to answer your question... Yes, sir, I can handle that. Whenever you're ready, Commander.

speaker: Sothe
text: Commander, we can't retreat. We have to keep fighting, even if I have to fight you...

speaker: Ike
text: Sothe, you've already lost this fight.

speaker: Sothe
text: What do you mean by that?

speaker: Ike
text: you don't think you can win against me, so you won't. Going into a battle with that kind of doubt, you'll lose for sure. Just think of me as an enemy soldier to be cut down.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Hello, Sothe...

speaker: Sothe
text: If you’re here with the Greil Mercenaries, does that mean the caravan is with you, too?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Yes. Everyone is back together. Why don’t you join us? You should bring Micaiah, of course. Everyone is worried about you two...

speaker: Sothe
text: I’m sorry, I can’t...

speaker: Ilyana
text: I see... I’m sorry, Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: Jill! What are you doing?!

speaker: Jill
text: I’m sorry. I just don’t believe that Daein is in the right this time. Retreat now, Sothe. Daein has no business getting involved in this war.

speaker: Sothe
text: I can’t do that. Micaiah has made up her mind, and I’ll follow her no matter what. Even if I have to fight you.

speaker: Jill
text: Then I’ll be forced to stop you! Prepare yourself, Sothe!

speaker: Sothe
text: I understand. I thought that fighting against the laguz would set you off.

speaker: Zihark
text: I won’t make any excuses. I’m finished with the new Daein.

speaker: Sothe
text: You chose principles over country and comrades. I can’t blame you for that.

speaker: Zihark
text: But these people are my comrades! Look around you, Sothe! These people aren’t your enemies, they’re your friends!

speaker: Sothe
text: Let’s get on with this. I’m with Daein. You’re with the Laguz Alliance. There’s only one thing to do when enemies meet.

speaker: Zihark
text: I won’t go easy on you. I respect you too much for that!

speaker: Sothe
text: Unh... Micaiah, I'm sorry.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe? No! Sothe, please! Hold on, I'm coming over to you!

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't worry... I won't die so easily. I'll stay by your side.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank goodness you're all right! But, Sothe, go back and rest. You can't fight with a gaping wound like that... Promise me that you'll go back and get some rest.

speaker: Sothe
text: ...Fine.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Just as you have a reason to fight, so do we.

speaker: Reyson
text: Micaiah, the Maiden of Dawn... Is that what they call you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who are you? Your wings look just like Rafiel's.

speaker: Reyson
text: I am Reyson. My brother told me about you. That is why I'm here. Please pull back your troops. Our enemy is not Daein. This is not your fight. Am I not correct?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know how you feel... Though I owe a debt to Rafiel, I cannot do what you ask. It's not that I don't want to! I think this whole war is madness! But I must keep fighting.

speaker: Reyson
text: Why is that?

speaker: Micaiah
text: This fight is my king's will. I cannot stop fighting just because I don't agree with him. If we don't pull together under our new king, Daein will fall apart again, just as it did before its liberation. I believe in King Pelleas. I believe that our king will lead the people of Daein to happiness.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...I see. I understand your position. Please accept my apology for asking the impossible.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? What do you mean?

speaker: Reyson
text: You are fighting to protect your beliefs. I understand that now. But remember that we also cannot, and will not, pull back. We both carry a heavy burden. That's why we're here.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes...

speaker: Ilyana
text: Oh...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ilyana! I remember now... You said that you were a member of the Greil Mercenaries in Ashnard’s War.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Yes.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m sorry.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Let’s not do this. Please?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Let’s not fight.

speaker: Micaiah
text: If that means letting the Laguz Alliance get by us, I cannot agree to it.

speaker: Ilyana
text: I see... That’s too bad.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How is everyone in the caravan?

speaker: Ilyana
text: They’re fine.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m glad to hear that.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Maybe... we should fight.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Ilyana
text: We’re enemies now. We can’t stand here and try to have a normal conversation. It’s too strange...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ilyana...

speaker: Ilyana
text: It’ll be all right. I’m really strong against your spells, and my magic is not powerful enough to defeat you. We’ll be fine.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But if we’re equally matched, why should we fight at all? It sounds... wrong.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Of course it’s wrong! The fact that we’re fighting is all wrong! We don’t even dislike each other!

speaker: Ilyana
text: Let’s just fight and pretend like this conversation never took place.

speaker: Jill
text: Lady Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Jill...

speaker: Jill
text: Lady Micaiah... I cannot continue to fight for Daein. It’s all gone wrong. I’m here to tell you that... This is good-bye. I must part ways with you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I... see.

speaker: Jill
text: I am joining the Laguz Alliance. But it’s not because I want to fight the Daein army.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Jill, I don’t understand...

speaker: Jill
text: Please retreat! There is no reason for Daein to get involved in this war. You know that better than anyone, Lady Micaiah! This is madness!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I can’t do that.

speaker: Jill
text: ...Very well. I will not give up hope. I’ll stand before you as many times as it takes. I will get you to leave this fight.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Jill...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Zihark...

speaker: Zihark
text: As you can see, I’m with the Laguz Alliance now. I can’t lie to myself anymore, Micaiah. I’m sorry.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I see...

speaker: Zihark
text: Tell me, Micaiah. Why did Daein become an enemy of the laguz? Daein has a new king now. Why can’t it escape the grip of Begnion?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don’t know, Zihark. I wish I did. I’m sorry...

speaker: Zihark
text: No, I’m the one who should be sorry. I know this isn’t your fault. It’s just that... now I wonder if the time I’ve spent fighting to liberate Daein was well spent. It makes me sad.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Will you cut me down?

speaker: Zihark
text: That depends on you, Micaiah. Will you try to kill me?

speaker: Micaiah
text: You are an enemy of Daein now. But... I... How could I? How could I possibly kill you?

speaker: Zihark
text: I feel the same way. I couldn’t possibly hurt you. However, fighting laguz is something I will not do for anyone. Where do we go from here?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I... I don’t know...

speaker: Micaiah
text: My wounds... They're nothing! They're nothing compare to what my people have suffered! We won't lose! We'll never give up!

speaker: Micaiah
text: You're...

speaker: Ike
text: Hello.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You must be Ike, of the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Ike
text: And you're the Maiden of Dawn, Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I feel like I know you already. Maybe it's because Sothe has told me so much about you.

speaker: Ike
text: I hate to do this to Sothe, but if you stand before me as my enemy, you'll get no mercy from me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Good. I prefer it that way. Prepare yourself!

speaker: Soren
text: ...Ah, that explains quite a bit about the stories that surround you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who are you? You're... You're just like me!

speaker: Soren
text: Yes, they call our kind the Branded. As the years pass, I understand better and better how others see us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You are so...cold. It's like you're cloaked in frost. Is there even blood in your veins?

speaker: Soren
text: There is. Blood very similar to yours, in fact. Blood that teaches us what it means to be rejected and alone.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your heart is frozen, but I feel a warm core trying to melt through that ice. I see... You have someone you cherish very much. Someone you rely on.

speaker: Soren
text: Do not presume to understand me, you ridiculous girl. You have no idea who I am and what I can do. None at all. Daein has no business in this war. I will defeat you swiftly and send you and your army back to Daein.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I finally meet my own kind, and he is an enemy... ...I will not retreat. I won't let you go any further!

speaker: Ulki
text: ...Janaff. The king is calling us.

speaker: Janaff
text: Hmm, right. Good! Looks like we did it! Ike! The main force has crossed the river. We did it!

speaker: Ike
text: Excellent. Everyone, push through! Let's meet up with the main force!

speaker: Daein
text: The beast soldiers are behind us! We're being attacked from behind!

speaker: Sothe
text: The Gallians?! How did they cross the river?!

speaker: Daein
text: It's not just the beasts! There are hundreds of hawks, as well!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Even the hawk tribe is here? The Begnion army never told us that they had moved out...

speaker: Sothe
text: ...They got us. Commander Ike's force was just a decoy.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Staying will only increase casualties. Let's retreat.

speaker: Daein
text: No, Maiden! We can still fight! Please give us your orders!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I have. We shall retreat! I will not let all of you die in vain!

speaker: Begnion
text: But...

speaker: Sothe
text: General's orders. We kept our losses to a minimum. That's enough for this battle.

speaker: Daein
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, I'm surprised. This is the first time you couldn't predict the enemy's movement.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...You're right.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?! What's wrong?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, don't... Just act...normal. Everyone...is watching...

speaker: Pelleas
text: What? Micaiah failed to eradicate the Laguz Alliance?! No!

speaker: Lekain
text: Hmm, this looks bad, King Pelleas. Is this how the people of Daein repay Begnion for all the kindness it has offered them? I'm afraid Daein and the senate's friendly relationship stops here.

speaker: Pelleas
text: P-please, wait! Give me one more chance, I beg of you!

speaker: Lekain
text: Well, well... Since you begged, I suppose... I will consider it.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Please, just listen... Daein remains loyal to the senate. We will carry out any task give to us. Your whim is our command. Just, please give us another chance!

speaker: Lekain
text: Very well. We shall overlook your failure this one time. But only once. Farewell, young king of Daein.
Pelleas...

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...Mother!

speaker: Almedha
text: That man you were speaking with... He is a senator from Begnion, correct? Duke Lekain of Gaddos, I believe? He was here before as part of the empire's inspection team. He came in Duke Persis's stead.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Yes. You are quite right, Mother. That was Vice-Minister Lekain of Begnion. So you saw us together...

speaker: Almedha
text: Tell Mother what happened. You look absolutely terrified. Does that man have something on you? Is he trying to hurt you? It's all right to tell your mother th--

speaker: Pelleas
text: No. It's quite all right, Mother. We were talking about the future of our two countries, and how we might...repair our relationship.

speaker: Almedha
text: But--

speaker: Pelleas
text: Please go back to your room. I shall go rest as well. I find myself very tired of late.

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas... Wait! Oh, my son...

speaker: Ranulf
text: So, it happens to be that I have a very rare and precious item in my possession. Which one of you thinks you deserve a gift?

speaker: Lyre
text: Ooo, me! Me! I want it!

speaker: Kyza
text: No, Captain! You should give it to me! After all, I’m your faithful servant.

speaker: Lyre
text: What!? No way! That stuffy know-it-all doesn’t need it! Look at me! I’m so tiny and helpless, I need all the help I can get. You wouldn’t want me to get hurt, would you?

speaker: Kyza
text: A stuffy know-it-all?! Oh, I say! How dare you, madam!? Captain Ranulf! You know that rewarding her behavior will only encourage her to act up in front of others! Have I not always followed your orders without question, both quickly and effectively?

speaker: Ranulf
text: All right, all right... Sheesh. You know, I personally don’t really care which of you gets it.

speaker: Lyre
text: You hold it right there, Kyza! I think you just called me a brat!

speaker: Kyza
text: Pfft. I’m only stating the obvious. If you don’t like it, don’t act so childish.

speaker: Lyre
text: Hmph! You stuck-up old alley cat!

speaker: Kyza
text: Stuck up?! Your mother would be ashamed at your lack of manners!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Argh! Stop already! I’m sorry I asked. Obviously I have to make the decision for you. All right, Kyza! This is yours. Take it.

speaker: Kyza
text: Oh, thank you! Thank you! You’ve made me the happiest person in the army, Captain! Hah!

speaker: Lyre
text: What!? Why!? Why did you give it to him!?

speaker: Ranulf
text: He’s your commanding officer.

speaker: Lyre
text: That’s not fair! He’s a stuffy old bore! And I’m wearing my prettiest collar...

speaker: Kyza
text: Forget it, Lyre. The captain knows who slaves day and night to keep the army running smoothly!

speaker: Lyre
text: No, no, no! The captain’s love is mine! All mine! Give it to me!

speaker: Kyza
text: If you want it, you’ll have to take it!

speaker: Lyre
text: Oh, you’re dead!

speaker: Ranulf
text: What is it with you two? Sigh...

speaker: Elincia
text: I see... So, that's what's going on. Thank you for bringing it to my attention. I'm very sorry your village was affected by this. You have my sincere apologies.

speaker: Brom
text: Oh, no, Your Majesty. We don't need no apology. We're just happy we could help.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia... Brom's story confirms what we've suspected all along.

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes, as we thought. Duke Ludveck of Felirae is firing up a rebellion. We should have seen it coming. To be honest, Queen Elincia, there have been a number of indications that something like this was under way. We'd hoped to uncover something more tangible than hushed rumors... I should have told you sooner.

speaker: Elincia
text: No... I bear some responsibility as well. The discontent among the populace...is due to my lack of experience as a ruler. Now that a rebellion is gaining momentum, innocent blood will surely be spilled...

speaker: Elincia
text: I have always held the well-being of the Crimean people as my highest priority... I've done my utmost in Crimea's name. ...And all I've ever desired is a country where war and hunger are unknown.

speaker: Brom
text: Beggin' your pardon, Queen Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Yes, Brom?

speaker: Brom
text: Your Majesty is doin' a bang-up job of it. This country's a safe place to live, and that's more than most can say! Once you get the hang of things, I'm sure you'll be the name future kings and queens try to live up to. We know you can do it!

speaker: Nephenee
text: And it ain't like ALL the young bucks out there got bees in their bonnets! There's a whole mess o' folk doin' their darnedest to make this a fine country. They wanna make you proud, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: I... Thank you.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: All nations experience unrest when the reins of leadership change hands. It's true the world over. But for Ludveck to start beating the drums of war as if this were unheard of... What utter nonsense! We must not allow it! Your Majesty, would you be so kind as to appoint me to the task of his capture? I myself will march into Felirae and seize Ludveck and his rebels.

speaker: Lucia
text: No, Geoffrey. We can't do that. Unfortunately, we don't have enough evidence to arrest him.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: But...

speaker: Lucia
text: Don't worry, Brother. If we have no evidence, then I suppose we'll have to dig some up. Your Majesty, I'd like to take on that job.

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia, I appreciate your dedication. You have my permission to proceed...

speaker: Ludveck
text: Well, well... My dear Lady Lucia. Quite a way from home, aren't we?

speaker: Lucia
text: Please do excuse the sudden visit, Your Grace. Princess Leanne, Lady Lethe... This is Lord Ludveck, duke of Felirae. I was thinking that our laguz guests might enjoy the fine fruits this region is known for. We've traveled quite a long way... I hope it won't be too much trouble.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Don't be ridiculous! I could be nothing but delighted by a visit from you, Lady Lucia. Although I must admit... I would be all the more pleased if you had come such a long way just to see me.

speaker: Lucia
text: ...You are too kind, Lord Ludveck.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Please, feel free to take your ease. You are welcome to stay in Felirae as long as you desire.

speaker: Lucia
text: ...This is it! This document is an order written by Ludveck himself, marked with his signal. If we show this to the royal assembly, we'll surely have the backing to indict him. Thank you so much...both of you. We have to quell this uprising before things get out of hand.

speaker: Mordecai
text: If there is no war, we are happy. But if there is war, it is good we came.

speaker: Lethe
text: Ludveck is poor prey. He hides behind a shield of words, not realizing that words can be seen through.

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes, and that's quite fortunate for us. But we still have to get out of here without being detected.
M-my lady! You mustn't raise your voice...

speaker: Lucia
text: Who's there?! Show yourself!

speaker: Lucia
text: Princess Leanne! Sir Nealuchi! I thought you had returned to the royal palace... What in the world are you doing here?!

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oh ho ho... Forgive us... We just couldn't help but be concerned for you.

speaker: Lucia
text: Well, what can I say? This just means we'll have to be even more careful to get out of here safely.

speaker: Mordecai
text: ...Someone is coming.

speaker: Lucia
text: Guards? This cave has only one exit... I guess that means we do this the hard way. We've obtained enough evidence to indict Ludveck, so there's no point in sticking around. Let's go!

speaker: Maraj
text: As I expected. The queen's house pets are playful little pups indeed. The only thing your sniffing about will get you, however, is an abruptly shortened life span!

speaker: Maraj
text: To associate with beasts like you... One has to wonder where the queen acquired such a lack of taste.

speaker: Maraj
text: My death...means nothing... Our plan...is perfect... There is... nothing...nothing the queen...can do...

speaker: Maraj
text: Well, look what we have here... Lady Lucia and her pack of curs. How interesting. What cause could you have for roaming the grounds at night, hmm?

speaker: Lucia
text: Cause? Why, we've merely lost our way.

speaker: Maraj
text: Is that so? In that case, I will gladly escort you back to the castle.

speaker: Lucia
text: That's quite all right. We should be going home. But please do give Lord Ludveck a message... Tell him that his revolt will never succeed!

speaker: Maraj
text: ...Tsk tsk. I did try to warn Lord Ludveck, but it seems that he is quite fond of you. If he knew of your little discovery... I'm certain he would have no qualms about eliminating you.

speaker: Lucia
text: This way!

speaker: Lucia
text: As we suspected, Lord Ludveck is intent on rebellion. His followers are spread across the land, inciting insurrection. We have the documents to prove it.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Queen Elincia, I stand ready to defend the realm! I will lead the Royal Knights into Felirae, and we will seize the duke!

speaker: Elincia
text: I am hesitant to resort to the sword without at least attempting diplomacy. At all costs, I must stop the people of Crimea from fighting one another.

speaker: Crimea
text: Your Majesty! News from the countryside! Duke Ludveck has assembled an army and announced his intentions against you! The rebellion in Felirae is growing quickly!

speaker: Elincia
text: I see...

speaker: Lucia
text: He must have realized that his operations were no longer a secret. Your Majesty, we have no time to waste. We must stand against this, for the future of Crimea!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...I understand. Geoffrey, leader of the Royal Knights... I hereby authorize the use of military force against the rebel army!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Yes, Your Majesty. At once!

speaker: Lucia
text: I will begin marshalling forces. This rebellion must be stopped...before nobles in surrounding areas catch wind of it.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Am I doing the right thing? Oh, Father... Uncle Renning...

speaker: Elincia
text: Welcome back, Marcia. Did you learn of Sir Ike's whereabouts?

speaker: Marcia
text: No... I'm sorry. I've got nothing but sore feet and a tired pegasus. I've talked to a few local villagers who say the Greil Mercenaries have been working low-paying odd jobs here and there. Nobody seems to know where they are now, but everyone agrees that this is the first time they've been gone for so long.

speaker: Elincia
text: Princess Leanne, please try to keep your spirits high. I assure you, we will continue to investigate Sir Ike's whereabouts.

speaker: Leanne
text: Th-thank...you.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh! Princess Leanne! You spoke?!

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Quite a shock, yes? My lady has been studying your language, which we often call "modern speech."

speaker: Elincia
text: That's wonderful! It's hard enough visiting a strange land, let alone learning the languages.

speaker: Leanne
text: Me...not big...no pr-problem. Queen Elincia has tr-trouble...heart.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah... I'd forgotten. The heron tribe can peer into the heart. I can't hide the pain I'm feeling... At least not from you, Princess Leanne.

speaker: Leanne
text: Queen... El...Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Why does this happen?! My people fight, brother against brother... And no matter what I do, I can't stop it! I'm a miserable failure. I just want to crawl into a cave somewhere. How can anyone believe in me now?

speaker: Elincia
text: I never asked for any of this... I never wanted to be queen!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Sniff... I can't... I can't do it anymore...

speaker: Heather
text: Awww... I really wanted to go to the palace. I would've been happy with just a tiny little glance at Queen Elincia. She's... glorious. This is so unfair!

speaker: Brom
text: Yup, it's the pits. But that queen of ours is a real nice lady. Knowin' her, she'd prob'ly just let ya talk to 'er, noble or not.

speaker: Heather
text: The nerve of that Duke Ludveck! He ruined my one chance to meet the queen. I won't stand for it! He needs a kick in the rear! Or a punch in the mouth! The things I'd do to him...

speaker: Nephenee
text: Uhm... Heather? You sure are a lovely gal and all, but... You sure do say some funny things.

speaker: Brom
text: Can't argue with that, Nephenee. But that's just the way folks are. They ain't always what they appear to be. Ain't nobody perfect, neither. 'Less you're talkin' 'bout the goddess, that is.
Excuse me...

speaker: Heather
text: Hm?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Oh!

speaker: Brom
text: Well! Hi there, Miss Lucia. What can we help ya with?

speaker: Lucia
text: I came to ask for a favor. If it's not too much to ask, I'd like you both to accompany me to Felirae.

speaker: Brom
text: Hmm. Naw, that won't be a problem. You goin' ta catch the duke?

speaker: Lucia
text: Something a little more... preliminary. I guess you could call it espionage.

speaker: Brom
text: Espio-what? Sounds serious! Nephenee, you ever hearda that?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Oh, sure. When I was just a sprout, I caught a real bad case'a that. I got this awful rash all over my back, too!

speaker: Lucia
text: Uh... That's... a very nice story. Maybe I'd better explain what I mean.

speaker: Heather
text: Don't you know anything!? Espionage is all about stealing secrets and not getting caught. It's one of my many strong points!

speaker: Lucia
text: Oh, really? And who might you be?

speaker: Heather
text: My name is Heather! I'm a friend of Nephenee's. I'd do ANYTHING to help Her Majesty. Seriously, anything!

speaker: Lucia
text: ...I see. Maybe you can lend a hand as well.

speaker: Heather
text: Miss Lucia, you're the greatest! Like, amazingly stupendously great! I'd love to help!

speaker: Lethe
text: Lady Lucia! We've heard a rumor that you'll be leaving to investigate an enemy. Is this true?

speaker: Lucia
text: Lady Lethe, Sir Mordecai... I... Well...

speaker: Lethe
text: We could return to Gallia and bring back soldiers to help, you know. As an ally in a time of crisis, I'm certain our king would lend support.

speaker: Lucia
text: No, Lady Lethe. This is an internal affair. We don't want to have to involve Gallia in Crimea's civil problems.

speaker: Mordecai
text: More fighters are always better. The people of Gallia... All will fight for Queen Elincia.

speaker: Lucia
text: Listen, I know you mean well, but I just can't allow it. I'm sorry, but if there were even a hint of Gallia's assistance, there would be even more problems in the royal court.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Problems? What problems?

speaker: Lethe
text: This conflict isn't exactly a life-or-death situation for Crimea, so... Relying on support from a laguz nation would cause an uproar with the nobility. Is that what you mean?

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes, unfortunately. I'm ashamed to admit it, but it's the truth.

speaker: Lethe
text: No. It's common sense, given the history of both our nations. I completely understand. We won't report this to Gallia.

speaker: Lucia
text: Thank you for understanding. I apologize for troubling you.

speaker: Mordecai
text: No, it is fine.

speaker: Lethe
text: Why this tactic of rousing the people to rebel against the queen, though? Any laguz who wanted to be king would fight for it with teeth and claws, as is proper. You beorc are always wasting time talking.

speaker: Lucia
text: Our society is very complex. There's history and tradition, unwritten law and custom. There are lots of reasons for why we--

speaker: Lethe
text: Bah! Attempts to compromise won't get you anywhere. You should just kill him and get it over with.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Mordecai feels sad. Poor Queen Elincia... We cannot help her.

speaker: Lucia
text: That's not true, Mordecai. Having support from you and Lethe is very helpful.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Really? Mordecai will help with anything!

speaker: Lucia
text: Hmm. I have a great idea. Together with the laguz...

speaker: Leanne
text: (I'll go too!)

speaker: Lucia
text: Princess Leanne? Why do I suddenly have a crowd?

speaker: Lethe
text: She says that she'd like to go.

speaker: Lucia
text: No, I'm sorry. It's much too dangerous where we're going. I couldn't risk something happening to you.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Hoo hoo! I guess this mangy old coot will be joining the action, then! To ensure my lady's safety, of course.

speaker: Lucia
text: Sir Neluchi, as well? Stars above...

speaker: Lucia
text: Your Majesty...?

speaker: Elincia
text: OK... All finished.

speaker: Lucia
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Elincia
text: Don't worry about it. It's a secret.

speaker: Lucia
text: Aha! That was a needle and thread, wasn't it?! Did you just sew something into my collar?

speaker: Elincia
text: It's a good-luck charm. To keep you safe while you're away. So you'll come back to me in one piece.

speaker: Lucia
text: Elincia...

speaker: Elincia
text: Be careful out there. I'll be praying for you.

speaker: Lucia
text: Thanks. I'll be back with good news. I promise.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia, wait!

speaker: Lucia
text: You can't stop me, Geoffrey.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I know that. But I can try to keep you safe, can't I? So I'd like you to take this.

speaker: Lucia
text: An elixir? I don't need it. I'm just... I'm not going to fight, you know.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: If you don't use it, so much the better. But just hold on to it. For me.

speaker: Lucia
text: All right.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Promise me you won't do anything stupid. Promise for Elincia and me. And for Bastian.

speaker: Lucia
text: For you to even mention his name at a time like this... I give up. Sure, I promise. Keep Queen Elincia safe, got it?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Of course. On my life.

speaker: Jarod
text: You summoned me, Your Grace?

speaker: Numida
text: Jarod, there is trouble. The apostle has formed an inspection team. She's dispatching it to Daein.

speaker: Jarod
text: Oh-ho...

speaker: Numida
text: I've arranged to meet with the senate's vice-minister, Duke Gaddos. If we ask him the favor... I imagine he could discreetly sweep their findings under the rug. But in the meantime, you MUST obliterate the insurgents! Once that is done, we'll devise excuses.

speaker: Jarod
text: Understood, sir.

speaker: Alder
text: What's the plan? Will the senators be able to cover up this mess?

speaker: Jarod
text: If the inspection team and the rebel army ever cross paths...even the senate won't be able to hide the truth. We'll lure the rebels to Shifu Swamp. We'll plant tales of a mass execution there, and they'll be sure to come. Then, we'll trap the malcontents and wipe them from the face of the land.

speaker: Daein
text: It's amazing... My wound is healed. I give you thanks. I never thought I'd see the Silver-Haired Maiden work miracles before my very eyes.

speaker: Prisoner
text: Silver-Haired Maiden! Help them! You must help them!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Help who? What's going on? Calm down and tell me.

speaker: Prisoner
text: They're killing our men! I beg you, please, save them!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Prisoners from Joad Work Camp are being collected in Shifu Swamp and executed...

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Not only Joad. There's reportedly a plan to exterminate all prisoners in every camp and let the swamp conceal the remains.

speaker: Izuka
text: I've heard nothing of such a plan! It's a false rumor! Or an enemy trap!

speaker: Micaiah
text: It may indeed be a trap. But if we don't investigate, we risk a mass execution!

speaker: Izuka
text: And what if it is a trap and they vanquish the Liberation Army? The dream of restoring Daein to glory will die instantly! For the good of Daein's future, we must ignore this threat.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I understand. And that's why I won't take any troops. Only myself...and my old friends will go.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Mi-Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: If you refuse them your permission, I will go alone.

speaker: Izuka
text: Stop right there, little lady!! I will not authorize this action without the prince's full approval!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Izuka... Let her do as she wishes. Please. She hasn't disappointed us yet.

speaker: Izuka
text: My prince... Hrrgh! Fine. But I can't help but feel as if these children are running your army.

speaker: Sothe
text: We're just about ready. Let's talk to Tormod, and--

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey, remember our promise from three years ago? There are no secrets between us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, Muarim knows that I'm older than I look.

speaker: Sothe
text: I see. Well, don't worry too much about it. You can trust him.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I'm sure of that. Muarim seems very trustworthy. But, what about everyone else? What would they think if they knew all of my abilities came from the mixed blood running through my veins? Blood they consider cursed!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah, stop...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Right now, when they look at me, they have love and affection in their eyes, but would they look at me the same way if they knew? I don't want to find out, Sothe. I don't think I could bear the truth.

speaker: Sothe
text: You know, we can stop.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Sothe
text: Look, this was an impossible situation to begin with. You've always led such a secluded life... Ever since you were thrust into this position, I worried that the pressure might get to you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You're right. I knew it would turn out like this. Despite that, I accepted the job. I can't stop now.

speaker: Sothe
text: But, Micaiah...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Listen, Sothe. I realized something after Daein lost the war.

speaker: Sothe
text: What's that?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I realized how much I loved my country.

speaker: Sothe
text: And?

speaker: Micaiah
text: During the war, I spent a lot of time with the people of Daein while I was waiting for you to return. After we lost the war, all our cities and towns had been reduced to ruins. We had to help each other to cope. We supported and comforted each other. That's how we survived.

speaker: Sothe
text: You never mentioned this before.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I've been secluded so long, I had no idea people were so strong...and kind. No one knew who I was, but they helped me because I was from Daein. They were so...loving. They were my friends.

speaker: Sothe
text: And now you won't leave them.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I was touched by their kindness. Now, I'm scared to lose it. Very scared.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah...

speaker: Micaiah
text: I suppose this isn't the time to worry about such things. If my power is needed to liberate Daein, I will stand my ground and fight.

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, not to spoil your resolve... But if things get too hot, I'm just going to grab you and run.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe...

speaker: Sothe
text: Friends and Daein are important, but not as important as you are to me. Remember that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...All right. Thank you, Sothe.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Sorry about this, Lady Micaiah. Just this once, I agree with Lord Izuka’s concerns.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I completely understand. This is my fight, and mine alone. Please keep the prince safe, General Tauroneo.

speaker: Sothe
text: I’ll protect Micaiah. I’ve enlisted extra help, too. We’ll make it back in one piece.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I place my trust in you, Sothe. Best of luck. Oh, I nearly forgot. You should take this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What a peculiar staff… What power does it possess?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: It is a restore staff. It will help you recover from poison, sleep, and paralysis. Enemies will use every method they possess to destroy you. It is best that you be prepared for every eventuality.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you, General Tauroneo. We will return safely.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I know. And I know you’ll save the hostages, too.

speaker: Vika
text: Hm… I wonder where Boss is? These tents all look the same…

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello, Vika. Can I help you?

speaker: Vika
text: Meep!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Vika!

speaker: Micaiah
text: You always run away from me… Did I do something to offend you?

speaker: Vika
text: No, I’m so sorry. I can’t explain why this happens. I get so jumpy around you. There’s just… something about you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh…

speaker: Vika
text: Oh, but please don’t be sad! It’s not you. It’s me. I get…confused…sometimes. I really admire you, and then I get a bizarre feeling, and…

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s all right. Sorry to bother you.

speaker: Vika
text: …No. Wait.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hm?

speaker: Vika
text: I want to overcome this. I don’t like that I feel I must avoid you for some inexplicable reason.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But…

speaker: Vika
text: I know how painful it is to be…feared. I’m really, really sorry. Let’s be friends, OK? If you can forgive me, that is…

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course I forgive you! Thank you, Vika. I’d be honored to have your friendship.

speaker: Vika
text: Here. Take this as a token of that friendship. Please, take it. I’d like you to have it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What a beautiful figurine. The goddess looks so serene.

speaker: Vika
text: Carry it with you. It’ll bring you good luck. I met my boss and Muarim thanks to that figurine.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you, Vika. I’ll cherish it.

speaker: Vika
text: I’m glad you like it.

speaker: Radmin
text: Good. You may begin!

speaker: Bandit
text: Here, have a little swim!

speaker: Youth
text: Aaaaaaaahhh! No! Nooo! Help, someone!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Stop!

speaker: Begnion
text: You're that...bleeding-heart filth!

speaker: Micaiah
text: We are the Daein Liberation Army! Everyone, hold tight! You'll be safe soon!

speaker: Youth
text: Look at her hair... Could it be the Silver-Haired Maiden? Our country's savior, come to rescue us?

speaker: Youth
text: The Savior of Daein!

speaker: Radmin
text: Whether they suspected a trap or not, they're here. Brazen fools! All hands, take battle positions!

speaker: Radmin
text: Silver-haired wench! I'm going to drown you and all of Daein's hopes in these filthy waters! You've no escape!

speaker: Micaiah
text: So...it's a trap after all.

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't get too smug, you cruel cowards! We have a little something up our sleeves too. Tormod! Here's your chance!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Lady Nailah! Volug!

speaker: Begnion
text: Su-sub-humans! They're everywhere! How?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Rafiel, even you came to help?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What happened just now? What was that strange song?

speaker: Sothe
text: That was Vigor, a heron galdr that can reenergize our allies in a fight. Don't be distracted, Micaiah! Let's set our formation while we can.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Queen Nailah, are you sure it's all right involving not only you, but Rafiel, as well?

speaker: Nailah
text: Rafiel can't fly, so sometimes he has trouble keeping up. But even so, the effects of his galdr make him a valuable asset in battle. All I ask is that you keep him near me, so I can keep him safe.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I understand. I will.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Rafiel...why did you come? I thought herons abhorred fighting...

speaker: Rafiel
text: Wherever the queen goes, I follow. I practice seid magic... Even if I cannot fight, I can lend strength to my friends and companions.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I heard you singing to Queen Nailah and Volug earlier. We are blessed to have you at our side.

speaker: Rafiel
text: And if I sing to you, I can restore your spirits as well, so that you might attack your foes swiftly.

speaker: Micaiah
text: So you will help us?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Helping you would give me great joy.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You have my thanks.

speaker: Radmin
text: Silver-Haired Maiden, or whoever you really are! I knew you'd come! I knew how your reputation would suffer if you abandoned these prisoners here. You had no choice but to come.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How many innocent, defenseless people have you ordered killed...just to lure me here?

speaker: Radmin
text: Look who's passing judgment! Maiden of Miracles, Savior of Daein... You've spun quite a pack of lies to inspire your conquered people. But that ends here, wench! Let's show them how insignificant you really are!

speaker: Radmin
text: That wench...her powers...much...too dangerous... She mustn't be allowed...to...

speaker: Micaiah
text: We're nearly back to camp. I wonder if the prince will overlook the fact that I insisted on this mission?

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm sure he'll be happy when he sees the prisoners are safe.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe...do you hear a noise coming from the canyon? Is it...people shouting?

speaker: Daein
text: Look! Look up there! The Maiden has returned! And the prisoners are with her!

speaker: Daein
text: She won another victory! She escaped their trap and destroyed the enemy...again!

speaker: Daein
text: Radiant with divine protection, she truly has the goddess's blessing! The Silver-Haired Maiden! Our priestess!

speaker: Daein
text: Priestess...of Dawn! Hooray, Lady Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What could they be celebrating?

speaker: Nailah
text: It seems the soldiers are celebrating your liberation of the prisoners. You should wave to them. People like their heroes to seem approachable. It would make them happy.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm no hero... But I see what you mean.

speaker: Daein
text: What a glorious sight she is!

speaker: Daein
text: Lady Micaiah! Lady Micaiah, the Priestess of Dawn!

speaker: Sothe
text: Here you are. I've been looking for you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, after all those soldiers cheering... I feel like I'm doing real good here...

speaker: Sothe
text: ...Micaiah?

speaker: Tormod
text: Sothe! Please, come quick! There's something wrong with Muarim!

speaker: Muarim
text: Ghh...grraaahrrrr...

speaker: Tormod
text: Muarim, get ahold of yourself! Look at me!

speaker: Muarim
text: ...Gh... Li...ttle...one...

speaker: Tormod
text: This happens over and over... Muarim suddenly transforms, and...he growls like he's losing his mind. And if I...if I grab him and yell his name again and again, he returns to himself, but...then it just starts over. And...and...when he's growling, his eyes, they look... It's as if, as if one of "them" is looking at me...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Them? One of "them"? One of who?

speaker: Sothe
text: You can't mean... No!

speaker: Tormod
text: H-help him, please. I don't know what to do. The time between transformations is getting shorter and shorter...

speaker: Muarim
text: Agh... My body can't... ...No, no, no... Little one...get away...

speaker: Tormod
text: No, I won't let you! I'll die before I let you go feral! Muarim! Look at me!

speaker: Sothe
text: That song...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Rafiel...

speaker: Muarim
text: Gh...

speaker: Tormod
text: Wha--! Muarim! Muarim!

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...The galdr of rebirth restores twisted bodies and souls to their proper states. He will be all right now.

speaker: Tormod
text: Th...thank you... Without Muarim...life would be...terrible...

speaker: Micaiah
text: What was that song? It was different than when he sang before...

speaker: Sothe
text: It was the galdr of rebirth. I heard it once before, in the war. But... Micaiah, what's wrong?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I feel...odd. Maybe it was the song... I'm shaking, for some reason... But I'm truly glad that Muarim will be all right...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Feral Ones?

speaker: Sothe
text: In the Mad King's War... Daein's military developed living weapons. They were called "Feral Ones"...laguz that had been warped and twisted by terrible experiments.

speaker: Izuka
text: Terrible, you say?! Do you mean to refute the highly effective results of my brilliant research?!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Then it was you! You secretly gave Muarim the drug to turn him into a Feral One!

speaker: Izuka
text: And what's wrong with that? Maintaining constant battle strength in beast state... How splendid!

speaker: Tormod
text: How dare you! Transforming laguz into Feral Ones dramatically shortens their life spans. It destroys their sense of self, and they do nothing but fight until they die! And you! You gave Muarim that drug!

speaker: Izuka
text: Pawns need no sense of self! It's only natural to sacrifice soldiers for victory in war!

speaker: Micaiah
text: You twisted maniac! You are the lowest--

speaker: Pelleas
text: Everybody! Wait, please! Izuka clearly did a terrible thing to that sub-hum--that laguz, I apologize. Tormod... I'm truly sorry. He will not use the drug again. So, please... Try to forgive him...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Prince Pelleas...

speaker: Izuka
text: My prince! We must not have royalty bowing and scraping before swine like--

speaker: Tormod
text: ...That's enough!

speaker: Sothe
text: Tormod!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Let him go...

speaker: Sanaki
text: I see... Is that true?

speaker: Lekain
text: Yes, Apostle. Our occupation forces have engaged in appalling and inhumane excesses in Daein. These excesses were perpetrated entirely outside the knowledge of the occupational governor, Duke Numida.

speaker: Numida
text: I come to you penitent... Failing my duties as governor, I, Numida, share a measure of guilt for this disaster. I am prepared to take the appropriate punishment, Apostle Sanaki. However, I feel that freeing the people of Daein from the clutches of our oppression is our most urgent task...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Urgent, you say? Then we must make haste. We will forthwith convene an inspection team and request a meeting with the army led by the late King Ashnard's orphan. We will assure them of Begnion's intentions. Then, we will immediately address the occupation force's tyranny.

speaker: Lekain
text: Excellent! In that case, please deign to allow me, your humble servant Lekain, to lead the inspection team. The soldiers who have stained the empire's name will be toppled where they stand! I promise, they shall not live to return here.

speaker: Sanaki
text: That is unacceptable. I will decide the soldiers' punishment only after hearing their side. And I have chosen to appoint Sephiran, Duke Persis, to lead the investigation team. Is that acceptable, Sephiran?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I hear and I obey, my empress.

speaker: Lekain
text: What?! But, but, Apostle Sanaki...

speaker: Sanaki
text: This is a dire situation. Accordingly, I judge the prime minister, Duke Persis, to be more suited to the role than you, Vice-Minister Lekain. That is all.

speaker: Lekain
text: Hrrgh...

speaker: Numida
text: L-Lord Lekain...! What shall I do?!

speaker: Lekain
text: Duke Numida, my friend... I'm afraid you must sacrifice every last Begnion in the Imperial Occupation Army.

speaker: Numida
text: What? Th-that's ridiculous! But...grrgh! Blast that spoiled brat and her cunning little schemes... You'll regret this, Apostle Sanaki!

speaker: Haar
text: So... We're guessing that flare sent up from Geoffrey's troops means Ludveck plans to come for Your Majesty. He's probably marching his troops toward this fortress as we speak. Since it's come to this, I'd like to stick around and help. Let me know if you need me.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...I see. Thank you ever so much. Sir Haar... I have one more question. What about Lucia? Have you heard from her? Is she safe?

speaker: Haar
text: We found a man's body in the village safehouse. We believe he was her messenger. We also found this...

speaker: Elincia
text: No! This is... This is Lucia's hair! But... How?

speaker: Haar
text: Well, we assume that Ludveck infiltrated her network of spies and captured her. This is his way of letting us know. It also means she's still alive, which means we still can save her. Queen Elincia, it's up to you to determine the best course of action.

speaker: Elincia
text: Y-yes, I... I know... Royal guards! Arm yourselves, and prepare to meet the rebel forces in battle. I will be commanding you personally.

speaker: Crimea
text: Your Majesty! But...you are the queen! It's much too dangerous! Please, assign a subordinate to this duty!

speaker: Elincia
text: I will not. It is my indecision that has allowed the rebellion to come this far. I refuse to run from this problem any longer.

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia... Lucia, I'm sorry. Somehow, I promise you... I will save you!

speaker: Elincia
text: Princess Leanne, Sir Nealuchi... This fortress will soon be under siege.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Wh-whaaat?!

speaker: Elincia
text: Somehow the enemy has found out that I am hiding here. My two fine friends... You must escape.

speaker: Leanne
text: I...sing...and h-help...Queen Elincia!

speaker: Elincia
text: No! Under no circumstances! I won't allow any such thing!

speaker: Leanne
text: I...like help...Q-Queen...Elincia.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Now, now. When my lady makes up her mind, nothing in Tellius can sway her. And me? I'm sure you wouldn't mind having these old bones on the battlefield.

speaker: Elincia
text: Sir Nealuchi... Honestly, I couldn't... Sigh...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Wait until you see me... Even at my age, I'll be one step ahead of those freshly hatched whippersnappers.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Very well. I must prepare as well. I had hoped this day would never come... Amiti, the treasured blade of House Crimea, will awake from its long slumber.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...The battle will begin soon. I want both of you to promise me that you will fall back if in danger. Understood?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Fall back, Your Majesty? No one can hold a candle to the speed at which the raven tribe retreats.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ha ha... That's a relief.

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Reporting, sir! Fort Alpea's gate is sealed, and they are readying their defenses.

speaker: Ludveck
text: I see... Lady Lucia must have arranged some way to warn the queen. But alas, even if they were to have all the energy and luck in the world, the Royal Knights wouldn't arrive for two days. In any case, there's no way we can lose, considering that we have a card which has yet to be put into the game.

speaker: Crimea
text: Y-Your Majesty, dire news! The rear gate is open, and the rebel army is storming in!

speaker: Elincia
text: What?! how could this happen?!

speaker: Lethe
text: I think you'll understand once you question this man.

speaker: Elincia
text: You guard the inner garden, correct?

speaker: Crimea
text: You scum! You helped the rebel army, didn't you?!

speaker: Servant
text: Yes. Yes, I did. I did it because it was the best thing for the future of this country. Those Daein murderers killed my entire family, and now the queen bows down and wags her tail at them! It's a disgrace!

speaker: Crimea
text: Silence! You're the traitor here! Prepare to die.

speaker: Elincia
text: Wait! Killing this man will do nothing to help our situation. We have to halt Ludveck and his men. They're already inside!

speaker: Lethe
text: I'm going out there, too.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Mordecai will fight for you, Queen Elincia.

speaker: Brom
text: You can count on me, Your Majesty.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Queen Elincia, Crimea needs you more than anything, and I reckon you could use my help.

speaker: Heather
text: My homeland, being ruled by a snobby stiff like Ludveck? Please. I don't think so!

speaker: Crimea
text: Your Majesty! We would give our lives for our queen! Allow us to fight!

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you, everyone. I am indeed the queen of Crimea, and a queen does not hide. Our enemies are fellow citizens of Crimea. But we can no longer sit idle as they destroy the harmony of our nation.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Could our situation be any better? Just look at these fragile defenses... As fragile as the queen's reign! Ludveck: ...Oh? The queen's taken command? I expected her to abandon her people, turn tail, and run for the hills. How preciously naïve. We shall have to teach her that being overly optimistic can be fatal.
Queen Elincia! I made it!

speaker: Elincia
text: Marcia!

speaker: Marcia
text: Thanks to General Geoffrey, we spotted an ambush on the main road and snuck by on the old highway instead! The Royal Knights will be here soon. I flew ahead to tell you...and to serve you some traitor pie on my lance!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Thank you. I'm impressed you made it back so quickly.

speaker: Marcia
text: My pleasure, Your Majesty! Now, which monkeys do you want filleted before the Royal Knights get here?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty! We'll countercharge their flank! The Royal Knights will succeed again! Indomitable knights of Crimea, this is the hour you have trained for! Hold the line, and run them down!

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey! Geoffrey, oh, Geoffrey!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Find Ludveck, duke of Felirae! Seize him immediately! He must not escape!

speaker: Ludveck
text: What a bother! They arrived far faster than I had expected. But I will prevail. I won't lose to that worthless queen.

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Elincia! I'm relieved you're safe. Leave the rest of the battle to us. Find someplace safe.

speaker: Elincia
text: No, this is my fight. This is my problem, and it will be resolved under my power!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Very well. If that's your decision, Your Majesty.

speaker: Ludveck
text: The day is upon us... A day that will stand proudly in the history of Crimea. Today, a weak queen falls...and a new king prevails!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: That's enough, Duke Ludveck! You have no chance of victory. The Royal Knights are here, and we have our queen to lead us.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Ho ho... It's the valiant Geoffrey. I assume, General, that you have yet to hear about Lady Lucia?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia? What's happened?

speaker: Ludveck
text: Well... I could tell you, but what would that gain me? Now, if you were to turn on the queen and grovel at my feet, I might consider telling you.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: How dare you, you rotten...

speaker: Ludveck
text: Queen Elincia...

speaker: Elincia
text: Ludveck.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Looking quite gallant, aren't we? I thought you would surely be fleeing by now...or pleading for your life. I must commend you on your unexpected bravery.

speaker: Elincia
text: I am the ruler of Crimea. I will not abandon that role.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Oh, I see... Self-sacrifice, is it? How very honorable of you. By the way, Your Majesty, Lady Lucia is often in your company. Wherever could she have gone to?

speaker: Elincia
text: Where is she?! Tell me she's safe! Tell me--now!

speaker: Ludveck
text: Oh my, you look pale. You two grew up like sisters... You must be worried, then? Ha! Yet another facet of your weakness.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Elincia! I yield to you! Please... You may imprison me. Your Majesty, be merciful! Spare our lives. We surrender our weapons.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Queen Elincia! I'm so glad you're safe... Please forgive my tardiness. I've let you down. I'm sorry.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ridiculous! You did no such thing. Geoffrey... Thank you so much. So, what of the rebel army?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Without Ludveck at the helm, they're a mess. They're all running about trying to escape. As commanded, we are not pursuing fleeing soldiers, and Lord Ludveck is locked up in the dungeon.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Queen Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia is being held captive! If we're to save her, we need to talk to him.

speaker: Crimea
text: Your Majesty! General! W-we've received a missive! It concerns Lady Lucia!

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Queen of Crimea, we demand that you release the duke of Felirae! Refuse, and Lady Lucia will die!

speaker: Elincia
text: No!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...Lucia.

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: You have half a mark! If the duke is not released by then, the girl dies!

speaker: Lucia
text: Queen Elincia, don't listen to them! Don't worry about me!

speaker: Lucia
text: Guh!

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Quiet! You can die sooner, if you like!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...Your Majesty, you can't... You have to let me do something about this.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia would willingly die fighting for her country, I know... But you have to help her, Elincia. If you were in her position, she would surely do the same. Please, just give the word.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Hello, Your Majesty... By the look on your face, I can see my plan has been a success.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...What exactly is it that you want? To throw our country into chaos?

speaker: Ludveck
text: No. I want to protect it, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: What?!

speaker: Ludveck
text: Queen Elincia, you're so naïve. Cold and callous decisions are sometimes required of a nation's ruler. ...I was testing you. We all wanted to know if our queen would have the power to stop a civil war. But, no, you were too hesitant and too concerned about harming the people... Now look what has happened. The rule of Crimea cannot be kept in your hands! Please, Your Majesty! You must abdicate and cede the crown to me! And considering Lady Lucia's life is on the line, you haven't much choice. Now, let's have you free me from this prison cell, and then we can discuss any further details...

speaker: Elincia
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Ludveck
text: What?! Are you truly willing to sacrifice Lady Lucia?!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Lord Ludveck, all your dissatisfaction and misgivings about me are well founded. However, do you realize how many lives you've simply thrown away?! Strength without compassion does not a ruler make. You care nothing for the people, sir. You cloak your desire to rule with pretty speeches, but it is petty avarice nonetheless!

speaker: Ludveck
text: ...So this is how it shall be? Very well... But Lady Lucia cannot be spared without my order.

speaker: Elincia
text: Allowing you to plant the seeds of rebellion and play havoc with the lives of my people is a failure for which I must answer. But I will see Crimea through this trial. I will give my people the future they deserve, no matter the cost.

speaker: Ludveck
text: ...Ha... Ha ha ha ha! Well played, Your Majesty! Indeed, I have failed. Yet I wonder... Are you capable of watching Lucia die? Or will you crawl back to me, your face awash with tears, begging for mercy? How I pray to see that face, Your Majesty!

speaker: Elincia
text: Rebel soldiers, hear me! Ludveck of Felirae, having conspired against the nation, will stand trial. As the queen and ruler of Crimea, I refuse to negotiate with those bent on destroying it.

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: ...So you're going to let this girl die?!

speaker: Lucia
text: Hah!

speaker: Elincia
text: I will be strong, Lucia...

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Tch... Kick, scream, beg... Give us a show, wench!

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Your Highness! Your trusted friend will now die. Let this burn forever in your memory!

speaker: Lucia
text: People of Crimea... Behold a true queen! YOUR queen! Long live Queen Elincia!

speaker: Shinon
text: Come on. Do it. It's a clean shot.

speaker: Shinon
text: What's the problem?

speaker: Rolf
text: I'm nervous. What if I hit her?

speaker: Shinon
text: It's too late for nerves, Rolf. If you're not up to it, just leave it to the master, eh?  Watch and learn. One clean motion, no hesitation.

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: The queen's men are attacking!

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Stop him!

speaker: Mia
text: Soren, always lost in your books! What have I said about watching your back?

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Form up! Surround them all! Don't let a single one escape!

speaker: Mist
text: Hold on, Lucia! Everything will be fine!

speaker: Mist
text: Can you hear me? Hold on!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Queen Elincia! It's Sir Ike and the Greil Mercenaries! They came to our aid! Now we'll get Lucia back in one piece. We've nothing more to worry about. I'll deploy my knights at once!

speaker: Elincia
text: Sir Ike... If you hadn't come to help, I would have lost one of my dearest friends. Thank you... Thank you ever so much.

speaker: Ike
text: We were happy to do it. And Bastian pays well for mercenary work.

speaker: Elincia
text: Bastian?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. The count of Fayre knew about Ludveck's plotting before he left for Daein. Bastian guessed that if he left the country, the rebels would feel confident enough to make their move. What else could you expect from Crimea's top tactician? Well...Crimea's most deceptive old dog, at any rate.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, that's just like him...

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry that we had to stay hidden until the last minute. For a ruse like that to work, you have to deceive allies as well as enemies. I know you were acting in Crimea's best interests, but I'm sorry you had to let that happen to Lucia.

speaker: Lucia
text: No... It worked out fine in the end. Please put it out of your mind.

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia, Geoffrey... I value your lives more than even my own. But it's my duty to protect this country, even if that means losing you. I've learned a lot from all of this. I hope to keep them out of harm's way, and I'll never make the same mistakes again.

speaker: Ike
text: Good to hear. So what are you going to do about all the escaped rebel soldiers?

speaker: Elincia
