text: The rebel army will be eradicated. We cannot allow them to sow the seeds of discontent among the people of Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: That's the right choice. Would you consider contracting my mercenaries for the job?

speaker: Elincia
text: ...No, Sir Ike. I'll leave that up to the Royal Knights. I'm certain this task will create anger among the people, and the Royal Knights may be resented for their role in it... But my duty as queen demands that it be done. The people will have to learn to accept that.

speaker: Ike
text: I respect your devotion to duty. So, you don't need me then?

speaker: Elincia
text: That's right. I'm going to move on, together with my vassals and the people of this country.

speaker: Elincia
text: Sir Ike... Before you leave, there's something I'd like to talk to you about.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Elincia
text: When you heard from Bastian... Did he say anything about Daein?

speaker: Ike
text: No, nothing.

speaker: Elincia
text: He informed me of a number of things. Apparently Daein's reconstruction is playing out much like Crimea's... He spoke of a new king raising the banner of war, and a charismatic young hero carrying it into battle. He compared King Pelleas to me, and a "Silver-Haired Maiden" to you... It's almost unnatural. He suspected that someone might be scheming, trying to manipulate Daein. Bastian seemed quite suspicious of it all.

speaker: Ike
text: So Bastian went to Daein to try and confirm his suspicions on that?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. There was also something about Daein's resurrection that we can't afford to overlook. ...The Black Knight.

speaker: Ike
text: What?!

speaker: Elincia
text: I'll never forget him... He was the one warrior who the late King Ashnard trusted. Encased in pitch-black armor, standing tall with a crimson cape... When the Liberation Army fought at the capital, he was there. He sided with the Silver-Haired Maiden.

speaker: Ike
text: The Black Knight... The man who killed my father... But I defeated him three years ago. I'm sure of it. At the very least, he couldn't have escaped when Nados Castle came crashing down on him.

speaker: Elincia
text: The day after you fought, Bastian ordered some men to search the remains of Nados Castle. There was no trace of the Black Knight. No armor... No sword... No corpse.

speaker: Elincia
text: If the Black Knight that was seen in Daein was indeed the same Black Knight... He might prove to be a threat to Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm. If he's still alive... I have no doubt I'll see him again. Elincia, this is very important information to me. Thank you.

speaker: Elincia
text: Of course.

speaker: Crimea
text: Your Majesty, the Begnion army has crossed the border. They are seizing food and supplies and calling it tribute to the empire. There are no casualties yet, but they are acting like bandits!

speaker: Elincia
text: I see... So, they simply ignored me.

speaker: Lucia
text: What shall I tell the troops, Your Majesty?

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Order the Royal Knights to mobilize. Ride out and advise Begnion to withdraw. If they do not comply... I approve the use of force to remove them from our lands.

speaker: Aristocrat
text: But...Your Majesty! This is the Begnion army we are talking about! It would be unwise to provoke them!

speaker: Elincia
text: I had hoped to avoid this situation... But the empire's attempts to strong-arm our people shall not go unanswered. Deploying the Royal Knights is the only way to protect our borders from incursion. However, I remain open to suggestions. Do you have an alternate plan of action, Lord Saron?

speaker: Aristocrat
text: N-no... Please forgive my impudence. Your Majesty is quite right.

speaker: Elincia
text: I am glad we are in agreement, Lord Saron.

speaker: Lucia
text: This whole situation disturbs me greatly. I wonder... What is happening to the empire?

speaker: Elincia
text: I doubt that the apostle would allow this sort of thing to happen. We should prepare for the worst. I fear something horrible must be happening within Begnion.

speaker: Man
text: Hey, did you hear? The Imperial Army is requesting Crimea's assistance.

speaker: Youth 1
text: Yeah, I heard! I also heard that the messenger treated our queen with no respect at all! Who do they think they are!?

speaker: Lady
text: Shhh! Not so loud! Begnion is ruled by the apostle. They helped us when Daein invaded. It's only right that we pay back the favor by coming to their aid.

speaker: Man
text: But Begnion is fighting the beast tribes of Gallia. Why would we fight Gallia? The beast tribes helped us rebuild Crimea.

speaker: Youth 2
text: That's true, but come on! Think about it. Who would you rather side with? A land of beorc, or the land of sub...laguz? The answer's as plain as day. We side with the beorc.

speaker: Man
text: Hmm... You have a point.

speaker: Youth 1
text: I'd choose Gallia over Begnion.

speaker: Lady
text: Really?

speaker: Youth 2
text: But why?

speaker: Youth 1
text: The people of Gallia helped us rebuild the village, even though we're beorc. They even repaired the road to the farm that's up on the mountain. That wasn't an easy job, either.

speaker: Lady
text: Yes, I remember. What was his name... Mordecai? He was strong, yet very kind. He looked frightening at first, but the children in the village loved to play with him. He was a wonderful man.

speaker: Man
text: If the queen decides to answer Begnion's request for troops, we'd have to fight Gallia. How terrible would that be?

speaker: Youth 2
text: That's war, isn't it?

speaker: Man
text: Yes. I suppose it is, at that.

speaker: Lady
text: Hmm.

speaker: Youth 2
text: I wish we didn't have to fight anyone at all.

speaker: Calill
text: It’s been one thing after another. First, the civil unrest, then the imperial invasion. I’m so sick of hearing about all of it.

speaker: Makalov
text: You and me both. I figured I’d be able to get in some me time now that Crimea’s peaceful again. Get a card game started or something...

speaker: Largo
text: You’re a Royal Knight. If the queen decides you should go sweep away ten or a hundred imperial soldiers, you should probably go do it.

speaker: Makalov
text: Yeah... We’ve been ordered to mobilize, and I can’t think of any excuse to get out of it. Maybe I could pretend to be dead. Any ideas, Amy?

speaker: Amy
text: Don’t make General Geoffrey mad! You’re a Royal Knight! You better follow his orders!

speaker: Makalov
text: Amy! You’re supposed to HELP me! She’s obviously been spending way too much time with you, Calill.

speaker: Calill
text: Well of course, you twit! All right, Makalov. It’s time for you to pay up and go.

speaker: Makalov
text: What!? But... I think my stomach’s acting funny...
That’s enough, you layabout!

speaker: Makalov
text: Oh. Hi, Marcia. Don’t surprise me like that!

speaker: Marcia
text: Makalov! I knew I’d find you here, slacker! You’re making the whole squad wait for you! Hurry up and head back!

speaker: Makalov
text: I don’t know about all this. Fighting the Imperial Army means fighting my old comrades. I don’t wanna fight my old friends. You know what I mean?

speaker: Marcia
text: ...I think I see. You owe them money, don’t you? Isn’t that the real reason why you don’t want to see them, cheese breath?

speaker: Makalov
text: W-when did you learn to read minds like the herons!?

speaker: Marcia
text: I can’t, you spineless sea cucumber! It’s just so typical of you that I guessed!

speaker: Astrid
text: Marcia, please. That’s quite enough.

speaker: Marcia
text: But, Astrid! It’s despicable!

speaker: Astrid
text: Look at how calm Sir Makalov is. He never gets irritated or upset. It’s the mark of a true knight. A good knight must know how to keep his cool on the battlefield.

speaker: Marcia
text: Um. But... we’re in a bar.

speaker: Astrid
text: Oh, I hope to be as good a knight as Sir Makalov someday! How I dream of that day!

speaker: Makalov
text: Heh.

speaker: Marcia
text: I don’t believe this.

speaker: Makalov
text: ...You don’t wanna end up like me, baby.

speaker: Marcia
text: Oh, I completely agree! Who’d want to end up a clown-haired chowderhead?

speaker: Astrid
text: The love you two have for each other is so wonderful. I wish I had a sibling!

speaker: Makalov
text: Uh, sure...

speaker: Marcia
text: I’ll sell him to you. Cheap.

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey. Please take this with you.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Why... this is a master crown! I am honored, Your Majesty. I will cherish it.

speaker: Elincia
text: I have been asking you to fight difficult battles against terrible odds.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty, allow me to reiterate: that is exactly what I wish. No matter the task, and no matter the odds, I can only succeed at it so long as you depend on me. I am yours entirely, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: I shall take those words to heart. Geoffrey of Delbray, you are truly my finest and mot faithful knight.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Thank you, Your Majesty.

speaker: Lucia
text: Here are the war funds. Remember, Geoffrey. You will face the Imperial Army. Should there be a conflict, you must not be caught unprepared.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I shall be prepared, Lucia.

speaker: Roark
text: Are you layabouts done collecting supplies? We don't have all day!

speaker: Begnion
text: No, sir. Progress is slow. These people just don't have much. Something about an uprising earlier...

speaker: Roark
text: Fools! I don't want excuses! Take anything you see, and if these bumpkins complain at all, cut them down! Because you can bet your armor that Senator Valtome will do the same to us if we're not done by the time he arrives!

speaker: Begnion
text: Reporting, sir! A Crimean army is approaching from the southwest! It seems to be the Royal Knights!

speaker: Roark
text: Wh-what?! Crimea is moving against us?! Those backwater fools! All right. Keep working. I'll take several men out to slow their approach! Colonial fools... I'll teach them what it means to defy the empire!

speaker: Kieran
text: General Geoffrey! We've confirmed the presence of the Begnion army in the village ahead of us!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I would prefer to avoid a fight, but I suppose that decision is up to them. Let's hurry!

speaker: Roark
text: Crimean soldiers! How dare you turn your weapons against us! You will pay for this betrayal. Men, burn these shanties to the ground! Show these fools what we do to traitors!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Monsters! They're setting the village on fire! Knights, evacuate the villagers and put out the fires immediately!

speaker: Roark
text: Dog of Crimea! I'll crush you!

speaker: Roark
text: The empire will not forget this... Once our main forces arrive, they will slaughter you like cattle!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I am Geoffrey, the commander of the Crimean Royal Knights. Do you command these men?

speaker: Roark
text: Knight of Crimea. You are clearly guilty of treason against the Begnion Empire! Do you understand what it means to send an army against us? You've just killed your people.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: You have been warned. Queen Elincia will not accept any further acts of violence or banditry within our borders! Withdraw your troops immediately, or I cannot guarantee your safe return! Decide quickly.

speaker: Roark
text: How dare you take that tone with me! I'll put you in your place!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Good, the enemy's retreating. Knights! Stay here and help to fix the damage done to this village.

speaker: Lucia
text: Good work, Geoffrey. You sent them running.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia! What are you doing here?

speaker: Lucia
text: I'm here to protect Her Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: Superb work, Geoffrey. You have my thanks.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty... Forgive me. I could not avoid a confrontation with the Imperial Army.

speaker: Elincia
text: It wasn't your fault, Geoffrey. However...I'm afraid our situation continues to deteriorate. Lucia, I appoint you as envoy to negotiate a treaty with the commander of the Imperial Army. They might be willing to listen now.

speaker: Lucia
text: I shall leave immediately, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: Senator Valtome... I sincerely regret having to meet under these circumstances.

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, I completely agree, Your Majesty. I never dreamed we'd suffer so much mistreatment from our allies. So, you've decided that Crimea will side with Gallia, and honor the alliance with those filthy sub-humans over ours?

speaker: Elincia
text: As I've said before, Crimea remains neutral. Crimea will side neither with Begnion nor the Laguz Alliance. That is my final answer.

speaker: Valtome
text: Ah, then please enlighten me... Why prevent us from getting what we needed? Begnion is your suzerain. You should be...delighted...to comply with our request for supplies. But instead, you launch an ambush and inflict horrible pain on us, your loving guardians. Now, Begnion is a patient parent, but I do hope you realize that your actions thus far have amounted to treason and sedition...

speaker: Elincia
text: You have violated our borders, stolen from my people, and inflicted harm upon them. I will not allow such actions within my lands, no matter who the aggressor may be!

speaker: Valtome
text: How quaint. Uwee hee hee... Your Majesty, do you know what the penalties are for the crimes you've committed? I can only assume you do not, or you would not so rashly endanger your life. But don't worry, Queen Elincia. Once Begnion has your crown--along with your head--removed for treason, I'm sure we will take VERY good care of your people.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Senator Valtome!

speaker: Valtome
text: I think, after the dust has settled, I'll place my portrait right over your throne-- ...Mmm-hmm. It was a pleasure chatting with Your Majesty. I am leaving now. She's all yours, General.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Your Majesty... Please forgive my superior officer's insolence.

speaker: Elincia
text: Wait, I recognize you... You came to our aid some time ago, during the Mad King's War. General Zelgius, wasn't it?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Yes, Your Majesty. This is the second time I've had the honor of seeing you. I sincerely apologize for my army's actions during the resupply operation. Please, forgive us.

speaker: Elincia
text: The Begnion Empire and the apostle gave us much support in our reconstruction effort. Crimea will always appreciate Begnion's generosity. However... Crimea and Gallia are allies. As such, we cannot take a side in this quarrel. Please understand.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...I understand, Your Majesty. Our forces will refrain from levying supplies while in Crimea.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh... Thank you for your understanding.

speaker: Zelgius
text: However, I must ask you to agree on these two points. First, the Imperial Army shall be given leave to pass through Crimea toward Gallia. Second, we shall be allowed to engage the Gallian army in towns near the Crimea-Gallia border.

speaker: Elincia
text: Excuse me?! This peace talk is meaningless. You will still do battle and spill blood within our borders!

speaker: Zelgius
text: I'm afraid this is the best I can offer. It's sometimes necessary to cut your losses for the greater good. Please think on it. Tomorrow, my army will begin marching toward Gallia. If the Crimean army does not interfere, I will take it as a sign of agreement. Farewell, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: General Zelgius! Please wait!

speaker: Elincia
text: Does the apostle know anything about this war with the laguz?

speaker: Elincia
text: It's just very hard for me to believe... Is this war truly the will of the apostle?

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...That is not for me to answer, Your Majesty.

speaker: Elincia
text: Then at least tell me this: is the apostle safe?

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...Excuse me, I must go.

speaker: Elincia
text: General...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Felirae, Mugill, and Telgam are ours. But this war has just started. The enemy's main force is in Sienne, the capital. The real fight starts now.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ah, now we fight the big battle! My claws itch for beorc flesh. Hey, Ranulf! Are there strong enemies in the capital?

speaker: Ranulf
text: There will be plenty. Before we go, we must fight the northern nobles. Their collective army is massive.

speaker: Soren
text: By now, I imagine the Begnion Central Army is heading our way. They're going to be our real problem.

speaker: Titania
text: So, if we're too slow, we get caught in the middle.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't like the sound of this. Soren, do you have a deployment plan worked out?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Actually, why don't you all just relax? You might not believe it, but WE have a plan this time!

speaker: Titania
text: I see. An army of that size would require a massive amount of supplies to be able to sustain itself. So the bird tribes will hit the Central Army's supply unit and slow their advance.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Exactly. The empire fears the bird tribes. The Shipless Pirates, they're called. They specialize in surprise attacks and have been raiding Begnion merchant ships for years.

speaker: Ike
text: After they hit the supply unit, the bird tribes will head north. We'll meet up with them after we finish off the nobles' forces. Then when the Central Army arrives, we'll attack them together. Does that pretty much sum it up?

speaker: Soren
text: I'm surprised. As laguz strategies go, it's not bad at all. We might even win, provided everything goes as planned.

speaker: Naesala
text: Tibarn! We can't see it yet, but Begnion is close. Shouldn't you let your men take a break?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yeah... Let's land on one of those islands and get some rest.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You're full of surprises, Naesala. I never expected you to join the Laguz Alliance. I wish you could be this helpful all the time.

speaker: Naesala
text: Tibarn, just stop. I'm not interested in your friendship.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The hawk tribe and the raven tribe used to live together in Phoenicis. Our tribes were like brothers! Maybe if you fess up about some of your secrets, I might consider helping you out in the future.

speaker: Naesala
text: That doesn't really narrow it down, Tibarn. Which secrets are you talking about?

speaker: Tibarn
text: How about the secret of how you suddenly became first in line to succeed the throne of Kilvas?

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh, THAT secret. Sure, no problem.. I'll tell you if we live through this war. Sound all right to you?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sounds fine to me. You know, this war is going to be vicious, but at least our tribes will grow close again.

speaker: Naesala
text: Do you actually trust me? You might live to regret it.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You're trying to protect Reyson, Leanne, Rafiel, and their father, King Lorazieh. Isn't that so? As long as they're on our side, you won't betray us. I think that's enough rest and small talk, though. Let's go!

speaker: Boyd
text: So I told him, you know? I thought it was important.

speaker: Oscar
text: Are you sure about this? You're always exaggerating stories to make them more impressive.

speaker: Boyd
text: No, I'm deadly serious! Trust me, you'd have done exactly the same thing if you were there!
Oh... I finally found you!

speaker: Woman
text: Oscar... Boyd... It's been such a long time.

speaker: Oscar
text: Eep!

speaker: Boyd
text: How did you find us?
She's in here!

speaker: Woman
text: Let go!

speaker: Gallia
text: What are you doing here, intruder? You're coming with me!

speaker: Woman
text: No, please! I'm not done yet!

speaker: Oscar
text: Sigh... Please let her go. She's a friend of ours.

speaker: Gallia
text: She is? You should have said something!

speaker: Woman
text: ...Thank you, Oscar. Oh, that was scary!

speaker: Boyd
text: Why did you come here?

speaker: Woman
text: Please. You have to let me see him.

speaker: Oscar
text: I do?

speaker: Woman
text: He's here with you, right!? Let me see Rolf!

speaker: Boyd
text: Uh... Why should we?

speaker: Woman
text: What!?

speaker: Boyd
text: You abandoned him! You left me, Dad, and Rolf for some guy! What kind of mom does that, huh!?

speaker: Woman
text: I was different back then! I was so young... I didn't know how to raise two kids while looking after your bedridden father. Believe me, I tried! I tried... But it was too difficult.

speaker: Boyd
text: At least you and I aren't related. But, Rolf... That's different. He's your son! Yours! And you left him behind because it was "too hard"!?

speaker: Woman
text: I'm sorry... I've regretted my decision since the day I made it. I thought of you each and every day.

speaker: Boyd
text: My father died not too long after you left him. We'd have followed him, too, if my brother hadn't abandoned his knighthood in Crimea to take care of us!

speaker: Woman
text: I... I had no idea... Oh... I've made a terrible mistake! I'm so sorry. Forgive me.

speaker: Boyd
text: Leave. Now. You've got no right to see Rolf.

speaker: Woman
text: Boyd! Please, I'm begging you! I...I want Rolf to come back and live with me!

speaker: Boyd
text: Lady, you've got some serious nerve. He's our brother! You're not gonna take him away from us!

speaker: Oscar
text: ...Just...wait here. I'll go get Rolf.

speaker: Boyd
text: Oscar?!

speaker: Woman
text: Oscar! Thank you!

speaker: Oscar
text: Don't get the wrong idea. I haven't suddenly forgiven you.

speaker: Woman
text: Then why...?

speaker: Oscar
text: Because you are still Rolf's mother. Nothing in the world will change that. We'll leave it up to Rolf to decide.

speaker: Boyd
text: Oscar...

speaker: Oscar
text: Are you sure? Are you sure you don't want to see her?

speaker: Rolf
text: Yeah. I don't even remember her face. She's just another stranger to me.

speaker: Oscar
text: Rolf...

speaker: Rolf
text: I have my family, Oscar. You, Boyd...everyone in the Greil Mercenaries. I don't need anyone else. Why should I let her try and change that?

speaker: Rolf
text: Don't look at me like that. Why do you look so sad? I'm not sad.

speaker: Oscar
text: Then I'll ask her to go home.

speaker: Rolf
text: Tell her never to come back. She's being a nuisance.

speaker: Oscar
text: ...Fine.

speaker: Boyd
text: Rolf...

speaker: Rolf
text: I... I do love you, Boyd. We fight all the time, and we might not be related, but you're my real brother. Don't make me go away. You can't! I want to stay with you! I want to stay with my family!

speaker: Boyd
text: You little idiot. Of course you can stay! We raised you, remember? You're not some...thing, to give away to a crazy woman! You're one of us.

speaker: Rolf
text: ...Thanks.

speaker: Begnion
text: General Levail! How did it go?

speaker: Levail
text: It was no use. No one would even listen to me. It makes my heart heavy. The nobles are too busy competing with one another for rewards and status to realize the danger to their lands. Begnion: Rewards? Are they crazy? The sub-humans are at their doors, and all they care about is some reward?!

speaker: Levail
text: They only listen to each other. No one wants to listen to me.

speaker: Begnion
text: General Levail, how are we going to survive this?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike! Are you in position?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah. Ready when you are.

speaker: Ranulf
text: We'll leave the troops on the left to you beorc. Sound good?

speaker: Ike
text: Fine by me. We'll teach these nobles a thing or two.

speaker: Ike
text: All right! Move out!

speaker: Istvan
text: What luck! Enemy comes in tiny numbers. Get up, comrades! We cannot let other army take reward! Crush enemy and gain glory for Lord Seliora!

speaker: Istvan
text: I am Istvan, general of Lord Seliora's royal army! You, leader of sub-human filth! State your name!

speaker: Ike
text: I'm Ike of the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Istvan
text: Greil Mercenaries? Hm. Never heard of them! You are just small-time bandits, yes? Argh! If we had left behind dead bodies of sub-humans, our reward would have been bigger! My lord is not being pleased with heads of bandits!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, I wouldn't worry about our heads. You have no chance to win this fight. Leave while you can.

speaker: Istvan
text: W-wait...! This cannot be! Our...reward...

speaker: Ike
text: The enemy general is down! Let the fleeing soldiers go. Everyone, fall back!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey. You're done, too? That was fast.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, it was easy work. They retreated pretty quickly.

speaker: Soren
text: Their soldiers were well equipped and well trained, but their commanders were terrible.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That's lucky for us, I suppose. Things seem to be working out pretty well so far. Unless they bring in a real commander, it's only a matter of time before they wave a white flag.

speaker: Gallia
text: E-enemies to the south! It's the Central Army!

speaker: Ranulf
text: What?!

speaker: Ike
text: Tibarn failed in stalling them... Does that mean he's...dead?

speaker: Soren
text: Doubtful. I don't think there was even a battle. The Central Army has arrived too quickly.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Grrrr... We only know one thing for sure. The enemy now has the advantage.

speaker: Titania
text: There are still enemies to the north. This is quickly turning into our worst-case scenario.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir, we must retreat. We're in serious trouble here.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Show my back to beorc? Never! We will fight on like the Gallians we are!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir, listen to me! We must retreat. This is the Central Army we're talking about!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ah, finally! Finally, we get to fight the Begnion Central Army! I have been waiting for this!

speaker: Ranulf
text: I can see you won't change your mind, Skrimir. All right, if it has to come to this...

speaker: Skrimir
text: Are you joking? You can't beat me, Ranulf. You know that.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I can't let you or our men die in vain. It's my job to keep you from doing anything that stupid. If I have to knock you out to keep you out of this battle, then that's what I'll do.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Fine. Try.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Stop them!

speaker: Ike
text: No. They need to do this.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Do not worry about him. I might have broken some bones, but he will heal quickly.

speaker: Skrimir
text: My soldiers! We are leaving! Head back to base camp!

speaker: Ike
text: General Skrimir...

speaker: Skrimir
text: We will return and regroup. It pains me, but we must. Damn it, Ranulf... He...got my leg.

speaker: Ike
text: But you're still willing to carry him?

speaker: Skrimir
text: If he doesn't rest and heal, all his little chores fall on me. I can't have that.

speaker: Begnion
text: Reporting, sir! The Laguz Alliance is retreating!

speaker: Zelgius
text: So, the enemy does not persist with the situation turns against them. I'm impressed. They're flexible and adapt quickly to a changing environment.

speaker: Begnion
text: Shall we pursue them?

speaker: Zelgius
text: No, first we will join our allies to the north. I hear they've taken heavy losses.

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius. It's an honor to meet you.

speaker: Zelgius
text: General Levail of Duke Gaddos's northern force, is it? Are you in command here?

speaker: Levail
text: No, not I. Rather... The northern force lacks any order. We do not have a central commander to direct us in battle.

speaker: Zelgius
text: So, each force was fighting the enemy on its own?

speaker: Levail
text: Quite so. Taking orders from others is beneath the nobles, I suppose.

speaker: Zelgius
text: How pitiful.

speaker: Levail
text: A sad state of affairs, yes. But now that you are here, General, the situation will be rectified.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Yes, one can hope.

speaker: Levail
text: ...So, are the rumors true?

speaker: Levail
text: I've heard that power in Begnion has been split between the apostle and the senators.

speaker: Zelgius
text: True, they do not agree on how to deal with the Laguz Alliance. However...

speaker: Zelgius
text: As long as there are enemies who threaten the empire, we shall fight. That is our duty, is it not?

speaker: Levail
text: ...Indeed.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Then do not trouble your mind with politics. Let the nobles worry about their games. We should focus on this war.

speaker: Heather
text: So you’re Ilyana? That’s such a cute and delicate name! I’d never have guessed there’d be such a pretty girl around all these laguz! What a lucky day!

speaker: Ilyana
text: Sigh…

speaker: Heather
text: Is something wrong, Ilyana? Are you feeling sick? You look weak.

speaker: Ilyana
text: I’m… so hungry…

speaker: Heather
text: Oh, no! That’s no good. Hold on. I’ll bring some food for you right away.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Really? Oh, that would be wonderful…

speaker: Heather
text: Oh, look at that smile! So, what do you like?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Something delicious. I don’t particularly care what it is. I just want loads of it.

speaker: Heather
text: Um, all right. I guess that means you eat pretty much anything? I’ll go find somoe dupe who thinks I’m cute, and I’ll con him into cooking something! You stay put!

speaker: Ilyana
text: How interesting… Heather… Her name is Heather. I’ll have to remember her name. She likes to feed me.

speaker: Ike
text: You still eating everything in sight?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Ah… Hello, Ike. I haven’t seen you in a long time.

speaker: Ike
text: Glad to see you remember me.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Of course. I remember all of the mercenaries. Well, most of you, anyway. Oscar prepares such delicious meals. I remember that well enough. Oh, I can’t wait to eat his food again.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, I can see you haven’t changed a bit.

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh… It’s like a dream come true. My hero, standing right in front of me. Somebody pinch me.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, if you don’t let go of my hand, I can’t pay you for anything.

speaker: Aimee
text: No! My darling… Let us not spoil our time together with talk of money! Speak sweetly to me, handsome.

speaker: Ike
text: Listen, lady. This is a shop, and I’m a customer. What’s so sweet about that?

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, such cold words… My hero plays hard to get! You’re only making me more interested.

speaker: Ike
text: Will you let go of my hand? Please?

speaker: Aimee
text: Then tell me I’m beautiful! Tell me I’m more beautiful than any woman in this camp!

speaker: Ike
text: …And then you’ll let go of my hand?

speaker: Aimee
text: Of course. I’ll even give you everything you want for free.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh! All right, then…
No, Ike! Don’t say another word!

speaker: Aimee
text: That voice! It’s--

speaker: Ike
text: C’mon, Soren. She’s going to give us everything! For free!

speaker: Soren
text: Nothing in life is free, Ike. Suppose you said what she asked you to say, hmm? What then? You’d hear it all over the camp. In nearby villages. Eventually, the entire country would be saying it! "Ike, hero of the Mad King’s War, is in love with Aimee the shopgirl." Rumors can quickly spin out of control.

speaker: Ike
text: Come off it. You’re exaggerating.

speaker: Aimee
text: Ooh, don’t be so sure. With my network of merchants, I’ll spread the word to the four corners of Tellius! Within half a year, everyone will know! Then you will be mine forever, Ike! You’ll have no choice at all!

speaker: Ike
text: Man, you go right for the neck, don’t you? All right, Soren. She’s all yours.

speaker: Soren
text: Yes, sir. What I do now, I do for the good of the company.

speaker: Aimee
text: No, Ike! Don’t go! Don’t do this to me!

speaker: Soren
text: Well, now. Shall we get on with our business? You’re looking more beautiful than ever, Miss Aimee. A true delight for the eyes.

speaker: Aimee
text: Ooo… Now you’re talking, you little lady-killer!

speaker: Soren
text: I know you won’t discount the goods to nothing, since it’s coming from me. So… How about you cut your prices down by three-quarters?

speaker: Aimee
text: Ooh… Decisions, decisions.

speaker: Soren
text: You’re a diamond, and other beorc only glass beads, Miss Aimee. I’ll buy more than enough to justify the discount.

speaker: Aimee
text: Half price, maybe.

speaker: Soren
text: A touch less than three-quarters, then. What do you say, rose of Tellius? O goddess of desire?

speaker: Aimee
text: All right, you win! Just this time, mind you. Take this.

speaker: Soren
text: Ah, a Silver Card. I can buy everything for half price at all of the shops?

speaker: Aimee
text: That’s right. Remember what I said, though. It’s a limited-time deal. I’ll have to take it away soon. Oh, and while you own this card, you won’t be able to sell your weapons as raw material. Got that?

speaker: Soren
text: Understood, Miss Aimee. Stay beautiful.

speaker: Janaff
text: As far as I can see and Ulki can hear, it seems we're the only ones left.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Strange. I guess only the strongest of us didn't wind up as statues.

speaker: Ike
text: Anyone who was in the building with us was safe, too. But everyone else was petrified...
Wow! There are quite a few more of you flesh creatures left than I imagined.
That's good. Maybe that means we'll stand a chance against her.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah? Are you feeling all right?
I'm not Micaiah! How many times do I have to tell you that?!

speaker: Ike
text: If you're not Micaiah, then who are you?

speaker: Yune
text: I'm Yune. Pleased to meet you!

speaker: Sothe
text: Yune?! What did you do to Micaiah?!

speaker: Yune
text: Micaiah is here with me now. She knows that you'll never save the petrified ones without me. So, she let me use her body to talk to you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right. Let me ask you this, Yune. If you don't have a body of your own, what the heck are you?

speaker: Yune
text: I've been asleep inside the medallion for a long, long time. Longer than any of you can imagine. But the galdr woke me up.

speaker: Ike
text: Lehran's Medallion? Are you the dark god who was sealed inside it?

speaker: Yune
text: Hmmm..."dark god." "Dark god"... No, I'm pretty sure I'm not one of those. I am neither holy nor base, neither angel nor devil. I am...freedom. Chaos. Transformation. Future. Mystery. I am Yune.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't care what you're called. Was it you who turned everyone into stone?

speaker: Yune
text: No, that wasn't me. I haven't done much of anything. I just woke up, so I don't have that kind of power just yet. That was Ashera's doing. It was her judgment upon this world.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Nonsense! Holy Ashera would never harm us! She protects us at all times and guides us toward the right path.

speaker: Yune
text: You've got it all wrong, little meatling. Ashera is neither kind nor loving to the beings of this world. Neither is she holy nor base, angel nor devil. She is...restriction. Order. Stability. Past. Certainty. Restraint. She is Ashera.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't understand... Why would the goddess Ashera try to destroy us? If anyone's going to kill us all, shouldn't it be you, the dark god who was sealed inside the medallion?

speaker: Yune
text: You called me a dark god again! How would you like it if I called you a dark bag of organs? I don't want to talk to you anymore!

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Yune
text: Instead...I'll talk to...you. Yes! You're the one I'll talk to!

speaker: Mist
text: Me?

speaker: Yune
text: Ashera has always hated me, but I like her. You've got some of her in you. So, I'll talk to you.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, OK... So... You're Yune?

speaker: Yune
text: That's right. I'm Yune. Ashera is order. I am chaos. We are sisters, but opposite in all things. We're linked to one another, though. When I sleep, Ashera sleeps. When I wake, Ashera wakes.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, then you're...a...a goddess? I-I'm so sorry! Please forgive my insolence! I've been talking down to you like you're a little kid!

speaker: Yune
text: No, no, it's fine. Talk to me however you like. You don't have to stand on ceremony with me.

speaker: Mist
text: Well... All right. If you insist... So, you were sealed inside the medallion, but now you're inside Micaiah?

speaker: Yune
text: That's right.

speaker: Mist
text: ...And the goddess Ashera was the one who turned all the beorc and laguz into stone. Oh! Are you here to tell us how to save them? Wait, I get it! You were the one who spoke to me! You said, "Wake me with the galdr of release, not with the spirit of war."

speaker: Yune
text: Yes, I did! I'm so glad you understood! You're so very clever! Of course, I was hoping, by sending you that message, I would stop all of this from happening.

speaker: Mist
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Yune
text: We're running out of time, so I'll explain quickly. Long, long ago, your ancestors made a promise to Ashera. They promised they would start no wars among all the nations for at least one thousand years. If this promise was broken, then Ashera would destroy the world and try again with a new one. Despite this promise, you bone-cages kept fighting each other. Eventually, war and conflict spread throughout the world. When Ashera woke up, she cast down her judgment upon those who failed to keep her promise.

speaker: Ike
text: I still don't understand. Why would it make a difference whether you were woken up by the galdr or by the spirit of chaos? How were you planning to stop Ashera from passing down her judgment?

speaker: Yune
text: I'm not talking to you!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, by all that's-- Would you stop acting like a child?

speaker: Mist
text: Please forgive my brother, Yune. We want to save the people who were turned to stone. We need you to tell us how. It did matter that we woke you with the galdr of release, right?

speaker: Yune
text: First of all, you should understand that, because of our link, waking me is the same as waking Ashera. Now, if Ashera had been awakened by the spirit of chaos, none of us would be standing here right now. By the terms of the promise, she was just supposed to destroy the world. No hesitation, no discussion. But if she was awakened by the galdr of release, she was supposed to consult with me first. She wasn't supposed to pass down her judgment until she heard from me. Ashera went ahead and turned everyone into stone without asking me. That's so unfair! I'll show her, though. I'll turn them all back somehow! The problem is that I can't do this by myself. I need your help. Will you help me?

speaker: Mist
text: Of course we'll help! It's strange, but I trust you, Yune. And we all want to save the people who got turned to stone!

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. We'll do whatever it takes.

speaker: Skrimir
text: That's right! We will allow nothing to stand in our way! We will fight!

speaker: Elincia
text: It's all so confusing... But we must do everything in our power to save the people.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...To be honest, I've spent my life teaching that the goddess Ashera watches over and protects us. This is all a little hard to accept.

speaker: Yune
text: You don't have to believe me. You could just let her destroy the world...

speaker: Sanaki
text: No, I will do whatever it takes to save the people who were turned to stone. I will join the others in helping you.

speaker: Sothe
text: So what you're saying is that we all have to play nice and work together? Just forget about all that's happened?

speaker: Ike
text: Sothe, open your eyes and look around. There aren't that many people left to fix this mess. If you don't help, we can't do it. Besides, I would think saving the world is something we could all agree on.

speaker: Sothe
text: You're right, Commander. All of this is the result of our war. I guess there's not much reason for flag-waving on either side. First thing we have to do is...unpetrify everyone. And, well... I, uh... I'm actually kind of relived. At least I don't have to worry about fighting you anymore.

speaker: Ike
text: I wasn't looking forward to that matchup, either.

speaker: Yune
text: It's settled, then! How should we begin? I know! Let's divide the army into three teams. I'm pretty sure that Ashera is going to notice what we're up to...

speaker: Ike
text: Dividing us up is smart. It reduces the risk of everyone getting killed at once.

speaker: Yune
text: We have to hurry. I can feel Ashera's power building.

speaker: Ike
text: It's all over if we get turned to stone, too. All right, everyone, it's up to us!

speaker: Yune
text: What's your name?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm Ike.

speaker: Yune
text: All right, Ike. You won't call me a dark god ever again, will you?

speaker: Ike
text: Not if you don't like it. Can I call you Yune?

speaker: Yune
text: I would like that. I guess I forgive you, then. Oh, I know! As a sign of my forgiveness, I'll make sure that you can get to your destination safely. I can't do it for everyone because it's a bit exhausting for me, but... Hold still and close your eyes.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm ready.

speaker: Yune
text: How do you feel?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Strong. Like I can take on anyone.

speaker: Yune
text: Wow, you're very confident for a being that can die! Let's see... You go with this team.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm going with you. I'm not leaving your--Micaiah's--side.

speaker: Yune
text: ...Fine. Micaiah says that's what she wants, too.

speaker: Sothe
text: Let me talk to her!

speaker: Yune
text: Not right now. You'll have plenty of time to talk on the road, all right?  Hey, you're with this team over here.

speaker: Sothe
text: ...Damn it.

speaker: Yune
text: Each team will take a different route, but your destination is the same. It's the Tower of Guidance that stands in the middle of the land you named Begnion. Go there at once. ...I hope to see you all there. I'll be waiting.

speaker: Ike
text: Waiting? Aren't you coming with us?

speaker: Yune
text: I'll see you at the tower.

speaker: Ike
text: A bird?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yune! Then she must be--

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Oh. Hello, Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: You're back! I was so worried.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, if that bird was Yune...where did she go?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't know where, exactly, but she said she must go look for...something.

speaker: Ike
text: Leaving us by ourselves? What's she thinking?

speaker: Tibarn
text: At least we know what we have to do. Let's move out for the tower.

speaker: Ena
text: May I have a moment before we leave? Prince Kurth has requested that I pass these out to the herons.

speaker: Ike
text: Those are sending stones, right?

speaker: Ena
text: Correct. Fortunately for us, each heron has been assigned to a different team.

speaker: Ena
text: King Tibarn, would you give this one to Prince Reyson?

speaker: Tibarn
text: That's ideal. We can each communicate with the other teams using the stones. Good idea.

speaker: Ena
text: Queen Nailah, please give this one to Prince Rafiel.

speaker: Nailah
text: I will.

speaker: Ena
text: And the last one is for Princess Leanne.

speaker: Sothe
text: She's on my team. I'll give it to her.

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right, we're ready to go. See you at the tower!

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, see you at the tower... Hopefully.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Since we're on different teams, I need to tell you something before we go. Something important. It's General Zelgius. Next time you see him, Ike, use caution. He's your enemy.

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ranulf
text: He's the one. He's the Black Knight.

speaker: Ike
text: What?!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Zelgius is the Black Knight. I became certain of it when we crossed the river.

speaker: Ike
text: It can't be...

speaker: Ranulf
text: I wasn't going to tell you until I had hard proof, but it looks like we're out of time. Sorry I didn't tell you before.

speaker: Ike
text: General Zelgius is the one who killed my father?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I doubt that Zelgius has been turned to stone. Be careful, Ike. You might run into him. ...Good luck to you.

speaker: Ike
text: Zelgius... The Black Knight...

speaker: Lekain
text: Blessed servants of the goddess! I bring dire news. The dark god has awakened and made its wrath manifest in stone. All of us were turned to hard rock by its evil power, yet we stand here today, made flesh again by the power of the goddess! Why is that? It is because ware the chosen ones! Go forth, Disciples of Order! Deliver her divine judgment upon the dark god and those who worship it!

speaker: Sigrun
text: All right, everyone. Let's spend the night in this town. Please be sure to get some rest and prepare for tomorrow.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh, it's you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I saw you having an argument with General Skrimir.

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh, that? Yeah. That happens sometimes.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I know you had no choice but to betray the Laguz Alliance. If you wish, I can speak to him about it.

speaker: Naesala
text: No. Stay out of it. Whatever the circumstances, what I did was unacceptable. The pieces can fall where they may.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You'd carry the burden of your crime alone to protect your people? That's very selfless of you.

speaker: Naesala
text: Of course I'd take the blame! My first priority is my people. As long as they're safe, it doesn't matter one whit what the rest of the world thinks of me.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You indeed are a good king to your people. I have no doubts of that. I wonder, will the history say I was a good empress for Begnion?

speaker: Naesala
text: The people of Begnion rose up and overthrew the senate for you. Isn't that proof enough that you're a good empress?

speaker: Sanaki
text: That's only because they thought that I was the apostle. But now...

speaker: Naesala
text: You're worried over the galdr of release?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes. That song... It can only be sung by the direct descendents of Altina--the first settlers of Begnion. Why was that girl able to sing it? Moreover, why couldn't I?

speaker: Naesala
text: You know, you could just ask her directly.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I can't work up the courage. It doesn't matter who she is. All I know is that she possesses all the powers which I lack. I'm... I'm frightened of the truth.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe! Wake everyone and have them gather at the square! Enemies are on the way!

speaker: Sothe
text: Wha--huh? All right, I'm on it.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Lady Micaiah! Has the enemy arrived already?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Not yet. But they're coming. I'm sure of it.

speaker: Skrimir
text: I can't smell troops or weapons. How can you be certain?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't know who they are or their exact numbers, but the enemy army is massive!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hmm...

speaker: Micaiah
text: l know it sounds strange, but I swear it's true! You must believe me!

speaker: Skrimir
text: No one doubts your gift, Micaiah. I will not ignore the words of one who has spoken with the voice of a goddess.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh...

speaker: Naesala
text: Micaiah, it looks like you were right. We have guests.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Leave them to me! The weak among you should hide, for the battle will be fierce!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress Sanaki. We should leave the fighting to General Skrimir. I will take you someplace safe.

speaker: Sanaki
text: No. I will stay and fight with the others.

speaker: Sigrun
text: With all due respect, Empress, I cannot allow it! What if you are injured?!

speaker: Sanaki
text: If Micaiah, an untrained girl from the streets of Daein, is fighting, then I shall stand my ground as well.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress...

speaker: Naesala
text: You can't win an argument with royalty. But don't worry about her. I'll look after the apostle.

speaker: Sigrun
text: That is a kind offer, but I must decline. It is the first and most sacred duty of the Holy Knights to protect the apostle.

speaker: Sanaki
text: It looks like the enemy is about to take this argument out of our hands. They're here.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Do you beorc ever stop talking? Take your positions! Now!

speaker: Yuma
text: Here are the minions of the dark god! Go forth, Disciples, and deliver the holy judgment of the goddess! Destroy them!

speaker: Sanaki
text: You! All of you. You are all Begnion citizens! I'm so relieved you are all safe.

speaker: Naesala
text: Sanaki, be careful! I don't know that they're going to be pleased to see you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: What do you--

speaker: Order
text: Minions of the dark god! We are the Disciples of Order, led by blessed Lord Lekain. We have been charged by the goddess Ashera to cleanse your taint from the world!

speaker: Order
text: Death to the tainted souls! Let none escape!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress Sanaki, please stay back. These traitors must have sided with the senate during the coup.

speaker: Order
text: Apostle Sanaki is a fraud! Any apostle who defies the edicts of the goddess is an enemy to the people!

speaker: Sanaki
text: What?! No, I--

speaker: Sigrun
text: Silence, betrayers of the empire! How dare you accuse the empress! Treason can only be punished by death!

speaker: Yuma
text: Die! Die!

speaker: Yuma
text: How...could this have happened? How could betrayers of the goddess's word defeat her appointed champions?

speaker: Yuma
text: Death to the false apostle! Show her the punishment for her wicked, deceitful acts!

speaker: Sanaki
text: I...I have not deceived you! I am the true... I am the true apostle...

speaker: Yuma
text: You are the dark god made flesh! The source of all evil!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Don't speak that way about Yune! She is not a dark god!

speaker: Yuma
text: Death to the filthy sub-humans! Despicable, rabid beasts!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes! Feed my rage! Make me hate you. Give me reason to crush your bones in my jaws...

speaker: Yuma
text: Black-winged demon, eater of carrion! Prepare to receive the goddess’s judgment!

speaker: Naesala
text: Hmm...how colorful.

speaker: Yuma
text: The dark god breeds foul corruption through the words of its false apostle! Her soul is a blackened, withered husk, and we shall banish it from this world!

speaker: Sigrun
text: As long as I draw breath, you will not lay hands on Apostle Sanaki.

speaker: Yuma
text: Traitorous knight of the false apostle! Prepare to be cleansed!

speaker: Tanith
text: Oathbreakers! You are servants of the empire and the apostle! The Holy Knights will teach you the meaning of loyalty.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hmph. They were strong...for beorc. Has the senate held back its elite forces?

speaker: Sigrun
text: No, I knew a few of them by face. Some of these soldiers were new recruits. I can't imagine how they could have fought against us so fiercely.
Simple. They were protected by Ashera.

speaker: Yune
text: I sent a message to Micaiah about the impending attack, then returned here as fast as I could. Ashera freed the petrified soldiers who would pledge loyalty to her. By themselves, they weren't a threat to skin puppets as strong as you, so she blessed their armor and weapons. Now they are worthy to be her true disciples, and their power will be stronger as we get closer to her. The battle will only get more difficult from here.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Their weapons and armor are blessed by the goddess herself?

speaker: Naesala
text: Is that similar to the Black Knight's armor, or Ike's sword Ragnell?

speaker: Yune
text: It's the same idea, yes. The Disciples' blessings were much weaker, because there were a lot of them. Still, it makes them a lot more powerful than they originally were. I'd like to bless you all with protection, too, but I haven't been awake long enough to wield that kind of power. Sorry about that.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ahhh...that was how they were able to stand against us.

speaker: Yune
text: Poor souls... When they were turned back from stone, they probably thought they were the chosen ones or something. No one is good enough for her, though. When she's done using them against us, they'll all be stone creatures again.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah! There you are!

speaker: Yune
text: Oh, it's her shadow again! I should go. All right, everyone. I'll see you later. Good luck!

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Unh...! What?

speaker: Naesala
text: Hey, glad to have you back. We should tell the other teams what happened here.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hm?

speaker: Skrimir
text: I am going back to sleep. I dislike being awakened so early in the morning. Even if it is for battle.

speaker: Sothe
text: Yune was here again? I don't like that she keeps taking over your body. She should stick to being that stupid bird.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Please don't say mean things about her. She's like an older sister to me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Your older sister is a dark god?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I finally understand now. Remember the voice that used to warn me about impending danger? That was Yune's voice. I finally realized it this morning. Even as she slept, she watched over us. Yune loves beorc and laguz with all her heart. I can feel it when she speaks through me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Then why do people call her the dark god?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't know... But she doesn't like that name. It hurts her when you call her that.

speaker: Sothe
text: Sorry... I won't call her that again.

speaker: Yune
text: You mean it? Then I forgive you!

speaker: Sothe
text: ...Hey! Is that you, Yune?

speaker: Yune
text: Sorry... I won't call her that again. Why can't you be that nice with me? To be honest, it makes me a little jealous. But that's all right, I guess. I know that Micaiah needs you. That's why I can't let you die. Here, come closer to me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey, what are you doing?

speaker: Yune
text: Don't be so jumpy. I'm giving you the power to protect Micaiah.

speaker: Sothe
text: Wow. Amazing... I feel incredible, like I could arm wrestle Skrimir.

speaker: Yune
text: Good... Always stay by Micaiah's side.

speaker: Sothe
text: Yune?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, it's me again. Disappointed?

speaker: Sothe
text: Never. But I do wish she had at least let me thank her.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It just would have embarrassed her. You know, you two are very much alike. You're both very stubborn.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm just teasing you, Sothe. Anyway, did you hear what the enemy said before the battle?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yeah... They called out Lekain by name. No mistake about it. That means he's still alive, and probably not petrified, since they said he was their leader. I suppose we'll run across him once we get closer to the tower. That'll be our big chance.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Right. We must break the blood pact. No matter what it takes. Of course, our first goal is to save everyone from the goddess's judgment. But we have to break the pact while they're all stone. If we don't, we may save the world, but still lose Daein.

speaker: Sigrun
text: ...We seem to have missed our chance to speak with her. What a remarkable girl. Lady Micaiah can hear the voice of the goddess Yune and learn of impending danger. She is much like you, Empress Sanaki.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...Let us head back.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Are you sure? You said before that it was imperative you speak with Lady Micaiah...

speaker: Sanaki
text: It's not important. Forget it.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ahh...

speaker: Sothe
text: What’s wrong, Micaiah? Are you still tired?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, I’m fine. The air is nice out here. It’s calm, quiet even. I don’t remember the last time it was this quiet. It’s almost relaxing, isn’t it? I hate to say it, but I feel like the world is back to the way it ought to be, finally. I know that sounds horrible. But that’s how I honestly feel. Like all debts have been settled, and everything is properly arranged.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hmm. I think I understand what you’re trying to say.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe... I’m scared. I don’t want to get used to this. It’s too comfortable. Like our mother’s come home.

speaker: Sothe
text: A mother who’d smother her children in order to protect them.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Hello, Muston. I would like to purchase some weapons.

speaker: Muston
text: Ah, Micaiah! Good timing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You have something for me, then?

speaker: Muston
text: Indeed I do, missy. Look at this!

speaker: Micaiah
text: That’s a thunder tome. The most powerful of its kind, too! How did you get it?

speaker: Muston
text: That’s a trade secret! But it’s the best thing I ever acquired for sale, and that’s a fact.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How much are you asking for it?

speaker: Muston
text: You want it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. Yune told me that the goddess Ashera would do everything in her power to stop us. I have no idea what to expect, but I’m certain the battle ahead won’t be easy. We have to be prepared. For anything.

speaker: Muston
text: I know. You can have it for free.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? But why?

speaker: Muston
text: It’s not like we have any other customers. Everyone else has been turned to stone. Listen, Micaiah. I still have hope. We have your goddess and an army of heroes on our side. I believe in you--all of you. You’ll put the world right again, I’m sure of it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I believe that, too. Thank you, Muston. With your tome in my hand and your hope in my heart, I’m sure we’ll succeed.

speaker: Muston
text: Good luck, Maiden of Dawn.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Hmmm... I’m confused.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Is something wrong, General Skrimir?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Here, look at this!

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s a satori sign. What about it?

speaker: Skrimir
text: I found a patch of ground that was emitting light, so I started digging. This was what I found.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, so that’s it...

speaker: Skrimir
text: You buried it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, but I saw a vision in a dream. Rays of light fell from the sky, wriggling into the ground and burying themselves.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ah. So maybe there are more?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes... I think so. Somewhere...

speaker: Micaiah
text: We have to go back to the desert. We still have something we need to do.

speaker: Sothe
text: It'd be great if it were to find Ashnard's son. I'm burning up out here.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm not sure what it is. I see a lot of images, stacked on top of each other. It's hard to see what they all are. There's danger, battles, and terrible sadness, but also...hope. Whatever our destiny is, I know we'll find it in the desert. Let's go.

speaker: Sothe
text: I understand, Micaiah. I'll tell everyone to make ready.

speaker: Sothe
text: We've already been north, where we met Prince Rafiel and his party. That leaves east or south... Which way?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is it, Volug? Is something wrong? Volug says he senses beorc to the south. A lot of beorc.

speaker: Sothe
text: That settles it then. We'll head south.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Hmph!

speaker: Zihark
text: Impressive as ever, General Tauroneo. However, we can't hold out forever. We are seriously outnumbered. It's time we put these vermin in their place. Are you ready, Jill?

speaker: Jill
text: Just give the word!

speaker: Zihark
text: All right then, let's get 'em!

speaker: Sothe
text: Who could the Begnion soldiers be attacking out here in the middle of nowhere?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Whoever it is, we have to help them!

speaker: Sothe
text: wait a moment. Those people fighting the Begnion soldiers... It couldn't be... That white armor... Only certain generals were allowed to wear it. I may very well know that soldier. Micaiah: Really? Well then, all the more reason to help them. Let's hurry!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Really? Well then, all the more reason to help them. Let’s hurry!

speaker: Ilyana
text: Ah…

speaker: Zihark
text: Ilyana! It’s been a while.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Too long, Zihark…

speaker: Zihark
text: So you remember my name!

speaker: Ilyana
text: How could I forget you, Zihark? Why, I think of you often! You treated me to food…glorious food… On 23 separate occasions! But who’s counting?

speaker: Zihark
text: Apparently, you are. And now, might I request something in return?

speaker: Ilyana
text: Well, um, yes. What exactly did you have in mind?

speaker: Zihark
text: For you, something sweet! You join our merry band, and together, we fight for Daein’s freedom. I’m counting on you, my dear. You wouldn’t want to disappoint me, would you?

speaker: Ilyana
text: …Ah…er… What?

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey, Jill? Jill Fizzart? It is you, isn’t it?

speaker: Jill
text: Sothe?!

speaker: Sothe
text: Haven’t seen you since the war ended.

speaker: Jill
text: That does bring back memories… What are you doing out here in the middle of nowhere?

speaker: Sothe
text: We heard that King Ashnard’s orphan was in need of soldiers. We came to find out if it’s true.

speaker: Jill
text: The prince? He’s just inside the fort.

speaker: Sothe
text: Then it’s true?

speaker: Jill
text: It is. Will you help us protect him?

speaker: Sothe
text: Of course.

speaker: Sothe
text: General Tauroneo!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Well, if it isn't our little Sothe! I'd never have thought to see you here!

speaker: Sothe
text: General, these ruins you're defending... Do they hold hope for Daein?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: They do. In fact, these walls hold what may well be Daein's only hope.

speaker: Sothe
text: I see. Then we must protect this place at all costs.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Indeed.

speaker: Sothe
text: Need a hand?

speaker: Zihark
text: Sothe? Where did you come from? What are you doing here?

speaker: Sothe
text: Hello, Zihark. I see you’re fighting Begnion soldiers. I assume you’re siding with Daein here?

speaker: Zihark
text: That’s right. This is my homeland. These are my people.

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, really? I didn’t know you were from Daein.

speaker: Zihark
text: Yep, I’m a Daein, through and through.

speaker: Sothe
text: All that time we fought together, and I never knew.

speaker: Zihark
text: That’s because I never told you. At any rate, let’s rejoin the fight. We can talk later.

speaker: Sothe
text: Ah, yes…

speaker: Wystan
text: You're a tenacious bunch, I'll grant you. Daein isn't known for winning its wars... So why do you keep trying?

speaker: Wystan
text: Absurd... One must not...meet failure...against the tattered remnants...of a conquered...coun...try...

speaker: Wystan
text: Come to help the helpless? A dainty little flower like you is hardly worth the effort! Well, do your worst.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is Begnion doing out here in the desert? Is there something or someone in these ruins that you're interested in?

speaker: Wystan
text: That's none of your business, little girl. We'll slash our way in no matter what anybody else wants!

speaker: Sothe
text: General Tauroneo! Zihark and Jill, too. I haven't seen you since the war ended three years ago. Who would've thought we'd meet again in such a desolate place?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Sothe, you've grown. I hardly recognized you.

speaker: Sothe
text: We have a lot of catching up to do, but for now, I'll just make introductions. This is Micaiah...

speaker: Izuka
text: And who have we here? Hmmm?

speaker: Sothe
text: Step back. Who are you?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Lord Izuka, there's no need for concern. This young man is Sothe. We know him well. Sothe, may I introduce Lord Izuka. He is advisor and close confidant to Prince Pelleas, Ashnard's son.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah! Did you hear that? The prince IS here. Still, I can't believe we ran into you three--of all people--guarding the prince. What a lucky coincidence. General Tauroneo, we came here because we heard the prince was gathering forces in the desert. We want to help you in your efforts. Will you let us join you?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Certainly. Daein needs all the courage we can muster. Let us join forces.

speaker: Izuka
text: See here! What do you think you're doing?! You can't just ignore me and start making decisions! These people are suspicious, verrry suspicious. You're all Begnion spies, aren't you? Come now, tell the truth!

speaker: Sothe
text: We're the Dawn Brigade. We'd never work for those filthy curs!

speaker: Izuka
text: The Dawn Brigade! But how? Then, perhaps the girl... No! Could it be? Are you the Silver-Haired Maiden? Do you have the healing touch of Sacrifice?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Excuse me!

speaker: Sothe
text: Take your hands off her!

speaker: Izuka
text: What a coincidence! Or is it fate? Or maybe it's my unrivaled skill as a revolutionary organizer? With the Silver-Haired Maiden at our side, we'll surely win over the people of Daein! And then...yes! Incite scattered rebel movements, mm-hm, and then, further...the future of...change...

speaker: Sothe
text: Is he...touched in the head?

speaker: Izuka
text: Oh, my, but yes. I'll beckon to...no, demand that the vicious scalawags...surrender! Perfect! I am a genius! Come, come, my dear maiden! You must meet the prince!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Goddess help me, that man could try the patience of a stone.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Izuka
text: Look here! Before you stands the one and only, the grand Prince Pelleas, true-blooded son of the king of Daein. And here we have the consort and queen of our late King Ashnard, Lady Almedha. And look at you! You're standing? Did the desert dry out your brains? Kneel ye before these royal personages!

speaker: Pelleas
text: It's all right, Izuka. Please, don't stand on ceremony. I didn't know I was a prince until very recently. So, really, I'm not used to any of this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Until a half year ago--that is, until Izuka found me--I was raised as a normal commoner. To be frank, it still doesn't feel real to me. That I...I myself could be the son of King Ashnard. It's a little overwhelming.

speaker: Almedha
text: Don't talk nonsense, darling. You are my own sweet, sweet son, Prince Pelleas, yes... I'll never let you be parted from me, no, never ever again...

speaker: Izuka
text: Ahem! Enough of the pleasantries, then. Shall we get down to business? Well then, Micaiah of the Dawn Brigade. I henceforth appoint thee to the post of Vice-General of the Daein Liberation Army!

speaker: Sothe
text: Excuse me?! What do you mean by that?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait a moment! I appreciate the offer, Izuka, but I'm afraid I cannot accept. I have no war experience and no knowledge of battle tactics. Daein needs a general with both.

speaker: Izuka
text: Are you not a member of the heroic Dawn Brigade, whose conquests precede them?! Do you not want to save the people of Daein?! Serve the prince, and you can step out of the shadows and face the empire boldly, without shame! Why hesitate?

speaker: Sothe
text: This is a thinly veiled scheme...and I see right through it. You just want Micaiah to serve as a figurehead for your revolution.

speaker: Izuka
text: Is that a problem?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yes, that's a problem! She's not some fancy stoneware for you to set on display. If you're going to do this...then I cannot sign on.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Exactly.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, please, wait! That isn't what we meant. You're not the only one who knows nothing about battle. I don't either. But if I don't act, the devastation of Daein will grow ever worse. So, I have to be brave. Please, I'm asking you to do the same, Micaiah... For the sake of the future of Daein, will you join our cause?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Prince Pelleas...I will.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Thank you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: And in return, will you ensure, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that Daein will be freed from the rule of the Begnion Empire?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I promise.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I trust in your word.

speaker: Sothe
text: I can't believe you!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, why are you so angry about this?

speaker: Sothe
text: You have to ask? You know we can't live in the public eye. Doing something that will deliberately make you stand out... I'm just saying, it isn't like you, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: When we were separated during the war, you changed, Sothe. And I changed too. I want to protect Daein more than anything. Our people must be saved, and if I can help in that effort, I will.

speaker: Sothe
text: So much so that you'll risk your life and sacrifice who you are?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. But that isn't all. Prince Pelleas cherishes the same wish that I do. I can feel it. Deep in his heart, he wants to save Daein. If we work together, I know that we can do it.

speaker: Sothe
text: And you don't hear that voice we spoke of? The voice that warns you of impending danger?

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's all right, Sothe. The visions I see spreading out before us... most of them shine with hope.

speaker: Sothe
text: All right. I trust you. More importantly, I believe in you. I won't resist anymore. But let me just say one thing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Sothe
text: I will protect you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know that! Why do you think you need to say it?

speaker: Sothe
text: I just wanted to make sure you knew.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Thank you, Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey, Micaiah. I sold the treasures we took from the ruins. We have traveling cash now.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How did we do?

speaker: Sothe
text: We have 10,000 in gold.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Great! That’ll help a lot.

speaker: Sothe
text: Maybe. We could use more.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, 10,000 is plenty. We just need enough money to live on. More than that, and the soul becomes impoverished.

speaker: Sothe
text: I know, I know. We should be rich of heart and poor of pocket… Me, I just follow your orders.

speaker: Nailah
text: So, you’re returning to the desert?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, we must go back.

speaker: Rafiel
text: My dear…

speaker: Nailah
text: Yes, Rafiel, I know. Micaiah, I have a question. How can we help you in this fight?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? But…

speaker: Nailah
text: I know you probably don’t want to be seen with laguz. But we cannot just sit on our paws, so to speak, while our allies are in danger.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I appreciate that, but…

speaker: Nailah
text: No? Fine. Sorry to bother you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, no. It’s not what you think. Please don’t apologize. It’s just that…

speaker: Nailah
text: What is it, Volug?

speaker: Nailah
text: I see. That is a good idea.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Oh, yes. I agree. That’s a wonderful idea.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes? Volug? What’s going on?

speaker: Nailah
text: Micaiah, it will not seem so strange if you travel into the desert with this dog at your side, will it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?!

speaker: Nailah
text: As you know, we laguz fight only in our shifted forms. However, we can’t remain in that state for very long. It is too exhausting. Volug, however, has halfshifted. When he does this, he can remain in beast form all day long.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Queen Nailah, I appreciate you help–

speaker: Nailah
text: He is not as strong in this transitional form. Even so, he is still more than a match for any beorc.

speaker: Micaiah
text: How could you call Volug a dog?!

speaker: Nailah
text: I know. He’s not as friendly as a dog. And I don’t know if he’s housebroken. But he can fight!

speaker: Micaiah
text: That is not what I meant.

speaker: Nailah
text: Micaiah. We wish you good luck. Volug, guard her well.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Do be careful.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I will. Thank you. Volug, is she always so…blunt?

speaker: Micaiah
text: So, you are an old friend of Laura’s?

speaker: Aran
text: Yes. I’m afraid I must apologize for my poor choice in employers.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Please don’t worry about it. After all, you saved us.

speaker: Aran
text: When I saw Laura, I simply couldn’t stand by any longer.

speaker: Laura
text: Thank you, Aran.

speaker: Aran
text: I’ve been meaning to ask you, Laura. What’s become of your church? I’d heard that, since the occupation, most of Daein’s clergy have been excommunicated and sent to prisons. I know that the empire sent its own replacements. Was your church affected?

speaker: Laura
text: No, thankfully. Our congregation would always say… "The clergy of the empire wouldn’t even consider coming to a dingy church in a backwater village like this! You’re been spared, Minister!" Ha ha ha… We extended our prayer time to thank the goddess for saving our church.

speaker: Aran
text: Ah… I see.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, Aran. I meant to tell you, now that you’re one of us, you’ll have to become a bandit.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Aran
text: I’m sorry…a bandit?

speaker: Laura
text: There’s really no need to worry. The Dawn Brigade bandits have virtuous people like Micaiah in their ranks.

speaker: Aran
text: Er… Okaaaay…

speaker: Micaiah
text: No, we’re not ban--

speaker: Laura
text: But always remember, Aran. We must strive above all else to be honorable bandits. For the future of Daein.

speaker: Aran
text: Uh… All right…

speaker: Micaiah
text: …Bandits?

speaker: Edward
text: Oh, man… Where is this prince, anyway? I wanna go home to Nevassa.

speaker: Leonardo
text: A long-lost prince of Daein? Who even knows if he really exists…

speaker: Edward
text: Of course he does!

speaker: Leonardo
text: How do you know? Do you have any proof?

speaker: Edward
text: Simple. Micaiah told us we should look for the prince. So, it’s gotta be true!

speaker: Leonardo
text: Yeah, you’re right. Her farsight is always spot on.

speaker: Edward
text: Even if we don’t find him, there’s no need to worry… ’cause I’m here!

speaker: Leonardo
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Edward
text: Since we left Nevassa, my swordsmanship has pretty much improved tenfold! By the time we get back home, I’ll be invincible! I’ll kick those tyrants out of Daein with my own two hands and one sharp blade!

speaker: Leonardo
text: It’s great to have a dream, Edward…but you should wake up now!

speaker: Edward
text: Are you saying I’m not good enough?!

speaker: Leonardo
text: No. I’m saying there’s a limit to how much one person can achieve. I’m going to do the best I can, but… It doesn’t matter how strong the two of us become. We can’t change what’s going on in Daein. Not by ourselves.

speaker: Edward
text: Well, duh! I’m just saying it’s a goal! You know? Just something to work toward.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Sure. But you shouldn’t say such things lightly. It might be just a joke to you. It’s not to me.

speaker: Edward
text: Wow. Sorry.

speaker: Leonardo
text: Ya, well. So am I. I didn’t mean to get so serious. All the fighting…it just gets to me sometimes.

speaker: Nolan
text: Hey, boys. What is this, a funeral? What’s with all the doom and gloom?

speaker: Edward
text: Nolan.

speaker: Nolan
text: I couldn’t help but overhear, and I have a little to say on the subject. You’re right, each of us can only achieve so much on our own. But you boys are still young. Don’t let go of your hopes and dreams. Not yet, anyway.

speaker: Leonardo
text: But…

speaker: Nolan
text: Listen, there’s no way we can free Daein by ourselves. But we CAN find King Ashnard’s lost son and fight against the empire under Daein’s banner. If we gather our strength, we stand a better chance of freeing our motherland. Now then, how’s that for a little motivation to get your sorry backsides into training harder?

speaker: Edward
text: That’s great! Thanks, Nolan. You’re pretty smart for an old man!

speaker: Nolan
text: Hey, now… None of that, or I’ll show you what an old man can do! Leonardo, are you feeling better?

speaker: Leonardo
text: Yes, sir. Thank you, Nolan. I guess age does make you wiser.

speaker: Nolan
text: How old do you think I am, anyway? Now I’m getting depressed…

speaker: Daein
text: Begnion is attacking Nevassa!

speaker: Daein
text: No! My parents live there! They're far too old and frail to defend themselves!

speaker: Daein
text: My wife and kids are there, too! It's that heartless murderer, Jarod... He just wants us to suffer to the bitter end.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Prince Pelleas! We have to do something. We must liberate Nevassa and save the people form this brutal attack!

speaker: Izuka
text: Is there no end to your lunacy?! The apostle's envoy is nearly here! Why be rash when victory is so close!

speaker: Sothe
text: People are dying, and Nevassa has already suffered more than enough. Do you really expect us not to lift a finger to help?

speaker: Micaiah
text: If you will not help, we will go by ourselves. Again.

speaker: Izuka
text: Wait! Where are you going?! You can't take the laguz and rush off on some harebrained mission again!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Can't I?

speaker: Izuka
text: Of course not, you idiot girl. You've already been far too impulsive, acting without the prince's consent. And do you think I do not see what has happened? Your name has been raised to lavish heights among the Daein people--your name, and yours alone! Why, even our own soldiers heap their praise on you like sugar on berries, sparing not a thought for their prince!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh...

speaker: Jarod
text: Hah! The prince! He's a sham, a travesty, a clod of mud no amount of polishing could shine. The real jewel--whose radiance attracts the people like moths to flame--is you, Priestess. And so I shall steal you and extinguish Daein's light of hope!!

speaker: Izuka
text: And then, even once their rightful king is crowned, the people will still await the approval of their precious Priestess of Dawn. Why, if we are not careful, some calculating wretches might decide they would rather see a priestess on the throne instead of a king! And once again, this country will be torn apart, all because of your glory-hounding disregard for our prince's command!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Please, Izuka...

speaker: Izuka
text: Come to think of it...perhaps our "Priestess" here has been planning this all along! Pretending to help the prince...when in truth she seeks to wear the crown herself!

speaker: Sothe
text: Stop your tongue, worm, or my knife will stop it for you. The only one who seems too hungry for power here is you--
That's enough!!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Izuka, Micaiah does not deserve any such attack on her character. She is pure and noble, and I... I am inadequate.

speaker: Izuka
text: Have her actions poisoned your mind too, my prince?!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Since we met, Micaiah has led every battle, even joining the soldiers on the battlefield. Not so with me. I...cannot defend my people. How could our people not rally around her? They see her fighting, throwing her lot in with their own. They respect her. That said, things cannot remain as they are. Izuka is right to worry about my standing. I need to earn my people's respect. Therefore... Therefore, I must take action.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Um... Soldiers of the Liberation Army! Heed my-- No, no... Hear my words! I am Pelleas, true prince of Daein.

speaker: Daein
text: Yes, we know who you are, milord! We ought to by now!

speaker: Pelleas
text: And so, uh... So... ...

speaker: Daein
text: ...Is he...all right?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Prince...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight?

speaker: Pelleas
