text: ...And so... ...And so, beloved friends and comrades dear. With thanks to you, our capital lies close! And if we do not act, if we turn back, the war still ends with us the victors proud, and Daein's rule still falls back to our hands. And if we choose to fight and free this town, we may enrage the empire once again. Thus Daein's fortune turns to sorrow swift. But while I speak, Nevassa's hardship grows! Our brothers suffer, our sisters die, and... I shall not... I... I cannot ignore this tragedy. No man can, and certainly no prince... I cannot look away when my people suffer. And so I ask... I ask you all. Please, will you join me?!

speaker: Daein
text: Long live the prince!

speaker: Daein
text: Long live Prince Pelleas!

speaker: Daein
text: Long live Daein! It's time to save our country!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Ah...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Very well, my prince. We are at your service.

speaker: Pelleas
text: My army is arrayed and waiting. Be well. And...no overly heroic risks, please.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Company, at attention! Our objective is to save the town and take the keep! Now, move out!

speaker: Begnion
text: The rebels are on the move!

speaker: Jarod
text: Mm. And a good thing too. What is more honorable than a death fraught with purpose?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I wonder where Jarod is?

speaker: Jarod
text: Listen up, all of you. This is our last chance to die as we've lived. As proud soldiers of the empire. If we survive this fight, imprisonment and a hushed-up execution await us. If we run from this fight, dishonor and pursuit will dog our miserable days. So I say, let's give those Daein curs a fight to remember, and let the glory of our deaths light our way! We've lived as proud soldiers of the empire! Let us die as proud soldiers of the empire! Now GO!

speaker: Micaiah
text: That shout...that's Jarod! For Daein's sake, this time I swear I will put an end to him.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Maiden, take no risks upon yourself. You are the heart of this army, the soul that inspires us. We must not lose you. Leave this battle to me, and stay back.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you for your concern, Sir Knight. But I am going to fight. You and everyone else are putting your lives on the line. I will not shirk my duty.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You...are much...like her.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Nothing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Pardon, Sir Knight. I wanted to thank you. Thank you for fighting beside us.

speaker: Black Knight
text: No thanks are needed. I do nothing more than fulfill my duty.

speaker: Micaiah
text: When our fighting is done...will you remain in Daein?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Never mind. It's none of my business. It's only... If you were here with us, we could take heart in--

speaker: Black Knight
text: I may...take leave of Daein.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh! But why?

speaker: Black Knight
text: More than this, I cannot say. Forgive me.

speaker: Sothe
text: ...What do you want?

speaker: Sothe
text: Why are you trying to get close to Micaiah?

speaker: Black Knight
text: So that I might protect her.

speaker: Sothe
text: I protect her!

speaker: Black Knight
text: As things stand, I simply cannot entrust her safety to you.

speaker: Sothe
text: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Black Knight
text: If you hope to protect her, become stronger. Strong enough to surpass me, and stronger still.

speaker: Sothe
text: What? What could he mean...

speaker: Jarod
text: So, you have the audacity to approach me at last. Don't expect an easy fight. Before I die, I will see each of you dead before me.

speaker: Jarod
text: So, sub-human, the slave turns on the master? I'll teach you to know your betters!

speaker: Jarod
text: You're one, aren't you? One of those odd sub-humans that witch brought... You'll make a nice rug!

speaker: Jarod
text: Well well well. Look what we have here. The loathsome phantom of old Daein... Why in blazes are you here? What inspired you to slooooowly clank your way up out of your grave?

speaker: Black Knight
text: My purpose is not for you to know.

speaker: Jarod
text: Oh. I feel so rejected. Must I crack that helm open and ask your ugly, naked face directly!? I have to take vengeance for Alder's death, after all!

speaker: Black Knight
text: This is how you meet your death? Sad. Come at me, then, and join your friend.

speaker: Jarod
text: That face...I remember you. The kid who's always with that little wench.

speaker: Sothe
text: Sothe, of the Dawn Brigade.

speaker: Jarod
text: The Dawn Brigade, hm? Oh, how I despise your ilk. The thought of draining the life from your body... It makes me tingle all over.

speaker: Sothe
text: Ditto.

speaker: Jarod
text: So it's you...little girl.

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Jarod, the battle is over. Surely you can see it. You never believed Daein could do it, did you? But here you stand, broken, defeated by my countrymen and friends.

speaker: Jarod
text: Have I really, I wonder? Didn't I tell you? With you dead, there is no "Liberation Army." This is my golden opportunity... One blow is all it takes to turn defeat to victory. Such a lovely thought.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I will not lose to you. More importantly, the people of Daein will not lose to you!

speaker: Jarod
text: Gh-ghuahh... I am...sorry for nothing. I regret...nothing. Because I did it my way... You win, Priestess. You must be delighted. Enjoy it while you can... Because...sooner or later...you...

speaker: Micaiah
text: We won! We've taken back our country! Daein is under our control once again!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Thank you, Micaiah... Thanks to you, the kingdom of Daein lives again.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I didn't do it alone. We did it--everyone fighting together.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Well, you didn't hurt the effort! I'd hazard a guess that Daein's reconstruction would have only been a dream without you. I regret I have no other way to show my gratitude, but... I want to officially name you Supreme Commander of the armies of Daein.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I see. And I accept. It is with great honor that I assume this office. This battle may be over, but the fight to return Daein to its former glory will take time and effort. If my support can be of service, then I am honored to assist.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm glad. Well then, I'll perform the simple ceremony... Will you kneel? In the name of the king of Daein, I dub thee, Micaiah, Supreme Commander of Daein and grant thee the authority and responsibility pertaining thereto.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...It feels...odd.

speaker: Pelleas
text: You wear it well. Won't you join me, as I champion Daein to a great new era? I'm counting on you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I will.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Are you really leaving already? Stay...at least for the feast tonight. You've done so much, you deserve some celebration! Nothing I can say will convince you to break bread with Lord Izuka?

speaker: Tormod
text: Well, there is that. But honestly... If we stick around too long, the soldiers are gonna start giving us dirty looks. It's kind of awkward.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Tormod
text: Most Daeins still loathe laguz. Getting rid of that hatred... Let's just say you have your work cut out for you. Look, we don't want to ruin everyone's party. It's been great, but we'll just quietly slip away.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That's terrible! I can't believe I never noticed. Tormod, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Tormod
text: Ah! Don't cry! I hate it when girls cry!

speaker: Sothe
text: Um...take care of yourselves. It's, you know, good...that you came to help us. So...um... Thanks.

speaker: Tormod
text: Whoa! You're thanking me? Better get ahold of yourself, Sothe. You're gonna make ME get all weepy.

speaker: Sothe
text: You little...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Muarim, before you go... I just want to thank you. Thank you for not telling anyone about my brand.

speaker: Muarim
text: No thanks are needed. It's rude of me to ask, but do you know anything about the circumstances of your birth?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No. I know nothing of my parents. But just before she died, the old woman who raised me told me what the brand was and what it meant.

speaker: Micaiah
text: This is proof that the blood of both beorc and laguz course through me. And so, I am anathema to both. She told me never to let anyone see it, and to be always on my guard.

speaker: Muarim
text: Wise advice...

speaker: Micaiah
text: I've avoided people most of my life to conceal my brand...and my powers. But there's no way to hide how very slowly I age. I just keep moving through Daein. The same holds true now... I won't be able to stay in this army long.

speaker: Muarim
text: Even so... As long as little Sothe is by your side, I think that you can overcome any difficulty.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes... Just as you have Tormod.

speaker: Muarim
text: Yes.

speaker: Vika
text: Muarim, Boss, I know you don't want to go, but at this rate, we'll be standing here all night.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Vika! My thanks go to you too. Sothe and I will visit you in the desert.

speaker: Vika
text: I'll be there...but I won't be waiting. Waiting for people who never come is...hard.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Vika, I said I'll come, and I will.

speaker: Vika
text: ...OK, then.

speaker: Nailah
text: Micaiah, Sothe, we're going with them.

speaker: Sothe
text: What? Aren't you going to Gallia?

speaker: Tormod
text: Yeah. We're taking them. C'mon, neither of you can leave Daein for a little while, right? Don't worry, we can handle it.

speaker: Nailah
text: Once the battle ended, it seemed time to move on. I'm sorry to change our plans, but this is better for all of us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That's awful... I can't believe you're all leaving us at once.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Micaiah... Fate brought us together, you and I, guided by the same voice. Our paths are fated to cross again someday... I am sure of it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm embarrassed... I didn't mean...to cry... It's been so nice meeting you all...

speaker: Tormod
text: 'Til next time! 'Cause I know we'll meet again!

speaker: Micaiah
text: What was that sound?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Volug! Lady Nailah... Did she send you back to guard me, Volug?

speaker: Sothe
text: Ridiculous... As if you didn't already have that annoying bird...

speaker: Sothe
text: Ouch! Ow! Ow ow ow! I take it back!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe, we freed our country from tyranny together. But it's not over yet. We'll have to work hard for a long time to return Daein to its former grandeur. I know it won't be easy, but if I have you two with me, I know we can do it.

speaker: Fiona
text: Lady Micaiah. I’m sorry to bother you while you prepare for battle. May I have a word with you?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course. What can I help you with?

speaker: Fiona
text: If my memory serves me correctly, you always use this type of tome, correct?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, that’s right.

speaker: Fiona
text: Oh, I’m glad I remembered correctly. Then please, take this.

speaker: Micaiah
text: For me? Are you sure?

speaker: Fiona
text: It’s a token of appreciation for letting me--and Marado--join your army.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We’re lucky to have you. And thank you. I’ll use this tome well.

speaker: Fiona
text: Listening to Prince Pelleas’s speech earlier, I’m certain that Daein will exist anew. It will be a greater and more unified country than ever before!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I agree. So many things have happened along the way, but I am glad to be here now. I feel happy...and very proud.

speaker: Fiona
text: I feel the same way, and I’m sure all the soldiers of the Liberation Army do as well. Daein will soon be free... Lady Micaiah, please lead us to victory.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Yes. Together, we shall see victory!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Volug, where-- How did you get this?

speaker: Volug
text: (I got it from the ruins in the desert.)

speaker: Micaiah
text: From the ruins of the desert? Oh, you got it when we were there before?

speaker: Volug
text: (No, not quite.)

speaker: Micaiah
text: No? Then... how? When?

speaker: Volug
text: (You should keep it.)

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? It’s for me?

speaker: Volug
text: (I will catch up to you later.)

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait! Volug? Did he go back to the desert just to get this...?

speaker: Ike
text: Are we going the right way?

speaker: Yune
text: Yes. Ashera is at the top. We're going up. This is definitely the right way.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm a little disoriented because this is much bigger than it looks from outside. It's not my imagination, is it?

speaker: Yune
text: To be honest, you probably shouldn't look around too carefully. True miracles can overwhelm and terrify mortal minds. If you dwell on what you see here, you might stop climbing.

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Yune
text: Yes, really! Well, for most people, anyway. You're all the exceptions. You are all focused on your one goal, and you can't die until you achieve it. That's what you think, right?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes.

speaker: Yune
text: Desire propels people forward. That's how it's been since the beginning of your kind. You hope, take, give, kill, struggle... Out of all those needs and desires, hate and strife are born. And that's all right. You should want. You should strive to fill that want. You should challenge your fates. When all else fails, you can still die fighting.

speaker: Ike
text: Your philosophy is pretty extreme, too. Ashera doesn't forgive people for their imperfections. But you embrace both the good and evil natures of people. You seem to enjoy our internal struggles.

speaker: Yune
text: A straight road is boring. Defeat and destruction are far more interesting than stasis.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh. Is there a goddess who takes a middle-of-the-road approach?

speaker: Yune
text: Well, long ago... Wait. Stop, everyone! We need to talk. The next one who stands in our way is someone deeply tied to you.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Let's go.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You've come. Welcome, son of Gawain. Welcome all, courageous warriors.

speaker: Ike
text: I wonder how I didn't notice? Your composure, bearing, voice... It seems obvious in retrospect.

speaker: Ike
text: I wish I'd had the chance to fight you...or see you fight, General. Then I would've known a lot sooner.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Unfortunately for both of us, that opportunity never came.

speaker: Ike
text: So, it really is you. The Black Knight... No, General Zelgius!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Ike. I have long looked forward to the day we would fight again. Now that it is here, let us not delay any longer. Raise your sword and begin!

speaker: Ike
text: Let's finish this!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Stop right there. I've got a debt to settle with this scum.

speaker: Zelgius
text: True, your revenge against me remains incomplete. However, may I ask you to step aside for now? Though at different times, Ike and I both learned the way of the sword from the same master: one of Daein's famous Four Riders, General Gawain. He left Daein under an assumed name and formed a mercenary company.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I was entranced by Greil's swordsmanship while he was in Daein. I studied under him, I fought next to him... I idolized him. When he left, I was crushed. I vowed to find him again, and challenge him to  duel. I had to know if I had surpassed him! Three years ago, I caught up to Greil. I challenged him to a duel, and was victorious. But, something was wrong... The fight had been too simple. I thought I'd never feel satisfaction again. Then, Ike told me why it had been so easy. Greil had severed all the tendons in his right hand, and swore never again to draw a blade. Can you imagine my joy at the news? I knew that a swordsman of his stature couldn't have been so easy to defeat!

speaker: Zelgius
text: My master's skills were passed down to his son, Ike. I will defeat him and finally surpass my master! I trust that you understand. Once our fight is finished, I will allow you to settle your quarrel, Hawk King.

speaker: Ike
text: Please, Tibarn.

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...Fine. If you're taking my place, you'd better win. Got that?

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. This is my chance to avenge my father's death. This time, he won't walk away.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Let us begin.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I won't allow anyone to interfere with our fight.

speaker: Ike
text: Agreed. It's better this way. I can focus on you!

speaker: Zelgius
text: No draw. No escape. One wins. One loses. We shall end this. One of us will live...

speaker: Zelgius
text: And one of us will die.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm ready. Good-bye, General Zelgius.

speaker: Levail
text: Face me in an honorable duel, and know that I shall be the one to take your life.

speaker: Reyson
text: Why do you avoid eye contact? Am I not a worthy enemy?

speaker: Levail
text: Attacking a defenseless man goes against the code of chivalry. Please stay back, man of Serenes.

speaker: Reyson
text: Do not insult me!

speaker: Sanaki
text: I know you... You were a general in the Gaddos army. Did Zelgius betray Sephiran and side with the senate?

speaker: Levail
text: No, no! I swear upon the general's good name that he would do no such thing! I was the one who abandoned the duke of Gaddos to follow General Zelgius.

speaker: Sanaki
text: What is going on here? I don't understand the relationship between the Black Knight and the senate, or who is friend or foe...

speaker: Levail
text: Of one thing I am certain, Empress Sanaki. We are not your enemy! z Sanaki: Then order your men to stand down! I must speak with Zelgius. Take down that barrier!

speaker: Levail
text: I cannot do that. General Zelgius was very clear: he wishes to fight that man. Alone. My orders are to eliminate any intruders inside the tower in the meantime. My deepest apologies, Empress.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Wait! I won't allow it! Halt, Levail! Halt!

speaker: Levail
text: You must be the Silver-Haired Maiden, Micaiah, correct?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who are you?

speaker: Levail
text: Don't worry, I've no intention of harming you. Far from it, in fact. I'm under orders from General Zelgius to keep my men away from you. Please retreat. I don't want to disobey the general.

speaker: Levail
text: Captain Haar! You are still alive!

speaker: Haar
text: What happened that you didn't expect me to survive?

speaker: Levail
text: Um... Nothing, I suppose. It's just that it's been a while since you left Begnion.

speaker: Haar
text: Yeah. Twenty years ago, wasn't it?

speaker: Levail
text: I was still very young at the time. You had just been dubbed a knight. Oh, it brings back such memories... The bravery of the dracoknights, especially the Fizzart Platoon. It was legendary among the soldiers. But then you suddenly defected to Daein.

speaker: Haar
text: I got sick of taking orders from corrupt senators, so I ditched the country with General Shiharam.

speaker: Levail
text: I joined the army after I came of age. But it was different after you all left. It was as if you took its spirit with you. The only exception was General Zelgius, the general of Duke Persis's army.

speaker: Haar
text: I see. Is that why you're under his command?

speaker: Levail
text: Yes. He is the last true knight. I will die for him.

speaker: Haar
text: Yes, Levail. You will.

speaker: Levail
text: How I dreamed of fighting a proper foe! I am honored, Sir Haar! Have at you!

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...It seems as though you have been avoiding me since this battle began. What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Levail
text: Attacking a defenseless man goes against the code of chivalry. Please stay back, man of Serenes.

speaker: Leanne
text: Um... You... Keep... run away... from me. Why?

speaker: Levail
text: Attacking a defenseless woman goes against the code of chivalry. Please stay back, woman of Serenes.

speaker: Leanne
text: What? But...

speaker: Levail
text: General...Zelgius... I'd hoped...to fight for you...a while longer...

speaker: Levail
text: Face me in an honorable duel, and know that I shall be the one to take your life.

speaker: Levail
text: Captain Haar! You are still alive!

speaker: Haar
text: What happened that you didn't expect me to survive?

speaker: Levail
text: Um... Nothing, I suppose. It's just that it's been a while since you left Begnion.

speaker: Haar
text: Yeah. Twenty years ago, wasn't it?

speaker: Levail
text: I was still very young at the time. You had just been dubbed a knight. Oh, it brings back such memories... The bravery of the dracoknights, especially the Fizzart Platoon. It was legendary among the soldiers. But then you suddenly defected to Daein.

speaker: Haar
text: I got sick of taking orders from corrupt senators, so I ditched the country with General Shiharam.

speaker: Levail
text: I joined the army after I came of age. But it was different after you all left. It was as if you took its spirit with you. The only exception was General Zelgius, the general of Duke Persis's army.

speaker: Haar
text: I see. Is that why you're under his command?

speaker: Levail
text: Yes. He is the last true knight. I will die for him.

speaker: Haar
text: Yes, Levail. You will.

speaker: Levail
text: How I dreamed of fighting a proper foe! I am honored, Sir Haar! Have at you!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Sir Levail, you stand against Empress Sanaki. Lay down your weapons.

speaker: Levail
text: I cannot, Lady Sigrun. As strong as your loyalty is for the apostle, so is mine for General Zelgius.

speaker: Tanith
text: Sir Levail! How dare you raise your sword against Empress Sanaki! Has Goddess Ashera taken over your mind, too?

speaker: Levail
text: No, Lady Tanith. I fight for General Zelgius. I care not for the goddess's cause.

speaker: Levail
text: Lady Astrid, please stand down. A lady like you shouldn't have taken up a weapon in the first place.

speaker: Astrid
text: No, I am a knight of Crimea, here to fight you. Please forget about the past. The Lady Astrid you knew no longer exists.

speaker: Levail
text: You have indeed become strong. Very well! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Levail
text: Duke Tanas! I thought you were executed as a slave trader three years ago.

speaker: Oliver
text: True beauty is immortal. Look at me. Right now, I am flawless. You are not without potential. With education, you could aspire to be me.

speaker: Levail
text: ...No, thank you.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Let's see how you handle this!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Impressive! Most impressive!

speaker: Ike
text: Ugh! Hahh!

speaker: Zelgius
text: You are stronger. Much stronger than before...

speaker: Ike
text: I have you to thank for that. I grew stronger through our previous fight. To be honest... I was overjoyed when I heard that the Black Knight was still alive. That surprised me... I felt neither sadness nor hate. Just joy. My hands were shaking with anticipation. I couldn't wait to fight my most formidable enemy again! Your swordsmanship was fearsome. Fiercer and more powerful than any I've ever seen. After our duel three years ago, I trained hard, trying to remember all of your skills and techniques.

speaker: Zelgius
text: General Gawain was invincible at the time he trained me. To surpass him was my ultimate goal as a swordsman.

speaker: Ike
text: Was I as skillful as you remember my father in his prime years? Did you see his shadow in my sword?

speaker: Zelgius
text: I certainly did, Ike. Thanks to you, I was able to fight my master at the height of his glory days.

speaker: Ike
text: Black Knight Zelgius. You were my father's killer. And my last teacher.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...I spent most of my life shrouded in darkness... But my life had meaning. Now I'm certain of it...

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...phiran, I will wait for you in the afterlife...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Let's move on. We don't have much time left.

speaker: Yune
text: The swords are calling to each other...

speaker: Yune
text: The holy sword Alondite... It's the counterpart to your sword, Ragnell. I think it wants you to take it up.

speaker: Ike
text: Alondite... The sword that took my father's life.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What happened here?

speaker: Sephiran
text: We have arrived too late.

speaker: Zelgius
text: General Gawain!

speaker: Zelgius
text: General! Oh, thank the goddess... He's still alive. But...oh, no... what has he done? Elena... Did he kill her?

speaker: Sephiran
text: It must have been the medallion. He touched it, and the chaos bound within sent him into a rage beyond reason. Tragic...

speaker: Mist
text: Ike, wait for me!

speaker: Mist
text: Ahh! Father! Mother!

speaker: Zelgius
text: The general's children...

speaker: Mist
text: What's wrong with them? Are they asleep? ...Father? Mother?

speaker: Sephiran
text: They're very tired, child. Let's not disturb them.

speaker: Mist
text: We can't leave them sleeping here! It's cold out! We have to take them home! Ike, you have to help me!

speaker: Mist
text: Ike?

speaker: Zelgius
text: I'll take them home. Will you show me the way?

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah! Come with me!

speaker: Sephiran
text: May your final slumber be a peaceful one. It appears the medallion was too much for Lord Ashnard. It would be unwise to allow him access to it again.

speaker: Mist
text: Ah! Hey!

speaker: Mist
text: That's my mother's medallion! No one's supposed to see it!

speaker: Sephiran
text: No, child! You mustn't touch it!

speaker: Mist
text: We can't let it get lost. I'll keep it.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You... You are unchanged?

speaker: Mist
text: You said you'd take my mother home, too.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike? What's wrong? Why are you just standing there? Are you hurt?

speaker: Sephiran
text: You saw everything, didn't you? Poor child.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: AH! AAAH! AAAAAAAH! AAAAAAAH!

speaker: Mist
text: Ike?! What's wrong?

speaker: Ike
text: AHHH!

speaker: Mist
text: Ouch! Ike, that hurts. Let go!

speaker: Ike
text: Nnng! Aaagh! Aaaanngghh!

speaker: Zelgius
text: What happened?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Give me a moment.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sweet children... Sleep now. Rest.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What did you do to him?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Merely helped him to forget. I could not leave this memory to haunt him. It is too heavy a burden for one so young.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What will you do with the medallion?

speaker: Sephiran
text: The girl seems safe from its influence. We will leave it with her, for the time being.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Mm.

speaker: Ike
text: What... What was that?

speaker: Yune
text: You saw it too, didn't you, Ike? That memory... Could that have been--

speaker: Ike
text: I...I...was there... In that...place... My mother, she tried to stop my father, and...he killed her... I saw it all...

speaker: Yune
text: Is that what happened? I was contained inside at that time. I had no idea.

speaker: Ike
text: Zelgius...

speaker: Yune
text: Can you still fight?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. I will keep fighting. I won't stop until I die.

speaker: Yune
text: What's happening? Ah! What...?
You bear the mark. So that's your secret, is it? The blood of the laguz runs through your veins.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Yes. There was someone on my father's side who...who was with a laguz.

speaker: Zelgius
text: My lord...the brand...do you know of a way to remove it? This cursed thing, I...I am an outcast from my family. I joined the military to escape the shame and hatred in their eyes... I live in fear of discovery. When I think that I might see that same shame and hatred in another's eyes, I... I come close to despair... I have lived my life alone, unable to trust or become close to anyone.
Such loneliness and isolation. You poor child... It pains me to tell you that I know of no way to remove your brand.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I...I understand... It was a foolish question. I apologize.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Lord Sage, I-- I realized some years ago that I was aging more slowly than others do.
And you wish to conceal that fact, don't you? Is that why you rarely remove your armor, even when indoors?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Yes...but this ruse will not last indefinitely. In a few years, I will be forced to leave this army's service.
And once again, you will be alone.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I am accustomed to being alone. My only hesitation, is that...I will miss studying the sword under my commander, General Gawain.
When the time comes for you to leave, will you come to me, perhaps?

speaker: Zelgius
text: My lord?
We share a...similar condition. I see something familiar within you. I can... understand your pain and isolation.

speaker: Zelgius
text: But why me?
I have a task that I must accomplish. With you at my side, I would feel more confident of my success.

speaker: Zelgius
text: If I join you, will I be redeemed?
I cannot say. At the very least, however, you will no longer be alone. And neither will I.

speaker: Zelgius
text: That is enough, then. You have made my decision simple. When I leave here I will find you.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I am a soldier in the Daein army. I serve under the command of General Gawain. My name is Zelgius. May I ask your name, my lord sage?
My name? Of course...

speaker: Yune
text: Whose... Whose memory was that? It's just one of many... They're swirling everywhere... The tower resonates with their strength. But...who is it? Who do they belong to? ...There is such sadness... Zelgius met someone. One lonely soul calling out to another... But he's no longer with us. Zelgius is gone... And now the soul that remains is once more alone...

speaker: Lekain
text: The dark god's tainted minions have defeated our forces at every turn. Now they have set foot on the holy ground of the empire itself! We have no choice but to lead the army ourselves and destroy them once and for all! We are the chosen ones! Our will is the will of the goddess! With us at its head, our army is invincible!

speaker: Hetzel
text: Y-yes. Quite. As you say, Vice-Minister.

speaker: Lekain
text: When I've beaten that brat, Sanaki, I'll make her kneel before me and plead for her life! Heh heh heh!

speaker: Hetzel
text: The vice-minister says he hears the will of the goddess, yet I've heard nothing of the kind in my ears. Why would the goddess choose Lekain and me? We are the ones with the most to atone for...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Empress Sanaki.

speaker: Sanaki
text: The Silver-Haired Maiden...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, it's me, Micaiah. Um... May I sit next to you?

speaker: Sanaki
text: What? Oh... Uh...

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...Of course you may.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Thank you. ...This is awkward. I'm sorry. I know that you are not very fond of me, but I wanted to talk to you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: It's not that. I like you just fine. It's just that...you make me feel inadequate.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's because I can sing the galdr of release and hear Yune's voice, isn't it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: How...did you know?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I can sense the flow of people's thoughts. By seeing the movement of a person's mind, I can usually deduce what the person is thinking...

speaker: Sanaki
text: You can read minds?! What a boon that would be to running a country... If I could read people's minds, I could tell what the nobles and senators were thinking behind their smiles. I wonder why the goddess didn't bless me with such power?

speaker: Yune
text: Micaiah was born with her power. We didn't give it to her.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ah! Is that you?! The dark g—No, I mean...the goddess of chaos, Yune? Let me ask you one thing, Yune. Why was Micaiah able to sing the galdr of release, but I wasn't?

speaker: Yune
text: I'm sorry, little empress, I don't know. But I knew that Micaiah could sing it. That's why I stayed close to her.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I don't understand. How can you be a goddess and not know? I thought gods were perfect beings who knew everything!

speaker: Yune
text: Gods? Perfect? Where did you get that idea? You haven't met a lot of gods, have you?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Well, no. But divinity created life from nothing! Surely only perfect beings could do that!

speaker: Yune
text: We did create life, and can do many things that you creatures of flesh can't. But that doesn't make us perfect. It just means we can make mistakes on a much grander scale...

speaker: Yune
text: We're not what you've been taught, and we're much closer to you skin-wearers than some will admit. But we do make mistakes... Sometimes we make terrible mistakes. Sometimes all it takes is one emotional outburst, and the entire world is drowning underwater!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ow! Where did this sandstorm come from? Yune! You need to calm down...

speaker: Yune
text: I wish we were perfect. Then there wouldn't be any wars, and no one would have to die because of our mistakes!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Y-yes! I understand, Yune! Now please calm down!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yune?

speaker: Micaiah
text: She's gone now. She got upset. She hasn't lost control of her emotions like that in a long time.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Micaiah. I'm supposed to be the voice of the goddess Ashera. Yet I've never once heard her speak. I wonder what she is like?

speaker: Micaiah
text: We may find out before this is over...

speaker: Micaiah
text: King Naesala. You are by yourself today?

speaker: Naesala
text: Yeah. How about you? Where's that stone-faced sidekick of yours?

speaker: Micaiah
text: He's just hesitant to show his emotions.

speaker: Naesala
text: I'm only joking. Don't get so defensive.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Then don't insult my family.

speaker: Naesala
text: Hmph. You say he's your brother, but there's as much resemblance between you two as between me and Skrimir.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We're not related, but we're very close. Perhaps like you and Princess Leanne.

speaker: Naesala
text: What?! You didn't--

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I can sense your emotions. I also know that you just closed up to keep me from looking in.

speaker: Naesala
text: You possess the same power as the herons? How stupid of me to let my guard down.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Naesala
text: What else did you sense?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Naesala
text: Did you find out anything else about me?

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! I didn't try to read your mind intentionally. I just felt that your feelings for Princess Leanne were very warm, and that's all I saw.

speaker: Naesala
text: You're sure? Fine. You're a lot like me. I'll let you off the hook this time.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What do you mean by that?

speaker: Naesala
text: You'll see when the time comes.

speaker: Micaiah
text: King Naesala...

speaker: Naesala
text: I almost forgot. Here, this is for you.

speaker: Micaiah
text: This is a tome of light...

speaker: Naesala
text: We need you to stay alive, all right? See you later.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Naesala...

speaker: Sanaki
text: How did it go, Sigrun? Did you find anything useful?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Only this, unfortunately.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ah! It’s the tome of Bolganone! This is quite rare. Good work, Commander!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Sigh...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Such a heavy sigh. What’s wrong?

speaker: Sigrun
text: What sort of state is the world in, when the apostle--our empress--has taken up arms and fights alongside the common soldiers?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Is that still bothering you? I already told you not to worry.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I know. But what would the duke of Persis think if he saw you right now?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ah, Sephiran... I wonder what he and Zelgius are doing right now?

speaker: Sigrun
text: They’re awaiting your return, of course.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You don’t have any doubt about that?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Of course not. Duke Persis comes from a family of great mages. General Zelgius is the finest general in all of Begnion. They wouldn’t have been petrified. We’ll see them when we return to the empire.

speaker: Sanaki
text: That’s true. I’m certain that they’re safe, too. They must be waiting for us. Let us make haste toward Sienne.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Yes. That is why I keep suggesting that you should stay away from danger, and--

speaker: Sanaki
text: Nonsense. We will fight with everything we have. And in order to fight to our utmost, we need powerful magic at our disposal! Follow me, Sigrun. Under these sands are many precious treasures. Help me find them!

speaker: Sigrun
text: I’m glad she is feeling better, but to see our empress is digging around in the dirt like a common farmhand... Sigh.

speaker: Sothe
text: Yune "visited" again, huh? Did she have anything interesting to say?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sort of. I think she might be responsible for the ancient flood that sank all of the other continents.

speaker: Naesala
text: Sorry to break up your alone time, you two, but we have Disciples of Order troubles again.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey! That's--

speaker: Sanaki
text: I knew this would happen, eventually.

speaker: Sigrun
text: What is it, Empress Sanaki? Oh, I see.

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah, my dear Sanaki, the false apostle! What a pleasure to see you again, and this time, I've an army of the righteous behind me, ready to strike you down!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Vice-Minister Lekain. You are the foulest kind of traitor. I can never forgive you!

speaker: Lekain
text: Ha ha... How amusing. Forgiveness from a fraud is of no value to anyone.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress, please don't force me to listen to his blasphemies any longer! All me to silence him for you!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hold, Sigrun. I want to understand. Lekain, on what grounds do you claim that I am not the true apostle?

speaker: Lekain
text: The apostle of Begnion shall be the firstborn daughter of each generation in the line of Altina, first empress. She will give voice to the goddess. She will pass judgment, give prophecy, and protect her people and their lands. Sanaki, you have never once heard the voice of the goddess, have you?

speaker: Sanaki
text: That is... That is only because... I have not come of age yet!

speaker: Lekain
text: Oh, what a hysterical coincidence! That's just what the senate has been telling the people for years now! "Apostle Sanaki is too young to hear the goddess. Give her more time." How funny that the lie you've been living is the same lie we've been telling.

speaker: Sanaki
text: But, how... Explain yourself, Lekain!

speaker: Lekain
text: Poor false apostle... No one ever told you about your older sister, did they? She was the true apostle.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I...had a sister?

speaker: Lekain
text: She died before you were born, assassinated along with Apostle Misaha by the heron clan. So the senate installed you, the second daughter, as the apostle instead.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You lie! You impugn both me and the noble herons!

speaker: Lekain
text: Heh heh heh... I'm glad to have exposed your secret. Perhaps now you will be able to accept the truth.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Silence! The lying tongue of a treacherous senator proves nothing!

speaker: Lekain
text: You seek proof? Fine. We shall settle this in the ancient way: in a battle to the death. Whomsoever the goddess sees fit to win the day must be in the right!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Lekain! We've finally found you! Now's our chance, Sothe! We must do whatever it takes to get the blood pact!

speaker: Sothe
text: Right. Let's go!

speaker: Numida
text: Vice-Minister Lekain, I take it we may begin? Champions of the goddess! Crush these heretics! Give them the reward for rebelling against our goddess!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ugh... They're so powerful... Are we...destined to perish here?

speaker: Black Knight
text: My Maiden... Hold on a little longer. I am here.

speaker: Stefan
text: Hello! How can I help?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? Who--

speaker: Stefan
text: You and I were born under the same fate.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Same fate? Do you also carry the mark?

speaker: Stefan
text: Indeed. I don’t know who you are fighting, or why. But attacking my kin in the desert is the same as attacking me. I will not let them leave this place alive.

speaker: Micaiah
text: My friend... May I ask your name?

speaker: Stefan
text: When you ask someone’s name, isn’t it proper to give your name first?

speaker: Micaiah
text: S-sorry. I’m Micaiah.

speaker: Stefan
text: And I am Stefan. Well met. Let’s go.

speaker: Lethe
text: I remember you!

speaker: Stefan
text: What a pleasure to see you again, noble dame of Gallia.

speaker: Lethe
text: It’s Lethe. I see that you were spared from petrification. I’m glad.

speaker: Stefan
text: Petrification? I’d like to hear more about that, but there seems to be some sort of battle on.

speaker: Lethe
text: We only seem to run into each other when I’m fighting for my life. Sorry I don’t have the time to catch up.

speaker: Stefan
text: Ah, well, that’s easily fixed. I shall help you win the battle, so we can talk properly. How does that sound?

speaker: Lethe
text: Sounds just like old times. It’s good to fight with you again, Stefan.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Stefan! What are you doing here?

speaker: Stefan
text: That’s what I was about to ask you! I came to see what all the noise in my desert was about.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ah, so you didn’t get turned to stone! That is very good!

speaker: Stefan
text: Stone? What are you talking about? I suppose you’ll have to fill me in later. Let’s fight off the enemy together.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Good! Mordecai is happy to fight with Stefan again!

speaker: Stefan
text: And I as well, Mordecai.

speaker: Lethe
text: I remember you!

speaker: Stefan
text: Pleasure to see you again, noble dame of Gallia.

speaker: Lethe
text: It’s Lethe. I see that you were spared from petrification. I’m glad.

speaker: Stefan
text: Petrification? I’d like to hear more about that, but there seems to be some sort of battle on.

speaker: Lethe
text: We only seem to run into each other when I’m fighting for my life. Sorry I don’t have the time to catch up.

speaker: Stefan
text: Ah, well, that’s easy. I've joined the battle, so we can talk properly later. How does that sound?

speaker: Lethe
text: He certainly hasn't changed.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Stefan! What are you doing here?

speaker: Stefan
text: That’s what I was about to ask you! I came to see what all the noise in my desert was about.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ah, so you didn’t get turned to stone! That is very good!

speaker: Stefan
text: Stone? What are you talking about? I suppose you’ll have to fill me in later. Let’s fight off the enemy together.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Good! Mordecai is happy to fight with Stefan again!

speaker: Stefan
text: And I as well, Mordecai.

speaker: Leanne
text: (By the goddess... You!)

speaker: Black Knight
text: You fear me? I do not blame you. I apologize for the circumstances of our last meeting. Be assured, Princess, I am not here to harm you. If you are frightened, I shall step away.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Nothing good can come of his being here. He’s a walking nightmare...)

speaker: Sothe
text: I knew it. I knew that even if the end of the world came, you'd be the last one left standing.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Your faith is touching.

speaker: Sothe
text: Well, you and the commander. Commander Ike will defeat you, you know. You can't run forever.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You are correct. We will soon meet again.

speaker: Sothe
text: Shouldn't you sound more worried about that? You sound as if you're looking forward to fighting Commander Ike again. Don't delude yourself. You can't beat him.

speaker: Black Knight
text: We shall see.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ah, Sir Knight! I am glad to see you're safe! I knew someone of your power wouldn't have turned to stone.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I am glad to see you're safe as well, Maiden.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Are you here to save us again?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Not "us."

speaker: Micaiah
text: What?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I am only here to save you. No one else.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But, why? Why just me?

speaker: Black Knight
text: We will talk more when the battle is over. I shouldn't have said anything yet. Forgive me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight...

speaker: Lekain
text: Hmm, reinforcements? I suppose I must turn back for my own safety. It is vital that I not be harmed, for the good of the world to come! While it pains me to leave the field of battle, I mustn't put myself at risk.

speaker: Lekain
text: Hmm, it's beginning to look dangerous here. I suppose I must turn back for my own safety. It is vital that I not be harmed, for the good of the world to come! While it pains me to leave the field of battle, I mustn't put myself at risk.

speaker: Numida
text: I don't understand. Why would they fight against the vice-minister, chosen of Ashera? Are they somehow...deficient? You will perish for your defiance of the empire, vermin!

speaker: Nolan
text: No one escapes from their past, Numida. We all have to answer for our crimes one day. Today is that day for you.

speaker: Numida
text: Silence, cur!

speaker: Edward
text: This is for the free people of Daein! Haaaa!

speaker: Numida
text: Don't you idealistic twits ever give up?

speaker: Numida
text: Ahhhh! What a fearsome beast! Only the dark god could create such a monstrosity!

speaker: Skrimir
text: What's wrong, little beorc? Frightened? If you cannot look upon me, you cannot hope to defeat me!

speaker: Naesala
text: Ah, Duke Numida. Unbelievable that a coward like you was changed back from stone. Particularly surprising, given some of your more...impious transgressions.

speaker: Numida
text: I-I have no idea what you're talking about! I am a senator in good standing!

speaker: Naesala
text: My country produces excellent spies, Your Grace. I know every atrocity you committed while in Daein. I actually hold quite a bit of incriminating evidence that would destroy you if it became public. It's a pity that all that work will be wasted, though, since this is the last day of your life.

speaker: Tanith
text: I am Second Commander Tanith of the Holy Knights! Enemies of the apostle, beware!

speaker: Numida
text: How said that you still put stock in your laughable infant of a holy figure. Fool!

speaker: Numida
text: It's tragic, really, that the Holy Knights have wasted so much time and energy protecting a sham apostle! It's not too late, you know, to align yourself with the true chosen of the goddess.

speaker: Sigrun
text: The loyalty of the Holy Knights can only be commanded by one person, and that will never change. It is my duty and privilege to execute her orders and destroy the enemies of the apostle!

speaker: Numida
text: So, child, what the vice-minister said was true! Wicked infant! How dare you pretend to be divinely inspired while you heard absolutely nothing from the goddess!

speaker: Numida
text: Fool! Do you honestly believe that your dark god can triumph in the face of Ashera's divine majesty?

speaker: Sothe
text: She's not my dark god. To be honest, I don't care about the gods. They have nothing to do with me.

speaker: Numida
text: What?! Then who do you fight for?!

speaker: Sothe
text: I fight for my family, and I fight against tyranny. That is enough.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You!

speaker: Numida
text: Who are you, girl?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Duke Numida! I will never forget your oppression of the Daein people, or your cowardly flight from justice!

speaker: Numida
text: Ah, you're from Daein. You should know that I had nothing to do with that unpleasantness. That was all General Jarod's doing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: General Jarod was a scoundrel and a fiend, but at least he had a soldier's honesty in his villainy. You black-hearted senators nauseate me, weaving a dense tapestry of lies that you yourselves believe!

speaker: Numida
text: What... What's happening? Vice-Minister? I lost the battle...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sir Knight! How good to see you! You always save me from danger.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Maiden. I have a favor to ask of you. Will you come with me? My master awaits you at the Tower of Guidance.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The Tower of Guidance? If I may ask...who is your master?

speaker: Black Knight
text: You will see when we get there. Please take my hand. We will be there in the blink of an eye.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I can't. I can't leave everyone behind. We have to get to the tower together.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Your allies will turn to stone with the light of judgment next shines. I do not wish for you to see it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The light will strike again? When? Please tell me!

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Maiden. I will come for you again. Make up your mind by then.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Wait...

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't tell me, he's gone again, right? I knew we couldn't count on him.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Um, Sothe...

speaker: Sothe
text: Lekain got away, didn't he?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, he did. But we'll have another chance.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm sure of it. I know he's going to attack us again. Don't know if that's good news or bad...

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know. We have to be ready.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sigrun. Tanith. I need to talk to both of you.

speaker: Tanith
text: Empress. Why so serious? Whatever it is, you can be sure that Sigrun and I will help you with it.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Tanith, let her speak.

speaker: Sanaki
text: When the last apostle was assassinated, and I was not yet born, Begnion went a long time without central authority. The people were frightened, both of the murder and the power vacuum. Without the goddess's voice, Begnion was lost. Sephiran once told me that when the senate confirmed my appointment as the next apostle, it was as if a sign of relief sounded across the country.

speaker: Sigrun
text: It's true. I still remember your coronation, the first time I ever saw you, Empress Sanaki. With your tiny hand in Sephiran's, you stumbled as you walked... A little girl, barely visible in the grand hallway of the cathedral. It was a moving sight.

speaker: Tanith
text: I remember as well. The empress stepped on her cape and tripped a total of five times.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Tanith, that hardly seems appropriate.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I think the country's sigh of relief was unwarranted. I cannot hear the goddess's voice. I never could. This has perplexed me for years. At first I thought my youth was to blame, but this excuse grows thinner each year. There is no clear age at which previous apostles heard the goddess for the first time, but all of them had heard by now.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Empress, if this is about what Duke Gaddos said--

speaker: Sanaki
text: If I am not the true apostle, have I betrayed my people? Even unknowingly? You two are my most trusted friends. How would you feel about me if I were not the apostle? Be honest with me.

speaker: Sigrun
text: You would like an honest answer? Very well. It would change nothing.

speaker: Sanaki
text: What?

speaker: Sigrun
text: If you thought that our allegiance was to the office of the apostle, well, you were wrong. Even from a young age, you have been working with Lord Sephiran to fight the senate on behalf of the people.

speaker: Tanith
text: Our loyalty lies with you, Empress Sanaki. You will always be our empress. Please do not forget that.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...I am...blessed. Not by the voice of the goddess, but by loyalty like yours.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Be strong, Empress Sanaki. Even if you are not an apostle, you are still the one, true empress of Begnion.

speaker: Ranulf
text: According to our scouts, the enemy has split into two forces. One is east of the Ertz Mountains. The other is approaching from the north, by crossing through Crimea.

speaker: Tibarn
text: So, they plan on flanking Gallia from the north and east. If we don't stop them, this is gonna hurt.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Agreed. What is the Crimean army doing?

speaker: Ranulf
text: From what the scouts have said, nothing at all. I'm guessing they're waiting to see how everything pans out.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Crimea let Begnion pass without a fight?! What about their alliance with Gallia?

speaker: Ranulf
text: It's not that simple, Skrimir. Begnion is Crimea's suzerain state. It's difficult for Crimea to refuse Begnion's demands.

speaker: Skrimir
text: A suza-what? Someone explain to me what that means.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hmm, how can I explain... All right, how's this? Begnion still holds political power over countries that won independence from them. Anything you want to add, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: Don't look at me. I've always thought the whole idea was ridiculous.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Never mind what it means. Has Crimea broken its treaty with us?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Not...as such. I didn't say it was right, just that it was complicated...

speaker: Skrimir
text: It's not complicated at all! Crimea has betrayed Gallia! We cannot let this pass! How da--
Control yourself, Skrimir. You're acting like a fool.

speaker: Skrimir
text: M-my apologies, Your Majesty. It is just--

speaker: Caineghis
text: I doubt that Crimea has sided with Begnion. Queen Elincia is very clever, and I will not stop trusting her judgment just yet. She most likely allowed the Imperial Army to pass through her lands in order to avoid a slaughter.

speaker: Nailah
text: Who is this beorc queen who warrants so much trust? Please, enlighten us.

speaker: Caineghis
text: She is a delightful woman, both in manner and in reign. Her late father, King Ramon, and I forged an alliance between beorc and laguz. We sought to bring our peoples closer. She has taken her father's ideals as her own and strives to create a country where anyone, beorc or laguz, can live free and in peace.

speaker: Rafiel
text: How times have changed... I never could have dreamed of a time where such a beorc ruler would exist. I must admit, I still have doubts.

speaker: Reyson
text: I don't blame you, my brother. Change has been slow, but the circle of acceptance in Tellius has been widening. As you can see, both Leanne and I have many beorc friends. Queen Elincia of Crimea is one of them.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Both the king and Reyson speak well of this woman! Is she truly so special?

speaker: Ike
text: She truly is. But right now, that's beside the point. The most important thing is, Elincia will never betray her allies in Gallia.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I couldn't agree more. We can trust her.

speaker: Caineghis
text: All right. Let's assume for now that Crimea will not aid the empire in any military fashion during this conflict. Hawk King, let's hear your thoughts.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well, if Crimea won't make a move, then I see no reason to wait until the empire reaches Gallia. I'd prefer to take an army up north and end this mess for good.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Very well. Ike, do the Greil Mercenaries have anything to add?

speaker: Soren
text: ...I agree with Tibarn's idea. We should strike while their army is split in half. I'm pretty sure that General Zelgius will be there, though. We'd better be careful.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Very well. Hawk King, may I ask that your forces protect the eastern border? While they do that, I would like you to lead our strike force to the northern border. Take Ranulf with you, as well.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Send me too, Your Majesty! Please, let me reclaim my honor! I beg you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I second that, Your Majesty. Skrimir is perfect for this mission.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ranulf?

speaker: Caineghis
text: ...Very well. Will you look after him, Hawk King?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sure, I can handle him. He's easier to keep under control than you are, Lion King.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Hmph. He's all yours, then. Now, everyone. Prepare to leave before daybreak. We are all depending on you.

speaker: Gallia
text: Insects of Begnion! We'll show you the power of the beast tribe!

speaker: Phoenicis
text: Beorc scum! For the razing of our homes, we'll make you wish you'd never been born!

speaker: Begnion
text: Filthy sub-humans! This war ends now. Prepare yourselves!

speaker: Gallia
text: A beorc army is approaching from the hill to the left! That flag... It's the Crimean army!

speaker: Gallia
text: C-Crimea intends to side with the empire after all!

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia? What are you doing...

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee hee. Finally, they see the light and are coming to fight with us! Excellent. Took them long enough. I suppose when you have the brain of a gnat, these things take some time to sink in.

speaker: Elincia
text: I am Queen Elincia of Crimea. I have a message for the commanders of both armies! I am here to declare the will of Crimea and its people! Crimea has been ruled under the ideals of peace and equality since the reign of my father, King Ramon. As such, I cannot and will not allow you to spill blood upon our land! Therefore...

speaker: Elincia
text: I demand that both the Laguz Alliance and the Imperial Army leave Crimea at once!

speaker: Valtome
text: Withdraw our troops?! You foolish girl! We will not be ordered about by the proclamations of a peasant like you! Puppet rulers such as yourself should stay inside their pretty castles and play dress-up. Begnion's patience has worn out. After we finish slaughtering the sub-humans, we'll be coming for you in Melior.

speaker: Elincia
text: Commander of the Laguz Alliance. How do you respond?

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...You have some serious guts, jumping into the middle of a battlefield all by yourself. But your high-and-mighty beliefs don't change the fact that Begnion must answer for its crimes. Step aside.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Very well. I've heard from both commanders. Then--

speaker: Elincia
text: This is Crimea's answer. We will not sway from our ideas. My countrymen stand united. We will not use force. But we are willing to do whatever it takes to end this here and now.

speaker: Valtome
text: What?! Have you lost your mind?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Heh...

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...Ha... Hahahahaha!  Ike, I thought you were the craziest beorc I'd ever met, but you have some serious competition! Crimea's queen is one tough woman... Your Majesty, I like your style! Skrimir! I can't let such a pretty woman down. Let's get out of here.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Of course. The beast tribe will not use our claws against unarmed beorc. Soldiers, back to the forest!

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you, King Tibarn.

speaker: Tibarn
text: This is only temporary. The war between the Laguz Alliance and Begnion isn't finished yet.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, I understand that. Even so, I want you all to know where Crimea stands in this.

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...Hey, you and I should get together and chat sometime. I'll be seeing you again soon.

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius! What are your orders? Shall we launch an attack?

speaker: Zelgius
text: No. We will withdraw.

speaker: Levail
text: Are you certain, General?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Could you cast aside your weapon while surrounded by armed soldiers?

speaker: Levail
text: I don't know, sir... No, probably not.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Queen Elincia has done something that even I would be hard pressed to do. For that, we must show our respect.

speaker: Valtome
text: Stop this instant! Wait! Where do you think you're going?! Attack those mangy beasts!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Please forgive my audacity. However, we are withdrawing. Every battle ebbs and flows. To go against these tides is unwise. Please understand, Senator.

speaker: Valtome
text: You self-righteous fool... You'll understand something else, once we're through with this battle.

speaker: Mist
text: I don't want to go back yet... Do we have time to talk to Elincia?

speaker: Titania
text: It has been a long time since we last saw Queen Elincia. We should at least say hello.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Sure, sounds great to me. There's probably not much time for small talk, but we'll see.

speaker: Valtome
text: ...Soldiers! Kill the queen of Crimea! That girl is a traitor to Begnion!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Whoa, this isn't good! The Imperial Army is on the move. They're after Queen Elincia!

speaker: Ike
text: So much for imperial honor. Greil Mercenaries! Looks like we have our old job back! Protect Queen Elincia!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Tch! I knew it! Follow me, my knights! We shall protect Her Majesty!

speaker: Valtome
text: Kill every living thing that stands in our way! Show them that I--no, the senate--controls this pathetic land!

speaker: Sergei
text: Of course, Senator Valtome! I'd be happy to kill the wench.

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia!

speaker: Elincia
text: Sir Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: I'm glad you're safe. That was one crazy move you pulled.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's what I had to do to stop the fighting. However...my efforts have failed. I could not stop them.

speaker: Ike
text: But at least you made your point to the Laguz Alliance. I'm sure there are those in the Imperial Army who understand as well. You did the right thing.

speaker: Elincia
text: You're always so kind. Thank you, Sir Ike.

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius! Senator Valtome is about to run down the queen of Crimea!

speaker: Zelgius
text: That useless parasite. Attacking an unarmed woman... This is beneath even him.

speaker: Levail
text: The Crimean army and a part of the Laguz Alliance have joined battle in order to rescue the queen. They are fighting Senator Valtome. Shall we assist the senator?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Prepare to leave. We are not fighting.

speaker: Levail
text: But, General... That would mean that we abandoned Duke Culbert's force...

speaker: Zelgius
text: I will take all responsibility for this. Make my command clear to all of the men. I will not accept more units joining this fight!

speaker: Begnion
text: Commander! Our force is taking heavy losses! Defeat is imminent. Even our strike force cannot keep the enemy at bay! Please, you must escape!

speaker: Valtome
text: I've been defeated? Me? By worthless rabble like this?! Ugh, blast that Zelgius! How dare he not assist me! I'll have his pompous head for this!

speaker: Sergei
text: Fools! How dare you fight my master? He is Senator Valtome, duke of Culbert! Die in his name!

speaker: Sergei
text: We are under the direct orders of Senator Valtome! His words carry the weight of the entire senate! Mercenaries! You know how war works. You know that Begnion can pay--

speaker: Ike
text: Save your breath. The Greil Mercenaries choose our employers. All the wealth in the senate couldn't buy us. Lay down your bow and surrender.

speaker: Sergei
text: What?! Wretched fool! You'll rot in the ground next to that treacherous girl.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Phew... Begnion's finally given up! That took some doing.

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me about it. But we did get some good information out of all this. Now we know for certain that there are serious leadership problems in the Imperial Army. I'm glad General Zelgius was honorable enough to withdraw. If the full strength of the two armies had clashed, Elincia's effort would've been wasted.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Sir Ike! Sir Ranulf! Thank you for helping us save Queen Elincia.

speaker: Ike
text: Geoffrey. I'm really surprised you let Elincia do such a dangerous thing. You must be more relaxed these days.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: It wasn't easy for me, as you could guess. But I can never really say no to Queen Elincia. What choice did we have, anyway?

speaker: Ike
text: You didn't have any, and you all did what needed to be done. I'm really impressed. Crimea's become quite strong.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Don't talk like such a stranger. The Greil Mercenaries are also from Crimea. You're part of that strength.

speaker: Ike
text: True. I'm very proud of my homeland.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Let's go see Her Majesty. You do have time to speak with her, right?

speaker: Valtome
text: I shall now dispense punishment for disobeying my orders! General Zelgius! Do you have anything to say? I would hear your pleas now.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...I am prepared to face the consequences of my actions.

speaker: Valtome
text: Quite an admirable sentiment, General. Although I imagine you should have thought about the consequences before you abandoned your allies! Now, on your knees. It's time for your execution. Good-bye, General Zelgius.

speaker: Levail
text: Wh-what?! Senator! I must ask you to reconsider! To execute a man of General Zelgius's caliber without a trial... It's madness! It's horrible!

speaker: Valtome
text: Levail, are you questioning a senator? A senator holds the right to punish a prisoner however he sees fit! Oh, I'll make sure to tell our people that the general was cut down in battle after felling hundreds of sub-humans. That way, the people will not trouble themselves over details that they couldn't possibly understand.

speaker: Levail
text: You would bury the truth?! Do you think the apostle is as easily fooled by your lies?!

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, I sincerely doubt the apostle will ever get to hear them. ...All right, I've waited long enough. Your wait is over as well, Zelgius. Execute him!

speaker: Valtome
text: Don't worry, Zelgius. I'll make sure that your lands are looked after. They'll be mine, of course. Uwee hee hee!

speaker: Valtome
text: What?!
Silence, Valtome! All soldiers loyal to Begnion are to stand down immediately!

speaker: Tanith
text: Hello, Senator Valtome.

speaker: Valtome
text: You...! You're one of the Holy Guards!

speaker: Tanith
text: The apostle will be here shortly! Soldiers, sheathe your weapons and kneel before the apostle!

speaker: Valtome
text: What?! No... It's impossible!

speaker: Begnion
text: Ah! It's her! There's no doubt about it!

speaker: Begnion
text: It's the apostle! The apostle is here!

speaker: Sanaki
text: ... My soldiers. I apologize for my sudden disappearance.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I am here today to explain things, and to bring you news from home that is of the utmost importance. My soldiers, listen to me carefully. I never wished for this war. It was started by those who wanted me dead. It was spurred on by their desire to rule Begnion for themselves. This war was the work of the senate and was organized by Vice-Minister Lekain of Gaddos!

speaker: Begnion
text: The senate wished harm upon the apostle?!

speaker: Begnion
text: No... Impossible! How can that be?

speaker: Valtome
text: ...Lies! She lies! Do not be tricked, proud soldiers of Begnion! She is not the true apostle!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ah, I see. Then we are not the real Holy Guards? Is that what you are trying to say?

speaker: Valtome
text: N-no! This is a farce! You cannot trick us! You are using a fake apostle to disable the senate and take over Begnion! Men, we must act! That vile Sephiran is their leader! The fact that he's been put in chains is our proof!

speaker: Valtome
text: Hurk!

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...I will not allow you to disgrace my master's good name. One more syllable and I shall snap your neck, Valtome.

speaker: Valtome
text: Urk...! Ahh!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Apostle. Words cannot express how good it is to see you alive and well. We have been awaiting your return.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Thank you, General Zelgius. You and I have much to discuss.

speaker: Giffca
text: Welcome back, you two.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Giffca. Apologies for worrying you.

speaker: Giffca
text: You persevered through many difficult battles. We are glad to have you back in one piece.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Each and every soldier in the army helped me. I couldn’t do anything by myself. Alone, I was powerless.

speaker: Giffca
text: That’s good. If that’s what you learned from this campaign, then it wasn’t a wasted effort for Gallia. Good work, Ranulf.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Thank you, sir.

speaker: Giffca
text: Skrimir, come here. I have something from the king.

speaker: Skrimir
text: What is this?

speaker: Giffca
text: It’s a satori sign. It is said to bring out the hidden power of the laguz.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Amazing!

speaker: Giffca
text: Here, it’s yours.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ranulf. You should take it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What? Why? The king said it was for you!

speaker: Skrimir
text: Yes, but you’ve been looking after me. It’s… a sign of my appreciation.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir…

speaker: Giffca
text: Very well. Ranulf. This is yours to keep.

speaker: Ranulf
text: A-all right. Thank you, sir.

speaker: Giffca
text: Skrimir, you reply to his thanks.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Um, yes. You’re welcome. I am grateful for your continued support.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Of course, General.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Oh goddess... Will you please stop? Is this not enough? Your...sister...regrets all she has done. If you look closely at any of Yune's actions, and their unintended consequences, you will see they were all born of fear. Fear that you would expunge her from yourself. If you would but allow her back within you, this would surely never happen again.

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: Yune is chaos. She is an imperfection in my being. It is because of her that I...I have done this thing that cannot be undone.

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: No matter how I admonished you, you would not stop fighting. There was nothing I could do. Every day my beloved children were killed, killed by others of my beloved children. With every death my rage and sorrow grew until I could control myself no longer. My emotions burst forth and I razed the land. Furious storms savaged the heavens, roiling waters rose in tremendous floods. Lives were lost beyond counting.

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: I will purge chaos from within myself. Never again will I allow myself to commit such atrocities. I will become a goddess to properly guide and protect my people. I will become perfect.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: But...to nullify half of your being... We were terribly, monstrously wrong to suggest it. You shouldn't have to bear the weight of our foolish ideas.

speaker: Female Voice 2
text: I...I was just...lonely. My other half spent all her time worrying about the laguz and beorc. She said she was going to erase me. I was...only playing. I never meant to hurt so many.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: I understand, Yune.

speaker: Female Voice 2
text: I won't do it again. I love all of you, too. You paid attention to me. I don't want to go away. It would be lonely, and I don't like being lonely. I want to stay here with all of you.

speaker: Female Voice 3
text: ...Goddess, I have a suggestion. If we here, of our own will, were to make a pledge to coexist, there would be no need to erase Yune, would there? In which case, we give you our solemn oath: never again will either the laguz or beorc seek the extermination of the other. Soan? Dheginsea? This is agreeable, is it not?

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: I do not accept your pledge.

speaker: Female Voice 3
text: Why?

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: I cannot believe you. You are living creatures created in our image. You cannot seal away your instincts with reason. You are like us. You feel profound sorrow, anger, fear... A conflict will surely arise to overwhelm your reason and discipline. You will be unable to master your emotions. And I may once again make the mistakes that have led us here. The only way to prevent this is to expunge chaos completely. Yune must not exist. My decision has not changed.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: In that case, Goddess... Would you consider an alternative to such drastic measures? We shall use the power of seid magic to seal Yune in this medallion. Someday...and it may be in the far, distant future... Someday we may be able to earn your trust, Goddess. In the hope of that day arriving, refrain from annihilating Yune, please.

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: In my eyes, imprisoning Yune and destroying her are the same thing. ...If the chaos and disaster that Yune begets can be averted, I have no objection. I do not know, however, if Yune will submit to such confinement.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Goddess Yune? Please hear me. I will never give up. Someday, I will see you restored to yourself. Please...

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Do not look so sad. I will always be with you. I will sing to you. You will not be lonely. I promise.

speaker: Yune
text: They're getting stronger and stronger... Whose memories are those? I know him.

speaker: Yune
text: Everyone, Ashera is nearby. Just beyond those doors... That's where we'll find her.

speaker: Ike
text: We made it. Finally...

speaker: Yune
text: You should know, Ashera may have changed since before her slumber. Order and chaos are meant to naturally balance each other out. If you take one away, balance is lost. I don't expect Ashera to have the merest shred of compassion. Talking to her will likely do no good.

speaker: Ike
text: We don't have much choice. If talking won't work, we'll have to use force. Otherwise, this has all been for nothing.

speaker: Ike
text: How about you?

speaker: Yune
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ike
text: Are you completely chaotic? Are you out of balance? As far as I can tell, you don't seem to lean too far in either direction.

speaker: Yune
text: Ashera and I see things a little differently... During my long sleep, I was wrapped in sweet, gentle music.

speaker: Ike
text: Heron galdrar?

speaker: Yune
text: Yes, but more important than the song itself, I was never alone. There was always someone, singing comfort to me. Ashera shouldn't have isolated herself. She became lonely and bitter, and lost touch with her people...

speaker: Ike
text: Hold on... This thing won't budge.

speaker: Yune
text: What's wrong with it?
Those doors cannot be opened.

speaker: Sephiran
text: They have been sealed with powerful magic.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran! You're all right... I'm so relieved to see you!

speaker: Sephiran
text: I'm sorry to have been a cause for concern, Apostle. Forgive me.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran... There's something I need to tell you. I'm not a true apostle. I didn't mean to abuse your trust.

speaker: Sephiran
text: I've known that for some time, Sanaki. Don't forget that I was almost a father to you. It honestly doesn't make any difference to me whether or not you can hear the goddess.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran... Th-thank you...for having always been there for me.

speaker: Ike
text: Empress... Shouldn't you tell him about General Zelgius?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes...I suppose I should. Sephiran, Zelgius is dead... I know you put a lot of trust in him, but he was also closely allied with Daein. I'm sure you've heard of Daein's so-called Black Knight? Sephiran, the Black Knight was Zelgius.

speaker: Ike
text: ...But that's probably not news to you, is it? After all, it was you he was taking orders from.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Wha-?! Ike? What are you saying?!

speaker: Ike
text: A man like Zelgius could never serve conflicting interests... Never. Everything he did, he did for one master. Isn't that so, Sephiran?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I think I understand! You wanted to monitor events within Daein! You sent Zelgius as a spy.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Precisely. I felt it important to observe King Ashnard carefully... That was my goal.

speaker: Sephiran
text: At the time, it was relatively easy to get an outsider close to the king. Ashnard was famous for employing powerful men with no regard for their background or social status.

speaker: Ike
text: Obviously, he would have needed no convincing once he saw the bladework of General Zelgius.

speaker: Ike
text: The Black Knight tried to take the medallion from my father, and killed him. Tell me, Sephiran, whose plan was that?! Ashnard's...or yours?!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Calm down, Ike! Sephiran? Would you please explain?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sir Ike, I'm afraid your father's death was an unfortunate result of Zelgius's own personal agenda. I did not order Sir Gawain killed. However, I must admit that I did ask him to seize the medallion and hand it over to King Ashnard. The goddess was to be freed...and all living creatures destroyed.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Come again?!

speaker: Ike
text: You're insane!

speaker: Sephiran
text: I couldn't be more sane, Sir Ike. Attend and learn... My aim has always been to wake Ashera so that she might pass judgment on all the people of the world. What I needed was a war that would spread all across the continent. How could I achieve this? My attention turned to the young Daein prince... I could use the fiery Ashnard for my purposes. He was ambitious, a fierce warrior, and more than anything, he had an earnest desire to change the world. When I allowed him to know of the goddess sealed inside the medallion, he became determined to set her free. We could use heron galdrar or a massive, continent-spanning war to throw the world into chaos.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Lord Sephiran, what are you saying? Are you saying you wanted this? You can't be serious!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sanaki, my long life has shown me the people of this world deserve only destruction. The selfishness, the brutality... The disregard for others, the endlessly quarreling laguz and beorc. We have been given many chances to correct our behavior and ourselves, and have squandered them all. The only remaining hope for a peaceful, orderly world is for Ashera to wipe us all out and begin again. To fulfill my ambition of destroying all beings, I had to use you... I had to betray you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: This is some kind of monstrous joke...

speaker: Ike
text: So you've been pulling the strings all along?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Correct.

speaker: Ike
text: Beyond just Empress Sanaki, you were trusted by a lot of people. Sephiran, I need to understand... Did you really betray all of those people?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I did.

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t need to hear anything else, then. I’m going to make your death as painful as I know how.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't get it... Why would you wake the goddess to pass judgment on us? Tell us why! How could you want that?!

speaker: Sephiran
text: It wouldn't make any difference if I told you. You would have to live a few centuries before you could understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Years ago, my father went into hiding with the medallion. At the time, he got help from both you and Zelgius. Does this have anything to do with that?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Hmm, you seem to have sparked a distant memory of mine.

speaker: Ike
text: Answer me. Why did you do this?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I'm sorry, I can't tell you. At least, not in any way you would understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Then I'll have to make you talk!

speaker: Sanaki
text: This can't be happening! I won't fight you Sephiran. I can't!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Poor Sanaki.... You'll have no choice but to fight. The doors leading to Ashera are sealed by my very own magic. Killing me is your only way through.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran!

speaker: Yune
text: So it was you?  All those memories penetrating my mind were yours... Since we entered this place, I've seen what you've been thinking, Lehran. Give it up.

speaker: Sephiran
