text: Goddess Yune... Why do you insist on calling me that name? I discarded it so long ago, Yune. I've changed. Lehran is a thing of the past. All I want now...is the end of all that is. Please don't stop me.

speaker: Yune
text: Lehran...

speaker: Sephiran
text: You're running out of time. At this rate, I wouldn't count on being able to face the goddess. I would hate to see you denied after coming all this way.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Well, now you know who brought you here and why... I suppose that just leaves our fight to the death to take care of.

speaker: Gareth
text: I am about to tell you a very old story--a story you should know, as the new king of Goldoa. This is one of the oldest and most heavily guarded secrets in all of Tellius. You'll find no trace of it in any histories or sagas.

speaker: Micaiah
text: If it's that important, maybe we should go somewhere else. Other people might hear us.

speaker: Gareth
text: Hmm. What do you think, Nasir?

speaker: Nasir
text: I called upon Lady Micaiah because I felt that she should know the story as well. No... I think now is the time to let everyone know. Would that be all right, Your Majesty?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: There will be no secrets from now on. Tell us everything.

speaker: Gareth
text: As you wish, Your Majesty. In the dawn of this age, after the goddesses began their long slumber, the kingdom of Begnion was established. In those early days, laguz and beorc lived side by side in harmony and peace. Yes, that kingdom would become the Begnion Empire. The hero Altina was chosen to be the kingdom's first queen. Lehran supported her as an advisor...and as a husband.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What!?

speaker: Nasir
text: Despite their differences, Lehran and Altina loved each other very deeply.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: The people accepted a marriage between a laguz and a beorc?

speaker: Nasir
text: That was what King Dheginsea said. This was before the people thought of such differences. They saw only a queen and her husband.

speaker: Gareth
text: At this time, King Dheginsea also created his own kingdom far from other laguz tribes and beorc nations. He believed that the dragon tribe was too powerful to interact equally with other tribes and peoples. That kingdom became Goldoa.

speaker: Nasir
text: Begnion had been established for four years when King Dheginsea received news that Altina had become pregnant. The news brought great joy. You see, the news was also quite surprising. There had been other unions between beorc and laguz, but until Altina's pregnancy, no children had ever been conceived. Indeed, hers was the first child ever to be born of beorc and laguz.

speaker: Gareth
text: As close friends of both Altina and Lehran, both King Dheginsea and Soan rejoiced at the news. The child would be the first to carry the joined blood of both laguz and beorc. The king said that the baby would become a symbol of peace between the two peoples.

speaker: Nasir
text: But joy over the child's birth did not last. Soon after the child was born, Lehran lost all the powers of the laguz. He could not transform any longer, nor could he sing galdrar.

speaker: Gareth
text: It became apparent that the child of such a union neutralizes the laguz parent's powers. To make matters worse, the child bears only the characteristics of a beorc.

speaker: Nasir
text: Lehran felt he was no longer a true laguz, and felt he could no longer act as a bridge between the goddess and the people of Tellius. He lost hope, and also his mind...at least temporarily. He attempted suicide several times, which is an unthinkable taboo for anyone who has sworn to serve the goddess.

speaker: Gareth
text: King Dheginsea fell into despair. If people caught wind of this news, he believed it would create a deep rift between the two peoples. The king was especially concerned about the reaction from the laguz. They might interpret the birth as a herald of their eventual end. Some might even attempt to harm the child.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Lehran needed to hear the voice of the goddess then more than ever before... But he could no longer sing the galdr of release. Is that what happened?

speaker: Nasir
text: Just so. Lehran was forced to make a very difficult decision to protect the peace between beorc and laguz. He decided to retreat into seclusion and consider the problem. Once he regained his sanity, he announced his decision.

speaker: Gareth
text: Lehran was forced to ask the  unthinkable of his wife, his aides, and close friends: "For the sake of Begnion, you must tell the people that I died in an accident. Tell them the birth was merely a false rumor."

speaker: Nasir
text: Lehran left the medallion to his tribe, moving to Goldoa under King Dheginsea's protection. He simply disappeared from history after that.

speaker: Gareth
text: After Lehran had left and life returned to normal, Altina eventually welcomed a beorc husband. She raised the child she'd had with Lehran as though it were an ordinary beorc child, born of her new husband. Since then, marriages between laguz and beorc have been forbidden. It became known as a "crime against the goddess."

speaker: Nasir
text: Even so, the taboo was broken several times over the next few decades. Usually no child was conceived, but when there was, it was swiftly covered up. The parents soon learned what it meant to bear a child who possessed both laguz and beorc blood. After they learned of the consequences, none of these parents ever rejected the edict forbidding it.

speaker: Gareth
text: The child was to be raised by the beorc parent, and raised as a beorc child. That should have been enough to hide everything, end of story.

speaker: Nasir
text: It was several generations later that the certain descendants began to manifest physical marks which indicated their ancestors' sins. Fortunately, this mark looked very similar to the marks on those protected by spirits. They could pass as students of the dark arts for at least a few years. Unfortunately, the Branded lived much longer than beorc.

speaker: Gareth
text: Most Branded chose to hide, living outside of ordinary society, and they disappeared into the shadows of history. Rumors had already begun to spread across Begnion, however. The Branded were shunned and cast out wherever they lived. Where the laguz held power, they persecuted the Branded and executed them in honor killings.

speaker: Micaiah
text: That's horrible!

speaker: Gareth
text: It was King Dheginsea's opinion that these were crimes that he had to carry on his conscience. From the beginning, he realized that he and the others in power had made a mistake. They understood that they should have revealed everything about Altina and Lehran's child. The people should have been told the truth. But since they'd kept the truth from everyone, the Branded were marked as unclean, persecuted wherever they traveled.

speaker: Nasir
text: Here is the family tree for Lehran and Altina's bloodline. Only King Dheginsea knew the truth. Until now.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father... You've had to endure this burden alone for so long.

speaker: Gareth
text: It was the same in Lady Almedha's case. When she lost her powers after giving birth to the Mad King's son, King Dheginsea had no choice but to hide the truth from everyone. So he chose to hide Almedha from everyone. Better to deny her existence than be forced to explain long-hidden secrets.

speaker: Nasir
text: In the process, he'd lost someone even more dear to him. Prince Rajaion. He deeply regretted his decision when he learned of the prince's death. The only choice left for King Dheginsea was to remain stubbornly neutral in all wars on the continent. He hoped--in vain--to keep the goddess from waking up before the thousand years had elapsed.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I'm such a fool... I had no idea what Father went through. All I did was deny what he fought for.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Kurth...

speaker: Gareth
text: Your Majesty. You are the king now. ?You know that it is a sin to fight against the goddess, and yet you've chosen to move forward.

speaker: Nasir
text: King Dheginsea left everything to you. You must succeed. Do not be afraid of what lies beyond. Forge ahead.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I understand. I shall be true to my convictions. I have no more doubts.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir!

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike. I’m sorry about earlier.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s all right. I know that you were in a tight spot.

speaker: Gareth
text: Ahh, the beorc hero. We will follow King Kurthnaga from now on. If he wishes to fight alongside you, I shall assist.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. Then you should receive a blessing of protection from the goddess Yune.

speaker: Nasir
text: We already have. We can fight Ashera now.

speaker: Ike
text: You’d lend us all of your might?

speaker: Nasir
text: Of course.

speaker: Gareth
text: We swear upon the good name of the dragon tribe that we shall do our best.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Mortals cannot stand against gods! Don't you see the futility of what you're doing?

speaker: Sephiran
text: The laguz and beorc have doomed each other with their mutual hatred. You have brought extinction on yourselves!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Go back to your forest, heron. You are like me, an avatar of order. You understand what I must do. Bask in the light of Ashera's judgment. It holds no fear for you!

speaker: Reyson
text: I refuse to save only myself. Such an act would be an unforgivable betrayal. I will stand by my companions, and fight to the end.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Are you sure you're of the heron tribe? I've never met a heron like you... Your will is extraordinarily strong.

speaker: Rafiel
text: It is you… Now that I’ve seen your face… I know that you once went by another name.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You are mistaken. I am known as Sephiran, and nothing else.

speaker: Rafiel
text: You have closed your heart. Why?

speaker: Sephiran
text: …I have nothing more to say. Nothing.

speaker: Leanne
text: (You… It… it can’t be…)

speaker: Sephiran
text: (Go back to the forest. This is not where you should be.)

speaker: Leanne
text: (No! I’m staying here with everyone! These people are my friends… my family! I will not leave them!)

speaker: Sephiran
text: Has the heron clan changed so much? They’ve always been so passive and accepting of their natural fate…

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...Sephiran... Everything you've ever told me, every time you gave your hand to me, every time you smiled... They were all lies? ...You're the most appalling fraud I've ever known!

speaker: Sephiran
text: No, Lady Sanaki... I've actually lied to you very little. What I have done is hold things back. I've also twisted the truth from time to time... But I have only told you one blatant falsehood. That one lie has weighed heavily on me. It makes me hate myself sometimes.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran...

speaker: Sephiran
text: I'll always care deeply for you, my little Lady Sanaki... You are my sun and my moon. I never wished to harm you. Please... You must understand...

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...No! Sephiran, no!

speaker: Jill
text: It's your fault what happened in Daein! Every pointless death in this war is on your head! Sephiran, Duke of Persis... History will remember you as the worst kind of man.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Everything. It's all been my fault. You should know one more thing, however. I also had a hand in the death of your father.

speaker: Jill
text: ...Die, monster!

speaker: Haar
text: We never spent much time together when I was in Begnion... But, Sephiran... I think I know you pretty well.

speaker: Sephiran
text: I haven't forgotten you, Haar. Shiharam's hotshot young protege. You were both exemplary soldiers. Your defection from the Begnion dracoknights was a huge loss.

speaker: Haar
text: Hmmm... Sort of like the huge loss when the senators managed to defeat all those great changes you proposed?

speaker: Haar
text: I suppose if any of those changes had happened, we wouldn't be here now. Am I wrong?

speaker: Sephiran
text: An interesting question... I'm honestly not sure, but that's all I can say about that.

speaker: Haar
text: Too bad. For you, and for me.

speaker: Sephiran
text: King Naesala, it seems as if everything went well with the pact.

speaker: Naesala
text: Yes, for which I am thankful. The blood pact yoked Kilvas to your country’s control… but we no longer suffer the curse for opposing the tyrannical edicts of your corrupt, bloated senators. Present company excluded, of course.

speaker: Sephiran
text: I’m quite glad to hear it.

speaker: Naesala
text: You shouldn’t be. You’re not like the other senators, but your insane agenda has turned my nation to stone! Freedom means nothing to a statue.

speaker: Sephiran
text: My goal was simply to save Sanaki. With your help, she is safe. The mutual benefit of your country was a happy accident, so don’t feel indebted to me.

speaker: Naesala
text: So you won’t object when I tear your lungs out here and now?

speaker: Sephiran
text: By all means. Be my guest.

speaker: Nailah
text: Who would’ve guessed that a madman on the other side of the desert would somehow threaten Hatari?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Hatari. I’m sorry I didn’t get a chance to see it. The wolf tribe has survived all this time in the far corner of the world. Only the goddess could have known that.

speaker: Nailah
text: Perhaps even she didn’t know it. Your goddess isn’t perfect, you know. Does an imperfect goddess have the right to judge imperfect beings?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I see your point. Does the creator retain the right to destroy her creations when they are no longer what she envisioned? I imagine we could discuss this sometime… if only we had more time. I believe you alone might be able to sway my opinion on this, Lady Nailah, Queen of Wolves.

speaker: Nailah
text: You have too many opinions. I’m done talking.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Duke of Tanas, imagine seeing you here!

speaker: Oliver
text: Lord Sephiran, as lovely as always. But has it come to this? Must we fight to the death, and deprive the world of one of our beautiful countenances? Can other lovers of beauty endure such a loss?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I confess that your presence has me bewildered. Could this be part of Yune’s plan? I simply never would have imagined you here. Your presence proves that Tellius is unravelling at the seams. Judgement cannot come soon enough.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Lord Sephiran, explain yourself! Your reasons for deceiving our empress may prevent me from striking you down as an enemy to the crown!

speaker: Sephiran
text: I have nothing to say to you. I am merely an obstacle. Do what you must do.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Sanaki trusted you! And so did I. You’ve turned your back on us, and the empire. How is that even possible?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sigrun, do with me what you will. Promise me that you will look after Lady Sanaki from now on.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I will. I will protect her from the likes of you.

speaker: Tanith
text: So as long as you’re alive, the doors don’t open? I’ve got an easy solution to that problem.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Tanith, you are a kind woman.

speaker: Tanith
text: Don’t flatter yourself. I do this only for Lady Sanaki.

speaker: Astrid
text: Lord Sephiran, your every action in office earned you the trust of millions of Begnion citizens. I can’t believe that you could stab every one of them in the back like that.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Young lady… Actually, I should address you properly… Astrid of the Crimean Royal Knights. Did you happen to stop by your home on the way here?

speaker: Astrid
text: No, I didn’t.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Aren’t you worried about your family? Perhaps you should check on them…

speaker: Astrid
text: No. Everyone’s fine. Even if they’re frozen solid, I’m going to save them. I have nothing at all to worry about.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You’ve grown stronger. But your heart hasn’t changed. Good.

speaker: Sephiran
text: King Pelleas, correct? Aren't you brave, coming all this way!

speaker: Pelleas
text: If you're the one who's been pulling the strings behind all this, please tell me... Who... Who am I?

speaker: Sephiran
text: ...I don't know. All I know is that you are a powerful practitioner of magic... I know you were an orphan born and raised in Daein. But that is all Izuka ever told me.

speaker: Pelleas
text: So... I'm not Ashnard's true son?

speaker: Sephiran
text: No, you're not. Ashnard's son is of dragon tribe blood and is thus Branded.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I think I'm going to be ill...

speaker: Sephiran
text: Be assured that you were essential to Daein's reconstruction, which was a vital step towards waking the goddess. Fortunately, Izuka was able to use you to execute my plan.

speaker: Pelleas
text: You are going to pay! You are going to...BLAAARRRGH!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Hello, King Tibarn.. I thought I might see you. Only the strongest reach the top. It's only natural that you would be among them.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You know what? I don't believe you're the big, bad, evil guy you want us to think you are.

speaker: Sephiran
text: What could you be talking about?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, I was right! I see it in your eyes. I've been around for a while, and learned a bit about spotting fakes. So now that your secret's out, maybe you'd like to open up and tell me: Who are you really?

speaker: Sothe
text: Here goes...

speaker: Sephiran
text: Hello, child... I'm a little surprised to see an ordinary boy like you, fighting for the world. This day is full of surprises!

speaker: Sothe
text: No one's more surprised than me. I can't read people's feelings like Micaiah... I'm not invincible in battle like Ike... Between all these laguz kings and great beorc heroes, I don't really belong here.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Then why are you here?

speaker: Sothe
text: Because there's one thing that I can't afford to lose. Micaiah. I've come all this way just to protect her... I won't lose her now.

speaker: Sephiran
text: The depth of your feelings... Might I ask your name?

speaker: Sothe
text: Sothe. Now if you want to stand in our way, I'm prepared to cut you down.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You... I've heard about you. Have we...met before?

speaker: Sephiran
text: The Silver-Haired Maiden. It's taken so long to finally meet you. If I had known you still lived, I... I... No, it's too late. This changes nothing. I cannot falter.

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is the matter with you?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I'm just overly sensitive. Don't feign concern over me.

speaker: Ike
text: I have to ask, Sephiran. What are you after? What's this all about?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Why do you wish to know? You would achieve nothing by learning my reasons. You would help no one. I lost faith in lesser beings, and desire an end to them. That's all.

speaker: Ike
text: So why did you save me on that day?

speaker: Sephiran
text: May I ask you a favor, Ike? Tell me how you feel about it now. Can you bear recalling those horrific memories?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes... I'm fine, now. But I suppose at the time I wouldn't have been able to take it.

speaker: Sephiran
text: All beings endure tragedies for as long as they continue to live. It has always been the case that suffering is unavoidable. And this grim reality plays out over and over, in every country, under every ruler... As long as there are beings who feel, they will feel pain.

speaker: Ike
text: So what? We should all just give in and die? Put it behind you. Deal with it.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Do not make light of this...

speaker: Ike
text: I'm not. Sephiran, I'm extremely grateful that you once helped me through a terrible time. But I have accepted that occasionally we all have to deal with hard times. I've had pain, I've had suffering, and I have gotten up and moved on. I don't try to forget what happened that day. I just accept it... And neither that or anything else will ever stop me.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You are a strong man, Ike, son of Gawain. But not everyone is as strong as you...

speaker: Sephiran
text: At last... I'm dying.

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: What? It can't be true! Our apostle...

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: Can't believe it myself. But the senators made an announcement! It must be true!

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Pardon me? Has something happened to the apostle?

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: Oh, my lord sage! The apostle! She's...she's dead.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: What? How?

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: According to the senators' announcement, she was assassinated by the Serenes herons.

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: They look so gentle, like they couldn't harm a fly, but... They're nothing but beasts, no better than the other sub-humans!

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Peace, friends! This is simply not possible. The heron tribe could never assassinate anyone, they...

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: She's dead, isn't she? Those damned sub-humans... Every last one of 'em's got to die! For the apostle!

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: That's the truth! They're nothing but monsters! Oh, I wish I could kill them myself!

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: You can! Grab a weapon! Grab a torch! Come on! We'll burn that forest to ash and wipe 'em all out.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: ...No, you mustn't...

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: What's wrong, my lord sage? You don't look well. Are you feeling all right?

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Ungh!

speaker: Female Voice 1
text: GWAAAAAHHHH! Wings! From the sage's back! Wings... He's one of them! He's a monster!

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: You're nothin' but a lying sub-human piece of filth! How dare you pretend to be one of us! Get him!

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: The medallion must be quelled. I cannot allow this madness to come to pass! Judgment...the goddess's judgment...

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: NO! What have they done? The forest...the trees... The herons were innocent... Why?

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: The medallion... I must quell the chaotic energies! Must...calm them...

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Ungh! NO! Chaos...madness... So much...anger...so much...pain...

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Why? Why was my family taken? Why? Why was my forest destroyed? The apostle did not deserve this fate... Killed by her innocence...her murderers free to seize power... This is monstrous! This world does need beorc. And the laguz...are deeply flawed. There is no need to wait for the covenant's thousand years. Awaken! Oh, Goddess. Awaken...and judge.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Sephiran!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran! Hold on! Open your eyes!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune...help me. What should I do? ...What? Really? ...OK. I'll try.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sana...ki...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran! You can hear me?! S-somebody help! He's wounded!

speaker: Yune
text: I'm sorry, Sanaki. The doors leading to Ashera won't open while he's alive. I can't save him.

speaker: Sephiran
text: That's correct. Thank you, Yune. I am sincerely grateful.

speaker: Yune
text: Death is all you've wanted since this started. Everything else has been little more than a terrible side effect. I'm sorry that this was your only goal, but I am happy to help you achieve it. Sephiran, I see now what you were going through. It must have been hard. I wish I could have helped you.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Please. Don't mourn for me. I'm not worth it.

speaker: Yune
text: I'm so sorry. I wanted to help you! I really did!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Forget about me. This path was my decision...my tragic mistake.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Lady... Sanaki... I want you to...have this. This is...the Rudol Gem. Wear it...in memory of me. It will protect you. Please forgive me... I'm sorry I...lied to you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran... Don't worry. We still have all the time we spent together... Nobody can take that away. Nobody.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Thank you... My Lady Sanaki... I'll...be leaving you now. Zel...gius...is waiting.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran... No... Nooooooooo!

speaker: Ike
text: Ashera is waiting just beyond those doors... Let’s go.

speaker: Yune
text: I’m sorry, Sephiran. I once lost hope in the laguz and beorc, too. I can see now that my punishment was far too strict. I was young and naive, and so sure that I was right. I wish I could have shown you the error of my ways, Sephir-- Lehran. Good-bye.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran... Don’t worry. We still have all the time we spent together... Nobody can take that away. Nobody.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Thank you... My Lady Sanaki... I’ll...be leaving you now. Zel...gius...is waiting. ...Al...ti...na...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sephiran! No... Noooooooo!

speaker: Yune
text: Now! Please, Micaiah!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Don’t die... You can’t die...

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...He's...breathing? Sephiran is breathing!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Ahh... Just in time.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You saved him! Thank you! Micaiah, thank you!

speaker: Yune
text: Micaiah is completely spent. She's sorry, but she won't be able to fight in the next battle. But there's no time. Hurry!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Goddess Yune. Is there something you haven't told us about you and Sephiran?

speaker: Yune
text: He saved my life.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Y-your life? Sephiran saved the life of a goddess? Is there something you haven't told us about Sephiran, then? Yune: He'll wake up in just a moment. Then you can ask him directly.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh. All right, I'll do that.

speaker: Ike
text: Why did you save him?

speaker: Yune
text: Should I not have?

speaker: Ike
text: I can think of a few reasons why you shouldn't have, yes!

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Get up. Now.

speaker: Yune
text: Take it easy on him! He's had a hard day!

speaker: Sephiran
text: ...unh... ...hhhuuunnn.... I... I'm alive?

speaker: Yune
text: Lehran!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Goddess Yune... Why? Why did you--

speaker: Yune
text: Because I want you to live! You've always taken care of me, and I couldn't bear it if it ended like this.

speaker: Sephiran
text: But...I've lost all my hope. All hope in the world and the people in it... I did what I did...for future generations, so they wouldn't have to live in this world. Please, Yune, let me die.

speaker: Yune
text: I won't, Lehran. I won't!

speaker: Ike
text: Lehran? Now he's some kind of hero-saint?

speaker: Ike
text: If death is what you really want, then I'm not going to let it happen on my watch. I don't care what you've gone through. I don't care how much you've suffered. What you've done is unforgivable.

speaker: Yune
text: Stop it, Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Ashera is waiting. It's time for the final confrontation with her. You can come... If you want to.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You... You're asking me to turn my back on goddess Ashera?

speaker: Ike
text: If you really want the total extinction of beorc and laguz alike, then you can just lie here like a lump. If not, this is your last chance to start rectifying your mistakes. Think hard on that.

speaker: Yune
text: But...Ike!

speaker: Yune
text: I'll be waiting for you, Lehran.

speaker: Senator
text: General Zelgius! Why did you retreat so quickly?! Order an all-out attack!

speaker: Zelgius
text: The Laguz Alliance is inching closer after successfully crossing the river. It would be unwise to attack them head-on at this time.

speaker: Senator
text: At this time? That is for me to decide! You are a fool, Zelgius! The senate wants all sub-humans roaming our lands to be exterminated at once! I forbid you to retreat from now on! Am I understood, Zelgius?

speaker: Levail
text: Pardon my impertinence, but that is madne--

speaker: Zelgius
text: I understand, my lord. I will do my best to end this fighting as soon as possible.

speaker: Levail
text: But, General Zelgius!

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius! Why didn't you say anything? The senator's orders are madness!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Don't make me repeat myself. We soldiers are in no position to question the orders of our superiors.

speaker: Levail
text: But I thought... No, I was certain that you would steer the military in the right direction.

speaker: Levail
text: General Zelgius! ...

speaker: Soren
text: I'm late. My apologies.

speaker: Skrimir
text: Ah, here comes the great strategist! Don't be so shy. Come sit next to me.

speaker: Soren
text: Not if you begged me, Skrimir.

speaker: Titania
text: Soren! I'm so sorry. He's rude to everyone, but strangers especially.

speaker: Skrimir
text: You still don't trust me? Then I will take the first step. I admit that we won the last battle thanks to your cleverness. I underestimated the wisdom of the beorc. As a general of Gallia, you have my thanks.

speaker: Soren
text: ...You're welcome.

speaker: Skrimir
text: What do we do next? We hit Begnion hard in the last battle. Surely we will use this opportunity to wipe out the enemy entirely?

speaker: Soren
text: Actually, it would be unwise to launch a new offensive now. I recommend we negotiate a peace treaty with Begnion.

speaker: Skrimir
text: What?! You'd give up our best opportunity to crush Begnion for some peace treaty?!

speaker: Soren
text: For once, please try to think for a moment, Skrimir. Yes, we crossed the river, but we haven't so much as touched the Central Army. Not one scratch. Consequently, Begnion still has the advantage. It would be foolish to press the attack.

speaker: Skrimir
text: I must ask you to think harder! A peace treaty? Now? My soldiers will never accept this! We need another way!

speaker: Ike
text: What do you think, Ranulf? Do you feel the same way?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well... It's not so much how I feel, but how we laguz are as a species. Once the fighting begins, laguz can't see anything except the enemy in front of them. In a long fight like this, it's even harder to keep ourselves in check.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The same goes for my tribe. If we were to stop fighting now, I'd have to go around knocking every one of my men unconscious.

speaker: Ranulf
text: But rushing headlong into the enemy and getting killed is not an option. Soren, can you think of something? ...Maybe it's too much to ask.

speaker: Soren
text: No, I can do it... ...Just let me think.  ...All right, I have it. Gather around the map. I'll explain what we have to do.

speaker: Lyre
text: Hey, Captain Ranulf! The hawk king's decoy attack got the Begnion forces to move out!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Good. Our unit will hit them from the north, Ike from the south, and Skrimir from the west. I'm impressed. If everything goes according to plan, Soren will have delivered another easy victory.

speaker: Kyza
text: Captain! We appear to have a situation! General Skrimir's western forces are charging down the cliff!

speaker: Ranulf
text: What?! I told him to keep his men under control at all costs!

speaker: Kyza
text: Apparently, an enemy commander challenged General Skrimir to a duel. He accepted, of course. He always was an impatient one. The challenger was a large raven-haired beorc, clad in stunning crimson armor.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That must be Zelgius. No, no, no! Skrimir can't win. He'll get slaughtered! Send a message to Tibarn and Ike. Tell them I'm going to save Skrimir. We can't let him do this!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! A company of enemy troops has appeared to the south of Skrimir's forces.

speaker: Soren
text: General Zelgius seems to be in command.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh oh. That's not good.

speaker: Soren
text: If Skrimir's force collapses, we'll get penned in by Begnion. We must change our strategy. Ike, let's help with the rescue. You can't take everyone, though. Assemble a strike force to accompany you.

speaker: Ike
text: Got it. Titania, let Tibarn know what's going on.

speaker: Ike
text: Where's Skrimir?

speaker: Ranulf
text: He charged up that cliff, chasing after Zelgius.

speaker: Ike
text: We have to get up there. The two of us might be able to save him from Zelgius.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Kyza, can you carve us a path to the top?

speaker: Kyza
text: Certainly, Captain. I'd be happy to. We'll neutralize anyone in your way. You can count on me, sir.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. Let's clear this pass. Time is a factor here, everyone, so let's make this quick!

speaker: Callum
text: None shall pass. General Zelgius forbids it!

speaker: Callum
text: So, sub-human. Are you worried about your general?

speaker: Ranulf
text: You bet I'm worried! Without us looking after him, who knows what kind of trouble that hothead might get himself into! You can see we're in a big hurry. Get out of my way, or I'll move you. Painfully.

speaker: Callum
text: Never! If you wish to reach the top, you must "move" me. Do your best, sub-human.

speaker: Callum
text: You will not gain the peak, nor shall I yield my position. You will wait for the duel to finish.

speaker: Ike
text: Duel?

speaker: Callum
text: Correct. The general does not wish to be disturbed during his duel. I'm certain that it will be over very soon. You may then pass and fetch the carcass of your general.

speaker: Callum
text: You are too late... The general... He is strong...

speaker: Ranulf
text: I have a bad feeling about this... Ike! Com on, there's no more time!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf, this way! Hurry!

speaker: Ranulf
text: No!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Skrimir!

speaker: Ike
text: Stop, Ranulf! Don't get too close!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Heed my words, Laguz Alliance! I am Zelgius, general of the Begnion Central Army! Your general has fallen to my blade in single combat! My army does not wish to continue this senseless bloodshed. Leave this place immediately! Soldiers of Begnion! I forbid you to attack the fleeing laguz soldiers! This fight is finished!

speaker: Begnion
text: General Zelgius is amazing! He kept the damage on both sides to a minimum!

speaker: Begnion
text: Yeah, that's great, but... I wanted to fight! How am I going to get my kid a stuffed laguz now?

speaker: Gallia
text: No... General Skrimir was defeated?! By a beorc?!

speaker: Gallia
text: If General Skrimir is defeated, we must fight on in his name! We must get revenge! Don't be fooled by that human! Fight on, brothers!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Stop! We will fall back! Brothers, listen to me! I swear upon my life that I'll take Skrimir back with us! Fall back!

speaker: Zelgius
text: A wise choice.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Levail. Go back to base camp. I have business to take care of.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What are you plotting? You could have crushed us.

speaker: Zelgius
text: True. That's exactly what the heads of the senate want. But the apostle feels differently. The apostle wishes to resolve this conflict peacefully. Begnion is not united on this idea, however. So, how about this? Arrange a peace proposal from your people. The apostle would accept it.

speaker: Ike
text: But...to begin a peace talk under the current circumstances...

speaker: Zelgius
text: The most favorable opportunity for a peace talk would have been when you crossed the river. You missed that chance, and now look at where you are.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Think it over. I'll give you three days. Request a peace talk within that time. If that isn't possible, negotiations are over. I sincerely hope that won't be the case.  As for the heir of King Caineghis, he will be fine. Treat his wounds quickly.

speaker: Ike
text: You mean you didn't finish him off? Why not?

speaker: Zelgius
text: It does not matter who the enemy is. If there is a way to avoid taking a life, that is the path I will choose. Leave now. I swear upon my name that my men will not attack as you retreat.

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...Three days, huh? What will the beast tribe do, Ranulf? What will become of Gallia?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I'm sorry, Tibarn. Now that Skrimir has been incapacitated... Gallia can't go on any further.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Right... That's too bad. I guess the Laguz Alliance has to take a break, then.

speaker: Ike
text: What about you? Will Phoenicis agree to a peace talk?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I haven't decided. Our force lacks numbers and supplies. We can't possibly take them on, but... I imagine that a "peace talk" would be far from pleasant.

speaker: Ranulf
text: General Zelgius seems like a trustworthy beorc. I also know from the Mad King's War that even the apostle is not a bad person at heart. But in reality, the senate controls Begnion right now. They were the ones who killed our messenger.

speaker: Ike
text: I know that General Zelgius can't disobey orders from the senate. But what about the apostle? She's Begnion's supreme leader, right? Can't we just contact her directly?

speaker: Reyson
text: Trust me, we tried. All our efforts were in vain. It's not just the laguz, either. Tanith said that the apostle won't even meet with the Holy Guards these days.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Wait, she won't meet with Tanith? But Tanith has been at her side forever! There's something very wrong with all this...

speaker: Ike
text: What is happening in Begnion?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well, we'll stick around and see what happens. The Laguz Alliance will disband temporarily. The problem is Gallia's retreat. You've got a lot of ground to cover before Begnion attacks in three days.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Agreed...

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, you have no idea how happy you've made me! Do you have any idea how long I've been waiting for this?

speaker: Shinon
text: Hey, I'm a busy guy. But I'm glad to hear it, I guess.

speaker: Aimee
text: Don't be so cold! You could do this for me anytime, if you want. You know I'll pay good money.

speaker: Shinon
text: No thanks. It's more trouble than it's worth.

speaker: Aimee
text: I'll make it worth your time. How about it, baby? You could leave your mercenary lifestyle behind, and...

speaker: Ike
text: Uh... What the heck are you talking about?

speaker: Aimee
text: Ike! My hero! Are you here to see me?

speaker: Shinon
text: Hmph. I'm outta here.

speaker: Aimee
text: Hey, wait! What about what I owe you?

speaker: Shinon
text: Give it to him! And don't tell him anything that he doesn't need to know!

speaker: Aimee
text: ...And now he's gone. What a selfish man.

speaker: Ike
text: Care to tell me what's going on?

speaker: Aimee
text: Ike, no! Are you feeling jealous? Don't you worry, darling. There's only room for you in my heart. Really!

speaker: Ike
text: You're scaring me, Aimee.

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, come on. It's just a joke! Business only, I promise. First, this is for you.

speaker: Ike
text: A blue gem?

speaker: Aimee
text: You heard what the man said. I'm supposed to pay you instead.

speaker: Ike
text: You're paying us? I'm very confused. I'd assumed that Shinon owed you money, or something.

speaker: Aimee
text: No, no. Nothing like that. This is what I owe him for-- Oops, he told me not to say.

speaker: Ike
text: Aimee? I'm getting scared again.

speaker: Aimee
text: All right, fine. It's a payment for a bow.

speaker: Ike
text: A bow?

speaker: Aimee
text: I paid a lot for a bow he made me. I'm going to offer it as a one-of-a-kind item at the shop.

speaker: Ike
text: Right... Is that why Rolf is making bows now? He mentioned something about bows being good income in emergencies.

speaker: Aimee
text: Probably. Rolf is learning from a good teacher, but he's still no match for the master himself.

speaker: Ike
text: Rolf is Shinon's student?

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, dang. You think that was a secret, too?

speaker: Ike
text: How should I know? Shinon wouldn't tell me that he smelled smoke if I was on fire.

speaker: Aimee
text: Well... I don't think Shinon likes people. Especially you, for some reason. I wonder why he came back to you after he left the Greil Mercenaries during the war?

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon likes our little group. I know that much. This is probably his way of trying to help us be less broke.

speaker: Aimee
text: You think so? Why wouldn't he just come out and say so? He's so strange like that.

speaker: Ike
text: I'll keep this conversation a secret. I don't want to risk losing Shinon by putting him on the defensive about all this.

speaker: Aimee
text: Right. It's a secret between you and me, Ike!

speaker: Ranulf
text: King Tibarn! Queen Elincia! We may need to halt for a bit.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Why? What's the problem?

speaker: Ranulf
text: We have some stragglers lagging behind.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You mean Almedha and Pelleas are slowing us down again. We have to reach the Tower of Guidance as soon as possible. We can't have them always hampering our progress.

speaker: Elincia
text: But we have no idea when the Disciples of Order might attack. We need to keep everyone together, for safety's sake.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson! We'll rest here. You can land and give your wings a break.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Reyson, I remember when a trip like this would have exhausted you. I'm impressed at how well you're handling it.

speaker: Reyson
text: Yes, physically I'm quite healthy. But I can't say that I'm really happy about that...

speaker: Elincia
text: Why would that be?

speaker: Reyson
text: We of the heron clan can feel the energies of others. In times of war, negative energy is dominant, and we sicken. Now that all of the people have been turned to stone, the energy is gone and, physically, I feel much better. It's unsettling to feel healthy and know that the reason is such a sad one.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's a terrible irony... We finally have the peace we've been praying for, at the cost of all freedom, everywhere.

speaker: Reyson
text: Could this truly be the world that Goddess Ashera wants for us?

speaker: Ranulf
text: No, this is the world she had to give us after we ruined hers.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, welcome back. Any sign of the Disciples of Order?

speaker: Janaff
text: Unfortunately, no.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I don't like this. Why are they leaving us alone?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I'm not sure I see the problem, Tibarn. If they're going to let us stroll on through, I won't complain.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Not me. Right or wrong, I would prefer a stand-up fight. Right now, even.

speaker: Elincia
text: What are you saying, Tibarn? how could you wish that upon us? I don't understand you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Right now, the world is calm, peaceful...almost eerily so. It almost feels...comfortable. If this goes on, we might relax, lose our edge. I'm worried that we'll get careless.

speaker: Elincia
text: Hmm...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Everyone, let's get one thing perfectly clear here...This isn't a natural peace. It's Ashera's work. Don't forget for an instant that the world isn't supposed to be like this. It should be noisy, vibrant, and chaotic.

speaker: Elincia
text: You're right. A peace built on the sacrifice of so many lives is monstrous and unjust. It cannot be allowed to stand.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I didn't mean that I'm losing motivation to save the petrified people. It's just that, before we started talking about it, I was feeling...complacent. Is it just me?

speaker: Tibarn
text: The spirit of order is hanging heavy across the land. When we fight, we get a dose of chaos, which may help us get back in touch with our true selves. If our enemy has also figured that out, it might explain why they're staying away.

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas, dear, how are you feeling?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Mother, I'm fine. Please stop asking after my health.

speaker: Almedha
text: But you're so pale, darling. You were always such a sickly little boy... You should rest a while. We can't have you exhausting yourself.

speaker: Pelleas
text: No, Mother... If we stop walking now, we would slow the others.

speaker: Almedha
text: Never mind them, sweetheart, they can wait. You should take a nice rest under that tree. Son, remember that you are a scion of both Daein's and Goldoa's royal families! You are more important than any of these peasants! The others can certainly wait for you; don't spare a single thought for them.

speaker: Pelleas
text: L-let go of me! Leave me alone!

speaker: Almedha
text: Haah!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Mother!

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm sorry, Mother. I...

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas, wait! Pelleas!

speaker: Janaff
text: We've spotted the enemy! They're over there, to the southwest!

speaker: Tibarn
text: How did they get so close without being noticed? Did we have men out of position?

speaker: Ulki
text: No, I just checked in. Enemy forces just suddenly appeared, with no sign or warning at all.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Guess that's one good thing about fighting a goddess... Things are sure to be exciting. Everyone, get in position!

speaker: Reyson
text: ...An entire legion that can appear from nowhere? Who are these Disciples?

speaker: Tibarn
text: To be honest, I don't care who they are. I just want to knock a little disorder back into the world.

speaker: Valtome
text: My humblest apologies. I hope we didn't sneak up on you. I'm sure that cheeky little queenlet is still amongst you? I hope so. I'm going to make her pay for defying me! Uwee hee hee!

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm sorry to be late! What unit would you like me to support?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Oh, King Pelleas. ?You shouldn't...endanger yourself. Besides, I don't think we'll have too much trouble with these guys.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I appreciate your concern, but as the king of Daein, I fight for the people of all free countries. It is my duty.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Wait, where is your mother?

speaker: Pelleas
text: W-well...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Listen, I don't know what she's been telling you, but don't throw your life away. I appreciate that you want to help, but this battle is beyond you. Try to stay out of the way.

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...Y-yes, sir.

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee hee! Uwee hee hee! I have always known that only I, Valtome, possessed the grace and beauty to be chosen by the goddess! How wonderful to finally be recognized for my excellence! If only that insufferable Zelgius could see me now! I am divinity! Uwee hee hee!

speaker: Valtome
text: You are no soldier! Who are you, boy?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I... I am Pelleas, king of Daein.

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, how precious! I was hoping that I'd meet the simpering moron who signed the blood pact with Lekain... Uwee hee hee!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Y-you will regret this!

speaker: Valtome
text: Ah, there you are, Queen of Hayseeds! I look forward to scraping you off my immaculate nails! Uwee hee hee hee!

speaker: Elincia
text: Lord Valtome, I desire no battle with you. Withdraw your troops immediately. If you do so, no more lives will be lost.

speaker: Valtome
text: Uwee hee...uwee hee hee... Are you touched as well as homely? I offer YOU the chance to surrender! But you, Elincia, I will only forgive if you beg. And crawl. And lick the sole of my left boot.

speaker: Elincia
text: I'm sorry that you feel that way. If that's how it has to be, may the goddess have mercy on you, Valtome.

speaker: Valtome
text: Zelgius... Where is Zelgius?! Do you think you can hide him? That man...must be...uwee hee hee...punished!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sorry to disappoint you, but Zelgius is my prey. There's no chance I'm passing him on to the likes of you.

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, how quaint...a bird. Do you seek to defeat me? Haven’t you herons learned it’s not safe to play with senators? Uwee hee hee! Beg for my mercy!

speaker: Reyson
text: Mercy will be done when you and your fellows are gone from this world.

speaker: Valtome
text: The so-called queen... Where is that brazen little hussy? Bring her before me! Now! Right away! Immediately!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Are you the best that Ashera could do? This really is the end of the world.

speaker: Valtome
text: You are no soldier! Who are you, boy?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I... I am Pelleas, king of Daein.

speaker: Valtome
text: Oh, how precious! I was hoping that I’d meet the simpering moron who signed the blood pact with Lekain... How funny! Uwee hee hee!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Y-you will regret this!

speaker: Valtome
text: Ah, a Crimean soldier, yes? Ugh! That queen of yours has no style! What ridiculous armor! You go out in that?

speaker: Kieran
text: I will brook no insult to my queen or my armor! You face Kieran, second commander of the Royal Knights...and your doom!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Whew, that's just what I needed! Queen Elincia, are you hurt?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Do you all feel as...alive as I do? This is proof that we need a little chaos. Everyone understand that now?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, but it doesn't make me fond of war. I know we can't stop, but...

speaker: Tibarn
text: I understand, Elincia. Your path is important, too. Leave the rough stuff to us.

speaker: Elincia
text: King Tibarn... Thank you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: That was some good work you did back there.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Haaaa haaa haaa...

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...OK, just relax. Get it together...

speaker: Pelleas
text: Haaa...haa...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hmm. I'll go get the others. You just sit down and catch your breath.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Haa huff... Ahem.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Considering he's the only son of Ashnard the Mad King, scourge of Crimea and butcher of innocents, he is quite the mama's boy.

speaker: Almedha
text: ... Hm?  Pelleas?!

speaker: Elincia
text: Queen Almedha... You shouldn't be out here all by yourself. It's dangerous.

speaker: Almedha
text: ...Queen Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: I was worried when I didn't see you at supper, so I came looking for you.

speaker: Almedha
text: Hmph. I didn't think anyone in this merry band cared about me. After all, my own son is trying to avoid me.

speaker: Elincia
text: Don't say that. A lot of things have just happened... I'm sure Pelleas is just confused. He'll come around.

speaker: Almedha
text: I hope you're right. Lady Elincia, can I ask you a question? What of your mother? Was she also turned to stone?

speaker: Elincia
text: No... My mother died three years ago. Both my mother and my father were killed by King Ashnard...

speaker: Almedha
text: By Ashnard? I-I'm sorry.

speaker: Elincia
text: Lady Almedha, you were King Ashnard's wife, correct?

speaker: Almedha
text: There was never a formal wedding ceremony, so I suppose some would call me a mistress... But I was the only one he could ever call his wife. And I'm the only one who can be called the mother of his child...

speaker: Elincia
text: King Pelleas.

speaker: Almedha
text: Yes, Pelleas. We were separated so long... Finally having him back is the greatest gift imaginable.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Forgive me for asking, but why did King Ashnard suddenly decide to invade Crimea? I want to know why my parents died.

speaker: Almedha
text: Truthfully, I don't know.

speaker: Elincia
text: You were closer to him than anyone. Didn't he say anything? Did he never explain his reasons?

speaker: Almedha
text: The last time I saw Ashnard was long ago, more than twenty years. I'm afraid I don't know many state secrets from after that point.

speaker: Elincia
text: But, why...

speaker: Almedha
text: You look so surprised. We had a falling out and ended up living separately... It happens rather a lot, I'm afraid.

speaker: Elincia
text: No, it's just that... Well, you said that King Ashnard had no other wives or children... I just assumed that you had always been by his side.

speaker: Almedha
text: Ha ha... There was always gossip, of course, and I hated it. But I know with absolute certainty... Ashnard had relations with no other woman. And so I said as much.

speaker: Elincia
text: So he did love you, in his own way?

speaker: Almedha
text: Love? Love?! Ha ha... Seriously... Ha ha ha...ha ha haa!

speaker: Elincia
text: Wh-what's so funny?

speaker: Almedha
text: There was no love between Ashnard and me. There was a strong mutual attraction between us, eventually resulting in a child... But all I ever was to him was a source of power. Once I became pregnant, I was useless to him. Bereft of my strength, he found my presence nothing more than an irritating distraction. After Pelleas was born, Ashnard became obsessed with the boy... But, once he realized Pelleas had no special powers... Ashnard rejected him, and used him as bait in a cruel trap for my brother...

speaker: Elincia
text: Lady Almedha?

speaker: Almedha
text: I... It's just that I...

speaker: Elincia
text: I'm sorry, it was not my place to ask.

speaker: Almedha
text: Where is he? Where is my Pelleas? He's the only thing that matters... I can't lose him...ever! Please, I beg of you. Bring me my Pelleas! Tell him his mother needs him... Hurry... Bring me my Pelleas!

speaker: Elincia
text: Of course. I-I'll bring him as soon as I can.

speaker: Almedha
text: Oh, Rajaion... I'm so sorry. Please forgive me...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson! Where are you!?

speaker: Reyson
text: Over here, Tibarn.

speaker: Tibarn
text: What are you doing so early in the morning?

speaker: Reyson
text: I’m hunting for treasure!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Could you repeat that?

speaker: Reyson
text: I believe it was the goddess Yune. She sent me a message in my sleep. I saw patches of ground that glowed. I went to one of those spots and found this.

speaker: Tibarn
text: A satori sign... Don’t see these very often. It’s a good find. But blast it, Reyson, why didn’t you wake me up?

speaker: Reyson
text: I didn’t know what I would find. Besides, you looked so comfortable.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hm. I didn’t even notice you’d snuck out. I can’t believe a heron snuck by me...

speaker: Reyson
text: Even heroes need their sleep to keep fighting, Tibarn. Where’s the harm in sleeping? I know that you haven’t had a good night’s rest since the incident in Phoenicis.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yeah. But you know, there must be something in the air... Despite all that’s happened I feel fantastic. It’s a perfect day for hunting treasure...and enemies.

speaker: Reyson
text: Excellent.

speaker: Jorge
text: Good morning, Queen Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh. Good morning, Jorge. It looks to be a pleasant day, doesn’t it?

speaker: Jorge
text: Indeed. And a splendid morning is the best time to present a queen with a fine gift.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, Jorge... Your kind thoughts are enough. You and Daniel have worked so hard to supply our army. If you have something for me, please let me pay you for it.

speaker: Daniel
text: Even under these circumstances, Queen Elincia, you always try to be good to us. That’s why we wanted to give you a gift. It’s a token of our appreciation.

speaker: Elincia
text: Daniel...

speaker: Daniel
text: We’ll take payment for everything else. But please, take this one item without any protests. It’s our pleasure.

speaker: Jorge
text: Please, Queen Elincia! We insist.

speaker: Elincia
text: Very well. I suppose it would be quite rude of me not to accept it.

speaker: Jorge
text: Wonderful!

speaker: Daniel
text: Here it is. Please use it with our compliments.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh... This is a fire tome.

speaker: Daniel
text: Yes. It’s a very valuable one.

speaker: Elincia
text: So I can see. I am not a mage, but I feel great power from this tome.

speaker: Jorge
text: Daniel and I happened to be in that building when there was the big flash of light. That’s how we escaped being turned to stone. But you avoided it because you were one of the chosen.

speaker: Daniel
text: But we still want to help you. We can collect weapons to help you in battle!

speaker: Jorge
text: Please, save the people who were turned to stone.

speaker: Daniel
text: Please give us the world we used to have.

speaker: Elincia
text: I promise you I will do my utmost. I’ll work toward it with everything I have. Together, we can accomplish anything.

speaker: Yune
text: How dull. I don't sense any enemies nearby. I know! Would you all like me to tell you a story as we climb?

speaker: Ike
text: What kind of story?

speaker: Yune
text: One from long ago, long before the grandparents of anyone here were born.

speaker: Yune
text: In the very beginning of this world...there was only water, until one day a girl appeared. The girl was very clever, and she forged the first land...then she made trees and flowers, and then she created beings.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The story of the grand creation? Heard it. Wake me when it's over.

speaker: Ike
text: The girl was you, right, Yune? Or are you talking about Ashera?

speaker: Yune
text: Both, really...and neither, actually. At first, the girl was excited by her new world, and she thought of little else. Then she started feeling lonely. Everyone, every being she'd created, was different from her. Not a single person that could truly understand her. All alone, she grew sadder and sadder, crying for thousands of years. Then some creatures began to grow and change, becoming more clever and sophisticated. They tried to comfort the girl and eventually grew closer to her... That was the birth of the Zunanma. They were your ancestors...beorc, laguz, everyone.

speaker: Sanaki
text: In Begnion, we are taught that the Zunanma were human—Uhm, I mean...beorc ancestors... ...It makes me wonder what else in my country has been warped beyond recognition.

speaker: Yune
text: It's possible that the truth was simply misunderstood. Like the way everyone calls me a dark god...

speaker: Yune
text: But let me continue... The Zunanma worshipped the girl as their own goddess. They said her hair was as striking a color as dawn's first light, so they gave her a name... The Goddess of Dawn. She was a much-loved goddess.

speaker: Ike
text: The Goddess of Dawn...

speaker: Yune
text: The Zunanma continued to evolve and change, giving rise to a variety of races and tribes across the land. Naturally, each of the races thought their own was superior to the others, and conflict arose between them.

speaker: Yune
text: The goddess tried to make peace among her people, but nothing could stop the warring Zunanma. Trying to separate the factions, the goddess gave them different names, laguz and beorc... But this only intensified their conflict.

speaker: Yune
text: And then...the great flood occurred.

speaker: Yune
text: The goddess was only trying to bring an end to the fighting. But her power was so great that all the continents were drowned in the flood, all except Tellius.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure about this story? It's very different from the histories that we've each been taught.

speaker: Elincia
text: Among beorc nations, we only know a vague fairy tale about the dark god stirring up a great disaster.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Neither the laguz nor the beorc have an accurate description by the sound of it. I wonder where the story got twisted.

speaker: Yune
text: There is another standing in our way... I have a feeling he might be able to tell us.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...Fa--...Father?

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: My father... Just beyond these doors, my father is waiting.

speaker: Ike
text: Dheginsea, king of Goldoa... He's supposed to be one of the three who defeated the dark god...Yune.

speaker: Yune
text: He has been blessed by Ashera. Not only that, but it's a powerful, resilient blessing from long ago. He may be nearly impossible to defeat. ...Let's get everyone together. There's no better time than now.

speaker: Yune
text: I was hoping to avoid this until we reached Ashera... Actually, I hoped not to have to do it at all... But she's left me with no choice. I will give you the blessings of Yune, goddess of chaos and freedom. In their natural state, the attacks of mortal creatures have no effect on divine beings.

speaker: Yune
text: When Ashera set out to defeat me, she gathered her strongest warriors and bestowed on them some of her power. This is called the Goddess's Blessing... She empowered the dual swords of the beorc swordswoman, Altina. The laguz warrior, Soan, and Dheginsea, the leader of the dragon tribe, were also blessed.

speaker: Yune
text: I failed then... But this time will be different. I'll use Ashera's own tricks, and I won't be defeated. Everyone... Take some time now to ready yourselves. Beorc, be sure to equip your best weapons. I'll begin when everyone's ready.

speaker: Yune
text: I think we're all ready. I'll need the laguz to transform.

speaker: Yune
text: Let's begin.

speaker: Yune
text: OK, I'm all done now. Whew... I... That was really hard... I think I... I think I need to rest.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah? Are you feeling all right? You don't look so good.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...I'm fine. Thank you, Sothe.

speaker: Ike
text: What happened to Yune?

speaker: Micaiah
text: She's sleeping. She wants us to take it from here.

speaker: Ike
text: All right... If we're all set, let's move out.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Caineghis, the great lion king... How many times have I said it now? How many times have I warned against starting another war?

speaker: Caineghis
text: I know, old friend. I know...

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Tibarn, the great hawk king... How many times have I said it now? How many times have I warned against starting another war?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Don’t you dare preach to me, you dried-up old fool.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Naesala, the great raven king... How many times have I said it now? How many times have I warned against starting another war?

speaker: Naesala
text: And since when have I ever listened to the likes of you?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: We have betrayed our vow to our goddess. We should have learned, but the fighting never stopped. Now we must pay for our crimes. We must take responsibility, and accept Ashera's judgment.

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! You don't understand! It wasn't the war that awoke the goddess! It was my song... The galdr of release freed the goddess!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...You can't expect me to believe that. We will wait here patiently for the punishment we deserve. If you are unwilling to await judgment...

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You will stand against... The greatest of all dragons!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father, no! Why must we fight? There must be a way to talk this through.

speaker: Ike
text: It's no use, Kurth. We have no choice but to fight. We must reach the goddess, and not even the king of dragons can stand in our way.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Feel the power of Ashera's faithful!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You have followed Yune's path here? That puts us irrevocably at odds. I'm sorry it had to be this way.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You've declared war on a goddess... A foolish action with terrible consequences!

speaker: Ena
text: Please let me pass, Gareth.

speaker: Gareth
text: I will not move. Such was the king's command.

speaker: Ena
text: Is there nothing I can do?

speaker: Gareth
text: No. I'm sorry to be so hardhead, Ena. But I must serve my king.

speaker: Ena
text: Maybe we're the hardheaded ones... Opposing our king and our goddess. But we've chosen our path...

speaker: Gareth
text: Lady Ena. Promise me you'll look after him. Keep the prince safe.

speaker: Ena
text: Of course. I promise... I will protect him at any cost!

speaker: Gareth
text: I was afraid it would come to this, squared off with the very prince I'm supposed to protect. What to do?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Gareth, let me pass! I need to reach my father!

speaker: Gareth
text: Without the king's word, I can't let that happen.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Do you mean to fight me?

speaker: Gareth
text: Of course not! You know I couldn't do that. All I will do is stand here, plant my feet, and wait.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Gareth!

speaker: Gareth
text: Prince Kurthnaga, it has been a privilege to serve you. I wish you all the best.

speaker: Gareth
text: My prince... I was supposed to protect you, but... I failed.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: No, Gareth! It was I that turned my back on Goldoa. Gareth... I'm sorry.

speaker: Nasir
text: I have lived long enough... Ena, I wish you...the best...

speaker: Ena
text: Nasir... Nasir! Grandfather...

speaker: Ena
text: I'm sorry to see that you stand with the king, Grandfather.

speaker: Nasir
text: I turned on him once, and I will never do it again. Will you follow your grandfather's example?

speaker: Ena
text: You know that I won't. I can't. I'm sorry...

speaker: Nasir
text: It's all right, my dear. You can side with the prince. Stand by your convictions.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Nasir! You must talk to my father! Convince him to stand down!

speaker: Nasir
text: ...We have committed two crimes. We ignored the will of our king, and in so doing let war rise once more. We must atone for our sins.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: ...I am willing to accept my own punishment. But is it right that the innocent--women and children who have never lifted a weapon--are also turned to stone?

speaker: Nasir
text: You can’t change my mind. I have made a solemn vow that I will never again betray my king.

speaker: Reyson
text: King Dheginsea, you are more powerful than any being alive... Use that power to help us save the people.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You are not the first to make such a request. But my answer is the same now as it was before. I will not change my mind. I have no choice but to follow the will of our goddess.

speaker: Rafiel
text: King Dheginsea, I don’t understand... Why? Why must we fight? I just can’t... I... I... I can’t take it. Fighting only causes more pain and suffering. Why do this?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...You remind me of a friend from long ago. He was the kindest soul I’ve known, but he was so terribly weak. You’ve moved me more than you’ll ever know... But I will not budge. I await my judgment.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Hello, Princess Leanne. You can’t fight me... I advise you to stand down.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Sadness... Your heart is filled with such sadness. What’s wrong? Can’t we talk about it?)

speaker: Dheginsea
text: I have nothing more to say to you. This is the way it has to be. My feelings do not matter.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Fools! By denying your judgment, you merely rush to your death.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: No... Unh... Has my body grown old? Or is it...my heart...

speaker: Ena
text: Your Majesty...

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Come now, Ena. Fight.

speaker: Ena
text: I'm sorry, I can't. I may have turned my back on my king and left my own country, but I still belong to the dragon tribe. I wouldn't dare attack my own king. I couldn't.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Then as your king, I order you. I order you to fight for Kurthnaga's life.

speaker: Ena
text: My king!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You and he need each other. You are different from other dragons.

speaker: Ena
text: ...Very well, Your Majesty.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father! Please think about what you're doing.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: The time for words has passed. The only option remaining is to stop you with brute force.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Why? Father, why?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: That is enough! No more sniveling! You, Kurthnaga, were to rule the dragon tribe in years to come. Show me that you would have been capable!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: But-- Yes, sir... I'll show you.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: In my eyes, the mightiest of you looks no different than an infant. Can you hope to stand a chance?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Of...of course. I am Sanaki, 37th empress of Begnion. It is my duty to save my people. Even the world's mightiest dragon will not dissuade me from that calling.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: All right, then, child. Fulfill your duty.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You, too, deign to oppose the goddess Ashera?

speaker: Elincia
text: I will do whatever is required to rescue those who were petrified. I beg of you, Dragon King, please reconsider what Prince Kurthnaga said to you.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: It is too late. People, in our weakness, betray the gods, and are meant to be punished for it.

speaker: Elincia
text: I cannot believe that. People are capable of both terrible and wonderful things. To describe them so simply and cynically does them a disservice.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: If I am defeated today, that may convince me that I am wrong. Come... I'm waiting.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I never would have believed that one day I'd be facing off against you. Life sure is funny, sometimes.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Even you, Tibarn? Don't make me kill you. You haven't got a chance.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Don't be so sure about that. You just might be surprised. Besides, you've got a lot to answer for, Dheginsea. You'll finally pay the price for all those years of inaction and indifference as your kin were butchered and enslaved.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You shortsighted fool, you still don't understand... All right, I'm waiting. Show me what you've got.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Have at you, follower of Yune.

speaker: Sothe
text: I won't live as long as you have, and I'll never be as powerful. Things like saving the world and fighting goddesses are just beyond me. They're out of my reach. That's why I've always chosen to fight for the smaller things in life and the people close to me. If that means I have to fight you to protect them, then so be it.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You...you're one of the parentless...

speaker: Micaiah
text: You know me?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Yes. I knew the first of your kind. I have been alive for a very long time... Perhaps too long. But soon it will all be over.

speaker: Ike
text: Dheginsea, Dragon King. I can see you have no intention of letting us pass.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: I follow my goddess's decrees. My will is unwavering.

speaker: Ike
text: I have no choice, then. Be on your guard.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Very well, beorc general. Our blessings may be equal and opposite, but your strength is a mere fraction of mine. Show me your best!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Naesala, you dare challenge me?

speaker: Naesala
text: Heh. It’s funny you should ask that... I’m not deluded enough to think that I can beat you. The goddess herself would hesitate to fight you. But my people are frozen solid, and I have to delude myself enough to think that I can help save them.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You are a true king, Naesala. I am ready when you are.

speaker: Naesala
text: I’ll be thrilled if I land even a single blow. I’m much better at fleeing than fighting.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You... are of the wolf people?

speaker: Nailah
text: Yes. After the floods, we built our country to the east of the great desert.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...So we weren’t the only ones to survive...

speaker: Nailah
text: Until we met Rafiel, we too thought ours were the only people left.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: In your country, are there only people of the wolf tribe?

speaker: Nailah
text: No, beorc live there, as well. There are also a number of what you call the "parentless." Children born of both laguz and beorc parents are still relatively few.. but they live normally among us.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Is that so?

speaker: Nailah
text: That’s probably enough chatting. Do you still intend to block our path?

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...I will not deny my goddess.

speaker: Nailah
text: And I won’t deny my conscience. I will revive those turned to stone, and you cannot stop me.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...Well done. You...have beaten me.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Don't lose your head now, boy. This wound... This is nothing. Your power... How could you defeat me? I was blessed by Ashera herself...
I gave them my blessings.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Yune?! Is that you?

speaker: Yune
text: That war long ago... I'm so sorry. You were right to fight against me. I was young and immature. The great flood was a result of my unchecked emotions.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: You don't have to apologize, Yune. I always knew that you weren't actually evil... You were just too powerful.

speaker: Yune
text: So why did you choose Ashera again? I had hoped that this time you would join me to help protect the people.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: I'm sorry, Yune. But I've done worse to you...

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Long ago, we made a vow before the goddess Ashera herself... We vowed that we, the laguz and beorc, would never commit the same genocidal sins. We didn't keep our promise... And for that reason I was committed to accepting my just punishment.

speaker: Yune
text: Silly, stubborn, old scalebag... You just don't know when to quit... You need to lighten up a bit.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: To convince the laguz kings to follow my example, I rewrote history, hid my tracks, and declared you a dark god. All I ever wanted was to avoid conflict... Please, forgive me.

speaker: Yune
text: Don't worry about it, Dheginsea. I caused enough trouble for you, so I'll forgive you just this once.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: I'm pleased to hear that.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Gareth! Gather our survivors. Kurthnaga is their commander from now on.

speaker: Gareth
text: Understood, sir!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Nasir... You followed your sovereign very far for having once left your country in disgust. ...I give you my sincerest thanks.

speaker: Nasir
text: No, my lord... Unaware of my own king's true heart, I did what I thought had to be done... I apologize.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Ena... I would like to tell you only that I wish you the greatest happiness in life.

speaker: Ena
text: Thank... Thank you, sire.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: Now then, Kurthnaga... Get these men moving. I will remain here, for I cannot move.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Yes, Father. We will stop Ashera. Wait here for our return. We will be back.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: ...Yes, my son. I'll be waiting.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: We must save them. Even now, as we speak, countless laguz slaves endure Begnion chains. They suffer terribly.

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: We have done all that we will do.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Admonitions and censures change nothing! Now is the time for the dragon tribes to use their strength to save the oppressed laguz!

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: Goldoa does not interfere with the outside world. As king of dragons, I will not allow my people to fan the flames of war. Conflict on the scale you describe will wake the goddess and call down her judgment upon us all. This is the path to destruction. A thousand years... That is how long we swore to the goddess that there would be no war. Have you forgotten our covenant?

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Of course not. Yet...there are laguz who are treated as less than livestock. I cannot believe that this is what the goddess wants.

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: Goldoa will not move. This decree stands from the time our nations were formed. The goddess has not yet slept one hundred and fifty years. Would you see the laguz and beorc destroyed? Would you see all of Tellius awash in blood? No, unless destruction comes to seek us at our door, Goldoa will not move, for the sake of future generations.

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: Tell me, do you care nothing for the laguz who suffer in the current generation? Do you think it would comfort them to know that you condone their misery?

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: All things require sacrifice.

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Male Voice 1
text: To Begnion. I will find a solution without you.

speaker: Male Voice 2
text: You, who have lost your birthright? All you will accomplish is your own destruction. Hold...hold, I say!

speaker: Dheginsea
text: My queen... Rajaion... I will soon join you.

speaker: Dheginsea
text: My lovely Almedha... Cherish...life...

speaker: Yune
text: It's happening again... Whose memory is that?! Something feels so...familiar about it. Is that... Is that your memory?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Father! ......

speaker: Ena
text: Kurth... He's gone...

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I know. This is simply another reason to move on... Entrusted by my father to care for our people, I will stand before Ashera. ...As the king of the dragon tribe!

speaker: Sothe
text: Are you all right, Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I’m fine. How about you, Sothe? Are you all right? You’re not hurt?

speaker: Sothe
text: I’m not a child, Micaiah! When are you going to start treating me like an adult?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Show me your hand.

speaker: Sothe
text: What?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Look at your hands. They’re so big... They were so small when we met.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah...

speaker: Ike
text: Ahh... Sorry. Am I interrupting something?

speaker: Sothe
text: C-Commander!

speaker: Micaiah
text: It’s all right, Ike. How can we help you?

speaker: Ike
text: I was scrounging around in my stuff and found some extra medicine. I figured I’d ask around and see if anyone needed it.

speaker: Sothe
text: ...I need to go get ready.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, there’s no rush. We still have... He didn’t catch a word of that, did he?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’m sorry about that.

speaker: Ike
text: How long have you been with him?

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...A long time. I met him when I was hiding out in the back alleys of Nevassa, over ten years ago. He was so skinny, but his gaze was so piercing... I wondered how such a young boy could look like that. One day, I noticed he was standing close to me, just watching. He continued like that for a few days. One day, I held out my hand. He was suspicious of me, but came over anyway. He looked like a scared animal. Then his little hand slipped into mine. It was shaking. His fingers were so thin and frail. I couldn’t let go after that.

speaker: Micaiah
text: After that, we traveled together all over the continent. No matter where we went, we were always together.

speaker: Ike
text: The first time I met him, he’d hidden on a ship we were taking. He mentioned he was looking for someone who was like family to him. It was you he was searching for, wasn’t it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: I...I tried to leave him behind. When we went to Crimea, I split off from him and took a ship to Begnion. But when I reached Begnion, war had broken out between Crimea and Daein. I knew I had to return to Daein to look for him. I couldn’t find him, so I went to Crimea. But I still couldn’t find him... We found each other again after the war, in Daein. In the back alleys of Nevassa, where we first met.

speaker: Ike
text: You took routes opposite to each other.

speaker: Micaiah
text: When I told him why I’d disappeared, he got so angry... I’d never seen him get so emotional before.

speaker: Ike
text: I can’t say that I blame him. I’d be pretty furious if I heard someone that I loved was wandering around two countries at war. Besides, I’m sure he’d hidden his feelings about being abandoned until he saw you again.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I thought I was reaching the limit of how long I could stay with him. He grew each and every day, but I remained the same... I didn’t want him to be harmed by the curse I lived with. Can you imagine how hard that would have been on him?

speaker: Ike
text: You mean the blood of the laguz?

speaker: Micaiah
text: So you knew. Did you find out from the boy who’s always beside you?

speaker: Ike
text: Soren. Yeah. I guess you both know how to recognize people with a similar nature.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. He and I are both Branded.

speaker: Ike
