text: ...Don’t use that word. You and Soren are both people. Just like me and everyone else.

speaker: Micaiah
text: People. You’re just like Yune. You call both laguz and beorcs people.

speaker: Ike
text: Why should I care about the color of your hair, eyes, and skin? Or your ears, wings, or tail? No matter how long you live or what powers you possess, we’re the same. At the end of the day, we’re all people.

speaker: Micaiah
text: ... Sothe talks that way, too. His time with you changed him. Thank you, Ike. I’ve made up my mind.

speaker: Ike
text: About what? I didn’t realize we were doing anything but talking.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I thought I might travel to a far-off place after all of this was over. But I won’t. I’ll go back to Daein. No matter what happens, I’ll have Sothe by my side. I have nothing to fear as long as he’s with me.

speaker: Ike
text: It seems the feelings between you two run both ways. But that’s probably the wisest choice for Daein, and Sothe too. Anyway...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, um... May I have some medicine?

speaker: Ike
text: Oh! Yeah, I almost forgot. Survive, Micaiah. We need you, and the goddess you host, to save the people of Tellius.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes. I know.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Zelgius is the Black Knight? I don’t know what to say... It’s unbelievable!

speaker: Ike
text: What was he like in Begnion?

speaker: Sanaki
text: He was the right-hand man of my most trusted aide, Duke Sephiran of Persis. He was a hero, a perfect general, and the best swordsman in all of Tellius. He was never anything but loyal. But he was serving another country!

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm. It makes me wonder how Sephiran is doing.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I doubt he’s been turned to stone. Even though he was captured by Lekain and forcibly removed from his post, he’ll have found a way to persevere. Sigrun always said there’s no other master of the arcane arts who can compare with the duke of Persis.

speaker: Ike
text: Makes you wonder, doesn’t it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ike... Don’t tell me you suspect Sephiran!

speaker: Ike
text: Well, look at the facts...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Do not trouble your mind with that thought! He would never betray me.

speaker: Ike
text: It’s nice to think so. But if he’s not petrified, he’d have received a message from Yune. So where is he?

speaker: Sanaki
text: The goddess isn’t perfect. She said so herself! Maybe the message didn’t reach everyone.

speaker: Ike
text: ...You have to admit that’s a weak excuse. Let’s leave it at that, for now. We need to focus on moving forward.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Please, let’s! Oh, I almost forgot! I have something for you.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Um... Uh... Well, you’re my trusted aide, just like Sephiran. You have to live! So protect yourself with this.

speaker: Ike
text: A mercenary with a contract to act as aide to the empress of Begnion. Who’d have thought? But thank you, Sanaki.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You’re welcome, Ike. And thank you.

speaker: Rafiel
text: Ike, take a look at this.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey now... Where’d you stumble across it?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Inside the tower. I thought of using it myself, but...

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I don’t think that it’s right for you.

speaker: Rafiel
text: ...Indeed. That’s why I brought it here for you to use.

speaker: Ike
text: Thanks. It’s a very rare item. I’m in your debt.

speaker: Rafiel
text: It’s the least I could do.

speaker: Reyson
text: Ike, take a look at this.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey now... Where’d you stumble across it?

speaker: Reyson
text: Lying around inside the tower. It seemed like the sort of thing I should bring to your attention.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s very nice of you, but you didn’t have to. Do whatever you want with it.

speaker: Reyson
text: Really? Do you think I’d be able to use it?

speaker: Ike
text: Well, don’t get hasty. I don’t think it’s right for you.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...I know. I’m just kidding, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Thanks. It’s a very rare item. I’ll cherish it.

speaker: Reyson
text: Please do.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Micaiah, have you ever seen one of these?)

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, Leanne, I have. That’s a very powerful artifact. Actually, it would be of great help to us, with what’s been happening.

speaker: Leanne
text: (I found it inside the tower. Do you think I can use it?)

speaker: Micaiah
text: Um... I don’t think so, Leanne. But you can try if you like...

speaker: Leanne
text: (...I’m only kidding. Here, you can have it.)

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, for me? Thank you very much. It’s a very precious item. I’ll make good use of it.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Please do!)

speaker: Begnion
text: Hey, have you heard? The sub-humans are retreating!

speaker: Begnion
text: General Zelgius is amazing! As long as we have him, Begnion has nothing to fear.

speaker: Levail
text: Ahem! Gentlemen. This is no time for idle chatter. However...if you wish to praise General Zelgius, I suppose that is all right. He is the glory of our forces, after all.

speaker: Begnion
text: It's true! As long as he leads us, we won't be afraid of any dirty sub-humans!

speaker: Senator
text: Gah! That insufferable fool! I cannot believe he killed one sub-human and ended the battle! Who gave him an order like that?1 I don't care for such a petty victory!

speaker: Lombroso
text: I understand, my lord. I was hoping that this would be the end of the sub-humans, once and for all. However, can we really punish him for winning the battle?

speaker: Senator
text: No, you fool! That's what makes it even more bothersome! Zelgius and the apostle are both making mockeries of the senate! They're more of a threat to Begnion than those filthy sub-humans are!

speaker: Lombroso
text: My lord, please let me fix this painful situation. I shall take to the battlefield and earn us the result Begnion desires.

speaker: Senator
text: That does sound lovely, I admit. But hasn't General Zelgius ordered all forces to cease fire for three days?

speaker: Lombroso
text: Who is in charge here, my lord? Must you follow Zelgius's orders?

speaker: Senator
text: Hah, I see your point. I shall leave everything to you, then. Make Begnion proud, Lord Lombroso.

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf has started his retreat. Tibarn and his men are gathering information on Zelgius's forces. Before he left, Tibarn asked me to take you to Gallia, where you'll be safe. Are you ready to go?

speaker: Reyson
text: No. I won't leave, Ike. I won't leave this place.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson, please...

speaker: Reyson
text: I've lived with the hawk tribe for twenty years. They are my family. I'll... I'll stay here and fight.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Well, since I can see I won't be changing your mind... You can join up with us. The Greil Mercenaries can stay here as long as we want. After all, we're not on anyone's payroll right now. We're free agents.

speaker: Reyson
text: Ike... Thank you.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, come out here! Hurry! It's the Begnion army!

speaker: Ike
text: What?!

speaker: Ike
text: What are they doing here?1 It hasn't been three days yet!

speaker: Soren
text: It seems they couldn't care less. They are demanding the castle back. If we don't comply, they'll attack.

speaker: Reyson
text: They were probably waiting for both the Gallians and the hawk tribe to leave the castle.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, they think they can take us now that we're all alone, huh? They obviously don't know who they're up against. Let's make them remember the name of the Greil Mercenaries! Everyone, get in position! Let's take them out!

speaker: Lombroso
text: Fools! Can't you see that you're outnumbered?! You have sided with the laguz and betrayed the empire! The senate will be happy to see the likes of you dead and buried!

speaker: Lombroso
text: The outcome of a battle depends solely on the number of troops in the field! Tactics and skill are nothing in the face of sheer numbers! Wait, are you laughing at me? Gah! Die, you insolent cur!

speaker: Lombroso
text: Hmph, pathetic. Your tiny band of outlaws doesn't stand a chance before our might. We have more troops on the way. The onslaught will not stop until every last one of you lies dead!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you really the best Begnion could send?

speaker: Lombroso
text: What?! How dare you take that tone with me!

speaker: Ike
text: Or did they send you at all? Does General Zelgius know about this little excursion?

speaker: Lombroso
text: I don't take orders from that sanctimonious has-been. Enough questions. Prepare to die!

speaker: Lombroso
text: Im-impossible! But now? We outnumbered them...

speaker: Begnion
text: General Lombroso has fallen! R-retreat! Fall back to base camp!

speaker: Ike
text: They're retreating. That was close.

speaker: Janaff
text: Hey, hold on a minute! What's going on here? We hurry back, and you don't save us anyone to fight?!

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry about that. You're back sooner than I expected. How far out did you scout?

speaker: Tibarn
text: We went to the enemy's headquarters, Castle Gaddos. As promised, the Begnion forces were waiting quietly in their castle. Apparently, some of their soldiers disobeyed orders, but we can trust Zelgius to keep the rest in line. I have other news, however. I ran into someone quite unexpected on the outskirts of enemy territory.

speaker: Ike
text: Who?

speaker: Tibarn
text: The commander of the Holy Guards.

speaker: Ike
text: General Sigrun?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yeah. She was by herself. She seemed hesitant to get near Castle Gaddos. It was odd. I figured since she's a friend and loyal to the apostle, why not try to get some information from her? She wouldn't budge. Tough girl, that one. She wasn't at all surprised to see me. Then she said, in such a sad voice, "Please escape at once."

speaker: Ike
text: I wonder what she meant by that? It can't be a good sign. This whole mess is getting worse by the minute.

speaker: Begnion
text: General Zelgius. General Sigrun of the Holy Guards is here to see you. Should I let her through?

speaker: Zelgius
text: General Sigrun? Let her through. At once!

speaker: Zelgius
text: Is something the matter, General? You do not look well. Should I send for something? Water, perhaps?

speaker: Sigrun
text: General Zelgius, I... I carry an order from the senate. The cease-fire has been repealed. You are ordered to destroy the Laguz Alliance, and their allies as well.

speaker: Zelgius
text: What?! The enemy has already lost the will to fight! The apostle and Lord Sephiran would never agree to such a terrible plan!

speaker: Zelgius
text: General Sigrun?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Lord Sephiran of Persis has been stripped of his titles as prime minister and head of the senate. He is currently under arrest and is charged with..."committing high treason and fomenting rebellion."

speaker: Zelgius
text: No! Impossible! This is madness!

speaker: Sigrun
text: It doesn't end there. The apostle has gone into seclusion, with illness as the stated reason.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Damn it! They've been captured!

speaker: Sigrun
text: I've ordered my subordinates to find out where the apostle is, but I have yet to hear any word. General Zelgius, I beg of you, follow the senate's orders. Our friends' lives are at risk.

speaker: Zelgius
text: ...Curse those senators.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You called for me, Your Majesty?

speaker: Pelleas
text: It is nice to see you, Micaiah. You remain Daein's goddess of victory. But I never see your face around here anymore. Are you busy in town?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Your Majesty. My room in the castle is much to lavish for my taste. I'd rather be in town helping with the reconstruction. It's good work, and it makes me happy to help our people.

speaker: Almedha
text: How precious. Still obsessed with garnering the adoration of peasants, are we? Aren't you past that yet, my dear?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Mother, please stop. Micaiah is my dear friend. She is the only person I have to turn to for a kind word now that Izuka and the Black Knight have both left Daein. They mysteriously disappeared on the day of my coronation... Do you think they'll ever return?

speaker: Almedha
text: I'm quire sure that they were both kidnapped by those who wish harm upon you, my beloved son! Those mongrels intend to throw the country into chaos by holding Daein's leaders hostage. But...Mother will always protect you, Pelleas. I will never leave you, not for one moment. When you seek kind words or good advice, you must come to me, and no one else.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I understand, Mother.

speaker: Almedha
text: The royal blood of Daein runs through your veins. Do not be afraid of your heritage. Reign over your people as a king. Whatever popularity that girl might garner from the peasants is of little consequence. She is your obedient subject, after all. Now, give her your orders.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, Daein's Maiden of Dawn. Your king requires your service once more. Mobilize the Daein Royal Army immediately.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Another war? Against who?

speaker: Pelleas
text: We are answering the request from the Begnion Empire to wipe out the barbaric Laguz Alliance. Your targets are... Gallia's sub-humans!

speaker: Haar
text: You need something from me, fearless leader?

speaker: Ike
text: I thought you were asleep.

speaker: Haar
text: Yeah, I was. Until you came within fifty paces of me. Yaaaaaawn…

speaker: Ike
text: Do you mind fighting alongside us?

speaker: Haar
text: I like it fine. As long as I can catch some sleep, I don’t care where I am. What can I do for you?

speaker: Ike
text: Ever since you joined us, I’ve been meaning to ask you about Jill. The last I’d heard, you were running some kind of delivery service with her. How did you end up passing through Crimea and then coming here?

speaker: Haar
text: I stopped to chew some fat during a delivery. That’s all.

speaker: Ike
text: How’s Jill these days?

speaker: Haar
text: Last I heard, she got mixed up with the army again, fighting for Daein’s emancipation.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. Don’t you think you ought to go back to Daein and give her some support?

speaker: Haar
text: She’s a big girl now. She doesn’t need me always lookin over her shoulder. Jill can do whatever she wants.

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t understand. I thought you two were… You know. Living under the same roof and all.

speaker: Haar
text: She’s the daughter of my dead teacher. Nothing more. Hey, if you don’t want me hanging around, feel free to just say so, all right?

speaker: Ike
text: No, it isn’t like that. You’re great on the battlefield. I appreciate you being here.

speaker: Haar
text: Good. I like your mercenary group. They’re laid back, and we have the same goal: crushing the empire.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s true.

speaker: Haar
text: Anyhow, is that all? I’m gonna nap until we deploy. Don’t wake me up until then.

speaker: Ike
text: All right.

speaker: Haar
text: Hey… Wait.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm?

speaker: Haar
text: See that bag on my wyvern? There’s a souvenir in there for you. Feel free to take it.

speaker: Ike
text: A souvenir?

speaker: Haar
text: It’s a small thing. You don’t need to thank me. …Yaaawn… Zzz… Zzz…

speaker: Ike
text: Asleep already? What a strange guy.

speaker: Lucia
text: Good luck! I'll be sure to keep the palace safe. I'm sorry we couldn't allocate more troops for you. You'll be OK, though, right?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Of course. We might even have too many. Actually, I'm more worried about the queen's safety. Make sure the guards stay sharp.

speaker: Lucia
text: Count on it. I'll maintain a tight watch on the area, and there is the backup plan, just in case.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Good... Hearing you reiterate that makes me feel better, I have to admit.

speaker: Lucia
text: Remember, this isn't for glory. You'll be confronting our own people. Just do your job and come straight back.

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: The Royal Knights have left the capital! We estimate roughly 4,000 soldiers are marching on Felirae.

speaker: Ludveck
text: That means about 2,000 are left in the capital... That's more than I'd expected. ...Hmm, I suppose it can't be helped. The column headed toward Felirae is primarily cavalry, is it not?

speaker: Crimean Rebel
text: Yes, sir. Exactly as you surmise, sir.

speaker: Ludveck
text: In that case, the forces at the capital will be led by the queen's confidante, Lady Lucia. This is most perfect. The soldiers remaining at Castle Felirae have been given detailed instructions...false instructions, I might add. ...The dear pawns. They are so very heroic, and so very disposable.

speaker: Kieran
text: General, all troops are in position! We stand ready for the assault!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Thank you, Kieran. The majority of the castle vanguard appears to be common soldiers. And there's still no sign of Ludveck or any of his subordinates?

speaker: Kieran
text: Correct, sir. And the rest are a bunch of amateurs! You should see them flop around on their horses like rag dolls. They won't last long against the finely tuned skills of our Crimean Royal Knights.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Don't get overconfident, now... Most of their forces are likely inside, waiting for us to exhaust ourselves out here.

speaker: Kieran
text: Yes, good point, sir!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: And the main gate... Have you seen it? Breaking through that is not going to be easy. We must be patient.

speaker: Kieran
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: And remember, we're not facing enemy soldiers. Yes, they're foolish enough to be lured into joining Ludveck...but they are fellow Crimean citizens. Her Majesty would prefer to capture these rebels alive and try to talk some sense into them.

speaker: Kieran
text: I'm...amazed, sir. Her Majesty's kindness is touching! I'll convey that to all our men.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Listen up! We're to sweep aside the rebels and punch through the fortress gate! Her Majesty wants as many lives to be spared as possible! Set lances! All forces, charge!

speaker: Tashoria
text: Not one step backward! Be strong! The duke will soon arrive with reinforcements. Stand strong a little longer... Stand firm for the revolution!

speaker: Tashoria
text: W-we have to hold out! The duke is on his way! We'll be heroes! Adored, and showered with riches!

speaker: Tashoria
text: Duke... Duke Ludveck... Where are...our reinforcements...?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Rebel forces! I am Geoffrey, commander of the Royal Knights of Crimea! Lay down your weapons and submit to the rule of law! Further resistance is futile! Her Majesty the queen promises leniency and means you no harm! Listen to me! You must yield!

speaker: Tashoria
text: Tch... What nonsense is this? Do you take us for idiots!? Our reinforcements will arrive shortly, and your fate will be sealed! Death to the tyrant and her lapdogs!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Grr... The queen lives to serve you! Why can't you see that?!

speaker: Crimea
text: Sir, the rebels have been routed! Some managed to escape, but most have surrendered their weapons.

speaker: Kieran
text: General Geoffrey! No sign of the Felirae regulars, is there?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...No. This was clearly a ruse. Duke Felirae's main force is most likely en route to the capital.

speaker: Kieran
text: But how?! Quickly! Rally the troops! We must return to Melior at once!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Don't panic! They want us to act rashly. Settle down. ...We have contingencies in place. Light the flares to notify the capital. Move, man!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Scout commander!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: It's very likely we'll be ambushed on the way back to the capital. Don't let anything escape your notice! We may need an alternate route back to the capital... Send some men out to investigate the old highway.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Those of you who remain, disarm the prisoners and tend the wounded! Let's move, everyone!

speaker: Haar
text: ...Well, look at that. Someone's launched a flare... And from Felirae, of all places.

speaker: Lucia
text: The emergency signal from Geoffrey! As I suspected... The rebels were just a decoy. Sir Haar, thank you for your assistance.

speaker: Haar
text: Hey, wait... Are you telling me that you knew about this all along?

speaker: Lucia
text: We knew the duke was up to no good. But if we had known about the decoys, we wouldn't have sent the Royal Knights to Castle Felirae. I suppose I'm just surprised that Lord Ludveck, the supposed epitome of nobility, would so willingly sacrifice his followers.

speaker: Haar
text: You know...you play a pretty deep game, woman.

speaker: Lucia
text: We all do, wouldn't you say? Her Majesty is at Fort Alpea. We're due to hear from her at any moment. I'll go check on that.

speaker: Haar
text: Sharp as a tack, aren't we? I think I'll excuse myself, then...

speaker: Lucia
text: Actually, there's one more thing... I want you to wait here a little longer. If all goes as planned, I'll be back shortly with your payment. Then you may do as you wish.

speaker: Haar
text: And if all doesn't go as planned?

speaker: Lucia
text: Then set out for Fort Alpea and alert the queen. I'll also send a messenger to Geoffrey. Thank you.

speaker: Haar
text: Very well, time for a nap...

speaker: Lucia
text: ...Well? Any news from Queen Elincia?

speaker: Lucia
text: What?! How?!

speaker: Lucia
text: You...

speaker: Ludveck
text: Yes, me. I was very hurt by how cruelly you manipulated me, my lady. And I am not easily wounded.

speaker: Lucia
text: Lord Ludveck... How did you...

speaker: Ludveck
text: My lady, I am certain to know of any and all facts that concern your activities. My dear, lovely Lucia. Oh yes, it was quite some time ago that I was informed of both this place and your network of shadowy assistants.

speaker: Lucia
text: Ah.

speaker: Ludveck
text: I would like to know one more thing... Something only you are aware of. ...Where the queen is currently hiding.

speaker: Lucia
text: Good luck finding that out.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Perhaps it's a little place called...Alpea? All that foolishness... the ruses, the informers, the secret flight from the palace... Ha ha ha... All that effort, wasted.

speaker: Lucia
text: ...Is that so?

speaker: Ludveck
text: Hm? I can see that my lady still retains secrets. Would it trouble you so much to tell them to me?

speaker: Lucia
text: To you, Lord Ludveck? I am afraid there is nothing to tell.

speaker: Ludveck
text: Lady Lucia... I'm done with these games. You'll tell me whatever I wish to know... But I believe I already know your secret.

speaker: Lucia
text: We shall see.

speaker: Calill
text: Come on in!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: May I?

speaker: Calill
text: Well, speak of the devil! If it isn't General Geoffrey himself. I wouldn't have expected a visit, since you're leaving tomorrow.

speaker: Amy
text: Hi, General Geoffrey! What can we do for you today?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Sorry, Amy, but I'm not here as a customer.

speaker: Amy
text: Huh?

speaker: Calill
text: Oh, I see why you're here. It's about time, too. I'm ready to string that blathering drunkard up by his heels.

speaker: Makalov
text: Ta dah...! Whoops... Who put that chair there? I could have been killed! Lady Calill, you beckoned?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Makalov, why are you drinking? You realize that tomorrow we have a battle to fight, yes?

speaker: Makalov
text: Greetings, General! My, you're looking even more dashing and handsome than usual, Your Excellency.

speaker: Calill
text: Good grief... That man's an embarrassment. Are you sure he's a Royal Knight? He's like a pig pretending to fly. Why not put a dog in armor and call it "sir"!

speaker: Astrid
text: Miss Calill, that's not very nice! I think Sir Makalov deserves a little more respect than that.

speaker: Calill
text: Are you blind, Astrid? It's the night before a mission, and that fool is stinking drunk. Probably gambled all his money away, too. And you! You follow him around mooning over him and cleaning up his messes! Do you have no pride, girl? What the man needs is someone to slap some sense into him. Perhaps I should--

speaker: Astrid
text: I've chosen to look after Sir Makalov! Nobody's forced me to do it. And it's really none of your business!

speaker: Calill
text: You know, I'm really starting to wonder about your "good upbringing." Of all the men out there, what possessed you to place your bets on such a shabby prospect?

speaker: Astrid
text: Wh-what did you just say!? There are no gentlemen in this land half as fine as Sir Makalov!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Oh my...

speaker: Largo
text: All right, settle down, everybody. Keep this up and the general's gonna pretend he doesn't know either of you.

speaker: Calill
text: Fine, fine. I'm sorry, all right? Happy? So... what was it that you needed with that ale-soaked oaf, anyway?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I just wanted to go over our battle plan one last time before retiring.

speaker: Largo
text: I heard you're going after the duke of Felirae? You think you can handle him?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Of course. However, he's been marshalling his forces for quite some time now. Which means our preparations will have to be flawless if we want to end this quickly.

speaker: Largo
text: If only I were up to it. You know me. Hah! I'd crush him! I'd kick him apart!

speaker: Calill
text: Well, I suppose I could go? Someone of my wisdom and power is easily worth two of you clods.

speaker: Largo
text: Yeah! That's a great idea, lamb-blossom. Like I always say, the best enemies are the ones that are on fire.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I'm sorry, but no. Although I do appreciate the enthusiasm.

speaker: Calill
text: I don't see the problem! Do you think I've gone soft! My magic is still in tip-top shape, I'll have you know!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: No. It's just that I'm sure Queen Elincia wouldn't be pleased with civilians fighting against their countrymen.

speaker: Calill
text: Hmm. I suppose you have a point.

speaker: Danved
text: In that case, let Danved join you. Danved is not a citizen of Crimea. Danved will fight like ten men.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Devdan! When did you get here?

speaker: Largo
text: Actually, General... This, uh... This is not Devdan. This is a friend of mine, Danved.

speaker: Danved
text: Yes, it's true. People often make that mistake. But Danved is definitely not Devdan.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Uh-huh. You look exactly like him.

speaker: Largo
text: Doesn't he?! Amazing, isn't it? Anyway, you can take him with you. Oh, and no pressure, but the fate of our country depends on the Royal Knights. Good luck! Don't blow it!

speaker: Danved
text: Danved will fight like a bear! like a tiger! We don't need Largo and Calill, because Danved is pretty amazing.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Uh... I understand, I think. Thank you for your help.

speaker: Calill
text: Well, I suppose that's settled. It's time for you to discuss tomorrow's tactics. Good luck with that. As for that useless drunk... I'll have someone carry him over later.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Thank you.

speaker: Astrid
text: Sir Makalov is not useless! How many times do I have to say it!?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Astrid. It's about time you got back, as well.

speaker: Astrid
text: Y-yes, General! Forgive me! I'll hurry back as soon as Sir Makalov is feeling better!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Give me strength... The sooner, the better.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty! What are you doing with that lance?

speaker: Elincia
text: I asked your servant for it, and he gave it to me.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Why would Your Majesty, as queen, do such a thing? Who knows how tangled the web of rumors could become, because of that...

speaker: Elincia
text: Let the court say what it wishes. You are far more important to me than the whispers of nattering nobles.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...You don't need to say that.

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey... I'm sorry.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I don't understand. What's wrong?

speaker: Elincia
text: Three years ago... you fought to free Crimea from the clutches of Daein. While you held this lance, your courage was dauntless and your prowess, legendary.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Yes. It's a brave lance, and I'm very proud of it.

speaker: Elincia
text: I... I can't have you raise the same lance against your fellow people of Crimea. I'm sorry... I just can't.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Your Majesty is worried about the shadow it would cast over my name? The dishonor of using that weapon on Crimeans?

speaker: Elincia
text: I would never want to damage your pride as a knight. It would be too much to bear.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Believe no such thing, Your Majesty. My pride as a knight is most deeply rooted in my service to you. That will never waver, no matter what. Elincia... You know that.

speaker: Elincia
text: Then take your lance. Use it to fight for Crimea once again.

speaker: Kieran
text: Forgive my tardiness, sir! Kieran, second in command of the Royal Knights, at your service!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Sorry to have disturbed your rest.

speaker: Kieran
text: Not at all! If it were your will, General, I would hasted to the very edge of the world at your calling.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Kieran, I'm lucky to have such a devoted follower. This is no reward, but there's something I want you to have.

speaker: Kieran
text: A silver axe!? Th-this is... It's so sharp! Do you mean I can have it!?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Do you like it?

speaker: Kieran
text: Like it? My heart is ready to burst! I feel... It's like it's my birthday, and I just got my first suit of armor!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Wonderful. I'm glad to hear it.

speaker: Kieran
text: It will look fabulous on the mantel! My family will enjoy it for years to come. I can't tell you how grateful I am.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Kieran, that's an axe, not a painting. Paintings are for mantels. Axes are for fighting. I want you to use that axe.

speaker: Kieran
text: What!? I couldn't!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: You can't refuse. It's an order.

speaker: Kieran
text: Sigh... Understood, sir! I promise to keep it well protected and free from scratches!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Sigh. You're hopeless.

speaker: Ashera
text: Lehran... I will not...countenance this plan.

speaker: Lehran
text: Hear me, Goddess Ashera... Yune's imprisonment within the medallion has begun to change you. Order and chaos, you are one being, comprising both parts. The one must naturally affect the other.

speaker: Ashera
text: Even so, I will not return Yune to this body. She is unstable, and I must be perfect in order to protect this world. It is as I have said, Yune must be destroyed.

speaker: Lehran
text: Ashera, you mustn't! You cannot survive without your opposite. Please, you must not do this. Your world still needs you.

speaker: Ashera
text: Lehran, you have ever been a wise and kind- hearted child. In deference to you, I will place my faith in your kind one last time. For the next thousand years, I shall sleep as well. When I wake again, I hope it is to a world of peace and order, where all prosper as equals. If I do, then I will know that you have advised me well. I will reward your counsel. I will also allow Yune to return to me. I will once again be the goddess of creation, whole and complete. Ashunera, the Dawn Goddess... The name your ancestors gave me so long ago. I should like to hear it again.

speaker: Ashera
text: However, during this thousand years, if the chaos of war should arise and awaken Yune from her slumber in the medallion... I will know that you have strayed from your path, and I will punish your failure as I would reward your success. And then you will know my judgment. You will pay for your sins, each of you to the last.

speaker: Lehran
text: In the names of our people, we vow to keep this covenant. There will be no great war between laguz and beorc for a thousand years. So pledge Altina of the beorc, Dheginsea of the dragon tribes, Soan of the beast tribes, and I, Lehran, of the bird tribes.

speaker: Ashera
text: If you believe during this thousand years that you have created a world that has outgrown the atrocities of war... Or if you feel the world has fallen beyond hope of redemption, you may sing the galdr of release and awaken us both. Your heirs will possess that ability as well... Sing to awaken us, and tell us your tale. Tell us of the world your two kinds have built in our absence. We will listen, and we will judge fairly and impartially. This is our covenant with you.

speaker: Ike
text: It's her...

speaker: Yune
text: Ashera.

speaker: Yune
text: Ashera! It's me...Yune. Can you hear me?

speaker: Yune
text: Please! Please listen to me! You don't need to pass any more judgment! You can return the people to normal!

speaker: Ashera
text: I cannot. There are still people in my world who are made of fallible flesh. This imperfect world has passed beyond control. Now, I shall pass my final judgment.

speaker: Yune
text: Wait! You can't violate the terms of the covenant, Ashera! One thousand years still hasn't passed. We were woken by galdr, not by mankind's war.

speaker: Ashera
text: It doesn't matter.

speaker: Ashera
text: During my long sleep, beorc and laguz continued to fight. The children of flesh will never learn nor grow. Time will pass as always, but nothing can change the destiny of mankind.

speaker: Yune
text: You have to look deeper! The first judgment didn't turn everyone to stone, and I'll tell you why. Because these people are not "people" as we know them. Ashera, these people have become something new!

speaker: Yune
text: People--the Zunanma--are the only living creatures of this world that we didn't create. Animals evolved to become Zunanma, who then became laguz and beorc. That evolution continues today!

speaker: Yune
text: Ashera... I'll tell you a secret you didn't know.  Children can be born of both a beorc and laguz parent. They are still very few in number, but if allowed to flourish, mankind might become anything! If the two races continue to evolve, I'm sure something wonderful will emerge! You can't just bring that to a halt.

speaker: Ashera
text: Do not claim certainty of anything. The children of this world are born of chaos, and nothing could be more uncertain. The world does not require the evolution of man. My responsibility is to protect order, the balance of all life-forms. Beings that evolve without my guidance will only destabilize and threaten this world. Because of that--

speaker: Yune
text: You have to wipe out everything made of flesh? Is that what you're trying to say? ...Very well then.

speaker: Yune
text: You and I have nothing more to talk about. My only choice is to defeat you.

speaker: Ashera
text: Yune, do not be absurd... You cannot overthrow me, just as I cannot overthrow you.

speaker: Yune
text: Of course not. But they can. Everyone! The time has come! Defeat Ashera, or everyone you love will be a statue forever!

speaker: Ashera
text: These people, they carry your blessing, Yune... You mean to fight me?

speaker: Ike
text: Ashera, our goddess... This is the world--and we are the people--you created. You make it sound as if we're some sort of filthy creatures that just decided to settle down here and cause trouble.

speaker: Yune
text: Ike! Don't say it like that.

speaker: Ike
text: We're not perfect. Sometimes our brains tell us one thing, while our emotions tell us another. And war... The more we try to avoid it, the worse it is when it comes to us.

speaker: Ike
text: People are probably the dumbest creatures alive.

speaker: Yune
text: But... Somehow you're also the most endearing. It's your imperfections that make you so interesting... Imperfections very similar to ours.

speaker: Ike
text: We know that we've messed up. We'll do our best to avoid more war and to make peace our highest priority. Ashera, just give us one more chance. All we ask for is one more chance.

speaker: Ashera
text: You expect me to reverse my judgment? The goddess of order cannot be so...mercurial. My decision is final.

speaker: Ike
text: So that's how it's going to be, huh? Then we will fight...  and we will save our people. Make your peace with whatever the gods worship. Your end is near.

speaker: Ashera
text: My end  is near?

speaker: Ike
text: In every battle that mattered in my life, I've always been the one left standing, no matter how slim my chances. This battle means more than any of the others, because it's for the life of every person that I've ever cared about. I will win this fight.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike... Um... Were you joking when you said you couldn't remember how we met?

speaker: Ike
text: Well, sorta. It was a long time ago.

speaker: Soren
text: How could you forget?

speaker: Ike
text: Relax, Soren. I got to thinking, and I remembered. I remember what happened in Gallia on the day we first met.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Mother had gone shopping with Mist that day. I was wandering around the village all alone. I walked to the edge of the forest, looking for a stick I could pretend was a sword. There was a raven-haired boy lying on the ground.

speaker: Soren
text: I remember the huge oak tree by the clearing... I'd been sleeping in the hollow by the roots.

speaker: Ike
text: He looked like he was my age. He was as skinny as a twig, wearing rags and covered in dirt. He looked like he was near death. I took out my lunch and I handed it to him. He made a noise like a scared animal and shied away. He was suspicious of me at first, but eventually he took my sandwich and started to eat. It was like he'd never eaten before in his life. I didn't have anything else to feed him, so I told him to come to my house. But he kept shaking his head no.

speaker: Soren
text: I was afraid you were going to trick me. Afraid that you were going to chase me away after taunting me with food, just for a laugh...

speaker: Ike
text: I told the boy that I'd bring him some food the next day at the same time and place. He finally nodded when I said that. It made me happy. I felt like I was doing something right, helping this boy. Like I was the only one who'd do that.

speaker: Soren
text: ...I was happy, too. Not just because I wasn't hungry anymore. Because someone finally would talk to me. So I went back to the village again the next day. I was scared of the other villagers and their rocks and sticks, but I still went back.

speaker: Ike
text: That's right. That was Gallia back then. The beorc abused and tormented the Branded because the laguz shunned them. They wanted to avoid upsetting the laguz.

speaker: Soren
text: The villagers threw stones at me, called me an animal and a devil. But on the next day, the village was littered with corpses. Soldiers and peasants were in a panic.

speaker: Ike
text: It was my dad. He went crazy when the spirit of chaos in the medallion touched him.

speaker: Soren
text: I walked through the empty streets, checking bodies to see if you were dead. But I couldn't find you. I decided that you had to be alive. I took money and food from the village and headed for Crimea, a land of beorcs.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren...

speaker: Soren
text: On my way to Crimea, I kept seeing laguz from the beast tribe. They were terrifying, but after a while I realized something. They never attacked me. They all seemed to notice something about me, and then pretend they couldn't see me. That look was burned into my mind, and it was always the same. They'd scowl, then walk away like they'd never noticed me. In a way, that left me feeling older and more alone than if they'd attacked me. Hate... That I could understand. This was denial. They made me feel like I wasn't supposed to exist at all. That my simply being alive was an affront to the world. That was how the beasts treated me. And I hated them for it. It sat in my heart like a lead bar. Like a glacier.

speaker: Soren
text: When I reached Crimea, I took refuge in a church along the way. They took my brand to be a sign that I had been trained in the arcane arts. They took good care of me, and taught me things. Once I had learned to speak and behave like other people, I wandered Crimea for several years. Then I finally found you.

speaker: Ike
text: But I'd...

speaker: Soren
text: Yes. You'd forgotten that day in Gallia. But I didn't care. My only wish was to see you again. I just wanted to see the only boy who had held out a warm hand when I had nothing.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren... Don't cry.

speaker: Soren
text: Don't cry? What? I'm not crying...

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, you're smart, but you're no good when it comes to your emotions. Come over here.

speaker: Soren
text: D-don't treat me like I'm a child! I'm not that--

speaker: Ike
text: Come on.

speaker: Soren
text: Shut up! Shut up...

speaker: Ike
text: Then I'll come over to you.

speaker: Ike
text: It's all in the past, Soren...

speaker: Soren
text: ...Sniff... Sniff... Gwuh... Wahhhhhhhh! Ahhhhhhh!

speaker: Lehran
text: Forgive me, goddess. I must end my service to you now. My dear goddess, Ashera. Please forgive me!

speaker: Ashera
text: Lehran...

speaker: Lehran
text: Everything I've done was a mistake. This is all a result of my weakness. The changes were unbearable to watch, too frightening to understand. It grew painful to accept change, and with that my heart filled with cowardice. I was overwhelmed by the pain, and could think of nothing but soothing it. As long as I suffered, I was blind to anything else, even to the beautiful things of the world. I can see it now... The people deserve compassion. They deserve to have their lives back!

speaker: Ashera
text: No. You were always too flexible, too inconstant. You cannot sway me any further.

speaker: Lehran
text: Ashera... My goddess... Please.

speaker: Ashera
text: Be silent now and watch as I erase these things that confuse your simple heart.

speaker: Yune
text: Everyone, listen carefully. In order to reach Ashera, we must first destroy the aura protecting her. Got it? Attack the aura.

speaker: Ashera
text: You would face me in battle? I need no further evidence of your kind's imperfections. This will hardly be a battle at all. Simply an end. Perish, flawed one.

speaker: Micaiah
text: The aura is gone.

speaker: Ike
text: Excellent. Now we can finish this.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: You're Lehran...

speaker: Lehran
text: Prince Kurthnaga... How you've grown.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: You know who I am?

speaker: Lehran
text: I resided in Goldoa for more than seven hundred years.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I... I had no idea.

speaker: Lehran
text: That's because I was kept in hiding. But I did meet you several times, when you were just an infant.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I remember a...a mysterious man with black wings. Was that you? I always thought it was a dream...

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I was always so fascinated by that man and his songs... I remember him well, and fondly.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You finally made it, Sephiran.

speaker: Lehran
text: Sanaki, I...

speaker: Sanaki
text: I was starting to wonder how I would punish you.

speaker: Lehran
text: I'm sorry?

speaker: Sanaki
text: You are my subordinate, after all. I have decided that leaving one's empress to die is punishable by drowning in a pool of rancid butter.

speaker: Lehran
text: Of course it is, my empress.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I hope you're a strong swimmer.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Um...

speaker: Lehran
text: Yes?

speaker: Micaiah
text: You're Lehran, aren't you?

speaker: Lehran
text: Yes.

speaker: Micaiah
text: You... Forgive me for asking, but... Aren't you my--

speaker: Lehran
text: Can we talk about this later?

speaker: Micaiah
text: What? Oh, I mean, of course... Sorry to bother you...

speaker: Lehran
text: Child, you couldn't possibly bother me. It's just, the talk you and I must have is going to take a long time. I don't think Ashera would wait for us to finish.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh... Very well.

speaker: Lehran
text: What is it?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, nothing... Never mind.

speaker: Lehran
text: Micaiah?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Y-yes?

speaker: Lehran
text: Looks like you could use some backup. I'm good with a staff, too, you know.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Th-thank you.

speaker: Ike
text: Sephiran... I mean, Lehran...

speaker: Lehran
text: I can't apologize enough. I was so terribly mistaken, and now there's nothing I can do to help.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't worry.

speaker: Lehran
text: What? z Ike: Wanting to do something that matters is enough. Sometimes, how you feel is more important than how you act.

speaker: Lehran
text: Ike, I... There's no one that I think more highly of...

speaker: Ike
text: No time for compliments. We still have work to do here.

speaker: Lehran
text: Yes... Yes, we do.

speaker: Ashera
text: You would face me in battle? I need no further evidence of your kind's imperfections. This will hardly be a battle at all. Simply an end. Perish, flawed one.

speaker: Ashera
text: It is tragic that you are too limited to see how hopeless this is. You cannot hope to defeat the divine.

speaker: Ike
text: You're right. We can't hope to defeat you.

speaker: Ashera
text: Then why continue?

speaker: Ike
text: You haven't left us much choice. I'd rather die like this instead of being turned into some mindless statue.

speaker: Ashera
text: Simpleminded fool...

speaker: Ashera
text: Don't waste your energy, fleshling. You are physically unable to harm me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yune... I'm fine. I can hear you. No, I'm not afraid. I know you're with me.

speaker: Ashera
text: Ah, son of the dragon king... You may be the greatest among the enfleshed, but you are no match for me.

speaker: Kurth
text: Goddess Ashera, please listen to me. We know that we are clearly imperfect, but you, unnaturally created of pure order... Might that not be considered an imperfection?

speaker: Ashera
text: No, I am perfect. Free of emotion, I have no doubts. Therefore I commit no errors.

speaker: Ashera
text: Lehran, you have joined my enemies?

speaker: Lehran
text: My goddess... Never before have I defied you in even the least thing. But I have seen the error of my ways and wish to save the people whom I once desired to destroy. I am one man, and my life is precious. How much more precious are the lives of the countless multitudes?

speaker: Ike
text: It's over. It's all over...

speaker: Micaiah
text: We did it. Our fighting is finally done. Now the people...

speaker: Ike
text: Now the people should all turn back to normal.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes!

speaker: Ike
text: Let's get out of here. I'm sure the others are getting tired of waiting for us outside.

speaker: Yune
text: Wait!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?!

speaker: Ike
text: What... What's going on? This is insane! We defeated her...

speaker: Ashera
text: You defeated nothing. This is nothing at all out of the ordinary. Mortals cannot defeat the divine. It is not possible.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But... We won... General Ike... We have to fight one more time! The people out there need our help!

speaker: Ashera
text: You can try as many times as you like. The result will always be the same. There is no way for you to win.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I can't believe that! General Ike, you can do it! Forge a new destiny for us! Ike, please... You've got to!

speaker: Ike
text: I don't need encouragement. I'd fight to the end no matter what. Ashera, you can't stop me. It doesn't matter if you're a goddess. It doesn't matter if I have no way to win. Fighting defines me, and I will not lose.

speaker: Ashera
text: When will you tiresome gnats surrender?

speaker: Yune
text: We have to put an end to this. Take all the power I have.

speaker: Ike
text: Thank you. I'll use it well.

speaker: Ike
text: What of you? Are you leaving?

speaker: Yune
text: I am. But I believe it's for the best. This world does not need gods. We have always failed you. We've made you weak. That's why we must...go.

speaker: Ike
text: You don't have to leave.

speaker: Yune
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: It's true, we don't have much use for gods. But, well... You show us what we should aspire to. We need inspiration. You give us a reason to grow. To become more than we are.

speaker: Ike
text: And if we don't have that, Yune, we're nothing more than statues.

speaker: Yune
text: Can you forgive me for the pain I've caused?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know. But you have already forgiven us. How could we not?

speaker: Ike
text: We are all family. We will try to understand one another, even when we disagree.

speaker: Yune
text: You're right. I will try. One more time.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, what's going on? I heard that you took ill on the field. Are you all right? What happened?

speaker: Sothe
text: What do you think, genius? Micaiah fainted because you've been pushing her too hard! She's terrified that she won't live up to your expectations.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I didn't realize... I am so sorry, Micaiah.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: According to the doctor, she is suffering from severe exhaustion. She must stay in bed for a time.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Well, I'm glad that she is all right. Do you think it will take long for her to recover? We must stop the laguz, after all. Our task is not complete.

speaker: Sothe
text: OK, that's it! Are you out of your mind? I'm getting Micaiah out of here. At this rate, if the laguz that we shouldn't be fighting don't kill her, you certainly will.

speaker: Pelleas
text: What?! B-but you can't leave!

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh yeah? I'd like to see you stop me. I held out until now, thinking it was best for Daein. I was wrong. We're through with you.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Please, Sothe! You must reconsider! Micaiah can't leave now.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: King Pelleas, I agree with Sothe. Let Lady Micaiah go. She has done enough.

speaker: Pelleas
text: No, don't leave! Please! I'm begging you! I need Micaiah to stay!

speaker: Almedha
text: P-Pelleas?! What are you doing?!

speaker: Pelleas
text: Our army cannot function without Micaiah. I can't let that happen! The army must continue the fight!

speaker: Sothe
text: Listen, I don't know what deals you've made with the empire behind our backs, but I won't let you hurt her anymore.

speaker: Pelleas
text: If Micaiah leaves the army...she will die.

speaker: Sothe
text: So now the king shows his true colors... Pelleas, I don't care if you're the king. Threaten Micaiah again, and I'll kill you where you stand. Is that clear?

speaker: Pelleas
text: She won't be the only one to die. You. Me. Every single person in Daein. We'll all die. And it's all my fault.

speaker: Almedha
text: Pelleas, you didn't... You signed a blood pact, didn't you?

speaker: Almedha
text: You signed a blood pact with the senate after you were crowned! That's why you've been so scared, so terrified as of late. Oh, my son...

speaker: Micaiah
text: What is...a blood pact?

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah! You should try to--

speaker: Micaiah
text: Please tell me, Your Majesty. What is a blood pact?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I-I swear to you. I didn't know. I had no idea...

speaker: Pelleas
text: What could be so urgent that the empire's messenger would pay a visit at this hour? Has something happened?

speaker: Messenger
text: King Pelleas... Please prepare to receive Vice-Minister Lekain.

speaker: Pelleas
text: What?!

speaker: Lekain
text: How do you do, King Pelleas?

speaker: Pelleas
text: H-how did you get here?!

speaker: Lekain
text: Our empire's magical research has made leaps and bounds. This rewarp staff is our latest invention. With this staff, one can get to any desired destination instantly. Isn't that just wonderful? Before this lovely little item, we used that ghastly warp powder. It worked well enough, but would completely exhaust whoever used it. What's the use of someone traveling anywhere they wish if they're too exhausted to do anything afterward? It'd take a very strong soldier to withstand the powder's side effects. The rewrap staff solves that problem.

speaker: Messenger
text: Vice-Minister...

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah, now I've said too much. I just can't help myself. I love innovation so.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Um... If I may, what is the purpose of your visit?

speaker: Lekain
text: Oh, yes. No time for idle chatter. We have a favor to ask of you, Your Majesty. As you are no doubt aware, the false apostle has raised an army of sub-humans to reclaim her throne. We require the use of the Daein army to wipe out this upstart "Laguz Alliance." Would you be so kind?

speaker: Pelleas
text: I... I'm afraid I cannot deploy my army on Begnion's behalf. My country cannot continue to rebuild while fighting a war. Please understand.

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah, so you reject our request? Then I've no choice but to watch you and your people perish slowly.

speaker: Pelleas
text: What?! You came here to make threats?

speaker: Lekain
text: The terms of our pact are quite clear in this document.

speaker: Pelleas
text: That's the treaty I signed on the day of my coronation. I don't see how this pertains to--

speaker: Lekain
text: All will be made clear, young Pelleas. Yes, this is the same document. You, my naïve young king, signed it believing it was an oath of reparation from Begnion. Sadly for you, however...

speaker: Pelleas
text: What are you telling me?

speaker: Lekain
text: In truth, this wonderful scrap of parchment is a blood pact. Once you sign the paper in blood, you can never break the terms of the pact!

speaker: Pelleas
text: A blood pact? But Izuka said he saw no problems with the terms of the treaty... No! Izuka? No, how could he...

speaker: Lekain
text: That's right. Izuka is one of us. He found the perfect king who would execute the senate's will.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I can't believe it! I won't!

speaker: Lekain
text: You'd better start believing it. You've at least heard stories of the forbidden "blood pact," haven't you? It's a marvelous tool used by the wise to control the foolish. A ruler agreeing to the pact is bound to it...absolutely. Once sworn, the pact will punish any transgression against its terms with the complete destruction of his country.

speaker: Pelleas
text: You...you can't be serious. That's impossible!

speaker: Lekain
text: Calm yourself, young king, and listen. I'll tell you an interesting story. Long ago, a foolhardy king signed a blood pact with the empire to take back his lost kingdom. In exchange for his country, he vowed complete obedience. He soon broke the terms of the pact and began to disobey the empire. Presumably he didn't understand the power of the oath he'd sworn... Would you like to hear what happened after he defied the empire's will?

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...What?

speaker: Lekain
text: It was quite tragic. One man died on the first day. He was only a peasant, so no one really noticed. Two more died on the second day. Three more on the third day. I think you can see where this is going. The wave of mysterious deaths spread across the kingdom like a contagion. After thirty days, the king finally realized that this was the curse of the blood pact, the price of infidelity. He apologized to the empire and pleaded with them to lift the curse. His plea was graciously accepted on the one hundredth day. By then, the king had lost half of his subordinates, as well as his lovely wife and child. That country remained under the control of the senate for a very long time.

speaker: Lekain
text: I hope I've made myself clear. No matter how you struggle, you have no choice but to follow the orders given to you by the empire. No matter how noble your motives, defiance against us will result in the death of your nation. This you must never forget. Ahhh, and one more thing... If you're considering seeking aid from outside of Daein, think again. We have spies and informants in every corner of Tellius. We will know immediately if you tell anyone.

speaker: Sothe
text: Let me get this straight. Everyone in Daein will die if you disobey the senate? Tauroneo: What a heavy burden... It cannot be! Almedha: Show Mother the mark of your pact.

speaker: Almedha
text: It's true... This is the mark of a blood pact. My son has been deceived!

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, give it up! You expect us to buy that ghost story? It's just something to scare little kings into eating their vegetables! Before you go shining Begnion's boots, get some proof of the senate's claims!

speaker: Sothe
text: We've done enough here. Micaiah, let's go. We'll let them find out if that story is real or not.

speaker: Micaiah
text: It's all true, Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: What?

speaker: Micaiah
text: King Pelleas and Queen Almedha are telling us the truth. It's hard to believe, but I can see it... My power hasn't gone away. It was just weakened from exhaustion. This is all so horrible... Now Daein can never be free from the senate's leash.

speaker: Sothe
text: Even if it's true, Micaiah, that doesn't mean you have to go to war again. We could leave Daein...

speaker: Micaiah
text: But without me, who would hold our forces together? Leaving the army would be the same as abandoning the people of Daein. I won't do it.

speaker: Sothe
text: But...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I'm sorry, everyone.. I'm so sorry... I-I-I didn't know...

speaker: Tauroneo
text: King Pelleas... What then do you propose we do?

speaker: Pelleas
text: Why, obey the empire, of course. We have no other choice in the matter. As long as I follow the senate's orders, no one will die because of me.

speaker: Sothe
text: No, I can't accept that! We have finally wrested our country back from the occupation forces... I'd rather be dead than have to bend to the will of the empire. What are we, dogs?!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: And now that Begnion is ordering Daein troops into battle, we are treated as disposable pawns. Many Daein citizens will die of this pact, whether we obey it or not.

speaker: Pelleas
text: It would appear that I have been crowned king during the last days of Daein. Follow or fight...the result is the same. We will be destroyed.

speaker: Micaiah
text: With all due respect, Your Majesty, we can't give up!

speaker: Pelleas
text: What?

speaker: Micaiah
text: You heard me. The only way to really be doomed is to give up.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, there's no way out of a blood pact. None! What do you suggest we do?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Look for a way out. I know Duke Lekain says the pact can't be broken, but of course he'd say that! King Pelleas, you have the resources of an entire country to draw on, and the best of reasons to do so. Check the royal library! Check the archives! Somewhere, I'm sure you'll find...something.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah, forgive me. I was so overwhelmed that I let myself give in to despair. But you're absolutely right. We can't give up just yet. We have people to save!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Unfortunately, we don't have much time. Begnion will not put off triggering the blood pact until after we've found a way to break it.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We can make time. If we take on the empress and the laguz forces, it'll look as if we're obeying the senate. In the meantime, you can research the pact.

speaker: Pelleas
text: All right. I'll start immediately. Just give me as much time as you can...

speaker: Micaiah
text: Of course. We'll do our best to hold them back...whatever it takes.

speaker: Sothe
text: It looks as if the apostle's forces are using this road to avoid a head-on confrontation. I guess we were right in assuming that they don't necessarily want to fight. Micaiah, are you still set on this?

speaker: Micaiah
text: Are the rocks ready?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Yes. They're in position.

speaker: Daein
text: General Maiel's forces have encountered General Ike's laguz forces. The battle has begun! The decoy operation succeeded. The apostle and her Holy Guards are heading this way.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All forces, get in position! Our target is the apostle. We will attack her while General Ike is distracted. If we let her through, her army will cross into Begnion. That will surely anger the senate, and the senate will move to destroy Daein. We must fight with everything we have so that Daein may live on!

speaker: Sothe
text: But, Micaiah... Is this really necessary? Can't we avoid all of this fighting and somehow pretend to obey the senate?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Micaiah, it was you more than anyone else who used to hate plans like this...

speaker: Micaiah
text: The apostle's army has incredible numbers. We wouldn't stand a chance taking them head-on. They would march right through us. We need to give Pelleas more time, but if we hold back, the senate will know we're up to something. For now...let's just try to draw this out a bit and stop the apostle's army.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Lady Micaiah. Your strength moves me. I shall not falter.

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah... All right. Let's do it. Let's do it for our friends--and for our country.

speaker: Daein
text: We have visual confirmation on the Holy Guards! They're heading this way!

speaker: Tanith
text: Blast! We're being ambushed! I should have known...

speaker: Sanaki
text: What is happening?!

speaker: Sigrun
text: We're under attack. We will engage them now. Please stay inside the carriage, Your Majesty.

speaker: Tanith
text: Someone, go tell General Ike!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Fear is our greatest enemy! Defend the apostle with your lives!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Nnngh... I must not...falter...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sigrun! Pull back! Get out of here right now!

speaker: Sigrun
text: No, Apostle Sanaki. I shall fight until my last breath! I won't leave your side until...you are safe.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Sigrun!

speaker: Sigrun
text: You are Daein's Maiden of Dawn? Your reputation is known across the face of Tellius. They say you are the savior who rescued the people of Daein from the empire's oppression. I see now that their stories were false. Daein remains a simple puppet.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I am not here to talk, I am here to fight. This is Daein's only chance of survival.

speaker: Sothe
text: I knew I'd run into you. You never leave the apostle's side.

speaker: Sigrun
text: You... You used to travel with the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Sothe
text: Used to. Not anymore. I'm a member of the Daein army now.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Does Sir Ike know about this?

speaker: Sothe
text: It doesn't matter. I'm my own person.

speaker: Sigrun
text: You're right. It doesn't matter. If you are after the apostle, you are my enemy. Prepare to meet the goddess.

speaker: Sigrun
text: If I may ask... Are you not Lord Fizzart’s daughter?

speaker: Jill
text: How did you know?

speaker: Sigrun
text: I am Sigrun of the Holy Guards. Have you not heard my name from Haar?

speaker: Jill
text: Yes, I remember... You were the one who negotiated to let my father’s men and their families stay in Begnion.

speaker: Sigrun
text: That’s right.

speaker: Jill
text: ...I’m so sorry. I’m sorry we have to meet under these circumstances.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Lady Jill... It’s not too late. Would you please withdraw?

speaker: Jill
text: No... I can’t. I know that this mission is terrible. Even so, I cannot abandon my comrades or my country.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I see... Very well. I shall remember your conviction when the battle is done.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I remember you... You used to travel with the Greil Mercenaries. Why are you fighting us?

speaker: Zihark
text: I couldn’t abandon the people of my homeland.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I see... You are from Daein. Then there is no way for us to avoid this confrontation?

speaker: Zihark
text: I’m afraid not. Just like you want to protect your own country, I want to protect mine.

speaker: Sigrun
text: ... I am sorry to hear that.

speaker: Tanith
text: Come to me, you dogs. Whatever might you think you possess pales to that of the Holy Guard.

speaker: Tanith
text: Ugh! I must...protect the apostle! I am a Holy Guard! It is my duty...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Tanith! Stop fighting! You must not throw your life away!

speaker: Tanith
text: I cannot fight any longer... but I can become your shield. I will not let the enemy harm you. Not even a scratch.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Tanith...

speaker: Tanith
text: Sothe. How you've grown. I didn't recognize you at first.

speaker: Sothe
text: ...You haven't changed much.

speaker: Tanith
text: I don't understand why you are with the Daein army, but it doesn't matter. All I need to know is that you stand before me. Are you my enemy, then? Or is this some kind of mistake?

speaker: Sothe
text: It's not mistake. I'm your enemy. And I'm prepared to fight.

speaker: Tanith
text: Then this conversation is useless. Have at you!

speaker: Tanith
text: Jill! Why does Daein continue to fight us? Does the Maiden of Dawn hunger for blood? Or is she a warmongering fool who doesn’t listen to reason?

speaker: Jill
text: She is none of those things! Lady Micaiah fights for the people of Daein!

speaker: Tanith
text: For the people, you say? Look around you, naive girl! Is all this death for the people?!

speaker: Jill
text: I-I can’t explain! We don’t have any choice in the matter!

speaker: Tanith
text: Fools! You merely assume that you have no choice!

speaker: Tanith
text: You used to fight alongside the Greil Mercenaries! You now fight for Daein? But General Ike is on our si–

speaker: Zihark
text: Yes, I’m aware of that. Even so, I can’t pull out of this fight.

speaker: Tanith
text: Then you are the apostle’s enemy! Prepare to die.

speaker: Kieran
text: Lying in wait for your enemies! What a dirty trick!

speaker: Kieran
text: I am Kieran of the Crimean Royal Knights! Prepare yourselves, evildoers of Daein!

speaker: Micaiah
text: I don't care what you say. This is our only choice! We can't stop fighting!

speaker: Kieran
text: You! You used to travel with the Greil Mercenaries!

speaker: Sothe
text: Wait, I know you... Crimea's Royal Knights, Fifth Platoon Leader...

speaker: Kieran
text: I am the second commander of the Royal Knights now!

speaker: Sothe
text: Ah, you did well for yourself. Are you still traveling with Oscar?

speaker: Kieran
text: Yes, he's my archrival!

speaker: Sothe
text: Um, what's your name again?

speaker: Kieran
text: It's Kieran! How dare you forget my name!

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, right, now I've got it. I hated the way you'd announce your name in the middle of the battlefield. That was annoying.

speaker: Kieran
text: And now you insult me! Even though we know each other, I will not go easy on you! You are my enemy now! This is your last chance to run. I'll give you to the count of three! One... Two... Three...

speaker: Sothe
text: Hey now, don't get mad. Other than the announcing thing, you were all right. But I have to fight. Prepare yourself!

speaker: Kieran
text: Dracoknight Jill! Why did you return to the Daein army?!

speaker: Kieran
text: Last time we fought together, you betrayed your heartless homeland to fight on Crimea’s side! You used to know how to tell right from wrong! What happened?

speaker: Jill
text: Sir Kieran...

speaker: Kieran
text: Why do you look so sad? It isn’t like you! Come, join us in righteousness!

speaker: Jill
text: I truly envy you. You fight with pride and loyalty in your heart. I wish I could do the same, these days...

speaker: Kieran
text: Zihark! What are you doing in the Daein army?!

speaker: Zihark
text: I couldn’t abandon the people of my homeland.

speaker: Kieran
text: You are originally from Daein?

speaker: Zihark
text: That’s right. I want to protect my country, just like you want to protect yours. That’s why I fight for the Daein army.

speaker: Kieran
text: I am sorry to hear that... I will not go easy on you just because we know each other.

speaker: Zihark
text: Thanks, Kieran. I prefer it that way.

speaker: Kieran
text: Ugh... Aargh! We will pull back temporarily! I'm not fool enough to let my men die needlessly!

speaker: Sothe
text: We're in position at the top of the cliff, and the Holy Guards are at the bottom. Just as we planned.

speaker: Micaiah
text: All right. Thank you.

speaker: Sothe
text: There is no turning back now, Micaiah. You have to give the order.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes, I know.

speaker: Daein
text: General Maiel has fallen to the claws of the sub-humans! General Ike and the Laguz Alliance are heading this way to rescue the apostle!

speaker: Micaiah
text: ...Prepare to move to the next phase. Archers, get ready! There's no more time for doubt.

speaker: Sanaki
text: What are they doing? What are they pouring down the cliff?

speaker: Sigrun
text: No! It's... It's oil! They're going to set us aflame! Apostle, onto my pegasus! We'll take to the sky!

speaker: Tanith
text: We will protect the apostle from the archers by becoming her shield! Holy Guards, form up!

speaker: Sanaki
text: No! No, Sigrun! We cannot leave the others here! I will not allow it!

speaker: Tanith
text: Commander, we're ready!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Don't let the apostle escape! Archers, mages! Bring down that pegasus!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Don't move. I see one arrow fly, and the boy gets a quick lesson in falling.

speaker: Sothe
text: Tibarn! Urk!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Sothe! No, please! All units, cease fire! Now!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: General Ike has reached us... We've failed.

speaker: Ike
text: Micaiah of Daein, listen to me very, very carefully.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Tell him to let Sothe go!

speaker: Ike
text: Not a chance. I'm offering you a choice. Surrender now and go home to Daein, or fight us and die.

speaker: Micaiah
text: We can't. We won't retreat or negotiate. Regardless of what you believe, the only choice we have is to fight.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Micaiah, are you insane? Look around! Every single person in your army will die! Do you care that little about them?
Enough! Everyone stand down!

speaker: Ike
text: Apostle...

speaker: Sanaki
text: I've seen enough bloodshed for one day! That's enough! Please, no more...

speaker: Ike
text: We'll retreat for now. You'd better do the same, and I mean now. I'm not sure how long I can hold my men back.

speaker: Micaiah
text: But we can't!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Fine. His death is on your hands, then. Sorry, little Sothe, your friend just killed you. Say a quick good-bye.

speaker: Sothe
text: No, wait, Micai--!

speaker: Micaiah
text: NOOO! SOTHE!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, thank the goddess. Sothe...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Take this as a lesson, little beorc. Next time, there won't be anyone to catch you.

speaker: Ike
text: General Tauroneo, I'll ask you one last time: talk some sense into that girl, all right? She's losing it.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: ...We won't pursue you this time. However, we cannot avoid this war. That is all I will say for now. And Ike...I'm sorry for this.

speaker: Ike
text: What is going on with you people...

speaker: Ike
text: What's the situation?

speaker: Soren
text: It's awful. The Begnion Central Army and the Crimean Royal Knights have almost been completely obliterated. On top of that, the oil that Daein used has injured the Holy Guards' pegasi and all but grounded them.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I think awful fits. Thoughts, everyone?

speaker: Skrimir
text: Thoughts?! Daein must answer for this! We attack them immediately!

speaker: Ranulf
text: We can't. If we fought Daein now, we couldn't possibly take on the senate's armies. We have to get Daein to listen to us.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Confusion is exactly what Lekain wants. Daein is merely a pawn in his scheme. But there is one thing I do not understand. Why use such horrible tactics? Oil and fire? What is that girl Micaiah thinking?
Micaiah? The Imperial Army has Micaiah on their side?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Rafiel! When did you arrive?

speaker: Rafiel
text: Just now, with Reyson and Queen Nailah.

speaker: Nailah
text: Reyson went straight to his sister. He will be here with Leanne in a moment.

speaker: Ike
text: Is it all right for the three of you to be here? What about the medallion?

speaker: Rafiel
text: The medallion is right here.

speaker: Nailah
text: We're very near the point where galdrar won't be able to contain its power. If this war goes on much longer, the dark god will surely awaken.

speaker: Almedha
text: Please... Please save him. Please save my son. Come save my Pelleas, I beg of you...

speaker: Pelleas
text: I've found it! This is it! A way to break the blood pact! Thank the goddess... I will be able to save my people after all.

speaker: Ena
text: Prince Kurth? What are you doing out so late? Looking for something?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Oh, hello, Ena. No, I was just looking at the moon. Its reflection on the lake is quite lovely, isn't it?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes, quite.

speaker: Begnion
text: You! H-how did you get in?! How did you find us?! Help, he's here!  Aaaargh!
My apologies for the long wait.
Is the apostle safe?
She fled to Crimea, then exposed the senate's plots to the world. Currently, she leads the apostle's army through Daein and is preparing to storm the empire.
I see. Very well... It's time for us to make our move.

speaker: Zelgius
text: As you wish, my master.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I have to head back to the castle. I have to know if there is a way to break free of the blood pact.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Please be careful.

speaker: Pelleas
text: ...Please, Micaiah. Stop being so kind to me. It’s too difficult for me.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I can feel how you’ve suffered. You’ve had to endure it all alone for so long. It’s ghastly.

speaker: Pelleas
text: It was my fault... I brought this curse upon Daein!

speaker: Micaiah
text: No! You didn’t know! I will protect Daein. I’ll protect our country from harm, no matter what happens. You have my word.

speaker: Pelleas
text: Micaiah... Very well. I won’t give up. We’ll fight destiny together.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes.

speaker: Pelleas
text: I want you to take this. I found another one in the treasure room of the castle. Stand fast, Micaiah. I will find a way to save Daein.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Sothe.

speaker: Sothe
text: Hello, General.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I thought you were going to leave the army, taking Lady Micaiah with you.

speaker: Sothe
text: I was. But now we can’t. Both Micaiah and I are from Daein. We can’t abandon our own country.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Hmm. I wonder if it’s the same if you leave Daein...

speaker: Sothe
text: I don’t understand.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: If you abandoned Daein and fought on the side of a different country, I wonder if you’d still be cursed?

speaker: Sothe
text: Who knows? I’m not a sage. In any case, it doesn’t matter. Micaiah would never leave Daein behind.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I see. Sothe, here. Take these.

speaker: Sothe
text: Why are you giving me these?

speaker: Tauroneo
text: I kept them as a parting gift to you. Since you’re staying, I’d like you to take them now.

speaker: Sothe
text: General...

speaker: Sothe
text: These are all the funds we have for the near future. The problem now is stopping the apostle’s army from advancing.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Conventional tactics won’t slow them down. They’ll easily break through our lines. ...What should we do?

speaker: Sothe
text: Micaiah?

speaker: Sothe
text: Are you all right? I’ll leave the gold here. You’re still not completely recovered yet. You have to rest, Micaiah.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I’ll try.

speaker: Sothe
text: Keep safe.

speaker: Sothe
text: Nolan. Sorry to keep you waiting.

speaker: Nolan
text: Hmm? Hey, Sothe. Don’t worry. I was reading while I waited.

speaker: Sothe
text: I didn’t realize you were such a dedicated reader, Nolan.

speaker: Nolan
text: It’s human nature to crave knowledge. I thought you would know that as well as anyone. How is Micaiah, by the way? Is she doing well?

speaker: Sothe
text: Yeah, I believe so. She’s alert, and she seems generally stronger.

speaker: Nolan
text: I see. Well, that’s good, right?

speaker: Sothe
text: Sorry to make you worry.

speaker: Nolan
text: Don’t mention it.

speaker: Sothe
text: And...I...brought this for you.

speaker: Nolan
text: Hey, now! This is a good axe. Must have cost you a fair bit. Thanks.

speaker: Sothe
text: Nolan, I...

speaker: Nolan
text: Don’t force it. You’ll only hurt yourself.

speaker: Sothe
text: What?

speaker: Nolan
text: You look like you’re carrying the weight of the world on your shoulders. You’re wondering if you should tell me, right?

speaker: Sothe
text: Right...

speaker: Nolan
text: The best thing to do is think it over. Give it some time to sit. Later, if you decide you want to tell me, you know exactly where to find me.

speaker: Sothe
text: I will. Thanks, Nolan.

speaker: Nolan
text: Anytime.
There she is! Hey, lady!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Who? Oh, Nico!

speaker: Nico
text: This is great. I was hoping I’d find you.

speaker: Lady
text: Nico, mind your manners. The Silver-Haired Maiden is the saviour of Daein. She’s not just some "lady."

speaker: Micaiah
text: Oh, it’s all right. I’m still the same simple girl from Daein you met before. Nothing’s changed. So, are things well with you?

speaker: Lady
text: Well, the fighting’s got everyone worried, coming so soon after the last war and all... But we’re doing all we can for Daein! It doesn’t matter who or what we’re up against. Believe me when I tell you we’ll never give up.

speaker: Nico
text: That’s right! We won’t give up. Ever! I know we’re gonna win, too. ‘Cause we’ve got you on our side. That’s what everybody says. The Dawn Brigade will save us.

speaker: Micaiah
text: Is that what they say? I see... Listen to me, Nico. You can believe in us. I promise we’ll keep you safe.

speaker: Nico
text: I knew it!

speaker: Lady
text: Come along, Nico. We should be going. The maiden’s got better things to do than stand here chatting with us all day.

speaker: Nico
text: Bye, lady! See you later!

speaker: Micaiah
text: Yes...good-bye, Nico.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I... I want to save them all. The world is a better place with people like them in it.

speaker: Sothe
text: I know how you feel, Micaiah. That’s why we started all this. We’ve always been fighting for them. But this war we’re in... It’s not just. We’re fighting on the wrong side.

speaker: Micaiah
text: I know. I don’t want to see anyone die. It’s ironic... I’m killing with no malice, because I don’t want anyone to be killed. I... What am I supposed to do? Am I supposed to stand back and let all of Daein perish? Is that the "just" thing to do?

speaker: Micaiah
text: If that’s what it takes to be just, then I want nothing to do with justice. I’d rather be hated and feared like Mad King Ashnard. I’d rather the dark god take my soul. I’m going to save my people, Sothe. If the rest of the world paints me as a beast to be reviled and hated, so be it.
